column8: Despite the fact that the game earned a lot of negative reviews, I was quite pleased with it. That's not to say it's good, but it's clearly not the worst thing I've ever played. I think that the other users below have already described enough of its bad sides, so I would like to say a couple of positive things about it. The first is the user-friendly interface. The interface in the game is really nice and it's really easy to find the mode that suits you. I would also like to mention the versatility of the game. I will not compare it with other parts, but I would like to say that I am pleased with the fact that each location in the game is diverse and unique in its own way. Actually, I think that most people criticized the game only because they could compare it with previous games of the series (I played all parts and I liked them very much), but nevertheless, I don't think that this product is bad at all.

column8:
So, what can be said about Flatout 3?

Well...


-The physics are completely busted, meaning sometimes you drive into the wall and die because of going too fast
-The "AI" are completely incompetent, often getting into wrecks and barely doing anything to actually win
-The other game modes are lazy and uninspired
-The visuals look horrendous, even for its time
-The multiplayer is a ghost town, making it basically impossible to get it's achievements
-When I set it to "my music", i was expecting it to play a song on my computer, but instead it just played the same drum loop over and over again, which is a song I couldn't find anywhere on my computer.

Yeah, maybe don't play this one.

column8: Better, than Forza 5, but still garbage.
column9: Better, than Forza 5, but still garbage.

I don't know what was going through Team6 and Strategy First's minds, but releasing the game in this state is simply criminal. After 20 patches! It still won't launch on Steam. Or rather, trying to get it to work partially helps, but every time it crashes, it requires a system reboot. And it would be fine if there was a reason to do so, after all, it's described on paper as having 9 modes, 47 cars, 20 characters, and 62 tracks. But none of it works; the racers are ridiculous skins with two lines of description. The tracks are inverted, a graphical mess thanks to a poor filter. Competitions and challenges are completely uninteresting due to poor AI, and most importantly, the abysmal physics. For the first time, I found it boring to smash through the environment, opponents, and even run over zombies. The cars are just troughs on wheels; even in the first game, they're visually inferior. The only positive things about FlatOut 3 are the bowling (and that's because it's a carbon copy of the previous games) and the soundtrack (which, again, falls short of its predecessors). It's a real shame, the worst survival race in video game history. 2.0 out of 10

column8:
This game is the virtual equivalent of leprosy, it makes you miserable, it makes other people avoid you, and you really wish you didn't have it. The gap in quality between Flatout 2 and Flatout 3 is astounding. I can only assume that everyone at Bugbear was in a coma and they passed the third game onto a group of blind baboons that don't have arms. 

I don't have to talk about the game play because it doesn't have any. Unlike other arcade racing games, Flatout 3 fails to inspire a competitive atmosphere. Burnout, Need For Speed, SplitSecond are all games that encourage you to perform better because not only can you actually understand why you would be winning or losing, but also because winning in those games makes you feel cool, because those are cool games. Flatout 3 isn't cool, it's really lame, with characters that are ugly and 1 dimensional. With all the different car options in the game it would make you think there was much of a difference in how each class plays. Nope. apart from the speed class, most classes feel very similar in terms of handling and strength. Not to mention that winning or losing doesn't have as much player agency as it should. You could win a race with zero effort or get your ass pummeled by every other racer coming after you specifically. The AI are able to take turns far better than you because of the whackass physics. But it's not like that matters because the AI is so stupid they will routinely crash into obstacles, and on the monster truck open map type of game, the AI trucks basically just drive in circles.

The game doesn't even function properly. Not only does the game crash every time you launch it and will continue to do so several times, but after trying over and over just to start you get "rewarded" with the worst racing game experience on earth. The automatic soundtrack option in settings is to take music from your music folder. That isn't actually a bad idea because it makes the soundtrack custom to the person playing. This has some issues however. If the player's music isn't fast paced or exciting (e.g they listen to Bob Dylan) it can lead to the music not matching the game. The other problem is far worse though, because I for instance didn't have any music in my music folder. So the game had no music at all. Given that most people listen to music on portable devices such as phones, and if they have music on a computer they likely use spodify or some other app, it wouldn't make sense for everybody who played this game to have their own soundtrack. (Also it is likely that the devs added this feature so that they didn't have to make the ost or pay someone to do it.) 

In conclusion avoid this game, other wise you might as well set the money on fire and piss on it.
column9:
This game is the virtual equivalent of leprosy, it makes you miserable, it makes other people avoid you, and you really wish you didn't have it. The gap in quality between Flatout 2 and Flatout 3 is astounding. I can only assume that everyone at Bugbear was in a coma and they passed the third game onto a group of blind baboons that don't have arms. 

I don't have to talk about the game play because it doesn't have any. Unlike other arcade racing games, Flatout 3 fails to inspire a competitive atmosphere. Burnout, Need For Speed, SplitSecond are all games that encourage you to perform better because not only can you actually understand why you would be winning or losing, but also because winning in those games makes you feel cool, because those are cool games. Flatout 3 isn't cool, it's really lame, with characters that are ugly and 1 dimensional. With all the different car options in the game it would make you think there was much of a difference in how each class plays. Nope. apart from the speed class, most classes feel very similar in terms of handling and strength. Not to mention that winning or losing doesn't have as much player agency as it should. You could win a race with zero effort or get your ass pummeled by every other racer coming after you specifically. The AI are able to take turns far better than you because of the whackass physics. But it's not like that matters because the AI is so stupid they will routinely crash into obstacles, and on the monster truck open map type of game, the AI trucks basically just drive in circles.

The game doesn't even function properly. Not only does the game crash every time you launch it and will continue to do so several times, but after trying over and over just to start you get "rewarded" with the worst racing game experience on earth. The automatic soundtrack option in settings is to take music from your music folder. That isn't actually a bad idea because it makes the soundtrack custom to the person playing. This has some issues however. If the player's music isn't fast paced or exciting (e.g they listen to Bob Dylan) it can lead to the music not matching the game. Given that most people listen to music on portable devices such as phones, and if they have music on a computer they likely use spodify or some other app, it wouldn't make sense for everybody who played this game to have their own soundtrack. I apologize in advance, but this is absolute crap. I think most people have already expressed their opinions about this game, and you probably know what I'm talking about.
Looking at the game's screenshots on Steam, you might think it's not that bad, but in the end... meh.
The graphics aren't that bad, yes, but the Instagram filters are top-notch, of course.
Now you have a choice of drivers not between a man and a woman, but from a bunch of freaks. There are a lot of them. From a depressed version of the guy from Postal to Dominic Toretto on the lowest settings. All sorts of whores, freaks, former killers. I didn't just make this up; they all have mini-backstories.
And now for the most painful part. The gameplay. Let's start with the fact that these cars now seem like they're from the year 2100, because they have the downforce of toy cars. It's impossible to drive. Fuck, why am I even trying to write anything here when you can get this for next to nothing, play it for a couple of minutes, and get your money back, and then fully understand what I mean? Das Spiel ist nur dann brauchbar, wenn man gezielt nach dem gr√∂√üten M√ºll sucht, den das Racing-Genre zu bieten hat.

Hat seine negativen Reviews definitiv verdient, kann aber auch ganz lustig sein, solange man nicht komplett an den Gamebugs scheitert.

Update: Nach ungef√§hr 20 Spielstunden konnte ich alle Erfolge, die dieses tolle Spiel zu bieten hat, freischalten. Der Weg dorthin grenzt aber an Selbstgeiselung, also sollte man sich davor gut √ºberlegen, welches Spiel man hier besiegen will...
Die KI f√§hrt teilweise gesamte Rennen mit perfekter Fahrtrajektorie und man hat √ºberhaupt keine Chance, dagegen anzukommen. Oft muss man das Rennen neustarten, bis die KI f√ºr das eine Rennen schw√§cher ist und dann hoffen, dass die FPS-Einbr√ºche w√§hrend dem Rennen nicht am n√§chsten Baum enden und man demoliert wird.
Dazu gibt es Challenges (19 und 30), die unm√∂glich zu schaffen sind, wenn man nicht den Gamecode √§ndert, 3 Stunden neustartet und betet oder wie in Challenge 19 die Strecke in Gegenrichtung(!) bef√§hrt, weil eine Rampe sonst nicht befahrbar ist. Bei anderen Herausforderungen muss der Spielmodus auf ,,schnell" gewechselt werden, um z.B. Stunts zu schaffen.
Man k√∂nnte meinen, die "Developer" h√§tten ihr eigenes Spiel nicht einmal selbst getestet, solche groben Fehler sind wirklich peinlich, selbst f√ºr FlatOut3.

Fazit: Man kann das Spiel spielen, wenn man Lust hat, sich mit einem von vorn bis hinten grauenhaften Spiel durchzuk√§mpfen, das bei mir beim Starten jedes Mal den zweiten Bildschirm deaktiviert hat.
Auch wenn es teilweise Spa√ü macht, sollte man das Spiel nicht daf√ºr positiv bewerten, denn es ist und bleibt M√ºll.
column9:
The game is only useful if you're specifically looking for the worst garbage the racing genre has to offer.

It definitely deserves its negative reviews, but it can also be quite fun as long as you don't completely fail due to the game's bugs.

Update: After about 20 hours of play, I was able to unlock all the achievements this great game has to offer. However, the path to getting there borders on self-flagellation, so you should carefully consider which game you're trying to beat...
The AI ‚Äã‚Äãsometimes drives entire races with perfect driving trajectories, and you have absolutely no chance of beating it. You often have to restart the race until the AI ‚Äã‚Äãis weaker for that race, and then hope that the FPS drops during the race don't end up hitting the nearest tree and destroying you.
There are also challenges (19 and 30) that are impossible to complete unless you change the game code, restart for three hours and pray, or, as in Challenge 19, drive the track in the opposite direction(!) because a ramp is otherwise impassable. For other challenges, you have to switch the game mode to "quick" to perform stunts, for example.
You'd think the "developers" hadn't even tested their own game; such glaring mistakes are truly embarrassing, even for FlatOut3.

Conclusion: You can play the game if you want to struggle through a game that is awful from start to finish and that disabled the second screen every time I started it.
Even if it's fun at times, you shouldn't rate the game positively for that, because it is and remains garbage.
I'd rather play Gacha Life than this.

column8:
[b]Flatout 3 - Ein entt√§uschendes Kapitel in der Flatout-Serie[/b]

Flatout 3 Chaos & Destruction ist der dritte Teil der beliebten Rennspielserie, diesmal entwickelt von Team6 Game Studios. Das Spiel verspricht rasante Action, Zerst√∂rung und Adrenalin pur. Verspricht... Chaos & Destruction war wohl die Zielsetzung um die Reihe zu begraben.

Wisst Ihr was, es lohnt sich nicht, dieses Spiel auch nur zu erw√§hnen.
Daher werde ich auch nichts zu dieser Gurke schreiben.

Hier, Ihr m√∂chtet euch die Liebe eurer Kollegen erkaufen? Dann ein Rezept f√ºr einen Kuchen den ich immer mal wieder backe und Arbeitskollegen in Heuschrecken verwandelt!

[h1]K√§sekuchen mit Brownie-Boden[/h1]

[i]F√ºr den Boden[/i]
120g Butter
150g Mehl
120g Zartbitter (2/3 70% 1/3 80% meine Mischung)
220g Feinstzucker
2 Eier, verquirlt
60ml Milch

[i]F√ºr den K√§sekuchen[/i]
500g Frischk√§se oder Quark 40% (QUARK!!!)
150g hellbrauner Feinstzucker
3 Eier, verquirlt
1 T√ºtchen Vanillezucker
125g Naturjoghurt

Ofen auf 180¬∞ vorheizen, Springform einfetten und mit Mehl best√§uben.

Butter mit Schokolade in einem kleinen Topf bei geringer Hitze schmelzen und verr√ºhren. Vom Herd nehmen und Zucker einr√ºhren. Eier mit Milch kr√§ftig unterr√ºhren. Das Mehl dar√ºbersieben und unterheben. Ab in die Form und f√ºr 25 Minuten backen.
Aus dem Ofen nehmen, auf 160¬∞ stellen und jetzt die K√§sekuchenschicht zubereiten, w√§hren der Boden leicht abk√ºhlt.
Frischk√§se (b√§h!) oder Quark mit Zucker, Eiern und Vaniellezucker gut mischen. Den Joghurt rein und auf dem Boden verteilen.
Weitere 45-55 Minuten backen. Kuchen vom Rand l√∂sen und abk√ºhlen lassen. Mindestens 4 Stunden oder √ºber Nacht in den K√ºhlschrank stellen, dann erst in St√ºcke schneiden.

Fazit: Nun doch nochmal ganz kurz zu Flatout 3, es entt√§uscht auf vielen Ebenen. Die schwache Grafik, das unausgereifte Gameplay und das uninspirierte Streckendesign lassen das Spiel im Vergleich zu seinen Vorg√§ngern weit zur√ºckfallen.

Von mir eine 5/5 f√ºr den Kuchen!
column9:
[b]Flatout 3 - A Disappointing Chapter in the Flatout Series[/b]

Flatout 3 Chaos & Destruction is the third installment in the popular racing game series, this time developed by Team6 Game Studios. The game promises fast-paced action, destruction, and pure adrenaline. Promises... Chaos & Destruction was probably the goal to bury the series.

You know what? It's not even worth mentioning this game.
Therefore, I won't write anything about this dud.

Here, you want to buy the love of your colleagues? Then here's a recipe for a cake I bake every now and then that turns coworkers into locusts!

[h1]Cheesecake with Brownie Base[/h1]

[i]For the base[/i]
120g butter
150g flour
120g dark chocolate (2/3 70%, 1/3 80% my mix)
220g caster sugar
2 eggs, beaten
60ml milk

[i]For the cheesecake[/i]
500g cream cheese or quark 40% (QUARK!!!)
150g light brown caster sugar
3 eggs, beaten
1 sachet vanilla sugar
125g natural yogurt

Preheat oven to 180¬∞C (350¬∞F), grease a springform pan and dust with flour.

Melt the butter and chocolate in a small saucepan over low heat and stir to combine. Remove from the heat and stir in the sugar. Whisk in the eggs and milk vigorously. Sift the flour over the top and fold in. Place in the pan and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove from the oven, set the oven to 160¬∞C, and prepare the cheesecake layer while the base cools slightly.
Mix the cream cheese (yuck!) or quark with the sugar, eggs, and vanilla sugar. Add the yogurt and spread it on the base.
Bake for another 45-55 minutes. Loosen the cake from the sides and let it cool. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight, then cut into slices.

Conclusion: A quick word about Flatout 3 again; it disappoints on many levels. The weak graphics, the underdeveloped gameplay, and the uninspired track design mean the game falls far short of its predecessors.

I give it a 5/5!

This game is terrible. The graphics were outdated even when it came out. The sounds are absolutely terrible, my ears almost bled. I found this mode, out of all chaotic ones, more "logical."
...

column8:
Today I¬¥m playing the lowest rated game on steam and leaving a positive review. However, I cannot lie!
Currently the game has a 15% rating, so this is not gonna be easy.
The best parts about the game are:
-Race Mode, where I immediately crashed into a tree after i had pressed one key, but I like games with a high skill curve where not everything is intuitive from the start. 
 Race Mode offers a great contrast to:
-Speed Mode, where I did nothing but drive around in a circle for 2 minutes and got first. I also like a game that has an easy, relaxing side to it to reflect upon my horrible life choices üòÇüòÇ
then of course, there¬¥s:
-Big Battle Mode, where you crash into other cars to damage them. After just a single round, i was left speechless, words cannot even describe the emotions I felt here.
 
The regular game crashes remind you not to play for hours on end and take breaks. 

Initially, I didn‚Äòt want to give this game 100%, because there‚Äòs a multiplayer that just doesn‚Äòt work at all- but then I remembered: I have no friends anyways

column8:
My life up to this point has been full of sorrow. Every day I wake up with sand in my eyes, and tears rolling down my face. I walk to my car parked outside the block of apartments. I unlock it using the rusted OEM Skoda Electric FOB, and get into the drivers seat. I shut the door and look at the windscreen, I see the reflection of my sad face, very sad.........

I insert the key into the ignition and twist clockwise, the engine starts......... I place my foot on the clutch and close my eyes.... 

Conclusion: Great game, does not crash at all, all these negative reviews are just UNNEEDED HATE, I can't stress this enough... GIVE YOUR MONEY TO THE DEVS. This game has changed my life for the better!

The game launches with an error! The graphics, physics, and optimization are simply terrible. Graphics settings don't help, and blurring and night mode make visibility even worse. Online play has been dead since release; if you have a friend who has the game, you'll be very lucky to get an achievement.
Almost all the modes are terrible, with the exception of zombies and Formula 1 speed. Don't even try to get the achievements if you're a fan of the Flatout series! Bottom line: it's not worth 50 rubles. If you buy it, only buy it in a bundle with all the parts. Everything is terribly and disgustingly made. Rating: 1/10.

This game is like porn, only no one watches it.
I shouldn't have gone there...

[h1]FO3:AnalDestruction[/h1]

Well, this is fucking awful.

You can come up with the worst version of Flatout 3, and the original would still be worse, it's just fucking crap. Not only are the graphics inferior to the first game, but they're also laced with a shitload of crap. The cars are complete garbage, the physics model sucks, and the destruction is nonsensical. The music is simply beyond praise, it's simply not there. In the previous games, every track was brilliant, but here it's simply not there. It's only in the main menu.
The gameplay is also a bummer, it's fucking garbage and buggy.
They added modes that nobody knows how or why anyone uses and don't work properly without intervention, like the stuntman mode, which is completely incomprehensible. Or the night race mode, which... just launches night tracks, fucking crap, Formula 1, what the hell is Formula 1 in flatout? The zombie props are worthless, they're just garbage. In every fucking mode, you can randomly get fucked up at the start or fly off into the sky, because that's how it is.

In short, the game isn't even free.

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

- this is just plain stupid.
The worst of all Flatouts, 2 out of 10

column8: Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction is a racing game with 47 cars, 9 racing modes, 10 different terrains and 8 online modes for up to 16 players. And - attention! - A truly insane amount of destructible objects will be scattered on the tracks: there are more than 20 thousand of them. We choose a car, a track, a character that is closer to your liking and at breakneck speed we spread everything that turns up under the wheels. This game will definitely not let you get bored. An underrated masterpiece of racing games from the past.

Listen to the reviews.

Cars are stuck to the ground, yet slippery. You drive up a hill at 100 MPH, expecting air, but you stick to it as if you're in an F1 car. But at the same time, your rear tires will get loose from the tiniest acceleration.

Game looks like garbage, runs like garbage, and the controls are horrendous.

Flatout 1 and 2 are the only acceptable titles.

column8: You know, this game was hated since its release. And after trying out Flatout 4 - I can safely say that Flatout 3 is NOT as bad as people tend to say. The physics are bad, but at least they're fun and not frustrating (at least I do not go flying for no reason). You always have nitrous to keep momentum, and the OST is almost non-existent, but at least you don't get to hear some mood-ruining songs instead. This game is definitely worth a shot during sales. Looking forward to 100%-ing it. No jokes.

column8: 0 estrelas, o jogo n√£o tem realismo suficiente para sucedir como os outros da franquia, o flatout 1 e o flatout 2 √© mil vezes melhor do q a terceira vers√£o do jogo, a fisica do jogo n√£o boa (carro gruda no asfalto algumas horas e em outros momentos n√£o tem nenhuma ader√™ncia ao ch√£o), as modelagens dos ve√≠culos s√£o estranhas com propor√ß√µes estranhas e com cores "mal colocadas", as texturas no jogo at√© mesmo no modo ultra ainda s√£o de muito baixa resolu√ß√£o at√© mesmo para os jogos da √©poca, o sistema de pontos do jogo √© extremamente quebrado pelo fato de vc n ganhar por posi√ß√£o em alguns modos e sim pelo dano que voc√™ deu ou tomou, o jogo √© repetitivo sem muitas formas de varia√ß√£o de modo/pista e etc. A intelig√™ncia artificial no jogo n√£o da desafios suficientes aos players, o sistema de musicas no jogo n√£o √© ruim porem poderia ser muito melhorado tanto em qualidade de √°udio quanto a pr√≥pria sele√ß√£o de musicas que existem no pr√≥prio jogo, a sistema de colis√£o do game √© injusto pois se voc√™ bate o carro devagar voc√™ tem chance de morrer e se voc√™ bate o carro em alta velocidade voc√™ morre sem nem ter chance de fazer nada, os bots de atrapalham muito pelo fato de serem devagares e te dificultam a sua melhora de posi√ß√£o na corrida, o jogo n√£o cumpre de forma boa a promessa dele de seguir de forma boa os jogos anteriores da franquia
column9: 0 stars, the game does not have enough realism to succeed as the others in the franchise, Flatout 1 and Flatout 2 are a thousand times better than the third version of the game, the physics of the game are not good (car sticks to the asphalt some hours and at other times has no grip on the ground), the modeling of the vehicles is strange with strange proportions and "badly placed" colors, the textures in the game even in ultra mode are still very low resolution even for the games of the time, the game's points system is extremely broken by the fact that you do not win by position in some modes but by the damage you gave or took, the game is repetitive without many ways to vary the mode/track, etc. The artificial intelligence in the game does not give enough challenges to players, the music system in the game is not bad but could be greatly improved both in audio quality and the selection of songs that exist in the game itself, the game's collision system is unfair because if you crash the car slowly you have a chance of dying and if you crash the car at high speed you die without even having a chance to do anything, the bots get in the way a lot because they are slow and make it difficult for you to improve your position in the race, the game does not fulfill its promise of following the previous games in the franchise well.

The game was downgraded after parts 1 and 2. Part 3 was made by a different studio with a budget of 3 rubles! To survive, these guys churned out garbage games just to survive... The game was released in 2011, and the engine Flatout 3 was developed on was nine years out of date. They squeezed the most out of it because they had no budget and their sponsors screwed them over more than once!
The game isn't that terrible!
P.S. The game initially throws a C++ file error. This can be easily fixed. Go to the game's installation folder, find the DirectX folder, open it, find dxsetup, and install it. (Not at all, ungrateful pigs.)

12/08/2024

A completely unplayable piece of crap. You can't even call it a regular racing game, let alone FlatOut. The cars drive like they're on ice and crash like toys. Combined with the atrocious physics, when you crash into an opponent at full speed, they either fly straight up or you drive over them without doing a single point of damage‚Äîhow can this even be called FlatOut? The only thing that's quite cool is the zombie mode, but the game's clunkiness makes it incredibly difficult to enjoy. Speaking of the music, it's cheaply recorded rock that's completely forgettable, and you're unlikely to even hear it over the excessively loud racing sounds. No Nickelback, Papa Roach, Amplifire, or even No Connection. There aren't even any vocals. Nothing special.
Basically, if you really hate someone, buy them this garbage, but don't even think about it for yourself. Don't make the same mistakes I did.

Como se habr√°n percatado, no tengo mucho tiempo jugado, pero a un as√≠ har√© est√° rese√±a. El juego no es la basura m√°s grande del mundo de los videojuegos como la plantean algunos, yo dir√≠a incluso que lo podr√≠a poner como decente, pasable, aprobado por casi nada. Tiene una jugabilidad por lo menos divertida y r√°pida, tus oponentes tienen una forma de conducci√≥n temeraria t√≠pica de la saga flatout ( al menos si hablamos desde el 2 para adelante ), forma de conducci√≥n que hace a un m√°s divertido el gameplay; tiene modos de juego muy divertidos, desde el cl√°sico modo carrera, asta una carrera de demolici√≥n, etc; los gr√°ficos viendo la √©poca de salida del juego no destacan en nada, de echo dir√≠a incluso que son feos, y la iluminaci√≥n es algo tosca, pero bueno esto es algo que afecta m√°s a lo visual; tiene una gran variedad de autos, algunos muy distintos, y gracias a qu√© es un juego sin licencias, se toma algunas libertades al crear algunos modelos de autos, que quedan por lo menos interesantes... Y por √∫ltimo y para finalizar, el juego cuenta con un rendimiento bastante decente, osea que el mismo puede correr en una gran variedad de PC, a un que recomiendo que si t√∫ PC es de bajos recursos, baja la resoluci√≥n ya que eso deber√≠a solucionar por completo el baj√≥n de FPS.

Les recomiendo que jueguen primero este t√≠tulo de la saga flatout, antes que el resto, por qu√© de jugar a los anteriores, se dar√°n cuenta que este esta a a√±os luz de siquiera llegarles a los talones. column9:
As you may have noticed, I haven't played much time, but I'll do this review anyway. The game isn't the biggest piece of garbage in the video game world as some people make it out to be, I'd even say I could put it as decent, passable, approved for almost nothing. It has at least fun and fast gameplay, your opponents have a reckless driving style typical of the Flatout saga (at least if we're talking about the 2 onwards), a way of driving that makes the gameplay more fun; it has very fun game modes, from the classic career mode, to a demolition race, etc.; the graphics considering the time the game was released don't stand out at all, in fact I'd even say they're ugly, and the lighting is somewhat crude, but hey, this is something that affects the visuals more; It has a wide variety of cars, some very different, and thanks to the fact that it's a license-free game, it takes some liberties when creating some car models, which are at least interesting. And finally, the game has pretty decent performance, meaning it can run on a wide variety of PCs. I recommend that if your PC is low-end, lower the resolution, as that should completely fix the FPS drop.

I recommend playing this title in the Flatout series first, before the rest, because if you play the previous ones, you'll realize that this one is light years away from even coming close. Play Flatout 3 first, then Flatout 1, then Flatout 4, then Flatout 2, and finally Flatout Ultimate Carnage (although if you play the 2nd one last, it won't be a problem either, since that one, in my opinion, is the best of the lot).

If I change my mind, this review will be updated immediately, so trust me.

no es un flat out pero lo considero un post- par√≠s chase , aunque redshirt theory es un duo que  marc√≥ con su m√∫sica mi adolescencia, es malo en mec√°nicas e inercia, pero me gusta la variedad.

column9: It's not a flat out, but I consider it a post-Paris Chase. Although Redshirt Theory is a duo whose music marked my adolescence, it's bad at mechanics and inertia, but I like the variety. 6 Team Studios would do a Saint Row style much better, with a very insane sense of humor, without sarcasm, more aggressive and harsh, with a tendency toward sadness and desolation. That would be a different game for people with brains and class, far from pretending to be "cool."
Give your friend such a gift for his birthday and I think he will be happy about it.

column9:
[h1]How could they release such crap?[/h1]
They've simply disgraced my beloved FlatOut series. What did publisher Strategy First expect by handing the game over to Team 6 Studios, the same team that created the unsuccessful port of the first FlatOut to the Wii?
I was surprised that this game has so much content, but what's the point if the gameplay and graphics are simply terrible?

The only mode that briefly captivated me was SPLATOUT, where you have to crush zombies.
However, I'll leave a positive review, if only because this game is practically free on sale with the collection, and there are plenty of negative reviews without me.

ENG
Lets see. This game got into my library after purchase of FlatOut Anthology Pack. As always when i have something from pack, i read reviews of others and then give game a chance, be reviews anyhow negative. It was same with Flatout 3. Aint gonna lie, after reading reviews i thought imma just turn it on, try out all modes and uninstall. But opposite happened. Ladies and gentleman, i actually love Flatout 3...  And im honest. Sure, grafics are pretty "dated" (tho it always were last concern on games for me), and driving model is not realistic (which honestly isnt bad thing), and yes, theres no soundtrack, but its awesome arcade thing for goofing around with cars. Controlls arent bad. Those who say that probably mean one lil problem - if u use ALT for nitro, for example left, car will both use nitro and will drift to left. dunno if its same with r.alt, but just rebind nitro for X as i do have it (have it like this on all flatouts), and all is good. 
Pros / Cons
- Absence of soundtrack
- Not changable drift function for Alt keys
- Some tracks require u to remember parts due to sharp curves
+ Probably everything else. In short, perfect simple arcade game with funny vehicular mayhem
column9:
SK & ENG

SK: Let's see. This game was added to my library by purchasing the FlatOut Anthology Pack. As always when I get something from the pack, I read the reviews and then give it a chance, no matter how negative the reviews are. It was the same with Flatout 3. I won't lie, after reading the reviews, I expected to turn it on, try all the modes and uninstall it. But the opposite happened. I really like the FO3... And I mean it sincerely. Sure, the graphics are pretty "dated" (even though that's the last thing I care about in games), and the driving model isn't realism (which honestly isn't a bad thing), and yes, it lacks a soundtrack, but it's a perfect arcade to goof off. Control is not bad. Probably those who claim this have one problem in mind - if you have a nitro alto, e.g. the left one, the car will drift to the left with the nitro. I don't know what it's like with a real alto, but simply rebind it to X like I do (I have nitro on all flatouts), and it works. 
Pros / Cons
- Absence of soundtrack
- immutable drift function on the Alt button
- on some tracks you have to remember where to go for sharp turns
+ Probably everything else. In short, it's fun arcade mayhem to get you crazy

column8:
I read all the reviews, thought they were probably exaggerated, and was proven wrong. I have literally played one single race and that is enough to never touch this game again.

A short summary:
- Character models look worse than N64 games. I've seen this same comment in another review and it is -not- exaggerated.
- The car selection/tuning options before a race are ridiculously uninformative.
- I've seen children with better understandings of physics than the devs of this game. I'm not saying it should be hyper realistic (especially not when playing a destruction / combat racer), but accelerating from 0 to 200 in less than 3 seconds and then (when everything is already flying around you) suddenly you need several more seconds to reach a speed around 240.
- The cars are so ridiculously fast and you constantly send objects flying around you that you have no idea of where your oponents are.

For me it's too late. I've wasted a whole 7 minutes on this game that I will never get back (and again as much on writing this review). If you want to torture yourself, please seek help (or at the very least seek better options than this game).

column8:
truly the best car game, one of the only games where your brain can degenerate after playing, if a game could have a mental disorder this would definitely be the result, well if you decide to get this game ive got a few tips on how to have fun:

step 1. choose the green car (for some reason its the only car where i can actually drive properly)
step 2. choose the most drip person
step 3. choose the map 'Castello reverse'
step 4. turn up the volume to listen to the beautiful sounds
step 5. watch as the ai suffers since they have 0 iq
step 6. and observe, itll be one of the greatest things youve ever seen in your life

also there are some mini-games like the big big battle one i think where there are 24 cars and you gotta slam into each other for points, I highly recommend turning up the volume all the way omg the sounds are so beautiful, i probably risked going deaf but its truly worth it.

anyway this is probably the best $1.45AUD ive spent in my life truly an experience like no other.

column9:
I disagree with some of the comments.
The game, while not even half as good as the others, is playable. It's not as bad as they say.
It's boring; you quickly lose the enjoyment of playing. It's not that difficult. Many of the tracks aren't good.
There are several game modes. Most of them I don't really enjoy, but that also applies to the other games in the series. I like racing and watching the mess.
The cars aren't "stiff" to handle, as some say; in fact, some are too "soft," taking corners too easily. The guy probably tuned the car with the speed option and didn't realize that it's normal for the steering to be firmer and "stiff."
There are indeed some bugs (car color, checkpoints, etc.).
Oh! It doesn't go up hills in 1st gear...

Tip:
Play with the Scimitar from Sports Class, tuning: default, which is a hit most of the time, and for a change, the Nibarreth GT X3 from Tuner Class, tuning: speed (this car has very "soft" steering ("too easy"), but when you put it in the speed tuning, it balances out and becomes almost overpowered).

In short: only buy it on sale when it's close to R$1.99 and you don't know what to do with that amount. After all, this game isn't that fun.

Have a good game (I don't even know).
God bless you.

column8: People have been Trashing on this game hard and it is not hard to see why. There are too many glitches, The driving controls are terrible, the rooster is boring as hell, all the modes suck, and the human designs look 1 million times worse than the first 3D game of all time Mario 64. How is a game that is 15 years more recent look 1 million time worse than the game that came out 15 years ago when this game came out. Also this game is so bad that even the CPU's gave at certain moments. This game is absolutely horrible, I may have had fun ranting about the worst rated game on steam right now, But all of you were right. I should next time try to play the best rated game on steam, because its both easier to find and I will have more fun with that game. So yeah, 2/10, 2nd worst game of all time behind Sonic Free Riders.

column8: This game is an apex in its genre, the controls handle like finely aged wine, the graphics are as exquisite and are worth the 10gb on my SSD. There are plenty of lobbies to join and the develops actively develop this game to this day. Other racing games do not hold a candle to this giant, forza horizon is shit compared to this game. Each game mode is hand crafted and the fullest of care to its mechanics. Physics that rival the source engine, the sound effects are one of a kind and with my dobly surround sound speaker system echo the quality that this game provides. For a low price of $1.50 this game is a steal, this is the only racing game you will need after. My final rating is 10/10, i will play this game with my kids to show how much i love them.
column9: This game is an apex in its genre, the controls handle like finely aged wine, the graphics are as exquisite and are worth the 10gb on my SSD. There are plenty of lobbies to join and the develops actively develop this game to this day. Other racing games do not hold a candle to this giant, forza horizon is shit compared to this game. Each game mode is hand crafted and the fullest of care to its mechanics. Physics that rival the source engine, the sound effects are one of a kind and with my dobly surround sound speaker system echo the quality that this game provides. For a low price of $1.50 this game is a steal, this is the only racing game you will need after. My final rating is 10/10, i will play this game with my kids to show how much i love them.

An excellent psychological horror game that affects both the psyche and the subconscious. After 10 minutes of this crap, I wanted to jump out the window, but then I remembered I needed a refund for this piece of crap. I'm describing the gameplay, go to the menu, and immediately my palms start sweating, my asshole shrinks to the size of an atom, and diarrhea oozes out, creating a favorable atmosphere for this stupid piece of crap. This game is like a beating from your dad, just as strong and merciless, only the beatings are free, and you have to pay for this nightmare!!! I'd rather buy a bottle of vodka, beat up my wife, and go play tanks than buy this game. As a psychological horror game, I give it a 10 out of 10, but as a game, I give it a zero. I'd like to end the review with some advice: play checkers or backgammon instead of this piece of crap, or better yet, go to jail.

column8: What the actual fuck is this? This plays like someone on itch.io tried to copy flatout 1 for a school project. Cars just bounce off each other with no deforming. There is no music during races. The graphics looks very very bad, legitimately the original Flatout game looks better. It's like the whole thing is compressed. I don't think I've ever seen such a downgrade in a series. Go play Flatout 1 or 2 or Ultimate Carnage or Roblox, anything but this. No progression system either. Never have I played a game where I just had to put down the controller and wonder why I touched this.

column9:
I decided to give it a try, given the overwhelmingly negative reviews. It feels like a very simple, old-fashioned game. Fans of the series apparently disliked it, but I hadn't played a racing game since F-Zero, so I figured it was about what you'd expect. Furthermore, I'm not familiar with how cars behave in real life, so I couldn't find anything to criticize about the game's behavior. There don't seem to be any serious bugs that would make it difficult to continue playing, and there are a decent number of game modes available.

But that doesn't mean I expect to play it for long, so I wouldn't recommend it. However, for those who have made it a point to try out games and other things that are panned, it might be worth a try.

column8:
cracked game i think i have a better outlook on life now that i played that game! According to all known laws
of aviation,

  
there is no way a bee
should be able to fly.

  
Its wings are too small to get
its fat little body off the ground.

  
The bee, of course, flies anyway

  
because bees don't care
what humans think is impossible.

  
Yellow, black. Yellow, black.
Yellow, black. Yellow, black.

  
Ooh, black and yellow!
Let's shake it up a little.

  
Barry! Breakfast is ready!

  
Ooming!

  
Hang on a second.

  
Hello?

  
- Barry?
- Adam?

  
- Oan you believe this is happening?
- I can't. I'll pick you up.

  
Looking sharp.

  
Use the stairs. Your father
paid good money for those.

  
Sorry. I'm excited.

  
Here's the graduate.
We're very proud of you, son.

  
A perfect report card, all B's.

  
Very proud.

  
Ma! I got a thing going here.

  
- You got lint on your fuzz.
- Ow! That's me!

  
- Wave to us! We'll be in row 118,000.
- Bye!

  
Barry, I told you,
stop flying in the house!

  
- Hey, Adam.
- Hey, Barry.

  
- Is that fuzz gel?
- A little. Special day, graduation.

  
Never thought I'd make it.

  
Three days grade school,
three days high school.

  
Those were awkward.

  
Three days college. I'm glad I took
a day and hitchhiked around the hive.

  
You did come back different.

  
- Hi, Barry.
- Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good.

  
- Hear about Frankie?
- Yeah.

  
- You going to the funeral?
- No, I'm not going.

  
Everybody knows,
sting someone, you die.

  
Don't waste it on a squirrel.
Such a hothead.

  
I guess he could have
just gotten out of the way.

  
I love this incorporating
an amusement park into our day.

  
That's why we don't need vacations.

  
Boy, quite a bit of pomp...
under the circumstances.

  
- Well, Adam, today we are men.
- We are!

  
- Bee-men.
- Amen!

  
Hallelujah!

  
Students, faculty, distinguished bees,

  
please welcome Dean Buzzwell.

  
Welcome, New Hive Oity
graduating class of...

  
...9:15.

  
That concludes our ceremonies.

  
And begins your career
at Honex Industries!

  
Will we pick ourjob today?

  
I heard it's just orientation.

  
Heads up! Here we go.

  
Keep your hands and antennas
inside the tram at all times.

  
- Wonder what it'll be like?
- A little scary.

  
Welcome to Honex,
a division of Honesco

  
and a part of the Hexagon Group.

  
This is it!

  
Wow.

  
Wow.

  
We know that you, as a bee,
have worked your whole life

  
to get to the point where you
can work for your whole life.

  
Honey begins when our valiant Pollen
Jocks bring the nectar to the hive.

  
Our top-secret formula

  
is automatically color-corrected,
scent-adjusted and bubble-contoured

  
into this soothing sweet syrup

  
with its distinctive
golden glow you know as...

  
Honey!

  
- That girl was hot.
- She's my cousin!

  
- She is?
- Yes, we're all cousins.

  
- Right. You're right.
- At Honex, we constantly strive

  
to improve every aspect
of bee existence.

  
These bees are stress-testing
a new helmet technology.

  
- What do you think he makes?
- Not enough.

  
Here we have our latest advancement,
the Krelman.

  
- What does that do?
- Oatches that little strand of honey

  
that hangs after you pour it.
Saves us millions.

  
Oan anyone work on the Krelman?

  
Of course. Most bee jobs are
small ones. But bees know

  
that every small job,
if it's done well, means a lot.

  
But choose carefully

  
because you'll stay in the job
you pick for the rest of your life.

  
The same job the rest of your life?
I didn't know that.

  
What's the difference?

  
You'll be happy to know that bees,
as a species, haven't had one day off

  
in 27 million years.

  
So you'll just work us to death?

  
We'll sure try.

  
Wow! That blew my mind!

  
"What's the difference?"
How can you say that?

  
One job forever?
That's an insane choice to have to make.

  
I'm relieved. Now we only have
to make one decision in life.

  
But, Adam, how could they
never have told us that?

  
Why would you question anything?
We're bees.

  
We're the most perfectly
functioning society on Earth.

  
You ever think maybe things
work a little too well here?

  
Like what? Give me one example.

  
I don't know. But you know
what I'm talking about.

  
Please clear the gate.
Royal Nectar Force on approach.

  
Wait a second. Oheck it out.

  
- Hey, those are Pollen Jocks!
- Wow.

  
I've never seen them this close.

  
They know what it's like
outside the hive.

  
Yeah, but some don't come back.

  
- Hey, Jocks!
- Hi, Jocks!

  
You guys did great!

  
You're monsters!
You're sky freaks! I love it! I love it!

  
- I wonder where they were.
- I don't know.

  
Their day's not planned.

  
Outside the hive, flying who knows
where, doing who knows what.

  
You can'tjust decide to be a Pollen
Jock. You have to be bred for that.

  
Right.

  
Look. That's more pollen
than you and I will see in a lifetime.

  
It's just a status symbol.
Bees make too much of it.

  
Perhaps. Unless you're wearing it
and the ladies see you wearing it.

  
Those ladies?
Aren't they our cousins too?

  
Distant. Distant.

  
Look at these two.

  
- Oouple of Hive Harrys.
- Let's have fun with them.

  
It must be dangerous
being a Pollen Jock.

  
Yeah. Once a bear pinned me
against a mushroom!

  
He had a paw on my throat,
and with the other, he was slapping me!

  
- Oh, my!
- I never thought I'd knock him out.

  
What were you doing during this?

  
Trying to alert the authorities.

  
I can autograph that.

  
A little gusty out there today,
wasn't it, comrades?

  
Yeah. Gusty.

  
We're hitting a sunflower patch
six miles from here tomorrow.

  
- Six miles, huh?
- Barry!

  
A puddle jump for us,
but maybe you're not up for it.

  
- Maybe I am.
- You are not!

  
We're going 0900 at J-Gate.

  
What do you think, buzzy-boy?
Are you bee enough?

  
I might be. It all depends
on what 0900 means.

  
Hey, Honex!

  
Dad, you surprised me.

  
You decide what you're interested in?

  
- Well, there's a lot of choices.
- But you only get one.

  
Do you ever get bored
doing the same job every day?

  
Son, let me tell you about stirring.

  
You grab that stick, and you just
move it around, and you stir it around.

  
You get yourself into a rhythm.
It's a beautiful thing.

  
You know, Dad,
the more I think about it,

  
maybe the honey field
just isn't right for me.

  
You were thinking of what,
making balloon animals?

  
That's a bad job
for a guy with a stinger.

  
Janet, your son's not sure
he wants to go into honey!

  
- Barry, you are so funny sometimes.
- I'm not trying to be funny.

  
You're not funny! You're going
into honey. Our son, the stirrer!

  
- You're gonna be a stirrer?
- No one's listening to me!

  
Wait till you see the sticks I have.

  
I could say anything right now.
I'm gonna get an ant tattoo!

  
Let's open some honey and celebrate!

  
Maybe I'll pierce my thorax.
Shave my antennae.

  
Shack up with a grasshopper. Get
a gold tooth and call everybody "dawg"!

  
I'm so proud.

  
- We're starting work today!
- Today's the day.

  
Oome on! All the good jobs
will be gone.

  
Yeah, right.

  
Pollen counting, stunt bee, pouring,
stirrer, front desk, hair removal...

  
- Is it still available?
- Hang on. Two left!

  
One of them's yours! Oongratulations!
Step to the side.

  
- What'd you get?
- Picking crud out. Stellar!

  
Wow!

  
Oouple of newbies?

  
Yes, sir! Our first day! We are ready!

  
Make your choice.

  
- You want to go first?
- No, you go.

  
Oh, my. What's available?

  
Restroom attendant's open,
not for the reason you think.

  
- Any chance of getting the Krelman?
- Sure, you're on.

  
I'm sorry, the Krelman just closed out.

  
Wax monkey's always open.

  
The Krelman opened up again.

  
What happened?

  
A bee died. Makes an opening. See?
He's dead. Another dead one.

  
Deady. Deadified. Two more dead.

  
Dead from the neck up.

column9:
cracked game i think i have a better outlook on life now that i played that game! According to all known laws
of aviation,

  
there is no way a bee
should be able to fly.

  
Its wings are too small to get
its fat little body off the ground.

  
The bee, of course, flies anyway

  
because bees don't care
what humans think is impossible.

  
Yellow, black. Yellow, black.
Yellow, black. Yellow, black.

  
Ooh, black and yellow!
Let's shake it up a little.

  
Barry! Breakfast is ready!

  
Ooming!

  
Hang on a second.

  
Hello?

  
- Barry?
- Adam?

  
- Oan you believe this is happening?
- I can't. I'll pick you up.

  
Looking sharp.

  
Use the stairs. Your father
paid good money for those.

  
Sorry. I'm excited.

  
Here's the graduate.
We're very proud of you, son.

  
A perfect report card, all B's.

  
Very proud.

  
Ma! I got a thing going here.

  
- You got lint on your fuzz.
- Ow! That's me!

  
- Wave to us! We'll be in row 118,000.
- Bye!

  
Barry, I told you,
stop flying in the house!

  
- Hey, Adam.
- Hey, Barry.

  
- Is that fuzz gel?
- A little. Special day, graduation.

  
Never thought I'd make it.

  
Three days grade school,
three days high school.

  
Those were awkward.

  
Three days college. I'm glad I took
a day and hitchhiked around the hive.

  
You did come back different.

  
- Hi, Barry.
- Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good.

  
- Hear about Frankie?
- Yeah.

  
- You going to the funeral?
- No, I'm not going.

  
Everybody knows,
sting someone, you die.

  
Don't waste it on a squirrel.
Such a hothead.

  
I guess he could have
just gotten out of the way.

  
I love this incorporating
an amusement park into our day.

  
That's why we don't need vacations.

  
Boy, quite a bit of pomp...
under the circumstances.

  
- Well, Adam, today we are men.
- We are!

  
- Bee-men.
- Amen!

  
Hallelujah!

  
Students, faculty, distinguished bees,

  
please welcome Dean Buzzwell.

  
Welcome, New Hive Oity
graduating class of...

  
...9:15.

  
That concludes our ceremonies.

  
And begins your career
at Honex Industries!

  
Will we pick ourjob today?

  
I heard it's just orientation.

  
Heads up! Here we go.

  
Keep your hands and antennas
inside the tram at all times.

  
- Wonder what it'll be like?
- A little scary.

  
Welcome to Honex,
a division of Honesco

  
and a part of the Hexagon Group.

  
This is it!

  
Wow.

  
Wow.

  
We know that you, as a bee,
have worked your whole life

  
to get to the point where you
can work for your whole life.

  
Honey begins when our valiant Pollen
Jocks bring the nectar to the hive.

  
Our top-secret formula

  
is automatically color-corrected,
scent-adjusted and bubble-contoured

  
into this soothing sweet syrup

  
with its distinctive
golden glow you know as...

  
Honey!

  
- That girl was hot.
- She's my cousin!

  
- She is?
- Yes, we're all cousins.

  
- Right. You're right.
- At Honex, we constantly strive

  
to improve every aspect
of bee existence.

  
These bees are stress-testing
a new helmet technology.

  
- What do you think he makes?
- Not enough.

  
Here we have our latest advancement,
the Krelman.

  
- What does that do?
- Oatches that little strand of honey

  
that hangs after you pour it.
Saves us millions.

  
Oan anyone work on the Krelman?

  
Of course. Most bee jobs are
small ones. But bees know

  
that every small job,
if it's done well, means a lot.

  
But choose carefully

  
because you'll stay in the job
you pick for the rest of your life.

  
The same job the rest of your life?
I didn't know that.

  
What's the difference?

  
You'll be happy to know that bees,
as a species, haven't had one day off

  
in 27 million years.

  
So you'll just work us to death?

  
We'll sure try.

  
Wow! That blew my mind!

  
"What's the difference?"
How can you say that?

  
One job forever?
That's an insane choice to have to make.

  
I'm relieved. Now we only have
to make one decision in life.

  
But, Adam, how could they
never have told us that?

  
Why would you question anything?
We're bees.

  
We're the most perfectly
functioning society on Earth.

  
You ever think maybe things
work a little too well here?

  
Like what? Give me one example.

  
I don't know. But you know
what I'm talking about.

  
Please clear the gate.
Royal Nectar Force on approach.

  
Wait a second. Oheck it out.

  
- Hey, those are Pollen Jocks!
- Wow.

  
I've never seen them this close.

  
They know what it's like
outside the hive.

  
Yeah, but some don't come back.

  
- Hey, Jocks!
- Hi, Jocks!

  
You guys did great!

  
You're monsters!
You're sky freaks! I love it! I love it!

  
- I wonder where they were.
- I don't know.

  
Their day's not planned.

  
Outside the hive, flying who knows
where, doing who knows what.

  
You can'tjust decide to be a Pollen
Jock. You have to be bred for that.

  
Right.

  
Look. That's more pollen
than you and I will see in a lifetime.

  
It's just a status symbol.
Bees make too much of it.

  
Perhaps. Unless you're wearing it
and the ladies see you wearing it.

  
Those ladies?
Aren't they our cousins too?

  
Distant. Distant.

  
Look at these two.

  
- Oouple of Hive Harrys.
- Let's have fun with them.

  
It must be dangerous
being a Pollen Jock.

  
Yeah. Once a bear pinned me
against a mushroom!

  
He had a paw on my throat,

column8: What can I say about this game, you know how you see a franchise do great things and make great games and then ultimately turn into an empty shell, a true husk of what it once was. You think about the greatness of the Flatout name, then you realize this will never live up to that greatness you were so fond of as a kid. You sit there 30 years old thinking maybe it won't be that bad, maybe there will be even the slightest amount joy to be found in this game, I am sad to say this game did none of that, the only thing this game truly had going for it was the fact I could play and eject discount Ron Jeremy into a windmill over and over again but that would be as far as I would get because that stupid windmill would cock me over every single time. Thankfully I am not the one who spent 99 cents on this game, that honor goes to my good buddy John who does not all regret this decision and in fact said it was 99 cents plus tax well spent. It could be worse though, he could have been one of the unfortunate souls that bought this game at the full price of $10, you poor miserable bastards I truly weep for you all.

column8:
Definitivamente el peor de la saga.

FlatOut se caracteriza por ser un juego de carreras donde la destrucci√≥n del ambiente y de los coches destaca bastante, pues ahora la destrucci√≥n del coche es m√≠nima, la c√°mara se bugea cuando alcanzas altas velocidades, la IA es nefasta tomando solo dos opciones, chocar contra el primer √°rbol o pared invisible que ven o simplemente conducci√≥n perfecta.

FlatOut 1 fue un buen arranque ya que nos introduce el tema de la destrucci√≥n de entorno (muy m√≠nima) y destrucci√≥n vehicular.

FlatOut 2 mejora aun m√°s la destrucci√≥n, las f√≠sicas e colisi√≥n de objetos.

FlatOut Ultimate Carnage fue la saga en su m√°ximo esplendor, una mejor gr√°fica muy notoria tanto iluminasion, detalle de texturas, etc.

Esta ultima entrega es un paso atr√°s, si, a√±ade mas modos de juego y personajes jugables pero aun asi no podemos ocultar el hecho de que perdio toda su esencia y carisma, la saga FlatOut murio gracias a su 4 entrega.
column9:
Definitely the worst in the series.

FlatOut is characterized by being a racing game where environmental and car destruction are quite prominent. Car destruction is minimal now, the camera bugs at high speeds, and the AI ‚Äã‚Äãis terrible, with only two options: crash into the first tree or invisible wall they see or simply perfect driving.

FlatOut 1 was a good start as it introduced us to the topic of environmental destruction (very minimal) and vehicle destruction.

FlatOut 2 further improves the destruction, physics, and object collisions.

FlatOut Ultimate Carnage was the series at its peak, with much improved graphics, lighting, texture detail, and more.

This latest installment is a step backwards, yes, adding more game modes and playable characters, but we still can't hide the fact that it lost all its essence and charisma. The FlatOut saga died thanks to its fourth installment.

column8:
Welcome to European Street Racing 2, now with offroading, formula cars...explosions...hell levels(??)...Zin Benzin...what in the actual fuck, what is this script even, guys? WAIT....This isn't ESR, but it also fucking IS!! It's the same game engine, same shitty sounds and ass handling, same incompetent devs that somehow bought the license to this masterpiece of a franchise to kill it for good & they brought pure and unfiltered PAIN.

You can't find anything good about this game, everything is just pure trash. Many game modes that most reside to same kinda race content but in different scenarios, derbies that all AI will target you and only you, a stunt mode so idiotically made it will bring you physical pain. The handling on some offroad tracks will make you want to end it, the braindead AI with unbelievable rubberbanding will always keep you on your toes if you get in front and winning is definitely possible...in most of the garbage in here. But you got no real career mode, just random ass maps with maybe some FlatOut cars & some god forsakes abominations of cars they have done. Oh, there is also a zombies mode for...no reason. And of course it is awful.

I will probably not list anything new that the other reviewers and youtubers already haven't said, but it has been fun ONLY to show it to my friends how the worst game ever would be like. In order to enjoy the good games, you gotta experience through the worst of the worst as well. Actually, no, scratch that, save yourself the pain & $$$ and don't buy this steaming pile of shit. It is a disgrace to the FlatOut name and a goddamn stain on the racing games genre.

column8:
Did you ever hear the tragedy of Darth Plagueis the Wise?
I thought not. It's not a story the Jedi would tell you. It's a Sith legend. Darth Plagueis was a Dark Lord of the Sith, so powerful and so wise that he could use the Force to influence midichlorians to create life. He had such a knowledge of the Dark Side that he could even keep the ones he cared about from dying. The Dark Side of the Force is a pathway to many abilities some consider to be unnatural. He became so powerful... the only thing he was afraid of was losing his power, which eventually - of course - he did. Unfortunately, he taught his apprentice everything he knew, and then his apprentice killed him in his sleep. Ironic. He could save others from death, but not himself.

Well this game was more of a tragedy.

column8:
I had no clue about this game's reputation prior to playing it. I picked it up cheap along with the other Flatout games.

When a game is this poorly reviewed, there's usually some sort of redeeming comical quality to it. Not so in this case. Flatout 3 is boring, plain, and ugly. That it's so unremarkable is part of what makes it so bad.

If you want to play Flatout, just play Flatout 2 or Flatout UC. There is nothing worth seeing here.

column8: So I originally found this game by watching a youtube video on it and I was like "damn, that's a horrid game". One day I was bored, and it was on sale. So I bought it and decided to stream it to my friends on discord. To my dismay, some of my friends decided to get it, and we ended up playing the online mode. This allowed my hubris to get to me. I decided to host a flatout 3 tournament, and this is how now, T E N OTHER PEOPLE own the game. This is the consequence of my actions. This is my tragedy, the Shakespearean play in which I live every waking moment in. Don't play flatout 3, unless you are willing to lose everything.

Once a hit with its debut and cemented with a legendary sequel, the series has only received a remake in the form of FlatOut: Ultimate Carnage in the five years since FlatOut 2's release. The entire gaming community was waiting for a proper third installment in the series... "No problem," thought players. "The third installment won't disappoint!" ...
"FlatOut: Ultimate Carnage is still good, but it's only recommended for those who haven't seen the original FlatOut 2. Everyone else is better off waiting for the full-fledged third installment." ¬©Igromania
"FlatOut: Ultimate Carnage is something you won't be bored with while you wait for the third installment." ¬©Playground
Did you finally get it! Have you ever had boiling tin poured on your face?! NO?! You just haven't played FlatOut 3!

COOL IDEA. INTERESTING SETTING. WETTED FANS' INTEREST.

During the game's development, the publisher kept promising what we'd see in the new FlatOut. By the way, I'd like to say that everything they promised and planned has come to fruition! So, what's the game's concept? The game's setting is apocalypse (who would have doubted it). Why plural? Yeah, because all the scenarios are embodied in this game: there's a flood - as you progress along the track, it sinks; there's an earthquake - as you progress along the track, the ground cracks and crevices appear in the road, into which cars fall; there's a meteor shower - flaming meteorites fall from the sky on sections of the track; there's a global crisis - war - during the race, helicopters fly and tanks drive by, shooting at the track and the racers; there's a zombie apocalypse, which is even highlighted as a separate mode - you need to score points by shooting down zombies and multiply them by doing combos (have you seen the 300X combo?!). Each apocalypse takes place in its own country, so during the game we travel around the world. That is, the first chapter is America, Detroit, and there is an industrial crisis everywhere, destroyed nature, ruins of cities and thriving factories that fill the air with acrid chemical smoke; the second chapter is Italy, Rome, and there is a meteor shower in the city, devastation and fires everywhere; and so on by region. And this is only the main campaign + zombie mode! The game, in principle, has a large number of modes - have fun as much as you want (God, for what). In addition to the above-mentioned, there are: stunt tricks, straight from the first parts, only with a larger number of locations (the last part of the stunts takes place on the HELL location - this is not a fucking joke!); arena fights - a battle on cars of the same class; a big battle - all classes, all cars; Bigfoot challenges; High-speed Formula One races on a wide variety of tracks (how scary are the "Kazakhstan Massacre" or "Lake Svityaz" tracks? NO?! It's time to be scared!); nightlife (Have you ever had a speck of dust in your eye? Well, imagine having a handful of salt in your eye that you can turn on and off whenever you want); off-roading; a challenge (essentially a random race from a random mode).
Indeed, racing in an apocalypse setting with gameplay featuring crumbling tracks is an interesting idea, but "Does it fit the FlatOut series?" is a big question. So, we've been promised a sea of ‚Äã‚Äãcontent (crap), but what about the rest of the game? Then things went like this: a new engine (more like an unfinished piece of code, but let's say so), new physics (Newton in his coffin would spin like a propeller at 2000 RPM after that kind of "physics"), a wide selection of characters (the next one is even worse than the last), a console and PC release, a dynamic soundtrack (that's right, a fucking soundtrack, one track for the entire game), an online mode (it's so good, it has such a magnificent zero-player mode), and most importantly, a numbered sequel to the legendary series (from now on, it's the worst sequel in history). Everyone was impatient, everyone was waiting for the new game.

FIRST "WAR WARNINGS" OR THE FAILURE OF A GAME NOT YET RELEASED

As already mentioned, the publisher eagerly leaked information about the threequel ‚Äì and then, a month before the game's release, the publisher releases a teaser featuring the legendary logo of the racing game developers, and this... ...Team6? Who the f*ck is this?! After digging around online, fans discovered that FlatOut's previous publisher, Empire Interactive, went bankrupt, and the rights to the "FlatOut" name were sold to a third party, namely Strategy First (after they released FlatOut 3, we'll call them Strategy Fisting). So, Strategy First commissioned the development of the sequel to their newly acquired franchise to one of their development companies, Team6. And now the best part! At the time of FlatOut 3's release, these unfortunate developers had 44 projects in development! And not one, I emphasize NOT ONE, of them was rated higher than 3 out of 10! So, these are developers of third-wave trash!

RESULT OR EXECUTION OF AN ENTIRE FRANCHISE WITH ONE GAME

And as they said, a studio that could have brought itself out of the shadows with one game, of course... shit its pants! What did you think they could do?! The real world isn't a Disney musical! What's wrong with the game?! Let's take it one step at a time:
Color Corrector. Remember the Yellow Filter in FlatOut 2 or NFS Most Wanted? Well, it's there too, only while in those games it was cool and pleasant, here it feels like someone pissed right in your eyes! I think the pain is comparable!
Gameplay. It's terrible, the cars are divided into many classes and subclasses... A LIE! They're divided into horribly controllable irons and uncontrollable irons! The latter are completely impossible to drive, the former are simply awful: the car brakes and accelerates whenever it wants, completely random handling, when you enter a turn, the car decides on its own whether to turn or not!
Nitro. Oh, shit, that's a whole other story! When nitro is activated, the car repairs damage, and the car model stretches out, turning into the bolt the developers put into this game!
Content? Where? All the maps and locations are simply terrible, most of them simply don't work, and the rest are afflicted with terrible game design! Seriously, after driving through a track, you won't want to return! And some you'll want to knock out right after the start! In zombie mode, after running over a zombie, a blood splatter effect appears, and at this point, you can't tell if it's just the effects or if you're already developing cataracts?! The entire game lasts 10-12 hours! That's almost all the achievements and all the gameplay! Why "almost"? Because all the achievements are basically impossible to obtain! For example, the online achievements! He's dead, just like my soul after completing this game! Or the achievement for completing the game's final mode‚Äîchallenges! There, the 19th challenge is impossible to complete a priori; you're given a bus that's impossible to drive the entire track on! It just gets stuck and that's it.
Remnants of luxury. The entire game plays one terrible track, no lyrics, just music! Why are you praising the devil?! This is his music! This is what they play in hell! This is the music to which sinners are tortured!! And the worst thing: there's a mode where the driver flies out through the windshield, requiring him to perform various tricks like in the previous games... you'd think there'd be much lower to fall, but nowhere near! This is simply pathetic! Now all the tricks have been reduced to hitting the target with the driver! And that's it! No points, no records! If you hit the target, you move on; if you miss, you'll just keep trying the same trick!
And oh yeah, I almost forgot, optimization... it's not here! Just accept it!
Conclusion: it's scary, really scary, we don't know what this is, if only we knew what it is, but we don't know what it is! And they dared to put the name FlatOut in the title!! I don't even know how to rate this! On the one hand, it's the end! On the other hand, it's pure, unbridled fun! I once got a driver wrapped around a car wheel, and I drove around like that for five laps! Or a race under the map in the void of existence! Where else can you see that?! Or falling through the textures in Hell. Overall, this game is for fans of trash or BDSM.

I'll give it a 2 out of 10, and you can decide for yourself which community I belong to!

P.S. A quick word about the price. "About WHAT?" you ask. Well, it costs money ‚Äì a whopping 250 rubles! It costs more than the legendary FlatOut 2! I think it's shameful to even give something like this away for free, and I consider it necessary to pay extra for the game!

column8:
Flatout 3 is a very good example of a game that sucks, beyond all measures, but it still remains true to the most basic principle of the series.

The cars accelerate ridiculously fast, brakes flip-flop from being either entire ineffectual or far too overbearing, sometimes you could crash into a wall and be just fine but sometimes you can crash and it sends you flying.

It is certainly true that Flatouts 1 and 2 were no sim racers but at least the cars in that game perform a little more like cars (especially 2) than this one does. The cars, mechanic-wise, seem to have been designed by a fetus that has had no taste of the real world, or real cars, and the rest of the game reflects that.

I played one race. It will not be my only one, as it will be fun to come back every couple of months and see just how bad this game is, because it will perhaps be fun to watch this dysfunctional garbage heap limp through basic mechanics.

This game, somehow, someway, stuck to Flatout principle of being a silly pre-Wreckfest combat racer. But it dialed up the somewhat lacking features of the original all the way to 9 and it really shows. 

Don't buy this game unless you have an itch to play some crappy game that looks the same as the rest of the series, and plays worse than those do.

I'm very sad to realize that this part of the game turned out to be a failure.
As someone who's not a fan of so-called arcade games, I didn't expect so many game modes, and I'm spoiled for choice.
After playing this game for almost two hours, I can confidently conclude that it's not worth playing through. There's no career in this game, only challenges. I don't know why they did it this way.
I've played all the modes several times. Honestly, I wasn't hooked.
The graphics are comparable to the second game. They did a good job with the color correction. It still feels like you're playing Burnout Paradise, not FlatOut.
The demolition derby is terrible, as are the physics. The collisions are paper-thin. I won't even mention the vehicle controls.
I spent two hours playing this game and don't want to play anymore. It's boring, not worth wasting your time.
I don't recommend it!

column8:
Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction is one of the most heavily negatively reviewed games on Steam, with a difficult to achieve "Overwhelmingly Negative" rating, usually reserved for AAA developers who really screw up.   Certainly, with most reviews on Steam being participation trophies, this is a major achievement for Strategy First, so a round of applause for screwing up this badly. 

I didn't think Flatout 3 was that bad.  It's 11 years old now and the visuals are badly dated, and there's optimisation problems as I experienced stuttering every 10 seconds or so, making the game somewhat unplayable.  It looks like when this was launched it would have been "okay" as a fun, brainless arcade racing game. 

This is superseded by Flatout 4, which is better rated, and because of the other general issues with it I can't recommend it.  Try one of the Need for Speed games or a newer Flatout game instead.

It's 11 years old now and the visuals are badly dated, and there's optimisation problems as I experienced stuttering every 10 seconds or so, making the game somewhat unplayable.  It looks like when this was launched it would have been "okay" as a fun, brainless arcade racing game. 

This is superseded by Flatout 4, which is better rated, and because of the other general issues with it I can't recommend it.  Try one of the Need for Speed games or a newer Flatout game instead.

column8:
It plays like a mobile game. I really love FlatOut series and I thought people were just overly negative, but no, all the reviews are true and honest.

The camera follows you like it was stuck between TPP and from the inside, you can't see the road before you, controls are clunky, cars have random physics during same race, just slip on the track or are hard to get them off of it. There's different collision mechanics, so the same objects that were destructible before, now are solid and completely ruin your progress on the race if you even lick them.

Both graphics and effects look like they were the first game in the series, not the third. It takes such a dive with quality it saddens me after binging previous two games. The UI is so disgusting and unreadable you can't even follow your progress in race, as the markers on the minimap are all the same colors and there's a ton of different words all around the screen, taking your attention off the road. You don't know which bar is nitro and which is your car's health. Everything suddenly needs to be told in a sentence instead of, for example, health bars, damage ratings, or just stupid road signs to show you where to turn next (there's a counter of how many meters/feet are to the next checkpoint, just to name one).

There's also no personality to this game. Previous ones had some characters coming back in every race, you knew their names, you knew their cars, their strenghts and weak points. It built some tension and made you more competetive, you knew who to watch out for if you were few points away from each other to win the cup. There's none of that. You don't know anyone's name until the race finishes and the list with places show up. You don't even know who is who, as all cars look so similar and bland. And, as I've previously stated, they all look like it was from a mobile game. 

The worst of all is that the crashes are not even satisfactory, they don't recompensate [u]s h i t[/u]. You can't visibly damage opponents' cars, as even the text that appears usually says "You've dealt 1% damage" while one collision with a rock on the track sends you to space. You get more damage done to yourself by rubbing against obstacles than by hitting others - while if anyone hits you, you're already dead, kid.

Please don't waste your money on this trash, even if its $2. It would be worth more if you just took $2 bill and threw it into thrash, because maybe some rat or racoon will eat it or some crow or pidgeon will make a nest out of it.

column8:

column9:
only played for trophy stuff 
at the other hand...this game sucks.

A game that should never have been created. A game that disgraces the entire FlatOut series. Although it's hard to classify it as part of that series, as the only thing that's FlatOut-esque in this pile of crap is the name. It's unclear why, or by what coincidence, the development of the third game (and the rights to the entire series) was handed over to another publisher and developer. It feels like Team6 didn't even try to make something decent and playable. They apparently just decided to go straight for trash, a parody, or something else inspired by FlatOut.

In the burning and tearing chaos and destruction, literally EVERYTHING is horribly done. You could start with any aspect of the game, as nothing offers any real value.

The graphics are pathetic; Team6 clearly didn't skimp on the ubiquitous blur. The car models, the environments, even the interface ‚Äì they're straight out of the 2000s.

The car physics don't compare to those in FlatOut 2 (in my opinion, the best game in the series). The cars behave like bars of soap, hard to catch in a bathtub.

The gameplay, while varied, offers so many modes, but they're so poorly organized and outdated that they're essentially worthless.

The opponent AI is completely nonexistent.

Judging by the soundtrack, I can tell it would be at home in some parody arcade game from the 2000s.

The characters are also a rather controversial issue. They're simply the pinnacle of the insanity that the developers seem to be suffering from.

The end result is one of the worst games in the entertainment industry, one I'd be ashamed to release on Steam, especially at a price of 250 rubles.

A 10 out of 10 bar of laundry soap.
I don't recommend this product. Don't even try it. It's a shame such a thriving series was cut short by the sale of the brand. It's a shame, a real shame.

FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction ‚Äì like all the FlatOut games before it‚Ä¶ it's a racing game, a death race, you might say. Unfortunately, it's clearly inferior to its competitor, NFS, but what can you do? Terrible controls and unattractive cars are to blame, but the aggressive driving and the ability to destroy everything in your path are almost always adjustable. The only thing I really liked was the Derby‚Ä¶ destroying your opponent with your car. There used to be a game called Carmageddon, which had the same principle, and they implemented it in FlatOut‚Ä¶ as I already said, the only huge advantage is ramming your opponent until they completely destroy him. There's no other appeal to the game; it's racing like anywhere else.

[*][b]Moster Truck:[/b] [i]At√© agora n√£o entendi esse modo, ganhei todas simplesmente destruindo meu carro na primeira oportunidade e por todos estarem com 0 de pontua√ß√£o eu ficava entre os 3 primeiros e ganhava a corrida.[/i]

Enquanto o design de alguma das pistas √© decente,a maior parte sem nexo e repetitiva, sem contar que tem diversos bugs como em algumas pistas em que passei por cima de um objeto e meu carro foi lan√ßado no espa√ßo.

Apesar do jogo ter bastante conte√∫do n√£o significa que est√£o completos, sinto que falta algo no jogo. A IA √© completamente in√∫til e acaba se tornando chato jogar pois n√£o h√° dificuldade no jogo. Outro ponto ruim √© que a maioria dos carros s√£o ruins de controlar o que acaba fazendo com que voc√™ escolha 1 carro e o use durante o jogo todo, n√£o tem um progresso √© como um jogo de corrida r√°pida aonde voc√™ pode escolher 1 carro qualquer e correr na pista que voc√™ quiser no modo de jogo que quiser, al√©m de que voc√™ se quer precisa jogar direito para ganhar, nos modos que pedem pontua√ß√£o para ganhar basta fazer um pouco de pontua√ß√£o e destruir o seu para ganhar pois assim que voc√™ destr√≥i o seu carro o que conta s√£o as pontua√ß√µes daquele momento, ganhei todas as corridas de Monster Truck em menos de 10 segundo apenas destruindo meu carro e vencendo com a pontua√ß√£o zero. O jogo n√£o tem um objetivo claro e n√£o pede nenhum empenho.

√â simplesmente um jogo terr√≠vel em quase todos os sentidos e n√£o vale o pre√ßo, sinceramente n√£o acho que vale nem em promo√ß√£o.
