column9:
[h1][b]Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction[/b][/h1]

Flat Out 3 is a game with a lot of content but almost no quality.

[b]AI: 0/10[/b]
The game's AI is terrible, terrible in every way, completely stupid in every mode. Even on hard, I managed to win several matches simply because my opponent couldn't make a single turn without destroying their own car. In derby mode, they pile up in one spot and destroy each other there.

[b]Mechanics: 1/10[/b]
The driving mechanics are so-so; each car is very different, and after a while, you get to control the car around the track, but it ends up becoming more work than fun, and you end up getting bored with the game. And we have several game modes:
[list]
[*][b]Race:[/b] [i]The classic race, nothing new or different.[/i]
[*][b]Stunt:[/b] [i]Pretty "okay," if compared to FlatOut 2, it leaves a lot to be desired with little variety in styles, and the only styles it has are quite boring.[/i]
[*][b]Battle and Big Battle:[/b] [i]Derby mode, extremely bad for two reasons: the AI ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äãthat will crowd into a corner, and the scoring system in which you don't have to do anything; opponents will attack you and you will score points before being destroyed, winning the match even if you are the first to be destroyed.[/i]
[*][b]Nightshift:[/b] [i]The classic race, but at night with fog that doesn't let you see what's ahead and few opponents, from 1 to 4.[/i]
[*][b]Offroad:[/b] [i]A mode with only two tracks, and the objective is to get the highest score possible by destroying objects or opponents, long jumps, and drifting. Nothing special and quite boring. Just destroy all the fences on one map and then drive over hills to jump on the other.[/i]
[*][b]Speed:[/b] [i]A Formula 1-style mode where the cars are faster and easier to control, making this mode completely unchallenging.[/i]
[*][b]Monster Truck:[/b] [i]I still don't understand this mode. I won them all by simply destroying my car at the first opportunity, and since everyone had 0 points, I was in the top 3 and won the race.[/i]
[*][b]Challenge:[/b] [i]There are 50 challenges that involve almost all game modes, but you can't choose the vehicle. or the rules of the race.[/i]
[*][b]Splatt Out:[/b] [i]A mode where the only objective is to reach a set score by running over zombies, which don't attack you or do anything; they just stand still on the track, quite boring.[/i]
[/list]
[b]Audio and Soundtrack: 0/10/[/b]
The sounds are unbalanced, quite annoying, and the soundtrack is one of the worst.

[b]Design: 2/10[/b]
While the design of some of the tracks is decent, most are disjointed and repetitive, not to mention having several bugs, like on some tracks where I ran over an object and my car was launched into space.

[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1]
Although the game has a lot of content, it doesn't mean it's complete; I feel like something is missing. The AI ‚Äã‚Äãis completely useless and ends up being boring to play because there's no difficulty in the game. Another downside is that most of the cars are difficult to control, which means you have to choose one car and use it throughout the game. There's no progression, it's like a fast-paced racing game where you can choose any car and race on any track you want in any game mode. Besides, you don't even need to play well to win. In modes that require scoring, you just need to earn a few points and destroy your car to win. Once you destroy your car, the only thing that counts is the score at that moment. I won every Monster Truck race in under 10 seconds by simply destroying my car and winning with a zero score. The game has no clear objective and doesn't require any effort.

It's simply a terrible game in almost every way and isn't worth the price. I honestly don't think it's worth it even on sale.

Current Price [b][u]R$19.99[/u][/b]
Recommended Price [b][u]R$2.49[/u][/b]

[b]Final Score: [u]0.7/10[/u][/b]

column8:
Alright, let me start if off by saying that for 9.99‚Ç¨, this is a crime. However, for 99 cents when it's on sale this is genuinely a decent choice.

Team 6 went with the motto "quantity over quality" and it shows. The game has plenty of content, but nothing, NOTHING is finished. Not even the elementary stuff like AI which is absolutely stupidly overpowered or just plain stupid (classic case of making no mistakes whatsoever, but the moment you make a mistake they'll crash on a straight road). 

[b][u]The driving model[/u][/b] is surprisingly okay-ish, and depending on your car choice you might have a good time going through some of the tracks. I did encounter a bug where the car refused to steer to the right properly though, and instead went sliding and spinning out immediately, which was fixed after restarting the game.

[b][u]The maps[/u][/b] are a split issue. While it seems to be the only thing where they at least tried, they're absolutely unreadable and the stiffness of half the objects on the road makes no sense whatsoever. Some of the hills in the offroad tracks are overly large, and some cars (including the AI) will struggle going up on them, which ruins the whole feeling. The circuit tracks are pretty well made though (probably because of the layouts already existing, yes, I noticed that half-assed Hockenheimring Team6).

[b][u]The derbies[/u][/b] are boring and poorly made. Not only is the damage model overall absolutely garbage (which is pretty crucial for a demolition derby racing game if you ask me), but the way the game counts points is absolutely retarded, plus the AI also shines here (you will get ganged upon by 3-4 drivers, eventually get stuck on their roof and get 10k points for staying there as the games will consider that as dealing damage for whatever reason).

[b][u]The stunts[/u][/b] are surprisingly okay. While the camera is absolutely terribly made, the stunts now allow you much more control post launch than the previous franchise entries, and this allowed for some interesting concepts for stunts, on which Team6 capitalized successfully.

[b][u]The game[/u][/b] also struggles with not having any unified career/campaign unlike the previous FlatOut games, and it shows - you do unlock some cars and tracks as you progress through certain types of events, but overall it all feels only like one huge "quick race" (in racing games, this stands for simply playing a track with a car of your choice while not progressing anywhere, just to get a feel for it/beat a certain time/whatever you want to do there). I can't also overlook some of the bugs I encountered while playing (broken UI after alttabbing, Justin Case's texture being broken during stunts and the driving model one I mentioned).

...and last but not least, [b][u]the sounds[/u][/b] are all very questionable. You'll get your eardrums blown off every single time you start, as there will be good bunch of cars NOSing instantly, but other than that there's not much, no songs (besides the main menu music), nothing.

I'm almost certain that I missed some points, however I won't go into details with every single gamemode in the game, since as I said, there are plenty and none of them are finished properly, so it would be a bit pointless. However, let me say this - the game is better than the general public makes it out to be, if this came out seven years earlier, and was being given out for free in those magazine CDs, I bet I'd have nice childhood memories of it. It's by no means a good game, but it also did some stuff correctly, and has it's moments where you'll genuinely be having fun. If you have a spare change left in your steam wallet, and don't want to buy either Unity asset abomination or a furry porn game, give this one a go.

Update: oh, and the multiplayer still works, and is actually pretty fun to play. Bonus points for that)

[b][u]The derbies[/u][/b] are boring and poorly made. Not only is the damage model overall absolutely garbage (which is pretty crucial for a demolition derby racing game if you ask me), but the way the game counts points is absolutely retarded, plus the AI also shines here (you will get ganged upon by 3-4 drivers, eventually get stuck on their roof and get 10k points for staying there as the games will consider that as dealing damage for whatever reason).

[b][u]The stunts[/u][/b] are surprisingly okay. While the camera is absolutely terribly made, the stunts now allow you much more control post launch than the previous franchise entries, and this allowed for some interesting concepts for stunts, on which Team6 capitalized successfully.

[b][u]The game[/u][/b] also struggles with not having any unified career/campaign unlike the previous FlatOut games, and it shows - you do unlock some cars and tracks as you progress through certain types of events, but overall it all feels only like one huge "quick race" (in racing games, this stands for simply playing a track with a car of your choice while not progressing anywhere, just to get a feel for it/beat a certain time/whatever you want to do there). I can't also overlook some of the bugs I encountered while playing (broken UI after alttabbing, Justin Case's texture being broken during stunts and the driving model one I mentioned).

...and last but not least, [b][u]the sounds[/u][/b] are all very questionable. You'll get your eardrums blown off every single time you start, as there will be good bunch of cars NOSing instantly, but other than that there's not much, no songs (besides the main menu music), nothing.

I'm almost certain that I missed some points, however I won't go into details with every single gamemode in the game, since as I said, there are plenty and none of them are finished properly, so it would be a bit pointless. However, let me say this - the game is better than the general public makes it out to be, if this came out seven years earlier, and was being given out for free in those magazine CDs, I bet I'd have nice childhood memories of it. It's by no means a good game, but it also did some stuff correctly, and has it's moments where you'll genuinely be having fun. If you have a spare change left in your steam wallet, and don't want to buy either Unity asset abomination or a furry porn game, give this one a go.

Update: oh, and the multiplayer still works, and is actually pretty fun to play. Bonus points for that)

I decided to try this game and see why it's getting so much hate. It's underrated, but there are some criticisms.
1. The controls aren't great; there are always moments when you skid off somewhere and crash.
2. The R key. In the first two games, it was the key that saved me. Now, it spawns you in the middle of nowhere, and if you were in first place, you'll quickly be overtaken, because you can't move for two seconds after respawning, and cars can easily fly right over you.

Game 4.5/10

column8:
Flatout 3 has historically been one of the lowest rated games on Steam, only dethroned from first place as of last year. A feat like this made me expect the worst... and yet I was somewhat surprised. 

It is no secret that the game is uglier than sin. The style is truly awful. Once I got past this though, I was surprised to see some level of competence went into this game. Having checked the settings, I saw custom key binds were a working feature, keyboard controls were given a level of respect I wouldn't have expected. 

Getting into a race, it's safe to say that it wasn't enjoyable. The first thing I noticed was the lack of music during gameplay so not off to a good start. Yet gameplay aside, in-game technical performance was actually fairly acceptable. I have encountered a couple of bugs during gameplay but nothing game breaking so far. I have also tried some of the alternative game modes such as destruction derby, the ragdoll launch, and Zombie knockdown. The first 2 were admittedly more interesting than the actual racing, dare I say... the destruction derby and ragdoll launch were actually somewhat "fun".

For some odd reason the game features selectable characters, they don't really serve any purpose other than how your ragdoll will look like. They're a odd mix of references or OC's, with one character clearly being based on Mario from Super Mario Bros, another on Vin Diesel, and then there's one based on film director Uwe Boll for some reason. It's a nigh useless feature, yet I feel it adds to the experience. The game's sense of humour has this alien charm to it.

I'm a bit conflicted here, as the 89 minutes I've played so far have been "bad" but also quite entertaining. I also received this game for free so I had nothing to lose, yet I feel that Flatout 3 stands as some sort of "So Bad it's Good" game. It entertained me beyond my initial expectations of none, and displayed features that some games considered good or rated "Very Positive" on Steam lack. The out of the box experience of Flatout 3 worked for me without issues which I think is a delicious piece of irony to end this on. Is this a good sequel to Flatout 2? HEAVENS NO! Do I recommend you buy this game? Not really, maybe for 50 pennies or less if you want to have a laugh with a friend. If you can get it for free, try it! 

tl;dr: A surprisingly "competent" but still terrible game.

Also ich muss ganz ehrlich gestehen, dass ich aufgrund vorangegangener Bewertungen, sagen wir mal "skeptisch" war, ABER als ich merkte, dass ein Gro√üteil der Produktionskosten in Lizenzen von Zario den Mechaniker und Zin Benzin geflossen sind, war mir schon klar, dass sollte ebenfalls ber√ºcksichtigt werden, da man deswegen nat√ºrlich auf eine Physik-Engine zur√ºckgreifen muss, die in einem sehr sehr nassen und dunklen Keller entstanden ist. Deswegen und weil ich eine Menge Spa√ü hatte, kann ich es jedem nur empfehlen.

Die Rennen machen Spa√ü, die Technik begeistert und die Audio mag in der Ohrmuschel knallen, aber ist ja auch irgendwie okay.

Entscheidet selbst KEKW
column9:
Well, I have to honestly admit that I was, let's say, "skeptical" based on previous reviews. BUT when I realized that a large portion of the production costs went into licenses for Zario the Mechanic and Zin Gasoline, I knew that this should also be taken into account, since it naturally requires the use of a physics engine that was developed in a very, very wet and dark basement. For this reason, and because I had a lot of fun, I can only recommend it to everyone.

The races are fun, the technology is impressive, and the audio may be jarring in your ears, but that's also okay.

Decide for yourself, KEKW

column8:
Where do I even start: The graphics, used sparingly but effectively; The music, ominously absent; The story, heart wrenching and i yet couldn't look away; The open world, some of the best and most subtle world building in gaming history. Not one of these aspects falls short of perfection. Not since Superman 64 has a game being so criminally underrated.
The game starts in a way that perfectly builds the atmosphere the sudden title screen shows there no padding throughout the story (and like a telltale your choices matter) the lack of an icon on the task bar may scare you into thinking its malware however this is subtly foreshadowing how this game will make you feel raw emotion.
The story is dense with character drama and to spoil any part in this review would keep me up at night.
This game has clear inspiration from fallout 76 the hunger and thirst mechanics make you feel like you are there. However unlike fallout it fits VR seamlessly with not a single graphical issue or fault.
The Rpg aspects are perfectly implemented and don't get in the way of the story. It is unique as exploration is both dangerous and rewarding as it can both end or extend your in game life depending on skill and your ability to adapt to the many challenging encounters.
i could not help but mention the soundtrack which perfectly counters the game play filling you with adrenaline when the action in the picks up, and the sorrow at the more dramatic parts.
While the game is nothing less then the second coming of christ i feel like the MMO aspects are not fully polished and finding another player is rare. I think to combat this the Devs should team up with the epic games launcher to give free copies to new players and expand the playerbase. I cannot wait to see the
continuation of the story in the upcoming dlc and i can't recommened this game more. 87/100

column9:
NOT RECOMMENDED (There are faster ways to go blind)
If you're a fan of the Flatout series or are eager to buy a car game, you might want to stop before even hovering over the buy button. If you still decide to take the risk, go in with zero expectations, as I'm sure the game will disappoint you even without them. It has a ton of visual issues, which I'll list below.

BAD POINTS
-Horrible handling: Driving in this game is a real pain.
-Ugly graphics: Anyone who knows me knows that I don't really care about graphics, but I simply can't see this game properly. The textures are horrible on the "high" settings, and the color selection is a disaster, to the point that even if you have the option to choose car colors, they'll almost always look brown or yellowish.
-Maps: Damn, the maps are something to cry about. Coming from previous Flatouts, you might think it's a good section, NO, it's not... the maps are visually and playably frustrating, like you have no idea. There are maps where the road design is very disproportionate to the cars. They're very empty, and many times the terrain is very strange and you can easily get stuck (it happened to me that in a race my car couldn't go up a slope because I wasn't going fast enough). -Destruction: The highlight of Flatouts was being able to destroy enemy cars and see how these hits affected them. Well, let's throw all that out the window and replace it with a crash system with % health and surface damage. Ah, maybe I should have added this to the maps, but sometimes when you do jumps on maps, it saps the car's life, even if they're mandatory jumps...
-Minigames: Most of the minigames are bad, but I'll only explain one. DESTRUCTION DERBY is awkward to play (like all minigames) since they put a crazy number of cars at you. Thanks to this, the mode on certain maps becomes an orgy of multiple cars crashing into each other. Plus, the minigame doesn't literally reward you with being last, but rather with the score obtained.

GOOD POINTS
-Does it have one?

CONCLUSION
This game is more painful than watching an orphan order a family pizza.

column9:
In a large pot - possibly a cistern, heat the lard and add the chopped onion (we will almost burn the onion with occasional stirring), this is the only way to make the right base for the goulash! Then add chili, pepper and chopped meat.

When the meat is browned, add paprika, mix and let it stew over medium heat for about 3 minutes. Add some oregano and about 150 g of ketchup. Stir and simmer over a moderate heat, basting occasionally, for about 2-2.5 to 3 hours, until the meat is almost soft.

About 1/2 hour before, we add 2 along the chopped capsicum and while basting (if necessary) we bring it to the point where we add as much salt as needed.

5 minutes before the end, add crushed garlic, enough marjoram and sifted flour as needed. Finally, add 0.2-0.3 dl of good Czech beer and do not boil anymore, otherwise the beer will disappear.

Let it sit for 2-3 days. The goulash born in this way has exceptional taste properties that you won't even taste any other goulash anymore!

We serve it with a good dumpling, onion rings, beer and, for gourmets, I recommend a spoon/teaspoon of sour cream on top.

[h1] Run and hide, bitch [/h1]
This "miracle" was included with the FlatOut anthology, which I got at a 90% discount during a sale.
And I thought... What if I give it a try?

How bitterly disappointed I am ‚Äì 15 minutes is enough to try all the stupid modes, not find the familiar and beloved campaign from FlatOut 2, and happily never return to "this one."

And now [u] interesting facts [/u]:
- You won't hear any ear-pleasing rock here, you won't hear any music at all ‚Äì only the endless creaking of screws being screwed in, damn, and the slamming of a leaky floor scrubber bucket on the ground. Apparently, the "soundtrack" was recorded in a steel mill. - The graphics are roughly like after drinking a liter of counterfeit cognac (I haven't personally tested it, of course, but I think I experienced it after playing "this"), or like when you have the flu, when you're nauseous and stumbling toward the toilet with a strange haze in your eyes...
- The car has no control whatsoever; it either skids off to the side, or slides and rolls off like a teardrop after you've just emerged from the toilet after the previous incident.
- That's enough of those (I'm still reeling from the previous ones...)

At best, I'd give this game to someone on mobile‚Äîthey'd be a hot commodity.

column8: Team 6 Studios. They somehow manage to screw up every single game they touch, and this is no exception. FlatOut series was viciously and brutally murdered by them. You would think that it would be so bad that it would be funny to laugh at, but it's just boring. The AI is painfully bad, there's no variation in driving between vehicles, poor crash physics, optimisation, graphics are a step back from the previous game and the game modes are so damn boring. It has zero redeeming qualities. Team 6 Studios is an insult to the gaming industries, gamers and developers.

I decide to bump into a car, cuz it's Flatout! Wow! 1% damage done! Oh, and what's that? Ah, I now have 30% health because of that, OK, cool! Uninstall. 
Thank god I got a cheap ass bundle and didn't buy this crap.

Although this game has only really gotten horribly negative reviews, I decided to give it a chance. First things first, yes there are some problems when you open the game, it has some bugs. But. It's still very fun, my friend and I downloaded it and had a good hour of fun regardless of the negative reviews. We laughed, we got frustrated, and most of all I won every single game we played. 

If you think about it, you spend more on a ticket to a movie theater than you would to play this game, and you'll get at least 1 hour of good laughs. 

Think of it like the room, but in game style because it's so bad, it becomes good again.

column8:
I paid just $0.99 for this garbage, and it's still not worth it. This doesn't control or handle like any racing game should. It opens in some weird resolution and then jumps up to another weird resolution that either isn't even 16:9 (I'm running a 2560 x 1440 monitor) or the textures and menus are weirdly stretched. No controller support from what I can tell. Drifting is like floating on ice. Heck, just driving around feels more like you're driving a jet ski around a harbor or a pond. I accidentally Austin Powers'd my car multiple times just because of how poor the handling is. There are stutters in the menu when you switch cars and characters. I'm not one to jump on the hate bandwagon. I'm not the kind of person who just wants games and studios to fail. I want indie developers to succeed. I want most games in general to succeed. Flatout 3 is just a mess of a game though and it isn't worth your money at any price point.

EDIT
It has controller support. It just doesn't always work, and it's hit or miss whether or not it'll register that you have a controller plugged in. It also still shows KB+M controls even when you have a controller plugged in and registered, so that's super helpful.
column9:
I paid just $0.99 for this garbage, and it's still not worth it. This doesn't control or handle like any racing game should. It opens in some weird resolution and then jumps up to another weird resolution that either isn't even 16:9 (I'm running a 2560 x 1440 monitor) or the textures and menus are weirdly stretched. No controller support from what I can tell. Drifting is like floating on ice. Heck, just driving around feels more like you're driving a jet ski around a harbor or a pond. I accidentally Austin Powers'd my car multiple times just because of how poor the handling is. There are stutters in the menu when you switch cars and characters. I'm not one to jump on the hate bandwagon. I'm not the kind of person who just wants games and studios to fail. I want indie developers to succeed. I want most games in general to succeed. Flatout 3 is just a mess of a game though and it isn't worth your money at any price point.

EDIT
It has controller support. It just doesn't always work, and it's hit or miss whether or not it'll register that you have a controller plugged in. It also still shows KB+M controls even when you have a controller plugged in and registered, so that's super helpful.

Once you buy this game, you'll realize that Flatout 2 was the best game in the series.
As for proper physics, we don't have them, and it turns out that buying this game means you'll regret spending your money before you've even played it for half an hour. I'd like to point out that in 3, by the way, the car body damage has improved compared to 2. That's all the positives, it's a one-time game, if there ever is one.
3 flat tires out of 10

column8:
Do not like this game. Takes some mechanics and elements from the previous FlatOut games, and crushes them into a fine paste to make whatever 'cheap arcade game' this is. No music, unlike all of the previous games. No actual way to know how much health you or other AI is at without a pop-up telling you every half a second. No sense of progression, the cars feel strange, especially in the 'tuning' sense. Disappointed as I really enjoyed all of the previous games, especially FlatOut Ultimate Carnage; they were just done better.
Apologies for the rant

I'm a huge fan of Fallout 2. I remember playing demolition derby at PC clubs as a kid, throwing drivers at different targets, racing each other ‚Äì it was awesome. Now I'm 27 years old. And I was absolutely stunned when I saw there was a third game, and I knew nothing about it. How come? I immediately went and deposited money into Steam via the terminal. I bought it. I logged in.
Overall, I liked everything, IF I hadn't been throwing up all over my keyboard from those disgusting graphics, and the controls, WELL, COME ON, THE DEVELOPERS ADDED SEPARATE BUTTONS FOR DRIVE, LEFT, AND RIGHT. I don't want to list any more of the specifics I didn't like. I wasted my money and I'm disappointed. Now I'm going to YouTube to find out where to get my money back.

column8:
[h1]Rating[/h1]
1/10

[h1]Intro[/h1]
Not only is it a significant downgrade under all previous entries, but it's genuinely one of the worst games I've ever played. Whatever enjoyment you might get out of this would most likely be for the wrong reasons.

[h1]Positives[/h1]
+ You can play your own music. Which is useful, because the game's default soundtrack is actually awful.

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
- Poor driving controls.
- Poor aesthetics and graphics. It somehow looks worse than the first entry from 2004.
- There's no cohesion with the vehicle selection. There's monster trucks and tanks, both of which are only useful in specific scenarios, neutering their usefulness.
- Demolition derby is based on points gained instead of last driver standing. Speaking of which, rubbing against other rivals gives you more points than slamming into them.
- Poor career mode. Not only is there no buying of cars or upgrades, but there's an event where you have to drive a bus that can't be finished and therefore the career mode can't be finished either. Because said bus isn't fast enough to go over the jump.

I don't know why the game has bad ratings, but I personally liked it (most likely because I'm not familiar with the other games in the series). Although the price of 250 rubles is unreasonably high (at least not like Spore), I recommend buying it on sale. There were occasional bugs. The car physics and destructibility are decent for 2011. In my opinion, it's a good racing simulator for simply killing 10 hours, maximum.

column8:
UGHhhhh
finally done with playing with this crap of a game that was bringing down the achievement percentage and now i can finally review this game.

yes i did all the challenges in this game and it was utter dogshit.

First of all 
battle mode ranks you based on points gained no last man standing same goes for big battle mode.
Race is terrible especially the night shift ones.

The night shift mode has got to be the worst race mode ever.
It rains and fogs up your damn road and you can't even see the road in front of you and AI races like crazy making 400km/hr turn (looking at you lvl 30 and lvl 50).
The challenges were bugged to an extent where u couldn't jump over the ramp (Double decker bus) so i had to exploit the respawn technique to by pass that ramp so basically it took me literally 10 mins to finish the race.

Wow this game is a terrible mess!!!
Again i got this in the bundle with flatout 2 and 1.

DON'T YOU DARE CALL THIS PIECE OF CRAP A FLATOUT! It's not worthy of the name.

column8:
You could sacrifice my family in front of my eyes but playing this game would still be worse.

It killed the best Racing game franchise to ever exist dead, and got away with it because of how bad it is; It's so bad, it became a legendary game. A "Kusoge" if you will. But trust me, unlike other Kusoge, there is nothing here to laugh at or have fun with. It's miserable through and through, and makes me angry that FlatOut was killed forever by it.

Don't waste your money.

column8:
Okay, I just spent $0.99 to play this game, and I played it for almost 2 hours. I had a blast. I won't be playing it again, but the races were at least fun enough to try and get the weird brake mechanics down, hitting zombies with a monster truck made me laugh like a buffoon, and watching 11 CPU cars all pile up on top of me in Battle Arena with neverending crashing sounds until my car was totaled also made me laugh like a buffoon.

This is like one of those poorly made N64 games that you and your friends play out of boredom, but you end up pissing yourselves laughing at each other for the stupid decisions that you did not intend to make. The game just craps all over you and it's hilarious.

Buy it for a dollar, don't take it seriously, laugh until you cry, and then uninstall it.

(Long)
This disappointment, as said by the community, and it is, ain't that bad, you know? How? Well, after getting used to the mechanics and how not to go "impossible mode" (like chances on the dark tracks were the AI has infinite nitro and grip... ...UNTIL the game decided to erase itself and won't let me play... How UNLUCKY... Ouch...
Aww man. Just when I was this close to 100%!

2/5 Stars... Reccomended: Fix that bug...

column8:
Well here we are. the infamous FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction. I don't think I need to say why this game is awful but because I've reviewed every other entry, I feel obligated to release a review anyway. Keep note that while my playtime is 26 minutes, I did play this game outside of Steam for over an hour which I feel was enough to really get a feel for how bad this game is. So this game was made in 2011 and wasn't developed by BugBear entertainment the creators of FlatOut who developed FlatOut 1, FlatOut 2, FlatOut Ultimate Carnage and FlatOut Head-On for PSP as they were busy making other projects, so instead noobie developer Team6 games was given the reigns instead. Most seem to forget this but Team 6 actually developed and released a game on the Wii a year prior just called FlatOut and in many ways it's a precursor to this game, it even has the same menu music and similar physics. That game is terrible though but is often forgotten, FlatOut 3 however is not, so let's dive in shall we?

So..where do I start, well let's just be blunt: Everything in this game sucks. The car physics are terrible and straight up broken at times, sometimes you'll ram full speed into something but you won't take any damage but other times you just love tap something and take insane amounts of damage. In this game you have a health meter unlike other FlatOut games, while in FlatOut 2 you can get out of the race if you take enough damage but it's rare, in this game it happens so often because the cars drive super fast and turn really badly and the tracks are so terribly tight that avoiding crashes or winning a race is near impossible. 

The character selection is a joke as it has nothing but a bunch of generic and bland characters who look like they belong in a crack den rather than a racing circuit, there are also some chicks in here who feel like they're thrown in to get some T&A in the game, it's pathetic. These characters don't even feel like they belong in a FlatOut game and their inclusion only shows just how little care was put into this game.

Another thing that really sucks is what they did to Hotseat, it's just ruined, nothing about it is good. The Mechanics make no sense and the events themselves have awful premises. The best way to describe it is like a bootleg version of FlatOut 2's mechanics for Hotseat but even saying that is an insult to FlatOut 2 and the legacy of Hotseat as a whole. They took the most standout mode of FlatOut and totally ruined it in this game, which given the rest of the game isn't too surprising.

Special events also return and they're really bad. For instance a capture the flag like mode is here and it's horrid because of the physics and the designs of the arenas, destruction derbies suffer from the same problems. Other bad inclusions include a formula 1 racing track, yes a formula 1 race in a FlatOut game, do I need to say more? I just can't with this game, like honestly what else can I say but everything about this game is bad? I'm quite shocked there isn't a single redeeming quality about the gameplay. Oh and did I mention the game does this awful motion blur effect when you drive fast? Like man it's like they wanted nobody to enjoy this game.

Before I wrap this up, I want to say 1 positive thing. Yes you heard me, 1 positive thing. That is the nicely designed exit button on the main menu, it functions great for leaving the game and you'll definitely need it only after a short while of playing, clearly the development focus was spent on this. Ok in all seriousness, this game does have 1 good thing: The Controller support. Surprisingly it functions rather well, it can be used on menus and unlike FlatOut 1 you don't have to use the gas key to select options. It's pretty amazing they managed to make better controller support than FlatOut 1 and 2 which is sad but thankfully FlatOut 1 and 2 more than make up for that.

So yeah as a whole this game is an abomination and you should stay the hell away from it for your sake. FlatOut 3 is an abortion and a stain on life and gaming as a whole. Playing this game will only induce suffering and depression, it hurts me even more being a fan of FlatOut ever since I was a kid, this is without question the worst game I have ever had the misfortune of playing. Stay away from this horrible game and please play FlatOut 1 and 2 instead. The team who made this game should be ashamed of themselves for nearly killing the FlatOut franchise. I'm amazed a FlatOut 4 was even made and thankfully even FlatOut 4 is much better than this pile of crap. Play literally any other FlatOut game than this, save yourself the money and time you'll waste on this, It was the lowest rated game on Steam for almost a decade for a reason, only being beaten out by the dreadful XIII Remake. Avoid this game like the plague, you'll thank me later.

Needless to say FlatOut 3 gets a 0/10, an absolute failure

So..where do I start, well let's just be blunt: Everything in this game sucks. The car physics are terrible and straight up broken at times, sometimes you'll ram full speed into something but you won't take any damage but other times you just love tap something and take insane amounts of damage. In this game you have a health meter unlike other FlatOut games, while in FlatOut 2 you can get out of the race if you take enough damage but it's rare, in this game it happens so often because the cars drive super fast and turn really badly and the tracks are so terribly tight that avoiding crashes or winning a race is near impossible. 

The character selection is a joke as it has nothing but a bunch of generic and bland characters who look like they belong in a crack den rather than a racing circuit, there are also some chicks in here who feel like they're thrown in to get some T&A in the game, it's pathetic. These characters don't even feel like they belong in a FlatOut game and their inclusion only shows just how little care was put into this game.

Another thing that really sucks is what they did to Hotseat, it's just ruined, nothing about it is good. The Mechanics make no sense and the events themselves have awful premises. The best way to describe it is like a bootleg version of FlatOut 2's mechanics for Hotseat but even saying that is an insult to FlatOut 2 and the legacy of Hotseat as a whole. They took the most standout mode of FlatOut and totally ruined it in this game, which given the rest of the game isn't too surprising.

Special events also return and they're really bad. For instance a capture the flag like mode is here and it's horrid because of the physics and the designs of the arenas, destruction derbies suffer from the same problems. Other bad inclusions include a formula 1 racing track, yes a formula 1 race in a FlatOut game, do I need to say more? I just can't with this game, like honestly what else can I say but everything about this game is bad? I'm quite shocked there isn't a single redeeming quality about the gameplay. Oh and did I mention the game does this awful motion blur effect when you drive fast? Like man it's like they wanted nobody to enjoy this game.

Before I wrap this up, I want to say 1 positive thing. Yes you heard me, 1 positive thing. That is the nicely designed exit button on the main menu, it functions great for leaving the game and you'll definitely need it only after a short while of playing, clearly the development focus was spent on this. Ok in all seriousness, this game does have 1 good thing: The Controller support. Surprisingly it functions rather well, it can be used on menus and unlike FlatOut 1 you don't have to use the gas key to select options. It's pretty amazing they managed to make better controller support than FlatOut 1 and 2 which is sad but thankfully FlatOut 1 and 2 more than make up for that.

So yeah as a whole this game is an abomination and you should stay the hell away from it for your sake. FlatOut 3 is an abortion and a stain on life and gaming as a whole. Playing this game will only induce suffering and depression, it hurts me even more being a fan of FlatOut ever since I was a kid, this is without question the worst game I have ever had the misfortune of playing. Stay away from this horrible game and please play FlatOut 1 and 2 instead. The team who made this game should be ashamed of themselves for nearly killing the FlatOut franchise. I'm amazed a FlatOut 4 was even made and thankfully even FlatOut 4 is much better than this pile of crap. Play literally any other FlatOut game than this, save yourself the money and time you'll waste on this, It was the lowest rated game on Steam for almost a decade for a reason, only being beaten out by the dreadful XIII Remake. Avoid this game like the plague, you'll thank me later.

Needless to say FlatOut 3 gets a 0/10, an absolute failure

I'll say right away, for fans of the True FlatOut, there's nothing to be gained here. If you don't know and haven't watched that this is a FlatOut game, you can still play it. BUT why did they say this could be FlatOut? It can't be, because the physics are complete crap, the graphics are complete crap for 2011, the bot AI is completely clueless, and in the demolition derby races (or derby, as we call it) they don't even let you move at all, they can keep you on the roof of their car for hours, and that's it, in a crowd... The only positives are the many modes that FlatOut doesn't really need. And there's no career here either. And what about optimization? For example, I sometimes get slideshows and game crashes... (My stove is fine (1660+R3))
In conclusion, I want to say that this game is only playable if you think of it as a completely different game, unrelated to FlatOut or even Carmaggedon (which is also good).

column9: I'll still give it a good review. While the graphics in Burnout 3 are definitely worse than its predecessor, the controls are terrible, and the AI ‚Äã‚Äãis incredibly weak (I have to say, the AI ‚Äã‚Äãthis time is truly disgusting; it doesn't crash into anything else, it just crashes into you), the developer has changed. There are good and bad things, and this generation has more modes (10 in total), as well as achievements. Even though it's gotten a lot of negative reviews, it's still far better than other crappy games.

column8: Why did I think launching this game was a good idea? Even though I played 24 minute , it's horrible to see what the developers have done to the Flatout franchise, so avoid this game, even at a lower price, not worth your time and money. I can easily recommend you to play flatout 1 and flatout 2 which are still quite impressive in 2021 and won't be a waste of time with real physics and good running (even the characters in flatout 2 are awesome, I miss them) . Flatout 3 chaos and destruction is a terrible nightmare and still don't know why you can still buy it, really who want to play this even for a joke

column8: I bought it for the memes and while I would say, there are worse games on Steam (like Uriel's Chasm), being somewhat of a fan of the first 3 Flatout games, it's really sad to see a series started by Bugbear, butchered so badly, by a developer (or maybe publisher?) who just leaned full force into the wackiness of Flatout games without offering any replacement for generally great damage and physics model of Flatout games before it (alright, maybe expect Flatout 2). So yeah, let's burry it deeper - enjoy the title of "the worst-rated game on Steam".

Nun habe ich das Spiel komplett durch, habe alles freigeschalten, was man freischalten kann und habe alle 45 Errungenschaften gesammelt. Anders gesagt: Ich habe das blaue Band.
 Daf√ºr gebraucht habe ich ca. 38 Stunden.

Wer nat√ºrlich die alten FlatOut & FlatOut II Teile vor Augen hat, der wird davon schon sehr entt√§uscht sein, was ich auch gut verstehen kann, weil ich die beiden Teile selbst fr√ºher gern und oft gespielt habe. Wobei ich die ab und an immer noch spiele.

Also ich muss sagen, das mir das Spiel eigentlich ganz gut gefallen hat, also an FlatOut kann es jetzt nicht wirklich ankn√ºpfen‚Ä¶ Das k√∂nnt ihr auch an den Bewertungen anderer lesen‚Ä¶ Anders gesagt die Entwickler haben das Konzept zu w√∂rtlich genommen und das Spiel gegen die Wand gefahren.

Wenn die Entwickler das Spiel nicht FlatOut 3 sondern z. B. Crash & Stunt Car Racer genannt h√§tten, w√§ren die Bewertungen wahrscheinlich eher Neutral ausgefallen.

Ich sehe das Spiel als Arcade Racer an. Wobei f√ºr mich Rennspiele ohne Cockpit-Ansicht generell Arcade Racer sind. Die Cockpit Ansicht geh√∂rt bei Rennspielen f√ºr mich zum Standard. 

Mich erinnert FlatOut 3 an die damaligen Davilex Spiele die es mal gab, die ich auch sehr gern gespielt habe. Manche liebten sie und andere hassten sie. 

Zum Fahrverhalten und Leveldesign muss ich sagen, da bin ich z. B. von einigen Need for Speed Teilen schlimmeres gew√∂hnt‚Ä¶ Anders gesagt ich war davon positiv √ºberrascht. Gut ich habe ca. 5 Minuten gebraucht, bis ich mich an das Fahrverhalten gew√∂hnt habe, dann ist es aber echt sehr einfach. Bei dem Spiel hatte ich beim Fahren nicht das Gef√ºhl wie bei anderen Spielen wie auf Schmierseife zu fahren.

Gespielt habe ich FlatOut 3 auf meinen alten Thinkpad T440 in 1366 x 768 was die maximale Aufl√∂sung des Notebooks ist. Und mit dem Grafiksetup ‚ÄûNiedrig‚Äú. War eigentlich ganz h√ºbsch anzusehen. (fand ich zumindest.)

Ich hatte in den meisten Leveln deutlich √ºber 30 FPS das h√∂chste was ich gesehen habe waren 119 FPS im Nachtrennmodus. Meistens waren die FPS aber so bei 60-70. Minimal waren sie bei den 24 Fahrzeuge Megaschlacht bei ca. 8 FPS. Anders gesagt: Ich war positiv √ºberrascht wie Fl√ºssig das Spiel trotz der Intel-Grafik war.

Angefangen habe ich mit dem Rennmodus der echt sehr einfach ist. Auch der Challenge-Modus war nicht allzu schwer. Bei den Stunts muss man auch nicht viel k√∂nnen, da ist es eher das Timing was z√§hlt.

Gut hier und da gab es Bugs‚Ä¶ Bei z. B. dem Switjas See im Nachtrennmodus sind die Checkpoints etwas durcheinander geraten. Aber auch die Monstertruck Missionen kann man eigentlich √ºberspringen wenn man den Truck verschrottet und alle anderen auch die Wertung von ‚Äû0‚Äú haben. Das Spiel ist bei mir kein einziges Mal Abgest√ºrzt, eingefroren oder sonstiges und lief sehr gut unter Windows 10-64 Bit was ich bei vielen anderen Spielen die auch so um die 10 Jahre alt sind nicht behaupten kann.

Bei anderen Publishern sind Bugs an der Tagesordnung von daher sehe ich dar√ºber hinweg, da es wirklich nur um Kleinigkeiten geht.

Ob das Spiel die 0,99 ‚Ç¨ Wert ist, m√ºsst ihr selbst entscheiden. Im Zweifel kann man es zur√ºckgeben wenn es einen nicht gef√§llt.

Mir hat es gefallen und ich habe sehr gern die N√§chte durchgezockt.
column9:
I bought the game from the shop on July 3, 2021, for ‚Ç¨0.99.

I've now completed the game, unlocked everything that can be unlocked, and collected all 45 achievements. In other words: I have the blue ribbon.
It took me about 38 hours.

Anyone who has the old FlatOut & FlatOut II games in mind will be very disappointed, which I can understand, because I used to enjoy playing both of them often. I still play them from time to time.

Well, I have to say, I actually quite liked the game, so it can't really compare to FlatOut... You can also see that in other people's reviews... In other words, the developers took the concept too literally and drove the game into the ground.

If the developers hadn't called the game FlatOut 3 but, for example, Crash & Stunt Car Racer, the reviews would probably have been more neutral.

I consider the game an arcade racer. Racing games without a cockpit view are generally arcade racers for me. The cockpit view is standard in racing games for me.

FlatOut 3 reminds me of the Davilex games that were around back then, which I also enjoyed a lot. Some people loved them and others hated them.

As for the handling and level design, I have to say, I'm used to worse from some Need for Speed ‚Äã‚Äãgames, for example... In other words, I was pleasantly surprised. It took me about five minutes to get used to the handling, but then it's really easy. I didn't feel like I was driving on soap like I do in other games.

I played FlatOut 3 on my old Thinkpad T440 at 1366 x 768, which is the laptop's maximum resolution, and with the graphics setup set to "Low." It was actually quite nice to look at. (At least, I thought so.)

I had well over 30 FPS in most levels; the highest I saw was 119 FPS in Night Race mode. Most of the time, however, the FPS was around 60-70. The minimum in the 24-vehicle Mega Battle was around 8 FPS. In other words: I was pleasantly surprised at how smooth the game was despite the Intel graphics.

I started with the Race mode, which is really easy. The Challenge mode wasn't too difficult either. You don't need much skill for the stunts; it's more about timing that counts.

Okay, there were a few bugs here and there... For example, at Lake Svityas in Night Race mode, the checkpoints were a bit messed up. But you can also skip the Monster Truck missions if you wreck the truck and all the others have a rating of "0." The game didn't crash, freeze, or anything else for me once, and it ran very well on Windows 10 64-bit, which I can't say about many other games that are around 10 years old.

Bugs are commonplace with other publishers, so I'll overlook them, as they're really just minor issues.

Whether the game is worth the ‚Ç¨0.99 is up to you to decide. If in doubt, you can return it if you don't like it.

I enjoyed it and I really enjoyed playing it all night long.

column8:
(Game was gifted to me by a friend, hence why I'm tagging it as having received the game for free.)

Having the (dis)honour of being one of few items on the Steam storefront to hold an "Overwhelmingly Negative" review score among Steam users, [b]FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction[/b] is an absolute travesty of a FlatOut game, if not of a video game in general. One does not even need previous experience with the preceding titles in the series; even outside of comparisons to its vastly superior predecessors, FlatOut 3 falls flat[strike]out[/strike] on its face.

The key distinction that needs to be made here is that the creators of the FlatOut series, Bugbear Entertainment, [i]had nothing to do with this title[/i]. After the release of FlatOut 2, they were asked by Bandai Namco to develop [i]Ridge Racer Unbounded[/i], and to make up for their "absence", the publisher [i]Strategy First[/i] assigned development of the third title in the FlatOut series to [b]Team6 Game Studios[/b].

This is an important detail, because not only it absolves Bugbear of the shame related to the reputation of the series being tarnished, it also gives us information on what we can expect from this title. Team6 are a Dutch game development company with plenty of racing games under their belt... most of them being remarkably low quality bug fiestas with clunky mechanics, no plot or poorly written plot, and unpleasant to the eye in terms of their visuals.

The racing aspect of the game - arguably the most important aspect given that it's, you know, a [i]racing[/i] game - is bland and uninspired. The cars handle nowhere near comfortably enough to make the races enjoyable. 

Before each race you can pick your character model from a variety of awful puns and pop culture references (Zario the Mechanic, Ufer Bull, Pete Saman (being phonetically similar to "pizza man"); also "Silen Einnor" which is the name of Team6's founder spelled backwards...), which changes absolutely nothing in gameplay.

As for the list of racing gamemodes...

[list]
[*] The "Race" gamemode is a collection of 6 environments with 13 tracks, each also existing in a reverse variant to pad out the length. You get the Steam achievement for completing the gamemode if you play all the races and their reverse variants. The tracks themselves are filled with many turns unsuited for this game's car mechanics; mountain environment races will often include uphills which the cars have massive difficulties surpassing without nitrous [i]and[/i] a prior rolling start. 
[*] "Speed" takes the player to 5 closed F1-like tracks with F1-like cars. The experience is often "spruced up" by poor visibility and sight obstructions in the form of uphills before sudden turns... or flames bursting from the ground and sudden cracks forming in the road in the final track of this mode. Nothing to write home about.
[*] The "Nightshift" mode is an interesting concept that perhaps could work better in a higher quality game... unfortunately, it's stuck in FlatOut 3. In this mode you race against only one opponent, and the weather in each track is set to a thunderstorm; it's meant to be "the ultimate test". Supposedly the rain is meant to worsen the handling of your car, but in my experience the cars have handled just as bad as in the rest of the game. Advertised as "the most difficult gamemode in the game", it's held back by technical limitations of goofy AI able to hold good racing lines but losing its head if it's sent off those lines even for a bit.
[/list]

Aside from racing, the series is known for its stunt and destruction-focused gamemodes. FlatOut 3 of course couldn't fall behind... though looking at what we got, it probably would have been better if it had.

[list]
[*] "Stunt Man" is all of the crazy ragdoll launching from FlatOut 2 with none of the fun. Often the objective is to score a certain amount of points... which is only possible by hitting a specific target. A 1200 point goal in a "hit the target" mission doesn't mean you can potentially score more than that - 1200 is the bullseye, the middle ring is 600 points and the outer ring is 300 points.
[*] "Battle Arena" is a destruction derby with 12 participants. Destroying enemy cars is honestly harder to pull off than it really should be because the impacts barely ever seem to do anything and they sure as hell don't feel like you're actually crashing vehicles against each others.
[*] "Big Battle" is... the same thing but with 24 cars. No idea why they made it into a separate gamemode.
[*] "Monstertrucks" is a series of 5 events focused on monster trucks. Push objects into goals, run over props etc. If it sounds bland, that's because it is.
[*] The "Offroad" gamemode tasks you with driving through 2 courses and getting points through drifting, jumping, destroying enemy cars and breaking things in the environment. 
[*] Splatout is FlatOut 3 at its most mindnumbing. You play through basically each map in the game as zombies keep spawning everywhere. You sit on the map for 3 minutes or so and try to run over as many zombies as you can to score points. There is no deeper meaning, no strategy factor, and practically no reason to devote your lifespan to... well, the game in general, but also this mode in particular.
[/list]

FlatOut 3 also includes a [b]Challenge[/b] gamemode, which is a series of 50 events taking the player through most of the game's content. I can only express my commiserations to those who have subjected themselves to the mode in its entirety. I felt the urge to tap out after the challenge which asked me to jump over a gap in a bus which, even with full nitrous power, cannot reach enough speed to pass the gap. The solution is to treat the track as less of a circuit and more of a horseshoe, driving back and forth between both sides of the river. I don't know what Team6 had in mind while designing that, but by that point I'd had enough.

All in all, I sincerely [b]cannot recommend FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction to anyone[/b]. It's not one of those games that are so bad that they cycle over into being good because of how broken they are. It's just plain bad, with very few (if any) redeeming factors. No discount warrants the purchase of this game, and I will forever curse the name of the friend who gifted this game to me. 

Seriously, don't buy it.

I have to say that for the bad reviews it has, it's not that terrible. There are more modes, for example monster trucks, but it's still nowhere near 2. If I rated FlatOut 1 8/10 FlatOut 2 10/10 then this would be 3/10 BUT There is a tournament and it disgusted me so much that even 1/10 would be a lot. Needless to say about monster trucks where no matter what you do you always win. I recommend this game only to big fans of racing games.    
To put it in perspective, I gave the game a thumbs up only because it doesn't deserve to be labeled as the worst game on Steam or even in the world :)

column9:
I wasted 7 minutes on this piece of crap. I supposedly finished one race, but it went okay despite the clunky steering. After those 7 minutes, the kebab in my stomach made a loud noise, and I had to retreat to my meditation spot. I took a good shit, until it was finally time to wipe myself. Unfortunately, my keys fell out of my back pockets and into my ponytail-thin mess. So I was forced to delve into the depths of my toilet and dig up my missing keys. It was bad, but it was nice to see the kebab in this form, because I could analyze it in depth like the wives in Ferdydurke. Finally, my underwater adventure in the toilet ended with finding those keys, so I left the shitland, cleaned the keys and myself, flushed the toilet, and came to the conclusion that those 7 minutes in the toilet were more interesting than playing this game.

OK, so I played over 6 more hours of this game, so I can completely blow it away because I know what's so stupid about it:
"Normal" Races - We have a typical neighborhood, Rome, a factory, etc. The problem is that when the developers designed these tracks, they thought it would be a great idea to give you the same routes but in reverse, which made it more tedious and unnecessarily lengthy.
Monstertrucks - another mess, where the super duper tasks were simple things like flipping buses or driving into barrels (there were only four tasks, and they were all crap).
Offroad - "Fun" where you destroy everything on the road and get the most points. However, points could be easily earned by driving under the wheels of a monster truck, and then you'd rack up points like hooligans' bumps.
Night Driving - Another "fun" where you do the same routes, but at night with rain and fog, where your opponent is going crazy and slacking off on the corners.
Arenas - Both types of arenas, the large one and the regular one, sucked. The game's logic is screwed up, as flipping a car onto its roof by driving into it at full speed is a real pain. It only deals 3% damage, and grazing the hood with the wheels deals 50%.
Some Stunts - You crash through the windshield and score points, or you have to hit the bull's eye. That was also fucked up considering how the physics don't work in this game.
Speed ‚Äã‚Äã- Nothing new, you're messing with the formula on a track with a broken AI.
Challenges - The challenges are also fucked up, offering nothing new. I got stuck on one challenge because some idiot at Team Orgy 6 thought a bus from England would be a good idea for a track with crappy ramps.
Splatout - Honestly, this was the most enjoyable mode in this game. I actually had fun playing it, which doesn't change the fact that the whole game is complete crap.

column9:
This game has a lot of negative reviews, it even holds the title "worst game of 2012". Being curious, I bought the game to see if it really was as bad as everyone was saying. And maybe I will surprise you, but for me it is an interesting and quite good game, but it has several fundamental problems.

The first is its name. FlatOut 3 has completely different mechanics and gameplay than the previous parts. When a part of a series is released, it is logical that players compare it to its predecessors, and this is a big problem in the case of FlatOut 3. The third part works completely differently and actually has nothing in common with the previous parts. At the same time, the gameplay is interesting in my opinion and I have nothing to complain about. If the developers had chosen a different name, the third FlatOut would have had a much better rating.

The second problem is a couple of fundamental errors that could be fixed with a patch.
The first major mistake occurred when I did the challenge with a double-decker bus. The idea is good, why not race the bus, but this race is on a track where you have to jump in one part and the bus is not fast enough to do that, making this race unplayable. I managed to get over it by driving to the jump, then turned around and went back about half way, fell into the water somewhere and lo and behold, it respawned me right behind the jump, so I could continue. This problem has a very simple solution. It was enough to simply put a different track.
The second major flaw is the fact that the speed of the game affects the characteristics of the vehicles. It happened to me that I drove an acrobatics where it was necessary to hit the target, but no matter how I drove, I was not able to fly to the target at all. The driver always landed right in front of him. Then when I opened a video on YouTube, I noticed something strange. In that video, the car was traveling at a speed of about 220 km/h at the time of the shot. I couldn't get over 160 km/h. Then I just thought to set the game speed to high (before that I was on medium) and suddenly my car was going as fast as in the video and I hit the target for the first time.
The third and final major flaw is Monstertrucks. They work, or should work, in such a way that everyone is divided into two teams. The first one is supposed to accomplish some task and the second one is supposed to prevent it from happening. In my opinion, it's an excellent idea, but unfortunately it doesn't work. Here it occurred to me that the developers must have made a mistake and put different source codes here, because the artificial intelligence behaves the same as in the classic derby and does not take into account the teams. In other words, right at the start, everyone goes into each other and they don't care that they have to complete a task or that they are destroying a partner. So in the end, everyone has 0 points, which automatically means a win for you.
A few times I also encountered the fact that the opponent partially fell into the texture or that I drove through the barracks, but these are rather minor mistakes.

In conclusion, I would recommend the game despite its shortcomings. If you don't compare it with the previous parts and turn a blind eye to the mistakes, you can enjoy it. I honestly enjoyed playing her. FlatOut 3 isn't a bad game at all to me, it's just rushed and misnamed. If the developers had paid more attention to it, properly tested it and given it a different name, the result would have been many times better. This is how we got a rushed title that obviously wasn't properly tested and is being compared by players to something that can't be compared to at all.
My rating is 6/10.

column8: This game was kinda funny, I had a confederate flag on my car, the optimization was awful, the ps2 graphics seemed too much for my computer to handle because the frame drops were constant. Every time you boost the car stretches like Elastic Girl from The Incredibles. Unironically, Garfield Kart (both versions) and Disney's Pixar Cars are 10/10 games compared to this dumpster fire. No wonder it's the worst rated game on steam. (At least as far as I scrolled, this game was literally the bottom of the screen when I scrolled all the way on user reviews.) Though this game is pretty doo doo, it's kinda funny. I haven't tried the rest of this franchise (got it since they were all bundled together for really cheap) and the others seemed to have better reception, so maybe those are good, but this game is a hot mess, but kinda funny, so maybe try it out for fun.

column8:
It's not really that bad.

While it is a downgrade from the first two games for sure, people seem to forget that FlatOut 1 and 2 were never that good to begin with. Both games had mediocre driving mechanics, physics, and terrible AI, but were enjoyable in short bursts for the crashes and the comedy. FlatOut 3 is also a game with mediocre driving mechanics, physics, and terrible AI that's also enjoyable for the same reasons as the first two.

It's less polished, there's less content, and the new non-cosmetic damage model isn't as fun to play with, but for $1 on sale, it's definitely worth checking out - especially if you have friends to play multiplayer with.

column9: When my kids misbehave I make them play this as punishment.

Personally, I didn't like this game.
Pros:
- Lots of modes.
- Decent maps (I wouldn't say they're amazing, but they're playable).
- Multiplayer: As you can imagine, you can have a fun game with friends after a sweaty CS:GO session.
Cons:
- Bugs: There are a number of bugs coming, which I personally encountered.
- The mouse doesn't work in the menu, and of course, you have to configure everything with the buttons.
- I couldn't even access the advanced graphics settings in the graphics settings because the game simply wouldn't let me.
- The game insists on running a performance test on Windows itself, but the game doesn't care that this feature was removed from Windows 10 long ago. (For Windows 7 users.)
- The game itself looks like a beta version, and there are a ton of bugs.
- Poor physics: I didn't like it; the controls are kind of sluggish, and practically any collision flips the car.
- Graphics: I also didn't like it, because, as I mentioned above, the game feels like a beta version.

Overall, it's fine for a quick spin and to calm your nerves after another leaked CS game, but if you're looking to play seriously, it's not. The game is too buggy, uninteresting, and simply unfinished. I wouldn't recommend buying it as a main game, but for a quick spin after a leaked CS game, you can buy it on sale.

My rating: 3/10

column8:
I am absolutely FUMING - DEVS PLEASE LISTEN


I waited 16 years for this game. SIXTEEN YEARS. Words cannot describe how excited I was. I booked two weeks off work, which in itself was really difficult. My boss was like "you do realise there's a pandemic with lots of unemployed people - I can replace you in a heartbeat?"

I said "I don't care!!! I want to play Flatout 3 : Chaos & Destruction!"

As the game finished downloading, my heartrate stayed at steady 200BPM whilst I burnt it onto multiple CDs, and proceeded to install it on to my gaming PC. Only for all my hopes and anticipation to be crushed like a paper cup under a hydraulic press.

This game isn't supported on Windows 98? Are you serious?? Give me ONE good reason why my perfectly fine PC has been excluded from support? I've never had a problem with this computer, and the CRT screen even still has the original vacuum tubes. It would be a crime to throw it away simply because greedy developers are in bed with Microsoft and hardware manufacturers.

This practice is ANTI-CONSUMER, and all it does it stick a middle finger up to all the hard working people who simply cannot afford to replace their computer every 20 years!

Words cannot describe my disappointment. You've lost a customer forever. Thanks for nothing. Now what am I supposed to do with all these CDs? Throw them in the bin? Great, let's destroy the environment as well.

For those who don't know, this is widely considered the worst game on Steam, no joke. 87% of reviews are negative, and the few positive ones, upon closer inspection, praise the game for its utterly unplayable trashiness.
The game is often bundled with other installments in the series, so it's tempting to buy the entire package. But it's not worth it, because the only good games in the franchise are FlatOut 2 and its sequel, Ultimate Carnage. 1 is too old, and 4 isn't much better than 3; you won't play it because of the physics, the clowns, and the clowns.

Now, let's get to the point:

- The cartoonish drivers available to choose from set the tone right away and make it clear what you're dealing with‚Äîa parody.
- The physics are completely nonexistent. The cars are barely controllable, and the player has no idea what will happen on the screen after pressing the keys. - The camera is positioned very low behind the car, so you can barely see the road.
- The tracks are bad and evoke not joy, but anger. They consist of turns that are simply impossible to navigate.
- In night racing mode, you can't see the road at all, not so much because of the darkness, but because of the water sprites that cover the entire screen. And this is despite the fact that the map is square, with every turn being a sudden right angle. And your opponent is infallible and speeds like a fighter jet.
- In monster truck mode, it turned out that the player is completely alone collecting target barrels, while the opponents are simply driving in circles and jostling each other near a completely incomprehensible, surreal water hole.
- The music doesn't play by default; you have to enable it in the settings. And I didn't hear anything good there, just some noise.
- I went into the Statistics and was stunned. The game was increasing my playtime tenfold. And the number of races I participated in was... fractional.

To be fair, I did see one good thing about the game. The high-speed car races (at least the first level) seemed perfectly fine to me. But that, of course, won't save the game when everything else is in such a terrible state.

Bottom line. Even bad games are generally playable, getting used to their flaws, when there's at least some kind of gameplay, meaning completion. But here, there's simply no campaign. The developers threw in a bunch of unrelated maps and modes‚Äîthere you go, have fun. The player simply doesn't feel like they have any goal here. You kick around a few levels, after which you're dumped to the menu... and the game is deleted.

column8:
We reviewed this game on our podcast: Garbage Game Night, where we try out poorly reviewed games and give them a second chance, either trying to find something the critics missed or enjoy them because they are so bad‚Ä¶

This game was genuinely entertaining trash to me. I don't know how long 'trash' can be entertaining for, but it was enough to make it worth a <$5 purchase, for me. on our scale of -10 to 10, I gave it a -5. So bad it's enjoyable, but not great. There is enough unlockables to keep you going, but you'll get bored quickly. There's enough silly things the engine can do, between using a tank and a double decker bus pile-up, that it's worth laughing at with some friends. 

If you're interested in an in-depth look into the background of the game and our reactions to our first playthrough, you can [url=https://garbagegamenight.com/flatout3/]check out the podcast on this episode.[/url]

Very mixed feelings.

Objectively speaking, FlatOut 3 has one major advantage: variety, which manifests itself in the multitude of game modes, cars, and tracks.

The only problem is, I don't really want to play it. I'd be willing to overlook the numerous bugs, the occasional crashes, and even the less-than-cutting-edge graphics, but the physics are absurdly terrible.

I can't even believe anyone seriously released this. It looks like an alpha version of a really cool game, nothing more.

column8: Oh dear mother of god why the fuck is this called a "FlatOut" game? This isn't Flatout, this is Racing Simulator! Why is it that whenever a car hits me from behind, my car does a 90 degree angle and smashes into a house forcing me to hit "R"? Poor basterds in those houses must be scared shitless with people racing in cars like these. Coming from FlatOut 1, 2 & Ultimate Carnage, I couldn't figure out how to drive properly in this monstrosity without hitting something or being hit by someone for my first 15 attempts, the cars turn WAY too fast. FlatOut 4 for some is bad, but that game is god tier when compared to this. I would rather have a Buffalo take a diarrhea dump in my ear and eat the rotten asshole of a roadkill skunk and down it with beer than play this piece of shit. Chaos & Destruction my ass, more like Shit & Farts. Its no wonder this is rated one of the worst steam games!!!!

column9: Simply unplayable, it's a shame what the series has become. I still enjoy playing the first two installments, but the third one is unplayable from the very first race. It often happens that you steer to the right and the car goes to the left, and vice versa. It's really no fun. But the third installment is already quite old, and I agree with what the previous speakers have said. A patch that makes the game playable probably won't be released soon, which is a real shame; it was such a good racing series. I always came first in the races in the first two installments, but as I said, the first race in the third installment is completely impossible to win.

column9: Simply a huge piece of garbage covered in shit! I wouldn't even say anything good about this game if I got paid.

I give you a big piece of advice: Never, ever play this game if you've played the first two games. Believe me, it's not worth it. However, if you're playing this game for the first time before playing FO1 and FO2, then congratulations, you're still sane.

Overall, the game is an acquired taste, in my opinion. I bought it from the entire anthology for about 150 rubles. After playing for just an hour, I realized this jackass game is a work of art. And now the story...

Do you like old games from the original Sony era? Are you a fan of old low-poly graphics? Do you love hardcore and hate games with realistic elements? Then welcome to FlatOut 3! This game is truly for hardcore gamers, fisting enthusiasts, and old-school geezers on the fast and the furious. Only here will you feel the pain and burden of the events around you. Only this game will truly convey the joyful childhood emotions of destroying cars, because only in this game can you truly revel in the days of humming modems and old consoles. Jackal's graphics, 144 rubles, will let you know that everything new is well-forgotten old. This exciting game also comes with a free DLC! To access it, set your resolution to 800x600, disable all game effects, and set the graphics to the lowest possible level! The DLC will be activated. For the best gaming experience, you'll need a computer from 2006-2009, and then you'll fully enjoy the nostalgia of the past. And realistic 90s-era physics will keep you entertained in this arcade racing game. LOVE HARDCORE, RACER! In this game, you can experience an endless number of old games, from Half-Life to Twisted Metal. Only Team 6 Studios can truly transport you back to the 90s, combining joy and sadness!

Available on Steam!
Released in 2011.
¬©Team 6 Studios

OUR MOTTO: Screw graphics and physics, screw gameplay and soundtracks. We miss you, Twisted Metal era!

I'll be honest ‚Äì I generally hate racing games, but for some reason I liked Flatout 3.
I'll start from afar: when I was 7 or 8 years old, I used to hang out with my buddies at the computer club playing Flatout 2, as it was pretty fun and we liked it.

Years passed, and I don't even know where I got Flatout 3 from Steam.
So, I decided to download it, play it, and to my surprise ‚Äì I liked it!
Let's go from there, first, what I liked:

- Modes: There are a lot of them, and almost all of them are good. I like the "Demolition Derby" and "Speed" modes the most.
- Map design: The maps are really well done. They're absolutely stunning, I really like them. They look unusual and beautiful.
- Lack of plot: Yes, that's right, the lack of a plot in this game makes it better. Let me explain. Look, what kind of storyline could you put in a racing game? That's right ‚Äì bad. There isn't one here, and that's a plus, because the game is made specifically for fun.
- Multiplayer: I think the title itself already explains it‚Äîyou can play the game with your friends, and it'll be quite fun!
- Car physics: they're a bit over the top, almost too much, but that's a plus, because it makes the game even more fun!

And now, what I didn't like:

- Bugs: No, don't get me wrong, I didn't see any bugs in the game itself; the bugs were technical. For example, in the graphics settings, I couldn't access the advanced graphics options because it simply wouldn't let me. I had to select "Yes," but it simply wouldn't select. The game also requires you to run a system performance test in Windows itself, and it doesn't care that this feature was removed from the latest version, Windows 10. (Hello, Windows 7)

I think I've said it all. I recommend buying the game if you have friends. If you play alone, you'll get tired of playing with bots after an hour or an hour and a half.

column8: These reviews are [b] FAR [/b] too dramatic for what this game is. Yes, it's bad. The physics are a mess and the AI is bad, but in no way at all is it [i] terrible [/i] and it certainly doesn't deserve the distinction of being the lowest rated game on Steam. I have played games that make this look like a AAA masterpiece. It seems as though a bunch of users just decided to latch onto this game as being the spawn of the Prince of Darkness himself, which is a bit unfair. I would not recommend this game in its current state on this platform, but I could imagine myself playing it in an arcade once or twice and then never thinking about it again.

column8:
After reading a lot of bad reviews of this game, I was very sceptical.
But I though what the heck, how bad could it be? 
It wasnt very expensive either.
And Im glad I gave it a chance.

Its actually possible to play this game and enjoy it as well.
The first thing you need to do, is to get the Flatout 3 name out of your head.
This game has little in common with Bugbears previous quality games.
Forget that, and lets say this game is just called Chaos & Destruction.
And that name, it lives up to.

The game is a low budget arcade racer, 
that is more like a fusion between Split/Second, Destruction Derby and Carmageddon.
And yes it has its bugs and problems.
But the good thing, is that it has been patched up since the release.
Now it is possible to play thru everthing. 

In almost every mode, it is possible to make a lot of adjustments to your liking.
And thats a good thing. Because that makes the game funnier, easier or harder if thats what you want.
I recommend you to learn how the game works, and use the adjustments and unlocked cars to your advantage.

I liked the fact that the game has alot of playmodes, tracks and cars to explore.
Some cars and tuningmodes are hard to control, others are easy to handle.

I've now played thru the whole game and unlocked everything, and I can say that I've enjoyed playing most of it.
Of course there are some playmodes that are better than others. 
And yes, unfortunately the damage system is still off.
But there is no law against only playing the modes you like and the cars/tunings you can handle.

The AI in this game is everything from easy to challenging, but also horrible and cheating.
I found that the easy difficulty was the most fair one, and in some modes also the normal difficulty.
Just awoid the hard one.

The graphics is not exactly top notch, its kind of muddy and 1080p looks more like 720p.
And you also need a good pc to run it smoothly.

The sound is okay, the music is tolerable for a short amount of time.
But its possible to use your own playlists as well.

So in short: if you can handle the issues of the game, learn how it works, 
and totally forget that its called Flatout 3, you can actually have a good time.

Let the Chaos & Destruction begin!

Total Score 6/10

I said to myself probably as many others "how bad can it actually be?", intrigued by its review score that I don't usually come across (Overwhelmingly Negative) I wanted to see it with my own eyes, and oh boy let me tell you that this is ABSOLUTE trash. It is bad in almost every possible aspect: starting from graphics, continuing with mechanics and ending with physics.

The worst part in my opinion is that failing does not come from skill level and that might make you easily rage - I know it did for me (for instance: a flip might come upon a failed landing after a simple jump or the AI might be too aggressive and can turn you around from behind)

The only positive aspects I found were that the achievements can actually be unlocked, and there is plenty diversity in terms of game modes, but that's obviously not enough to recommend this garbage.
