column8:
So... its basically trash.
I got this, just because it was still much cheaper for me to buy the whole franchise instead of buying every other FlatOut title except this one. So i atleast tried it. I already knew how bad this game is, but boy oh boy, you have NO IDEA what this game is all about until you play it all by yourself. It was the first time in my life, when i was playing the game so bad, that i actually had to laugh all the time. I dont know if it was to purpose to make it that bad, but i simply dont believe that any other developer studio could make such a joke even if they would try really really hard.

So basically if you are new to FlatOut franchise, bear in mind this:
FlatOut, FlatOut 2 and FlatOut: Ultimate Carnage made by Bugbear Entertainment (creators of Wreckfest) are absolutely amazing, fun and have nothing to do with all other FlatOut titles which comes after (including this garbage), which are made by different developers.
Thank you.

So... its basically trash.
I got this, just because it was still much cheaper for me to buy the whole franchise instead of buying every other FlatOut title except this one. So I at least tried it. I already knew how bad this game is, but boy oh boy, you have NO IDEA what this game is all about until you play it all by yourself. It was the first time in my life, when I was playing the game so badly, that I actually had to laugh all the time. I don't know if it was to purpose to make it that bad, but I simply don't believe that any other developer studio could make such a joke even if they would try really really hard.

So basically if you are new to the FlatOut franchise, bear in mind this:
FlatOut, FlatOut 2 and FlatOut: Ultimate Carnage made by Bugbear Entertainment (creators of Wreckfest) are absolutely amazing, fun and have nothing to do with all other FlatOut titles which come after (including this garbage), which are made by different developers.
Thank you.

column8:
To put it simply: This wasn't a Flatout game.
Sure, It's a racing game with the same style.
But: It just clearly isn't a Flatout game at all.
The previous games are actually just better.
Flatout 3 is quite frankly a huge step down.
The visuals simply look extremely outdated.
And not even the gameplay gets the point.
It feels like the AI just barely works in here.
So: The racing doesn't feel satisfying at all.
And the other game modes weren't better.
It took me 90 minutes to realize: It's trash.
Truly a huge disappointment. It is just sad.
But hey, at least they did get the title right.
Chaos and Destruction is one way to put it.
This almost destroyed the whole franchise.
But thankfully... The fourth game is better.
Not by a lot, but it's better than this trash.
I simply have to give tis a negative review.

column9: yeah

I think it's a pretty good game; I really liked it. I think most people just don't get it. They keep comparing the third game to the first two. But to understand that Flatout 3 is a worthy entry in the series, and not a bad game at all, you just need to remember what the first two games in this franchise were like. The first Flatout was a sim-like game with a bit of arcade flair and realistic physics. The second game was more arcade-like in terms of physics and controls. But this one is a completely arcade game. It doesn't have bad physics, controls, or car behavior, but it still has a largely realistic damage model. Also, the color scheme and design are more playful, fun, and bright, and that's cool. The game itself has become more action-packed and dynamic. And that's all cool. As for the graphics, I was honestly quite pleased with them; they weren't the most advanced for their time, but I think if they could have done better, they would have. But given the well-chosen color scheme and design, it looks quite acceptable. At the same time, the game feels very hardcore and old-school. And gamers love hardcore and old-school games, after all. If you don't like the graphics, then consider that part of the old-school feel. The game has many new features - the ability to choose a driver, car customization, many new modes, comets falling from the sky and helicopter gunships, many new car classes (by the way, I recognize real-life cars in the cars, such as Audi, BMW, Ford, etc., which was not the case in the previous games), car restoration, rage, new driver tricks. Where were all those harsh critics of this game looking? Why didn't they notice all this? I can really see that the developers tried and brought a lot of new things to the game. What's so bad about all this?! The new developers applied their own approach, their own style to the game; they didn't want to simply copy the previous games. Yes, Flatout 3 is indeed very different from the previous games; it's more like Carmageddon, Burnout, and Crashday, but many of the same ideas remain. And by the way, the spirit of madness, crazy races, and cool crashes inherent in the previous games are still there. What kind of game were you expecting from other developers? I think the developers did the right thing; they tried hard and really brought a lot of new things to the series. Unlike, for example, the developers of Flatout 4. That's a pretty mediocre game. I didn't like the fact that the developers of the fourth game added almost no new features, but essentially made a remake of the second game, with the same career mode, similar tracks, visual style, etc., only with different cars and updated graphics. They even removed some of the old features, and the physics and handling, although they resemble the second game, are much worse. And the optimization is so-so. That's the wrong approach. And thanks to the developers of the third game for the game. By the way, I'd also like to thank the developers of the third game for the excellent Super Street: The Game, which I once played at a friend's house. The game is truly excellent, with good graphics, decent physics, a very realistic damage model (even better than any flatout), excellent tuning, and very decent cars and racing. However, there is one serious problem: you can't buy other cars. This is a serious drawback. Please fix this problem and add the ability to buy other cars.

column8: BU OYUNU ALACAƒûINIZA Gƒ∞Dƒ∞N TAVUK D√ñNER Yƒ∞Yƒ∞N.

First off this game is not nearly as bad as everyone makes it out to be. It tarnished the FlatOut brand by not coming anywhere near the standards set before it, however there is quite a lot of content here, unfortunately the execution and technical prowess are what's holding it back.

The vehicle variety is very good: muscle, Tuner, Classic, Sport, Speed, Monster truck, Off-Road, Special, and stunt classes are available making around 47 cars total.

There are 13 race tracks, each with a reverse layout, they can also be played at night in the rain.

Races can have up to 16 drivers, derbies can have up to 12 drivers, and big derbies up to 24 drivers.

there are some party type modes including splat out (zombie killing), monster truck minigames, and stuntman mode, all up there are 8 game modes and a challenge series that has you play sequentially through 50 preset events.

This is a jack of all trades but a master of none, there is not enough content in either of the individual game modes to keep it interesting. The physics can be unpredictable at times, occasionally (but not often) glitch out and cause hilarious mayhem, the graphics are of early PS2 quality with some strangely good lighting effects considering the lack of polish elsewhere. The track design can be exciting but overall feels like they were made by a modder and are not intuitive. It captures the atmosphere of FlatOut but overall just feels like a cheap, mediocre mobile racing game that double dipped into the stock sound FX archive.

The Ai drivers are shocking, during races they are very rubber band heavy, some fall behind constantly crashing, while others shoot ahead (this is also affected by the game speed option you can pick before a race, fast tends to have the worst rubber banding), and during derbies the AI lock onto you and create a huge pile constantly pushing you until you get wrecked. Speaking of wrecking, the slightest of wall taps will result in a crash out and a reset, and hit detection and damage allocation is extremely poor, most times dealing 1% of damage upon colliding with an opponent at 250km/h.

Conclusion: if you can get this game for $1 you might as well pick it up for a laugh and to complete your FlatOut collection, you'll also gain a small piece of history having the worst reviewed game on Steam. If you can get it cheap in the FlatOut Anthology bundle, just get that and check it out if you want.

column8:
Flatout 3.... This game..... This bloody game! I don't think this game needs any introduction, as everyone knows about this game, considering it is the worst rated game on Steam, a record that was close to being broken, but has yet to be. I am about to rip into this game and tell you why exactly this game has the reputation it does!

History: This game was actually not developed by the original team, Bugbear Interactive. At this time, they were busy with Ridge Racer Unbounded, so to get this game out, they outsourced this game, but instead of going to someone competent, they went with Team 6. They were the same team who ported Flatout to the Wii, considered a terrible port. Why did they outsource the game to Team 6 of all people? And the game suffers because of it! But I guess complaining time is over, let's get this over with...

There is no story

Gameplay: The game is an arcade racer with barely any racer in the racing. You have your standard arcade gameplay stuff, ya know, driving, braking, drifting, and nitro, the basics. It'd be hard to mess that up. However, there is a new mechanic that lets you power up after filling a meter, destroying opponents in your way. Sound fun? It's underwhelming and doesn't even fully KO your opponent, what a waste. When you're in game, you'll also notice that this game has approximately 0 physics. You jump, you go in a straight arc without any form of weight, drifting feels wrong in every way, and you barely go any faster when you nitro. I myself am not really a fan of how the Flatout games play with how their physics work, but this feels so much worse! Doesn't help that collisions are stinky, you smash into someone and only do 1 damage, but someone grinds your car's asshole for 2 seconds and you're at 25 health. Thanks Team 6. Outside of the barely functioning gameplay, there are different modes, including a Destruction Derby (that sucks), super derby (that sucks), collection mode (that sucks), non-linear mode (that sucks), nigh mode (that sucks), minigames (that sucks), and Splatout (that sucks). All the modes suck because the game barely functions, and the ai is poo. Most of the time, it seems like they're drunk because they can barley go in a straight line or even turn, slamming face first directly into a wall and riding it. At this point I'd prefer the overly difficult ai in other games! 1/10! How could this game get worse.... I KNOW!!

Graphics and Presentation: This game just looks so stupid... It's like you took the Nokia Arabic Ringtone and turned it into graphics: Unorganized and messy. Areas do not look memorable at all, and cars are inconsistent too! In menus, they look very dirty and messy, but somehow become clean when you play! Also, say goodbye to memorable characters with actual personality, now we just have stupid parodies that aren't even slightly funny and only exist for the "Oh I recognize that" factor. Ugh... 1/10

Sound and Soundtrack: Stock. Just, stock. Everything about the sounds in this game is stock! In fact, the music is so stock and bad, they give you an option to use your own, which I admit would be cool. Keyword: Would. Why? Because it doesn't work, what did you expect? Because when I tried to load a custom song that wasn't a sound effect, the game just crashes. Nice game testing, Team 6. Plus, the game doesn't automatically advance songs, or sounds in this case, meaning the same sound will constantly repeat over and over until you get sick of it, press the D-Pad to advance, and then crash the game because it's terrible and deserves to die! 1/10

Replayability: There is no reason to even look at this game again, not only because of how terrible it is, but also because there is no incentive, like, really! They did not try at all! 1/10, unless you are a masochist, in which case, 10/10!

Final Thoughts: No. There is a reason this is the worst rated game on Steam. The fact a game in a well known franchise like Flatout turned out like this is just..... Ugh. If it wasn't a Flatout game, it'd be forgotten, but this being a Flatout game helped this game get it's infamy! Do not buy this game, not even at a joke, especially at a price of 9.99! The only score this game deserves is a 1/10 with a side of a turd! Team 6, remove this game! This game is awful in every sense, and I cannot believe Bugbear gave this the OK, they had to have at least seen the product, yes? It's the worst game on Steam, by far! It's an achievement of crap, but still an achievement, just in the wrong way. This game basically killed the Flatout series entirely! There was an attempted revival of the series named "Fl4tout" which should have been a reboot, but in the end, it did not successfully revive the series, and this game is to blame. This game is awful, in fact, you can say that IT'S JUST BAD!

column8:
This is going to be an extremely unpopular review, but I don't care because most of you people deeply exaggerate the quality of this game. I've played racing games all my life and it's what I mostly play, so this is from years of knowledge going into this review. It's not the worst game ever, it's far from the worst game on Steam. Somehow this mostly functional game has worse ratings than Unity asset flip garbage which is ridiculous. You people wouldn't know what a truly bad game was even if it hit you in the face. I don't give a rat's ass if the previous FlatOut games were better, we didn't give Forza 5 a 1% on Metacritic did we? Hell no.

Anyways, rant out of the way, I personally find this game to be a mixed bag. It has some really terrible moments and some really great ones. The fact that there's more than 1 good thing about this game should disqualify it from being the worst game ever. Let's dive into the details.

Physics: Extremely arcadey, beyond even Burnout. Some of the cars have functional handling while others should just be avoided all together. The muscle car class in particular is awful. The tuners have an insane amount of grip for some reason. The monster trucks and offroaders ironically have the most polished physics, which is the two classes of cars I suggest you stick with the most in this game.

Graphics: Nothing to write home about. They're functional, though the camera wobble makes me want to vomit. The nightshift races are borderline unplayable without tweaking some game files. The cars are fine, though a bit crap looking at times. Really nothing that detracts from the game itself tbh.

Racing: Very mixed bag. The AI will rubberband like crazy unless you put it in easy mode. Easy mode is basically fair racing mode and not technically much easier. The racing mode is awful unless you unlock the other cars in the game and have a flatout (no pun intended) multiclass race. The derby modes in this game demolish any other FlatOut game's derby modes and even Wreckfest's, no questions asked. It does everything right, including having large maps, allowing different types of cars at once, not enforcing a contact timer, and best of all, choosing a winner based on damage caused rather than who lasts the longest. But the stunt mode in this game is truly the worst thing about this game period. Don't even bother playing that mode. The monster truck and offroad modes are both awesome and the cars themselves are truly the best in the game in other modes. The speed mode is boring as hell, but the cars are useful. Oh, speaking of cars, you can unlock a TANK that can literally blow opponents up when they decide to rubberband and cheat. I wish every racing game had that, I've always wanted to blow cheating AI up. Too bad it'll crash your game usually. There's also a mediocre zombie mode.

Cars: Despite all cars appearing to have the same stats, I can confirm this is not the case. For example, in the speed class, some are an entire 10 mph quicker. Otherwise, there's an alright amount of variety I guess. You can't tune cars, but there's tunes that make a tiny difference. Really, if you want cars to go faster, you have to change the game speed to fast in the race settings. The worst cars are easily the muscle cars, the handling is literally unplayable in anything outside of derbies. The best cars in the game are the offroad and monster trucks followed by the speed, sports, tuner, and derby cars. The bonus vehicles are more for shits and giggles than actually racing them.

Controls: This game has something that Ultimate Carnage DOESN'T have! You can actually change your controller layout without having to mess with Steam's controller configuration tool. That is actually a very strong point, you'd expect this game to not have it and it's something I said was a huge negative for Ultimate Carnage. However, it's still a bit weird if you don't know what all the different assignments mean. Takes some trial and error.

In conclusion, this game is certainly not great or even good. Awesome for $0.99, somewhat overpriced at full price. It's pretty average, strong points are an excellent derby mode, a fucking tank that can blow people up, the ability to have any car in any race towards the end, the offroad and monster truck cars, and controller configurability. Weak points are the physics, the stunt mode, the muscle cars, the lack of a career mode and upgrading cars, and some tracks being a little confusing at first. This game doesn't deserve to be the worst rated game on Steam. It's not 1/10 like IGN said. Gamespot got it right, it's a 5/10. That's the only review that was honest. The hate bandwagon needs to stop.

I wouldn't play this for a week if someone payed me 100$ to do so, I would die of a heart attack before then. Playing this game for as long as I have makes me want to overdose on every pill in my house. Don't even play this game as a joke, the psychological horror is extremely accurate to this game, it makes me want to rip and tear.

column8:
I bought this out of curiosity, obviously, already knowing about the poor reception. Oh, boy, what did they do here? A total downgrade from FlatOut 2 or even the first one, I think a mid-to-late 90s racing game had better graphics than this 2011 crap. The only positive point is about a few  cool features not present on FlatOut 2, like the monster truck, but it's worthless since controls suck hard. This is still bad even when not comparing to other installments. Not worth a shot (but you're gonna do it, do ya? lol), you could even give it a bad review without playing 'cause it totally deserves.
[h3][b] Verdict: Very bad controls, awful [/b][/h3]
[h3][b] Linux: Usually works, but was borked for some time [/b][/h3]

column8:
Do NOT buy this, not even as a sick joke.

If you want to play flatout do:
Flatout 1,
Flatout 2,
Flatout: ultimate carnage,
Fl4tout: total insanity

Those games are not all equal but are good enough to stake claim for the name.
I have spent some time in the "game" and managed to avoid most technical issues somehow. Yet the tedium is only something you will get when people ho do not understand the genre attempt to make something in it.

Racing feels off, opponent's AI is... barely there, tracks are just meh, graphics so bad they are nearly decade out of date (for the listed release date). It is not even funny bad it is just plain tedium.

My overall rating 0/10

column8:
Alright, I know I'm gonna get crucified for giving this game a positive review and stuff, but hear me out on this, it's a summary of what the game has to offer.

-----
Ups:
-----





1. Wide variety of vehicles (a lot, to be honest. they also have more than 3 skins most of the time. an example would be the Scimitar)



2. Fun gameplay (at least for me)
-----------------------------------
From 9 gamemodes to 10 made it a slightly better game, of course. 



Race - it's probably the reason why the game exists. The tracks aren't exactly as bad as people say, in my opinion. Only select few are just really, REALLY terrible, like hairpin turns after speeding up to 180 MPH, and quite a lot of zig-zagging sometimes. It's the most "enjoyable" mode in the game. Pretty fun, and can be finished in under 2-3 hours, I think. With 1 lap per race event.


Splatout is okay - run over zombies, get the highest combo multiplier and proceed to the next level. It lags a lot on my laptop.


Offroad is nice - when you can finally use the vehicles you've unlocked from previous gamemodes, you can use vehicles such as the Calyx T1 (Formula 1 car), miscellaneous vehicles, and monster trucks  and try to get better lap times.


Speed mode is okay-ish. Not really bad but it's acceptable. Seeing the other race cars crashing into one another can sometimes be amusing. Also it's a bit hard to finish all of the levels.


Battle Arena - Derby mode with 8 or more opponents, with the bad damage detection and RNG values, it makes both Battle Arena and Big Battle hard to complete. The AI might constantly target you most of the time, but you can avoid this by driving in circles, as mentioned in another review. Also the scoring system only counts your TRUE victory if you place number ONE in the leaderboard. You might see that it displays a 0 instead of a 1, and while I'm not entirely sure why that happens, when you finish all of the Battle Arena events in first place, you unlock a one of a kind vehicle. I think this also applies to the Big Battle gamemode. Fun modes, regardless of these problems. For me, of course.


Big Battle - 24 player destruction derby with the same rules as the Battle Arena gamemode.


Challenge - terribly difficult (sometimes), random events with random vehicles (you can't choose your own vehicle) and random opponents.



Stuntman is the second hardest gamemode - since the physics are really bad, sometimes you can't just drag your ragdoll to the place you REALLY want it to go properly, you'll most of the time find out that you needed to move it downwards/upwards a little more. It's kinda hard to explain but I think it's something with the field of view. Also the physics too.


Nightshift - while Monstertrucks has its own degree of difficulty, Stuntman has the crappy physics and Challenge mode is just russian roulette but with more than 1 bullet, Nightshift is in a league of its own.  The track is slippery, it's raining,  every single level is set at night (I think), and you need to win the race in 1ST place to actually win the event.  You have to pretty much do the entire RACE challenge BUT with slippery tracks and agaisnt one opponent. With a lot of fog/smoke. And by a lot I mean a LOT.


Monstertrucks - nightmare. At least for me. Some of the levels are nerve-rackingly hard, and with low framerate it makes it a nightmare to do stuff such as hit 40 barrels. You can make things slightly easier by using the Alarma car, since it's one of the cars with the best handling in the game.
==================================

3. Hard to beat AI, especially in specific gamemodes and when you're using a specific vehicle.


4. Customizable options - You can change the amount of laps from 1, to 3 and 5, choose vehicle class restriction (for the AI), example would be for the AI not to use Muscle class cars. Damage multiplier, which can be cranked up to x2.00, which should've been the default value, in all honesty. People say the damage model doesn't exist, but it don't think this option existed in the 1.0.0.0 version. You can also change the physics from Default, to Classic (I think this should've also been the default choice) and Turbo. Boost healing (when you use the boost, your car repairs damage), and AI difficulty. Also you can change the amount of AI opponents, which really helps you out if your frames are absolutely poop.


5. Fun game - while it isn't the best Flatout title, you CAN do some seriosly awesome stuff like jump on a ramp, do a front/back flip and land on your wheels (you have no control of the vehicle while in the air), do a really smooth turn while braking/handbraking at just the right moment to get a satisfiying turn while not hitting any walls. And you can also play the game normally, race, turn around the corner, break some objects to get the Special bar filled in order to gain invulnerabilty and multiplied damage (near instant opponent vehicle crash on contact with your car, it can sometimes not destroy your opponent, too) and use it just at the right moment when you screw up a turn and an opponent is ready to smack you in the rear. Really, it's awesome and fun.


6. High variety of vehicles, ranging from Supercars, to tuned sports cars and classic cars such as the Cadillac. Of course, they're almost exactly the same in terms of statistics, but they're still good looking vehicles nonetheless. I think there's at least 48 or more vehicles in the game. Didn't know there was a "Bonecracker" until I had the latest version.


7. You can unlock gamemode vehicles for all other gamemodes once you finish all of their events - meaning that you can use the offroad vehicles in any mode once you finish all of the events, same for the Derby, Speed, Monstertrucks, Race and Stuntman. (not sure if Splatout vehicles are unlocked once you finish all of the events)


8. Nice graphics - although some compare the game's graphics to Playstation 2 era videogames (I agree), they are still really high, despite turning them down to the minimal, meaning that the game actually looks really well, and even has world reflection, I think.


9. Special vehicles are unlocked when you finish some gamemodes - you can get a Double Decker London bus, a hybrid Supercar with insane handling, a Tractor, and a few more special vehicles, that you can use in any event you want. It's fun.



--------
Downs:
--------




Performance issues when comparing to previous versions (at least on my laptop), freezing when there shouldn't really be any freezing, and of course bad optimization, as expected.

Despite the game description, the physics aren't equivalent to our world's as double decker buses can run on walls, a vehicle can be sent flying in weird angles in very rare occasions, and collisions on walls might make your vehicle just straight up die.


Damage detection and generator - the damage you give and take is pretty much random. According to many reviews can indeed be goin 180 MPH then hit a car on its front end, and still give it 2-10% damage, which is unnacceptable. Although this problem still remains, despite the game not being updated anymore, you can ignore it, well, sometimes.


AI that will sometimes relentlessly chase down the player in Battle Arena and Big Battle gamemodes, making it hard to score points, and sometimes in races, the AI can aim to take you down, which really sucks. Also they can get turn around corners WAY BETTER than the player, which makes them unfair opponents, especially when they successfully turn while at high speeds and you're lagging behind. Of course, sometimes they will be unsuccessful, and slow down/hit a solid object. (wall)



Summary:


In my opinion, there are more Pros than Cons, but you can easily remove the Pros because of the AI problems, optimization, and graphics.



In short, it's a poor man's:

Burnout Paradise, along with Stuntman: Ignition, Flatout and with a bit of Dangerous Driving into the mix. It's not a terrible game, but it could've been better.

column8: only got this game because it was 1 dollar. its garbage but if you have only 1 dollar it MIGHT be worth it. MIGHT.
column9: only got this game because it was 1 dollar. its garbage but if you have only 1 dollar it MIGHT be worth it. MIGHT.

The FlatOut series was, for me, one of the best examples of what racing games should be. Not boring F1 with its straight and uninteresting tracks, or NFS, which was iconic before Most Wanted and later descended into hopeless diarrhea. These were exactly the racing games I dreamed of. You have traditional racing, spiced up with a variety of track types and demolition derbies, and short tracks designed for crashing into each other. And even a special mode where you need to know how to properly eject your driver. The first two games were an unforgettable experience... and then I jumped into the third one. This game can't be described as anything other than a slap in the face.

1. Poor car models. While the cars in the first two games were nice to look at‚Äîthey were cars‚Äîthis one feels more like shoddy work by the game designers. The cars look like crap, and the default camera position is incredibly close to the car. You're not looking at the track, but at these crappy trunk textures.

2. Simplified controls. This one really shocked me. I don't know what kind of casual or disabled players this game was designed for, but you're literally moving along a precise path, only occasionally changing it slightly by pressing left or right. It feels like I'm playing a free-to-play piece of crap on Android that they didn't bother with, instead making the car drive itself and making the player feel like they're participating in the action. I can compare it to those old mobile games, where you'd press the turn button to change the path the developers had already modeled. It's almost impossible to lose or go off the track here. The AI ‚Äã‚Äãdoes everything for you. In the first two games, you had to sweat it out to avoid hitting another obstacle at high speed and sending you to Hades. Here, you just need to slow down (and sometimes you don't even need that) and press a button to turn. What's more, the car turns at a specific angle regardless of speed. I wonder if this game was developed specifically for players, not paraplegics?

3. A bunch of unnecessary modes. The game has 1v1 boss fights, off-road races for points, a mode where you blow up barrels against the clock!!! and a mode where you run over zombies. I just have one question? What kind of drugs were the developers on when they came up with this idea and implemented it into the game? Developers, this is derby racing!!! Players want survival racing. Why the hell do we need to perform stunts against the clock? Are we playing CrashDay? And did you get the zombie mode from, say, Zombi Driver? Maybe you had the idea to combine several racing genres into one game, but it doesn't work that way. You've crammed something into the game that absolutely shouldn't be there. This isn't genius, it's crap. You'd be better off implementing proper controls instead of pointless modes.

4. Game characters. Yes, as strange as it may sound, the player can now choose which driver to put in the car. There's just one catch! It's unnecessary. It doesn't affect the gameplay at all. The drivers don't have any unique abilities to make it meaningful, and even if they did, it's even more crap. We're playing racing games, not games where someone can legally cheat to win. This is a useless and unnecessary part of the game.

5. Pathetic menu. While this is a matter of personal taste, what have these monsters done to the menu? Previously, the car was parked in the garage and depicted from a normal angle, meaning it looked stylish. Now it's parked against some kind of crap backdrop and is disgusting to look at.

6. Soundtrack. It's impossible to describe how bad it is in words. If you absolutely decide to buy this Call of Duty and play, the first thing you should do is turn off the sound so you don't feel like vomiting after a couple of minutes of playing with this "music." While I understand that there's no accounting for taste, you'd have to be a seasoned eater to appreciate this kind of tweak from the developers.

Bottom line. FlatOut 3 is a complete failure and a huge disappointment. A pathetic game for casuals and the jaded. The developers have abandoned two amazing games, which featured cool racing and derby-thrash. Instead, they decided to combine several other genres into their product and screwed up. I played about 20 hours of each of the previous games, but this one disgusted me after the first race. Even without playing an hour, I can confidently say that the game isn't worthy of your attention, and it's completely contraindicated for fans of the first two games. Honestly, I'm now even afraid of what will happen with Part 4. Although, it couldn't get any worse. My rating is 0/10. Even if I wanted to give it a point, I don't know why. Everything about this game is terrible. From the cars and controls to the piles of unnecessary content and the obnoxious soundtrack. Don't traumatize your senses. Don't play this.
A timeless classic! Physics aren't exactly the best thing about this game, but hey, it's Flatout! :) It gets a bit tedious after playing it for a long time. So, for me, it's only a one-time thing.

words also cannot describe how much anger and genuine terror i felt while playing this scummy disgusting mess of a game.

column8:
Flatout 3 came to me at the perfect time in my life. Before I found this game, I was apart of aproximent 6.9 percent of people that are battling depression. Every day I wondered why I was still here because there was nothing left for me. It took all the energy I could muster just to get out of bed in the morning. I was down to my final days and I eventually just gave up and layed in bed all day. One day something inside of me caused me to get up and go check my computer to see if anybody was wondering where I was. To see if anybody still cared.... I saw that I had a steam notification. I felt the most miniscule glimmer of hope as I clicked to see what it was. All of the hope faded as I loaded up the page just to see a hunnnie pop trading card was added to my inventory. I was crushed. Just before I logged off for what I thought was the last time. I saw that there was a steam sale. I decided to take a look. When the page loaded up I saw a few games were on sale; nothing really that interesting though. Then all of a sudden my heart stoped beating and my face went pale. I read the title aloud "Flatout 3." To this day I don't know what caused me to stop at this paricular title. It was 25 percent off so I had Just enough funds in my steam walled to purchase it. I downloaded and installed the game. When I launched it my eyes began to water. I felt my lower lip quivering. The title screen alone was enough to make me feel emotions I haven't felt in a long time. Was this it? Was this my purpose? I begin to start a race and am greeted by a wide select of colourful zany characters. I went with the giraffe and a chose a race. As soon as it began, I was lost in the pure detail of the landscape and the individual personalities of the characters. I couldn't hold it in anymore. I began to cry. I felt something. Racing along side these new found friends made me feel like I wasn't alone. suddenly I had a purpose in life. This game is truly amazing and it saved my life. I could not recommend this game more. I hope that when you play this game, It will change your life like it did mine or in my case, save it.

I will now give an in depth desciption of the game and list some of the pros and cons before giving it a final score.

Flatout is an earth shattering fast paced action packed experience loaded with tons of features and playablity. This game is a racing game featuring all of your favourite animal pals. This is game is intended for all audiences and gamers of all skill levels. This game offers just the right amount of intesity so that novice players can pick and play the game easily due to the well thought out control scheme and and level layouts while still remaining challenging for the advanced players. This game also works well at events such as kids birthday parties due to the family friendly qualities of this game and the revolutionary split screen feature that comes at no extra cost. Because of flatout 3s large level and character selection, this game simply never ceases to amuse you. Buckle up and prepare for the adventure that comes once in a life time as every level in this game takes place in areas from all around the world. Why not do a race in egypt or an icy tundra? In flatout 3, the world is your playground. Each level has its own unique and interesting design and level layout. No race plays out quite the same as the others. Each level also comes with its own amazing sountrack. The character picks in my opinion also change the gamplay as well becuase of the unique voice lines and personality that comes with each character. The game overall is very easy to run and looks amazing on high settings. The amount of detail put into the models and the textures of the game is staggering. The gamplay is very smooth and the mechanics are glimmering with perfection. All of uprades and abilities in the game are very balenced and work without fail. This game apart from the previosly metioned split screen feature also presents an online multiplayer experience. You can now face off against all of your chums in a nice hardy game of Flatout 3. Practice offline with bots and bring the heat to any online oponent that may stand in your way! Finally it is worth mentioning that this game features one of the most undeniably prodigious story i have ever play in my life. There is not a single bad part about it. You immedieatly get connected to these characters and want to see it through to the end. To get the full expirience you would just have to play it for yourself. There is so much to exerience in this game it is unbelievable. All of this comes at the low price of just $4.49 CAD. What more could one ask for.

Pros and Cons:

Pros: -Easy to run -Story -Characters -Split screen -Online -Maps -Replayability -Visually apealing -Good soundtrack

Cons -you will spend a lot of time playing this

Conclusion: Overall this is one of the best games I have ever played. Some of my happiest memories have come from this game and I know there are lot more to come. I hope I could convince to buy this game and that you will have as much fun with it as I did.

P.s

See you on the track racers!

10/10

column8:
Flatout 3: 

Ein Spiel, welches definitv konkurrenzlos auf der Spitze des Olymps f√ºr simulations-getriebene Rennspiele thront. Die Gef√ºhle und Verz√ºcktheit, die mich nach dem ersten Starts des Spiels durchzogen lassen sich nur schwer in Worte fassen und lassen einen sprachlos ,sowie gl√ºckerf√ºllt zur√ºck. Besonders die massive Fahrzeugauswahl, die sowohl extremst hochgez√ºchtete Boliden, als auch untermotorisierte Untersetzte, welche wohl noch vor dem Krieg das Deutsche Reich verpestet haben, sind hier vertreten. Des Weiteren wei√ü die Charakterauswahl in Flatout 3 zu √ºerzeugen. Von Stalin (in seiner Truckerphase) bis zum Verr√ºckten Wissenschaftler Patrick H. 100 ist alles dabei. Dieses Spiel muss man erlebt haben! 

25/1
column9:
Flatout 3:

A game that definitely sits unrivaled at the pinnacle of simulation-driven racing games. The emotions and ecstasy that overcame me after launching the game for the first time are hard to put into words and leave me speechless, yet filled with joy. The massive vehicle selection, including both extremely sophisticated race cars and underpowered subcompacts that probably plagued the German Reich before the war, is particularly impressive. Furthermore, the character selection in Flatout 3 is impressive. From Stalin (in his trucking phase) to the mad scientist Patrick H. 100, everything is there. This game has to be experienced!

25/1

You know...I was gonna type that this was at a better state than the console version of [i]Cyberpunk 2077[/i]...until I played the damn thing. I essentially got this free as part of the FlatOut Complete Bundle sale. I decided to get the 5 minutes in so I could review it and my god, I dont wanna go through this s**t for 5 minutes [b]ever again[/b]...I completely underestimate at how s**t tier this game really is. 


This game has basically violated me in most ways possible within the 5 minute timespan i was required to play for to get this review in. Buy the bundle on sale, you get 3 amazing FlatOut games, two basically for free, but never touch this one. FlatOut 3 is as bad people say it is.


[b]EDIT (November 28, 2021): This has been changed back to Negative. Konami will probably never fix the broken ass game known as eFootball 2022, so this entire "changing it to positive to send a message" thing was useless.[/b]

column8: My father smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, "If you ever want to see your children graduate, you have to stop immediately.". Tears welled up in his eyes when he realised exactly what was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your father put us through.". I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette.  I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it because your game gave me cancer anyway.

column8:
Truly as bad as everyone says.
One of the other reviewers said "what happened?  The publisher is the same."
Maybe, but the [b]developer[/b] isn't.  FO1/2/UC are by [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bugbear_Entertainment]Bugbear[/url]; FO 3 by [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Team6_Game_Studios]Team6[/url]; FO4 by [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kylotonn]Kylotonn[/url].
I guess what happened was similar to [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Flashpoint#Codemasters_series]Operation Flashpoint[/url], where the publisher kept the IP but had no idea how to make another game.

Just for fun I started here, then switched to Flatout 1.
Within ten seconds I can see what Flatout 3 [b]wanted[/b] to be.
Don't buy this at [b]any[/b] price.

Absolutely awful for 2011? Yes, definitely - but is the rating on Steam more of a meme?

Yeah, definitely, I've played hundreds of worse games - the maps and controls are... very questionable and it feels more like a 2003 game, but is it possible to have fun anywhere? I had fun with much worse racing games as a child, so maybe this is a bit of misplaced nostalgia, but I could play this crap for 10 hours if I had to. It would definitely be more exhausting with other games.

2/10

Dos≈Çownie FlatOut 3 wyglƒÖda gorzej ni≈º pierwsza czƒô≈õƒá serii, kt√≥ra zadebiutowa≈Ça kilka lat wcze≈õniej. Zdecydowanie tutaj nale≈ºy siƒô ogromny minus za cofniƒôcie oprawy do dawnych lat.

Dodam, ≈ºe FlatOut 3 nie posiada synchronizacji pionowej i mo≈ºna ograniczyƒá kl/s tylko do 15 lub 30 co jest dla mnie niewyobra≈ºalne.

Tym razem muzyka do gry zosta≈Ça specjalnie stworzona, a nie jak to mia≈Ço miejsce poprzednio, gdzie to tw√≥rcy wykupowali licencje na fantastyczne utwory. Za ≈õcie≈ºkƒô d≈∫wiƒôkowƒÖ odpowiedzialne jest Redshirt Theory, Adam di Troia oraz Bitworm i swojƒÖ robotƒô pracƒô wykonali prawdopodobnie na kolanie ‚Äì denna, nudna oraz bez tego mocnego brzmienia, kt√≥re podczas ekstremalnych wy≈õcig√≥w jest niezwykle potrzebne. Dostajemy parƒô kategorii zawod√≥w, kt√≥re musimy wygraƒá, zaczynajƒÖc od zwyk≈Çych standardowych wy≈õcig√≥w, przechodzƒÖc przez wy≈õcigi typu off-road, nocne wy≈õcigi a ko≈ÑczƒÖc na trasach pe≈Çnych nieumar≈Çych ‚Äì wszystko to jest jakie≈õ bez ≈ºadnego smaku i poczucia rytmu, ot tak wrzucone w stylu ‚Äûmasz tu graczu trochƒô tryb√≥w i siƒô ciesz tym, co dostaniesz‚Äù. Najgorsze co tw√≥rcy zepsuli i jest to karygodne to prowadzenie samych pojazd√≥w, gdy≈º ciƒô≈ºko nad nimi zapanowaƒá oraz rozbijajƒÖ siƒô o ka≈ºdƒÖ ≈õcianƒô, w jakƒÖ uderzymy niezale≈ºnie z jakƒÖ si≈ÇƒÖ. Najzabawniejszy jest moment, gdy nie rozpƒôdzimy siƒô odpowiednio, to pojazd nie wjedzie nam pod g√≥rƒô, gdy≈º wtedy stopniowo zwalnia, a≈º siƒô zatrzyma i dalej ju≈º nam nie ruszy.

PodsumowujƒÖc, FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction to najgorsza gra z serii oraz og√≥lnie jedna z najgorszych gier, w jakie przysz≈Ço mi graƒá w ca≈Çym swoim ≈ºyciu ‚Äì okropna grafika niemal≈ºe sprzed dekady, muzyka bez dobrego brzmienia, poprawna optymalizacja, tragiczny model sterowania, mn√≥stwo b≈Çƒôd√≥w oraz brak kariery i nijakie tryby do wyboru. Moja ocena czwartej czƒô≈õci ods≈Çony tych ekstremalnych wy≈õcig√≥w to s≈Çabe, ale i niestety zas≈Çu≈ºone 1+/10.
column9:
FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction is the fourth installment in this fantastic series of extreme car racing games. The game's developer has changed, this time to Team6 Game Studios, and the publisher has also changed, becoming Strategy First. The game premiered in 2011 and debuted exclusively on PC.

The graphics are a complete joke, looking like something bundled with the cheapest gaming magazines from 2004 to 2006. The game features awful and ugly low-resolution textures; literally, the entire texture work on all possible objects in the game is pure hell for the player ‚Äì a real nightmare. The vehicle, character, and entire track models, along with the smallest elements, are also a joke, or even a slap in the face ‚Äì everything here is lackluster, even the water and particle effects. FlatOut 3 literally looks worse than the first installment in the series, which debuted a few years earlier. This is definitely a huge downside for reverting the visuals to the old days.

Optimization isn't worth mentioning, given the awful visuals ‚Äì an RTX 2070 with a 9th-generation processor at the highest graphics settings at 1920x1080 (FHD) resolution guarantees 350-500 fps, depending on the track. I should add that FlatOut 3 doesn't have v-sync and can only limit fps to 15 or 30, which is unimaginable to me.

This time, the game's music was created specifically for this game, unlike in previous games, where the developers licensed fantastic tracks. The soundtrack is by Redshirt Theory, Adam di Troia, and Bitworm, and they probably did their job half-assed ‚Äì it's pathetic, boring, and lacks that powerful sound that's sorely needed during extreme races. It's awful, tragic, and lacks any real sense of purpose.

This time, we don't have a career mode, where our goal is to win all the races. This time, it's different, and it didn't do the game any good. We're given a few categories of events to win, starting with regular, standard races, moving on to off-road races, night races, and ending with tracks full of the undead ‚Äì all of it lacks any flavor or sense of rhythm, just thrown in like, "Here, player, are some modes, enjoy what you get." All the tracks are boring, similar, riddled with bugs, and poorly executed. I should add that all the modes can be completed very quickly, as the number and length of the tracks are very, very short.

You no longer buy vehicles, and in fact, there's no cash involved ‚Äì everything is available from the start; all you have to do is choose your vehicle type and model and race it. Tuning has also been completely removed; all cars are already maxed out and have some ridiculous stats. The worst thing the developers have messed up, and it's reprehensible, is the handling of the vehicles themselves, as they're difficult to control and crash into any wall you hit, no matter how hard you hit them. The funniest part is when you don't accelerate enough and the vehicle can't get up a hill, as it gradually slows down until it stops and can't go any further.

In summary, FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction is the worst game in the series and, overall, one of the worst games I've ever played ‚Äì terrible graphics from almost a decade ago, music that doesn't sound good, poor optimization, a terrible control model, numerous bugs, and a lack of a career and bland modes to choose from. My rating for the fourth installment of these extreme racing games is a weak, but unfortunately deserved, 1+/10.
A dick, a slut, the developer's mother will die tomorrow.

column8:
[i]This is the [b]6th[/b] review of the Steam Redlight series, a series where I purposely seek out negatively or controversially rated games on Steam to see if they're as bad as the Internet says they are. It's accompanied by a video review that can be found [b][url=https://youtu.be/J4H2PtRHZ-k ]here[/url][/b].[/i]

[b]In summary, I can‚Äôt recommend this game[/b]. This game isn‚Äôt absolutely the worst game I‚Äôve ever played as Steam would make it seem, since it‚Äôs the lowest rated game, but it‚Äôs just not worth the time. The driving physics are really shallow, over half of the game-modes don‚Äôt seem to be well designed or have terrible pacing, and the game just overall [i]isn‚Äôt fun[/i].
[h2] Introduction [/h2]
I was recommended this game from my channel, but I was already aware of it since it‚Äôs regarded at Steam‚Äôs [b]worst[/b] game by review-count. Anyways, Flatout 3 is a racing game that emphasizes on destruction, as the subtitle would allude to. There‚Äôs absolutely no storyline, but there are several game modes. To cover each one briefly:

[list]
    [*]Racing Mode: Three laps versus several other people.
    [*]Stunt Mode: Non-racing, eject your character from the vehicle in an attempt to score points at a distant target.
    [*]Big Battle: You and 23 other cars bump uglies to get points until either you or everyone else explodes in a fiery death.
    [*]Regular Battle:You and 11 other cars bump uglies to get points until either you or everyone else explode in a more intimate fiery death.
    [*]Monster Trucks: Hit things with your big truck, score points while doing so.
    [*]Speed Racing: High-speed racing with hyper-fragile formula cars on a circuit.
    [*]Night Shift: A night-time duel of racing on wet tracks.
    [*]Off Road: Race while gathering points by drifting, jumping, or des[b]truck[/b]tion. They said it, not me.
    [*]SplatOut: Hit zombies with your car, get a combo, get big points.
    [*]Challenge: You get challenged by Team 6 to be a better person.
[/list]

This covers the foundation of what you need to know before we get into the good, so let‚Äôs move on.
[h2] The Good [/h2]
I found Stunt Mode to be the most enjoyable game mode. I definitely spent the most amount of time playing it. I feel like I [i]might[/i] like it because it has just about nothing to do with the driving physics in the game.
The game is also very memeable, albeit not good ones. I make some weak attempts at humor in my video.

These are about all the good things I got out of it -- and I‚Äôm sure for many, these points would be moot for you. None-the-less, let‚Äôs get to the un-good.
[h2] The Un-Good [/h2]
The driving physics are really shallow and easy to take advantage of. I get this game isn‚Äôt trying to be Forza or anything, but it‚Äôs just that they lack any semblance of complexity or depth. The recipe is to tap your brake or handbrake (depending on how sharp the turn is) to reorient yourself, then hit your super-boost to commit to that direction. This makes just about any concrete-based race, including Speed Racing easy to complete, save for getting hit by your opponents.

The AI plays out pretty terribly. In Night Shift, my opponent consistently crashed on the first turn on the first map. In subsequent maps, it was just short of being common that my opponent would crash and then I‚Äôd just [b]not[/b] see them for the rest of the race. In Battles, the AI gets stuck in loops and will just drive in literal circles, even if the last two cars are just yourself and them.

There are also plenty of game modes that just really seem to be poorly designed, either through pacing or mechanics. The Racing modes save of Off-Road are all fine, but that leaves many others. To start, Big Battle and Regular Battle just seem to be [i]off[/i]. If I run into an opponent at full super-boosted speed, knocking them a quarter-way through the arena and manage to do more damage to myself than to them, that‚Äôs just not fun. That consistently happened throughout my gameplay.

Off-Roading [b]should have[/b] been fine. The downside is that there‚Äôs only two maps to play on. [i]Technically[/i] there‚Äôs four, but that‚Äôs because the two maps have been reversed. It‚Äôs just really shallow -- off-road racing is typically very fun in games, but we don‚Äôt get a lot of opportunity to experience it in this game to the point where I wonder why it was included at all.

The two game modes that are pacing nightmares are SplatOut and Monster Trucks. In SplatOut, I constantly found myself driving slower, maybe even at [i]speed limit[/i] trying to keep my combo going. It really didn‚Äôt seem intuitive for a racing game to make me drag my speed down for the sake of a combo -- it ended up being less fun and more like a chore. Monster Trucks suffers the same fate where the trucks seem to be just as fragile as the formula cars. I‚Äôm not sure what drives health loss, but occasionally me just popping over a steep hill would deal a percent or two without any body contact. Shocks, maybe‚Ä¶ but it‚Äôs unpreventable damage that can lead to a shortened run. Just like SplatOut, I found myself creeping around the map, staying away from everyone else, just trying to hit my targets. I don‚Äôt even think the AI is even trying to compete against you in this mode. Terrible experience.

Finally we come to Challenge Mode. There‚Äôs nothing challenging about this mode except for the fact that it‚Äôs just making you play the game you‚Äôre already playing. There‚Äôs no special objectives or experiences to go through -- it‚Äôs just having you complete objectives in their relative game mode with no caveats. For example, there are several challenges that are asking you to place in first but the experience is no different on the track -- no new obstacles, no weird circumstances [i](other than them choosing your car‚Ä¶ but they‚Äôre all normal cars)[/i], nothing new or exciting. They even change up the wording of some of the challenges but are alluding to the [i]same conditions[/i] as if you were playing the game normally, i.e.; [i]‚ÄùLeave them all behind you.‚Äù[/i]... just ask me to place first, don‚Äôt polish a turd.

Lastly, minorly, are just some bad experiences and/or bugs I experienced:
[list]
    [*]The game has no tutorial.
    [*]To follow up, each game mode‚Äôs instructions are packed into the loading screen. [b]However[/b], the loading screen just progresses to the race without any button confirmation, commonly leaving you without enough time to comprehend how to play.
    [*]Specifically for Stunt Mode, the game tells you to [i]hit the eject button[/i], but makes no effort to tell you what that is. If you‚Äôre KB/M, it‚Äôs [b]Shift[/b], which I had to learn by looking at the Controls menu in Settings.
    [*]For the offroading maps, it didn‚Äôt save any of my scores.
    [*]The game tracks your attempts on maps and tracks, but doesn‚Äôt count an attempt if you restart the level from the pause menu. I played a Stunt Mode track for over 20 minutes and only accumulated 4 [i]‚Äùattempts‚Äù[/i].
[/list]

[h2] The End [/h2]
That just about covers as much in a nut-shell as I can fit. There‚Äôs a lot of other written and video reviews that cover different angles, and I can mirror my experience with most of them in case I‚Äôm missing anything. I figure that I‚Äôd cover mostly my displeasure with the game-modes since that‚Äôs what bothered me the most.

In case you‚Äôre wondering, Team 6 is still producing racing games. FlatOut 4 isn‚Äôt poorly as rated, and they‚Äôve released another game in 2018 called Super Street: The Game, both on Steam, both sitting at [i]Mixed[/i] ratings. I wonder what went wrong internally between everything post 2011 and FlatOut 2.

[i]Did you like this written review? Watch the video review which does have some different coverage not talked about here:[/i] https://youtu.be/J4H2PtRHZ-k

column8: Alrighty buckaroo, let me tell you something, you slimy little man; this GAME, no no this MAGNUM OPUS, this PINNACLE OF HUMAN ENGINEERING, a game to surpass every other game, the CITIZEN KANE OF GAMING, the gaming equivalent to THE FEELING OF A SWEET BACK SEAT HANDJOB ON THE WAY TO THE SCREENING OF THE LIGHTHOUSE, STARRING ROBERT PATTINSON AND WILLEM DAFOE, to put it bluntly, THE SWEET ORGASM OF GAMING, will put you into tears and make you relapse to the time when your father said to your mother, "All right, sugar tits, I'm outta here! Vamoose!" But like, its fine this time, it is an enriching experience, and your personality in the near future will be richer with the experience. The other day, I was playing this game, and my dog (Spittle, don't ask haha) was watching me from behind; as I played my heart out, nearly orgasming three times, he watched and watched. Eventually, he stood up on his back legs, cleared his throat, and said in a creamy and rich voice that I had never experienced sonically before: "Got Damn son! This game looks amazing!" I was taken aback, for not only had my dog just spoke, but he is also spoke the truest words ever spoken in human existence. I embraced him, for no longer was he just my dog, but he was an intellectual, a true appreciator of the arts, but most importantly, he was now my closest and greatest friend. Anywho, away from that tangent: This game is so incredibly beautiful, the imagery and graphics so picturesque and serene that I forget that I am simply playing a video game and not viewing gorgeous images of our magnificent earth. Never have I ran into an issue with gameplay, mechanics, nothing: this game is a gift from the Gods, crafted for the sole purpose of displaying perfection and bliss within a video game, carried down upon a rather soft pillow, so that us mere peons and plebeians may be blessed with the meticulous and precise work of the beings on high. If you have not already, purchase this piece of beauty; you will transcend to the realm of Gods and titans, and live out eternity in the paradise of Eden.

column9: The game is weak. I feel that FL 2 is much better; the driving model is more precise. The controls and graphics are strange. New modes have been added, but what's the point if the core gameplay is crap, i.e., the controls? I don't recommend it. If you want to play, buy FL 1 or 2.

You've never seen such brutal trash. The beloved Flatout series has sealed the deal for all future sequels with just one game ‚Äì the third installment. I see how bad the reviews are, and after playing it myself, I realized that all that remains of the old, cool game's spirit is its name. These guys should have followed Gabe Newell's example and not released a game with the number three for public review. Flatout: Ultimate Carnage turned out pretty good, didn't it? 
[h1]I'm giving this game a thumbs up for only one reason: I agree that the previous games in the series are still playable and worthy of your attention.[/h1]
And Chaos & Destruction can sit on a forgotten Steam server for eternity. What's done can't be undone.

column8:
Without a doubt the worst game I have ever played (relative to the release date). It is like a B-movie: The game - but instead of being low-budget the B stands for BAD. 

The gameplay is abysmal. I have played driving games with better physics in the 90's. The AI is rubber band trash. The graphics look worse than Flatout 2. There is no music during racing - NONE. The collision detection is a joke. 

The game has a lot of glitches and bugs (car randomly blowing up, car jumping 300 meters to the air, the character becoming a bar of nonsense during stunts etc.) - although it has only crashed once - if that's an upside.. 

The only upside of the game is the zombie mode - which has FPS drops with a system way above the recommended.

Any amount of money is too much for this pile of junk. The only reason I got it was due to it being in a bundle.

-Graphics: 3/10
-Audio: 1/10
-Gameplay 1/10

Overall:
-100/10. Simply don't buy it.

column8: I rather have Nicholas Cage narrate my dreams than play this crap. The game is unfinished because the dev team probably knew this was garbage.
column9: I rather have Nicholas Cage narrate my dreams than play this crap. The game is unfinished because the dev team probably knew this was garbage.

I'm warning anyone who wants to write to me about fixing this or that bug. I'm not buying the game to fix bugs, I'm buying it to play!
Let's start with the fact that the cars in this part of the game are kind of plastic. For example, if you ram an opponent, they'll fly off into the sky. But the cars feel like they weigh 10 times more, landing almost instantly after every ramp jump. The menu navigation is awkward (and in fact, in the game itself, it's all screwed up). I press the down button once, and it scrolls through 2-3 tabs. The tracks don't look great, but the cars look pretty good.
Ultimately, after one unfinished race, I don't want to play anymore.
I don't know how to describe it... Don't even try to play this, it's very bad.

The game is terrible, too arcade-like, the sound is terrible, the graphics are eye-popping, is this from 2011?!
GTA4 came out earlier, but its graphics are much better. The game runs on a GPU that's simply under voltage.
I don't even know what else to say. I absolutely don't recommend this game. It's a shame it came bundled with other games, and I can't refund it.

column9:
[b]FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction[/b] is the third installment in the FlatOut series, but beware, this game wasn't created by Bugbear, but by Team 6.

There's nothing good about this game, so there's nothing left to do but talk about the bad.

FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction is CRAP. It completely tarnished the FlatOut name. Team 6 ruined everything that could be ruined. The physics are a joke since the car sticks to the ground. The graphics are horrendous, and the soundtrack is nonexistent compared to the other games in the series.

In conclusion, NO ONE should buy [b]FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction[/b]. It's the worst racing game on Steam, and for a long time, it was the worst game on ALL of Steam. You can't even say "it's so bad it's laughable."

Final Score: [u][b]0/100[/b][/u]

column8:
They didn't even get the title of this game right. Instead of FlatOut it's Flatout. That alone should be an indicator that there is something wrong here if you didn't see it from all the negative reviews. But onto the review. I cannot believe that after the masterpiece that was FlatOut 2/Ultimate Carnage, we got this piece of junk here. Everything about this game is worse than the previous titles. The car handling is janky, physics are nonexistent, glitches everywhere, graphics are muddy, AI doesn't know how to drive, among other problems. Even the soundtrack sucks. Instead of real music it's now some generic background music. This game is a disgrace to the name it bears. The only redeeming thing in this game is the fact that they seemed to somewhat try something original. Some of the modes and stages are pretty interesting but that doesn't save this abomination.
Only get this thing if you want to play bad games or get the full FlatOut collection.

Team 6 Studios. More like Team sh*t studios.

4.5/10

column8: Well... I just wasted 0.3hrs of my life.
column9: Well... I just wasted 0.3hrs of my life.

Well, it's not really that different from its predecessors in my opinion. I still don't really want to play.

They changed the car physics; instead of "you can't wrap it up," it's like "a lonely dumpling in a pot." It seems to have added some action, but I can't say it's any more interesting. Other players, for example, didn't like it at all...

The graphics are really bad ‚Äì dull and dreary. Even worse than the similar BURNout on PSP.

The optimization is good; I didn't experience any performance lag. Another issue is that it refuses to let me access the advanced video settings, and for some reason the game can't find the performance index. ))) Wow, the project missed out on a whole new class of Windows systems.

At least they fixed the gamepad and integrated a Russian one ‚Äì thank you very much, no irony there.

But it's still just so-so entertainment.

column8: Incredible
column9: Incredible
expensive

Yes, we were expecting Flatout, but we got a crash that was a mix of Carmagedon, Burnout, Splitsecond, F1, and Dirt. I have a feeling the developers misunderstood what kind of game they were buying. As the old Russian proverb goes, "If you chase two hares, you'll catch neither." Five would probably drive you crazy. After finishing it, I sat down to play Burnout and realized that compared to the 2007 game, this 2011 one is lost in the swamp of textures. But the game does have a "nearly" balanced section‚Äîchallenges. When you drive around Moscow (I specifically went to the Kremlin and saw it‚Äîit looks completely different there) or Rome in cartoonish cars, magic happens, and you get captivated. I have no idea how it happens, but the emotions are there. The game is difficult to beat; I'd say you get through it by pure luck, not by driving skill. Firstly, you need to adjust the game speed in the campaign (challenges) yourself. If you can't complete something, go back to the menu and speed up the game (for example, the bus race or the 23rd stunt). Secondly, level 30 is completely unbalanced. It's the hardest, since it's a night mode with four opponents and a heavy car in terms of weight and handling. I spent an hour working on it, and then adjusted the settings. This is a terrible aspect of the game that ruins the entire experience. Let me remind you, this is an arcade racer, with simplified controls. Why are you introducing such an imbalance that can't be balanced by driving experience? I've played tens of thousands of hours of racing games, and yet I was uninterested in waiting for the stars to align and we'll move on. Thirdly, 10,000 zombies? Why do I have to make so many pointless runs?

Don't buy this game, even if it's the last game on earth...
The game is so terrible that it makes free games look much more interesting...

column8:
That's most likely one of the worst games, that I've ever played. Storyline do not exist (ok, it's flatout after all, so don't expect Oscar for plot). What's worse - graphics look awfully bad. There are many graphical bugs here and there. Game contains totally wrong ragdoll, which isn't even trying to imitate real behavior. Physics of cars and world is awfully bad, I'm gonna risk to say, that the game would be better without it. 
The whole competitions are actually good - there are plenty of different stuff to do. Biggest problem with it (excluding really awful physics) is drastic unbalance. There are many competitions, that are simply too ez (like splatout zombie, arena, drift or speed) and some are amazingly hard to finish with no particular reason (yes, night shi(f)t). The way AI's cars behave on some competitions does not leave you any space for errors, despite "easy" mode - cars are simply glued to ground in 9/10 corners, deal with it. 

Overall, there's nothing even being close to FUN, when playing this. Mix of poor graphics, non-existing physics, low difficulty level (not alyways, it sometimes get to skyhigh for no reason), stupid bugs and unstability (game could freeze for 2-3 secs for no reason, you could fall beneath track, despite being in the middle of way you should drive, sometimes this thing just crashes and bamm, restart it) gives me a constant question "why do I even bother?". 

Two things that put my final grade just a bit are achievements (not sure who is hard enough to have all of them) and Vin Diesel's model as one of the zombies. Really. That's it. In the entire game. 
If you bought it due to good memories from 1st and 2nd Flatout, this game will ruin it very quickly. If you got it for free - I still advice to think at least triple before starting this. Playing that game in purpouse other than farming achievements is simply out of my mind (or maybe I'm too stupid to understand pure genius behind it, lmao).

Even if you're a big Flatout fan, don't buy this. It's a waste of money, a waste of disk space, and bears no resemblance to previous releases. The physics are bad, the car handling sucks, the graphics are a pain to navigate. Even the menus are a pain to navigate. I repeat: don't buy it.

The worst part of the FlatOut series. As the saying goes, there's always a black sheep in every family. Bad graphics, poor gameplay, crippling controls, empty and uninteresting modes, a lousy soundtrack, poor car customization, and absolutely zero physics make this game a complete disaster. The only interesting things here are the playable characters (and even then, they're a bit shoddily designed) and the achievements, which at least slightly embellish this garbage. Overall, I don't recommend it.
A piece of shit, in short.
This isn't Flatout, it's some kind of trash, the cars are like in some kind of Lego, the only plus is that the Russian language is present.

column8:
The rise and fall of FlatOut is a tale only fans of the cult racing series will mourn to, but it should be a familiar tune for most gamers. FlatOut could've been a contender. It had what it takes. But the dream is over.
If FlatOut was a promising racehorse, FlatOut 3 is the busted leg that'll soon have it shot and bulldozed into a creek.

WHAT HAVE YOU DONE TO FLATOUT?
This game has absorbed all the worst aspects of the FLATOUT series and compiled them into this utter garbage. Everything about the game is bad, starting with the optimization (the game runs at 200-300 fps on an i7-7700 and 1066, but lags horribly, dropping frame rates so much that it's nauseating). The racing in the game is terrible; you're constantly crashing and flying out of your car, unable to drive even 10 meters.
They removed all the music from the game. Taking away rock from FLATOUT is like taking away car theft in GTA...

I've never played a worse game than this. It felt like someone infused shit in my urine and forced me to drink three bottles of healing potion.

Rating: I give the game 1 out of 10 Windesel (it's actually there).

column8:
This game is a real chaos & destruction... chaos & destruction of once legendary series!.. 

I really can't understand what new Flatout IP owners thought! The original publisher went bankrupt, so maybe we will buy the studio in addition and continue the series? No, let's give the development to an unknown studio that developed only a mediocre port of Flatout to Wii console, and end up with a complete piece of sh*t!

I don't even want to discuss the game itself: Asphalt series has more of Flatout in it than this game. And even if you forget about Flatout in the title the game just becomes a mediocre indie race, which you will barely play for more than 2 hours. The only real problem of this game, apart from its existance of course, is that you relaunch it from time to time trying to believe that maybe you missed or got wrong something and game has something to prove, but you fail every time because there is nothing and game is just a total crap.

[h1]FlatOut 3 ‚Äì So bad it's actually good. [/h1]

[i][b]Let's just say it right away ‚Äì handing over a popular series to people recruited off the street was a lousy idea. The third game is top-notch trash, impossible to play with a straight face. In places, it's hard to believe this is a FlatOut game. [/b] [/i]

[b]Everything is bad here.[/b] From the color scheme, which would make even the dead sick, to the controls, which resemble a cow on roller skates. But let's take things one step at a time.

Well, then! First of all, the new developers decided that [b]any career path is completely unnecessary for players[/b]. So, instead, they created about 12 different modes, from dubious monster truck races to zombie extermination. This is exactly why we love this series! Damn zombies, standing in a row on the road and not even trying to attack you. Fantastic!

Let's move on! Now you have access to a dozen cars right away, all of which are a designer's nightmare. Upgrading is also available and consists of some crappy classes[/b] like "Madman," "Tank," and so on. It feels like the game's creators simply had no idea how a car works and were just making it up at random. What can I say, once my car flipped over and I saw that it had no axles, and the wheels were just floating next to the frame...

When the cars are actually driving, that's a whole other story. The physics are completely nonexistent; even the smoothest turns require you to use the handbrake. If you hit water, the car explodes. Yeah, right! It explodes instantly, even if you barely touch the water's edge. Because someone was too lazy to paint the splashes.

The [b]location design[/b] is another hallmark of this gem. There are reinforced concrete bushes with meter-long leaves, helicopters that blow your car to pieces with their missiles, and a train emerging from a blind tunnel, which your incompetent opponents will crash into instead of waiting a few seconds for it to pass. Overall, I'm very glad the project's designers found some work, although I don't understand since when game developers have been recruiting people from the nuthouse.

Speaking of the aforementioned establishment, I'd also like to highlight the [b]wonderful characters of the game[/b]. Because the most brutal cringe is the best thing you can experience when contemplating these creatures. Indeed, some Jackie or Sophie‚Äîit's all a bit banal. But playing as a disabled person with third-degree burns, a beer-bellied truck driver, or Ron Jeremy himself‚Äîthat's exactly what everyone has dreamed of. And yes, now you can play as anyone, from a crazy woman who "thinks she can fly like Santa" to a stuntman who looks like a deputy.

[i][b]So, if you want a laugh, go for it. I only had the game crash once, so this bit of code works more or less reliably. But as a continuation of the series, this game is a complete f‚Ä¶ So don't even expect anything decent to await you there.

I might even recommend it, but only because it made me genuinely smile a couple of times. But a thumbs down so as not to confuse anyone. [/b]

column9: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

Flatout 3 is a terrible game. When I first launched it, I thought I was playing a mobile port and that it was just visually appealing, but it only got worse. On the plus side, I can note the ability to uninstall the game (which was a problem before).

I'd completely forgotten about this game; I saw it on Steam by accident. I thought, "Wow, I'll remember the old days now, especially since the third one is probably the best." But even from the menu, it was clear that something was wrong. If I'd been given the first three parts of the game without any mention of when each one came out, I'd have called this the very first: the graphics and physics are antediluvian, simply useless, the gameplay itself is complete crap. Basically, a worthless game.

column8: Stay clear from this POS
column9: Stay clear from this POS

It's no secret that this game is the cesspool of the racing industry, but it does have its positive aspects, albeit few. I completed all playable modes (regular races, 1v1, and a formula-like mode). Unfortunately, it wasn't until the end that I discovered you can change the number of laps in a sort of "career," which cost me 3x my time in the game.

Let's start with the pros:

+ Variety of modes (more modes than in other games, but most of them are unplayable)
+ Driving gimmick (they added extra nitro to the car, which is responsible for taking sharp turns, to the poor physics; without it, you have nothing to do in this game. By the way, if at the beginning of the game you don't understand why you skid when accelerating, I recommend looking at the control layout :))
+ Increased difficulty (compared to previous games)

This is where the pros end and the cons begin:

- Disgusting color scheme + the very purpose of adding an apocalypse to this game is unclear
- Sounds and music (the sounds are self-explanatory, and the music is only present in the main menu, but it is also terrible)
- Physics (on par with the sounds in this game) P.S. If you land on an opponent during a jump, their car will fly off into the sky of Jannat. - The effects are mind-blowing. I'd especially like to mention the circuit race on the final map in Rome; that race is the absolute worst. The action is greeted by car headlights, like you're looking at a bright lamp. The real fun begins when you climb up the Spanish Steps. If there's anyone nearby, you'll likely crash into them, and it'll be a wild ride. To understand just how amazing this section of the track is, I'll give you an example from my race, where my opponents got stuck in those textures on the last lap. It was the only time in my racing experience in this game where I overtook my pursuers for more than half a lap (usually this is impossible because the AI ‚Äã‚Äãadjusts its speed and will always be relatively close). Here's the track result: I was 5:53, 2nd and 3rd place were around 6:55, and the rest had times of 8:50+, which is unthinkable for this game. I'd also add the Tatra track to this list. Constant jumping on hills with unrealistic slopes (these jumps really make you sick), random trains and rockets.
- Optimization
- A variety of useless cars, since with the current physics, 95% of the tracks will require you to drive a car with maximum handling.
- The purpose of the added characters is unclear.
- Ultimate ability (Why? Why is it used?)
- AI (In regular races, someone will almost always stick close to you, and their behavior is truly mind-boggling. In 1v1, the opponent's speed can sometimes be astronomical, requiring a restart to correct it. There's no difficulty in F1.)
- A completely indifferent attitude (The lap start/end marker is created in a few seconds in Paint, and there were cases where it would even show up at regular checkpoints. Driving through textures in the port.)
- Graphics and [b]Effects[/b]

To summarize, the game is absolutely bad on all fronts and shouldn't be played unless you want to play it for the sake of it. 4/10
This is the worst race I've ever seen, including prehistoric mobiles.
