column9:
I bought the FlatOut game pack and noticed that the threequel had "negative reviews." I didn't read the reviews in detail, and I'd never played the game itself. I decided to evaluate this creation myself. I thought about it... installed the game and decided to give it a chance. After 15-20 minutes of playing, I understood why people were so critical of this game.

So! The first thing I noticed was the terrible graphics. I thought it was all about the game settings. I was just kidding. "You have everything maxed out, but you just choose eye-popping graphics and then go to hell."

What about the modes? They (in my opinion) feel rather empty, pointless, and very boring. Just look at the zombie modes or the Bigfoot and SUV driving.

The gameplay is simply "Disgusting," with a capital "A." It seems like they didn't even bother with the physics. It's like they gave us toy cars. And there's no physics like in FlatOut 1 or 2 (which, mind you, were released in 2004 and 2006).
The car upgrade system has become completely pointless.
The sound in the game is terrible. At that point, I wanted to play without sound or even quit the game and delete it (but I kept playing).
And the game has lags and freezes. For example, when you change the car or the color itself.

And the bugs! Hmm... that's a whole other story. In 15 minutes of play, I encountered at least 10 bugs. And I don't see the point in describing them.

The bottom line is: FlatOut 3 is NOT FlatOut! It's a game (though it's hard to call it a game) made out of crap and without any tools, trying to copy everyone's favorite game.
Avoid Shƒ±tOut 3. Better to buy part 1 or 2.

This is simply the WORST GAME IN THE ENTIRE SERIES. It's a disgrace, I don't understand how they even released something like this; it's weak even for a mobile racing game. It shouldn't be called FlatOut. Don't buy this game under any circumstances, even if you're getting a multi-part pack.

That moment when you're truly impressed. They screwed it up so well. What you've seen can't be unseen. Everything we've always wanted but were afraid to ask for. After launching, I double-checked what game I'd launched because I thought I'd made a mistake. 44 minutes of bewilderment and hope that the screen would fade to black with the words, "Did you really think this was the third part of Flatout!? You passed the test, you're a true FAN! Here you go!" And then the game launches the menu and the racing, derby, and everything begins. The next day, I made an appointment with an optometrist because I felt like my eyes were failing after this "game." This product left me in a state of profound emotional devastation. My family will file complaints against the developers because after I went through "this," I started drowning my sorrows.
I missed out on Part 3 back in the day. And now that I've tried it, I know for sure I didn't miss anything. The game is terrible, about 80% below even Part 1! And Part 1 was a masterpiece!

I bought it at a huge discount, but it's not even worth it. The developers killed absolutely every mechanic from the original series and released an unplayable chunk of code. As a fan of the FlatOut series, I couldn't finish this game.
What happened to poor Flatout? It used to be hard to choose between NFS and Flatout, but now some browser-based Flash racing game would be better.

column8:
Having played Flatout 2 years ago on the PC, I had very fond memories of that game as it was tremendous fun! I really loved it! Recently I found Flatout 3 on sale and decided to give it a go as the price was a bargain at 69p. Well, was it really?

The 3rd instalment of the Flatout series has nothing to do with it's predecessors. it is a mash of new ideas thrown to the table without any effort to be implemented well as enjoyable experience. There are new racing modes and classes but they are not well made. For example the Stuntman mode which is interesting as an idea, but comes out as annoying and buggy rubbish. Oh and there is no explanation what is needed to do in order to proceed to the next level. Nightshift and night driving courses, awesome as an idea, complete rubbish when materialized as the level lighting is non existent as some points and the player has no clue where to go. The offroad races with the checkpoints all over the place that one has to guess where the next checkpoint is and a tonne of other things badly made.

Pros:
Interesting variety of races
Interesting heavy-techno music

Cons:
Some stages are annoyingly difficult
Cars get easily damaged
Terrible graphics for it's date
Cars tuning is daft
Car models are poorly designed (Buggati front with a BMW rear? seriously now?)
Poor Car handling
Horrible level design

In short, if you haven't played any of the Flatout games, DO NOT choose this one, instead go for Flatout 2 which although being older, it is certainly a far more enjoyable and superior game.

column9:
Different and ultra-arcade, you could say.
Different from the others.
A facelift, but the other way around.
Instead of doing everything right, they did everything wrong.
An hour playing different modes and I didn't like it.
Bad graphics, what happened? It's worse than the first one.
Gameplay, controls, tracks, particles, effects, everything, absolutely everything is bad.
You unlock cars/tracks as you win.
There's no career mode here. You play here to have fun, if you can.
I didn't see the point. It's impossible to win races because when you turn, well, if the car turns, it can't.
It seems like they tried to top it off with some kind of zombie Carmageddon mode, and it sucks.
Honestly, this game is a first. I thought it was different and worse, but NOT SO!
Even Flatout 4 Total Bug is better.
I don't recommend it, not even to anyone who wants to try it, like me. You're going to end up disappointed.

column9:
Reading the reviews, it seemed like you could jump into the game, endure it for 10 minutes, and quit. Well, I got to taste this masterpiece for a full 40 minutes, and I can say it's bearable; I thought it would be even worse.
-The graphics are complete garbage, not even close to the previous games.
-The physics are complete crap, they've completely screwed everything up.
-The set of missions, tasks, whatever you like‚Äîit's lazy crap on the developers' part. You customize everything yourself and collect perks, mmm. No challenge for the player. Or...
+It's funny, but the physics are also a plus for the game. Yes, it's not flatout, but if you realize all the cars are fluff, you might even have some fun.
+It's complete crap, but it's fun crap, and I'm not ashamed to say it. If you forget that this game is a continuation of a cult series that was trashed in 2011, it's still fun to play, and I'm not ashamed to say so or praise it for anything.

If you don't have an epileptic seizure within the first few minutes of playing, I think you'll be okay with it.
_________________________
In short, recommended for shit-eaters.

column9:
Of course, it's not the best Flatout game, but it's still fun to play if you buy it at a discount, otherwise it's not really worth the detour! The achievements are easily completed in a few hours. You need to have a friend who has the game to complete it, since the multiplayer mode is completely empty!

The game as a whole is entertaining for an afternoon, but without the achievements, I don't see the point of continuing. I'm glad to have it in my collection, but I don't think I'll play it again for a single minute after completing it 100%. I recommend Flatout 2, which is incomparable compared to this third installment.

As for the graphics, the game is pretty average for its year of release, but still passable in my opinion, nothing too terrible either!

Overall Rating: Graphics: 5/10, Gameplay 6/10, Content 4/10, Durability 1/10, Difficulty 6/10, Multiplayer 0/10.

I played 9 minutes, apparently. And 9 minutes was enough. It does everything wrong, and shows a clear lack if understanding of what made the earlier games fun. It quite literally has nothing special going for it. I've already written more words in this review than this game deserves. And why is this?
Because it isn't the original devs. They went and made Wreckfest instead.

column8:
This is the worst FlatOut game of the series , I only got it because it is part of the FlatOut Anthology. I don't recommend it , no wonder why is it the worst reviewed game on Steam. Also I don't understand why they wanted it to be a apocalypse type of game, even the zombie mode is completely trash, I thought that at least that would be good. If u got it from the Anthology pack, u should refund it, this is not worth even 1‚Ç¨. I will keep it because why not, I want one day to do a review with all the bad parts of this game. Also, the 24 AIs derby is completely broken, just imagine 23 AIs trying to wreck you, they just drive into you giving you around a minimum 5% damage per hit , but when u go full speed into them, u just barely damage them. Well, not only those parts are broken, the entire game is. I just talked about those because they should fun. In all FlatOut games doing races is fun, but for me, the derbies are still legendary, they're very fun, and most of times, you are going to have a good laugh. If they want to save the game ( I don't think they will mostly because they changed the studio) they need to completely remake the game, it has soo many bugs, also they need to change the atmosphere, it is just depressing, even with the music, colors everything. Also, the cars are very weird, like one can have the face of a Lamborghini and the back of a Bentley. They.... just made the game to be like a Clutch (The new name of Armageddon Riders) combined with Carmageddon and a little bit of FlatOut , but a little. Shortly, it is having too many problems.
      
     This is my review, sorry for the bad grammar I have, and I hope that I helped you, bye!

column8:
I had played the crap out of FlatOut on the original Xbox. I played UC on PC for a while too. I knew that had been a FlatOut2, but hadn't played it. I NEVER knew anything about FlatOut 3. I found the FlatOut bundle on sale a few years ago. That was the moment I learned about 3. It took me until today to finally get up the nerve to play it. If you have any love for Flatout, DO NOT play this title. I will list issues below. This game is nightmarishly bad.

1. The graphics are cartoony.
2. The ability to pick a driver is cool, but they made it feel like you were selecting a driver in Twisted Metal.
3. The "Trying entirely too hard" outfits on the female characters.
4. The physics. Oh dear God, the physics.

column9: Total crap, I have nothing more to say.

A terrible, half-assed game. The cars don't feel like they're glued to the ground, and that's just one of the controls. When I downloaded the third game, I was expecting improved graphics and new music, but there's no music, and the graphics look worse than in the second game. There's no campaign, just a bunch of modes. It feels like some driving simulator some high school kid threw together on Unity in a week. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

I bought it, thinking it wasn't all that bad.
I went into the menu and my first thought was that it was some kind of scam.
I selected off-road mode, the first car, saw the character, and thought they'd worked with the Postal developers.
So what if the maps aren't the physics, it's just clunky, and you don't know where to go.
Apparently they made it in half a day and then waited five years.
It's not even worth getting on sale.
Total crap, much worse than the second part, despite the fact that it was released 5 years after it.

column8:
Noticed the very poor rating and thought fans mad because new developer. Gave it a shot anyway.

[b]Pros:[/b]
-Different
-Effort
-Challenging

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Poorly tuned vehicles
-Bad AI
-Annoying tracks
-Various general issues

[u]It's Different[/u]
-Apart from FO2, Head On and Ultimate Carnage, this game does bring something new to the table. Has decent concepts for new gamemodes however it delivers them very poorly.

[u]Effort[/u]
-I can clearly see some passion and effort was put into this instead of being a money symbol, and that I will appreciate.

[u]Challenging[/u]
-The game is terrible, but functional so it can make for a good challenge depending on the mode you play. Winning a race feels like I earned it

[u]Poorly Tuned Vehicles[/u]
-vehicles either turn too sharp or too slow, too slow acceleration or too fast, changing the tuning preset doesn't seem to help. Vehicles are way too flush with the ground at all times. Monster trucks feel like RC cars rather than monster trucks.

[u]Bad AI[/u]
-AI seem to only target you at all times rather than each other in derby mode. As soon as monster truck matches begin, any racer adjacent immediately turns to ram into you. Opponents in normal races don't seem to notice you and will proceed to drive into you without slowing down or attempting to turn even if it's bad for them.

[u]Annoying tracks[/u]
-Some tracks feel like they over-estimate how well vehicles can traverse them. Sudden turns camouflaged by props or world scenery (very bad on vertical roads). Too many static obstacles that look breakable.

[u]Various general issues[/u]
-For a game from 2011 the tracks designed to be open world seem very cramped and tiny. In said cramped, tiny tracks, there are bits that can snag your wheel most often needing to reset the vehicle to fix. There's not enough clarity for the goals in the stunt minigames.

[b]I feel the game is a strong 3/10[/b], but in my own thoughts I will be generous and give this game a 4/10

Opinions:
Personally I'm on the fence about liking this game on account of it's issues vs. things I like about it.

column9: FUCKING HOLY SHIT!!! Looking at the negative reviews, I didn't think it was that bad. But in reality, it's even worse. It's a bottomless pit of shit!! It's utterly rotten. The graphics and resolution of this game have regressed to the early 2000s. The mechanics and physics are a joke. Seriously, it's terrible. It's incredibly ugly, it makes me want to puke just looking at it. Trying to cover up the awful graphics and pixels with eye-popping blur and exaggerated anti-aliasing, bravo. Bring this mega-series down to the level of a game from a newsstand that you wouldn't want for free. I don't know what Team 6 is, but someone should shut it down and quarantine it, with a lifetime ban from creating anything. I look at it and can't believe why the hell I paid these idiots for this. SHOOOK. Avoid this, it's truly garbage, repulsive even from the menu. Entering the game causes permanent brain damage, and there's no way to undo it. This is just plain, premeditated rudeness. The previous installments were awesome and people bought them, so let's make this garbage at a reasonable price now, before someone catches on and we make some money... That's how I see it... A HUGE SNAP IN YOUR ANUS, THE ENTIRE TEAM 6!!!

A terrible game.
Or rather, it was made terribly.
Some of the game's ideas are good, but they're executed very poorly.
Games from the 2000s had much better graphics, physics, and gameplay than this piece of crap. There's no other way to describe it.
FlatOut is my first game ever, and I genuinely love it. The first half of the game is fantastic. But what you've done with the game is simply astounding. It's a shame the FlatOut logo is even in this game.
I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Don't ruin the experience of Parts 1 and 2; they're the best.

column9:
The review reads in bright red: "Overwhelmingly Unpopular." If these words get you excited, then buy it.
Flatout 3 is a legendary title that has been criticized as the cause of the demise of the popular Flatout racing game series.

...which makes you expect an incredibly crappy game, but in reality, it's just a pretty average, dud game.

There are no funny bugs, and it's the kind of boring racing games of this quality that were common back in the PS1 and PS2 days.

If this title didn't have the Flatout name, it probably would have settled for a rating of "mixed" at best.

It's not a game you can get wrong, and even as a crappy game, it's only half-baked.

That said, having played this game will give you something to talk about with other gamers, and if it's on sale (for 98 yen), it might not be a bad idea to buy it just for the sake of it.
It's boring... but as mentioned above, there are no fatal bugs, and other than the cars being unusually light, it's actually a pretty normal racing game.

I thought that with the Flatout brand under their belt, they could, for example, churn out copies of previous games in the series. Just go for quantity, so to speak.

Crunch new tracks from existing ones and make new cars from the existing arsenal. But I guess I'm missing something... Because on the one hand, that's what they did, and on the other, they decided there was no point in skimping...

The physics, the gameplay, the graphics‚Äîeverything is elevated to the level of trash. It's almost surreal. Either this was their goal and they created what they intended, or they were trying to use this game to unleash a filth into our world that would consume everything...

Avoid this game. Even with discounts of 90%, it's not a smart investment.

column9:
I'll try to summarize as much as possible.
This game's biggest mistake was using the FlatOut name. Why?
Let's face it, FlatOut 1, 2, and UC were excellent. Now, for some company to want to use the name of these wonders as if it were 3, what's the deal? If they made a decent game, it would be acceptable, but this?
Forget everything you know about FlatOut; this game has NOTHING to do with it.
The mechanics are horrible, the graphics are on par with FlatOut 2 (which is 5 years older), the maps are too small, the interface is poorly optimized for high resolutions (it gets blurry), the soundtrack is terrible, and so on.
Seriously, don't waste your money on this game unless it's under R$5.00.

column9:
A big shoutout to everyone who came here or found out about this marvel thanks to the "PIJOS" (Worst Games on Steam) section on the Adrenaline channel!

Don't believe the media hype in this game's reviews; it's all manipulation! Even my comment is being sent with a recommendation for this game, but the system will change my rating, and I won't recommend it because of these impostors!

Is the game worth it? Of course, especially if it's on sale (which is around 2 reais, at least I got it for that benefit) and you're having such a boring day that even this crap will lift your spirits.

Seriously, the game is funny. But it's funny because it's extremely bad. The car handling seems to be done by a potato with a badge saying "Head of the Kinematics and Physics Department for FlatOut 3." Using nitro doesn't make your car faster, but for some reason, creates an effect as if your car is being stretched during the turbo boost. It's magnificent!

The Big Battle and Battle Arena modes (which are practically the same thing) are the best for laughing and, at the same time, feeling disappointed with a franchise that had its worst ending in this game (although there's a sequel, which is apparently much better than this one). It's a car deathmatch where, on any difficulty setting, all enemy AI will target you, no matter what you do. You'll have 30 seconds of gameplay in this mode, and then just let the cars explode on your car until it explodes too.

This work of art is so worthy that I'll list the main aspects I noticed in many hours of gameplay, pros and cons (ignore the number of hours recorded on my profile; the manipulated media altered it to make fun of me).

PROS:

- 796 separate game modes, but no career mode
- Explosions all the time, since you never play
- 958 characters available for selection with great lore to interest the player, but not
- 20,494 unlockable cars, which won't be unlockable since you won't play more than 15 minutes in each mode
- Ultra-realistic effects; The Witcher 3 team claims to have stolen presets from the engine used in this game
- Multiplayer mode, where you can enjoy the comfort of playing alone, since there's no one active there

CONS:

- Absolutely none, as our comments and reviews do not take everything mentioned above with irony or sarcasm.

This is the single worst game that I have ever laid my hands on, and now I can't refund it or even delete it from my account because it was bought in a bundle together with FlatOut 1 and 2, both of which are great games but will be gone as well if I attempt to get rid of this ghastly piece of blasphemous trash. Now every time I open my library, I am left feeling utterly disgusted at the sight of FlatOut 3, thus driven to put it into the "Hidden" folder to rot in the darkness for evermore.

Come to think of it, it's still money well spent ‚Äì sometimes you can truly appreciate how actually good something is only after being fed a mouthful of steaming rubbish.

This game is bad on an entirely different scale. I cannot even begin to imagine how professionals, who are likely PAID to make games, managed to push out something like this. It looks like a PS2 game and plays like a bad indie racer from the early 2000's.

I had heard about it before, but never could I have imagined it would be this irredeemably bad. Right up there with Kane & Lynch 2, among the dullest, most uninteresting, least fun and mechanically-awful-while-technically-functional titles I've ever played.

A true stain in the underpants of gaming.

Ultimately, I'd say you'll like this game if you're crazy or want to swim in biological human waste converging from your 5th point.

[code][h1]
Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction
[/h1][/code]
[list]
[*] Genre: Arcade racing.
[*] Released: December 14, 2011
[/list]
Well, humanity pokes its long nose into everything, as it has no shortage of exploration and knowledge of the world. So, I couldn't curb my curiosity and bought this product.
Because, just as I love racing, just as Ice Venture loves all animals (even bats), I should love absolutely all racing games, or at least pay some attention to them. My Steam friends are trying to talk me out of it in their reviews, like, "Drop the crap and all that," but how could I not buy this Team 6 Studios product? Especially since it's a racing game from the famous Flatout series. There's an achievement, and of course, how could I not buy it with a huge discount of 24 rubles? Honestly, I'm not a fan of the series, but did I regret buying it? No! Why, you ask? It's simple, because it's all about the magic candies. Just kidding... I still got my share of positive emotions from the gameplay. :-)

[h1]
- My car is a disaster, I bought it for $500. - $500 for this? )))
\Danila Bagrov's dialogue with the truck driver from the movie Brother 2\ [/h1]
I'll say right away that every game in this genre has its own nuances, and to understand the physics of racing, you need to play a little, get used to it, make and analyze a couple dozen mistakes and conclusions, and you get used to it and feel like a fish in water. So this game is something like "Dark Souls" in the world of racing, or rather, a parody of "Dark Souls" in the world of racing, because you never know what kind of crap will happen around the corner. Yes, I took the long-awaited 3rd place, but what did it cost me? I completed the first level on the 10th try, or maybe the 20th. After such tortures, the game just starts to irritate: the car doesn't really respond to the steering wheel, it can go into a skid from a collision with debris, NPCs can hit you from behind and you too will go into a skid. skid and that's it, start over...and although all laws work for everyone, i.e. You can also hit an enemy from behind, and they'll skid, too, but when NPCs do this to you at the very end of the track, just before the finish line, and you watch the victory you had practically in your pocket, 2-3 meters away, vanish, you want to smash your keyboard or gamepad over the developers' heads. The game is unbalanced. There are missions where your car simply won't have enough durability to even reach the finish line. Cheating NPCs catch up to you in seconds, and when you see their rapidly approaching arrows, you begin to feel like you're a hunted animal, hearing the breathing of hounds behind you. Whatever you say, it creates a dual feeling: hopelessness (they're about to eat you) and, oddly enough, a kind of excitement (but no way, you won't catch up)... True, there are bugs, but what would you do without them?)...

[h1] - Why is it that I take first place in video games, but I can't pass a driving test in real life? - Emilien, the hero of the movie "Taxi."[/h1]
But what did I like about the game?
These are the nine additional modes, besides the crappy "zero" "Race" mode:
1. Stunt - a cool mode where you can torment your driver by throwing them through the windshield. Naturally, you have to hit the target (Y on the joystick).
2. Grand Battle - a crazy mode where you can race around an arena and ram enemies (this has already happened in some GTA game).
3. Battle Arena - almost the same as the Grand Arena.
4. Monster Trucks - you race around a small location and collect barrels... ok.
5. Speed ‚Äã‚Äã- you drive a Formula 1 car, I really liked this mode: the sound of the engine, and the sound of cars colliding behind you is simply delightful ‚Äì nice )
6. Night Shift - I think I'll skip this...
7. Off-Road - Jeep racing, I almost fell out of my chair when I saw the competitors' cars, and mine too, bouncing like balls over the bumps ‚Äì lol )
8. Splatout! - Zombie mode, how satisfying it is to crush zombies ‚Äì awesome!
9. Challenge - all modes combined. If it weren't for points 0 and 6, it would have been awesome.

[h1]
Verdict.
- The meeting place is at the zoo.
- Why at the zoo?
"So they wouldn't recognize you."
This is a pretty mediocre arcade racing game, which even loses to Blur from 2010, both in terms of gameplay and graphics. The concept itself is quite good ‚Äì destructible vehicles might be a good thing, but in my opinion, it's too unbalanced (the excess sagging of car parts, bumpers, etc., doesn't look very aesthetically pleasing. For example, I'm reminded of Truckers 3, which wasn't very pleasant to drive with such sagging parts ‚Äì they could have just added dents, scratches, and a smoking car body ‚Äì it would have been fine). If the developer had made it look nicer and had sound effects, like nuts and bolts flying off the car on impact or something else, and tweaked the graphics and balance, slightly reworked the levels in Race mode, and even integrated the modes into the campaign, like in Blur, it would have been a gem! You can fantasize about improving the game as much as you want. For example, it's become fashionable to make hybrid games‚Äîa garage with purchased cars, the ability to buy new devices and armor, and even add an RPG element‚Äîbut no, it seems the creators never even considered that. It's playable, but I can't take this product "seriously"... The hackwork makes me skeptical, and the positive aspects‚Äîa little smile mixed in‚Äîthat's my assessment.

[list]
[h1]Summary:[/h1]
[*]Rating 4.5 out of 10
[*]I don't really recommend it (unless it's at a deep discount, and for collectors...)
[*]Achi - yes!
[*]Cards - no!

column8: everything about this game is a fail.
column9: everything about this game is a fail.

I might seem strange, but this game isn't complete crap, as many people are making it out to be. I'll say right away that it's not FlatOut! (I've played them all). If the game were released on Google Play under the name "Derby Racing 3D 2019," I'm sure most people would buy it and wouldn't regret it, but it's not worth more than 50-100 rubles. I played all the modes and didn't care at first, but after about 20 minutes of play, some modes actually seemed interesting and engaging for long drives or standing in line. The zombie mode, for example, is quite addictive. Essentially, it's just FlatOut (not that!) on the Wii, just slightly improved. The music isn't great either, but thankfully I didn't hear it (I just didn't play it, so it must be a bug). However, I listened to the files separately, and for a mobile game, it's not that bad. Yes, there was FlatOut Stuntman for Android from the same developers, but it was only for Nvidia, which is a shame. The stunt mode, without physics and with a lot of 5th-point burnout, is quite good, again, only for mobile. As FlatOut 3, it's very bad, but as a Unity racing game for smartphones, it's not bad. This is just my opinion, and it naturally differs from yours. All the best to those who read this far.

column8:
This really is a travesty of a racing title and I don't wonder for a tenth of a second as to why it's (at the time of writing this) the worst rated game on Steam.

The handling is indescribably bad. The devs tried to go for a simple arcade-y handling, resulting in all the vehicles barely being able to turn, which means you will probably end up crashing into something you were frantically trying to avoid 5 seconds before the impact.
The AI is just garbage, making the outcome of a race or battle purely random. There is no common sense behind some of the decisions made by the other drivers. Sometimes they just become suicidal and go full speed into a brick wall, while other times they are just unbeatable, godlike drivers.
The damage physics make no sense. A crash in 200+ km/t can give you 5% damage, and barely scraping by a brick wall gives you 30% damage. Somewhat comparable to Russian Roulette

And really the most important part of this review, literally the only thing that separates it from the fun terrible meme games to just a huge steaming pile of garbage: The optimization.
This game crashes constantly. It could crash once every 3 hours, or like my case, it could crash every 5 minutes. It could crash at the end of a particular race, or in the middle of the main menu 15 seconds after launching the game. Hadn't it been for these constant crashes I could honestly recommend this game purely for the batshit insane things happening in this haunted hellhole of a game. But that doesn't matter if you can't even get to the fun stuff at the other side of the crashing nightmare which is the main menu.

I just can't recommend this game, not even for the 1$ sales it constantly goes on. Because I know that money goes to the devs, and they just don't deserve that money. If it was optimized, fine. But when a game crashes this much, it's just impossible for me to say it's worth it.

Steer far far clear of this dev studio, and stay with Bugbear. At least they know how to make a game.

column9:
Onslaught 3~emm~ Honestly, after this game came out, my opinion of the series was lowered~
I remember being amazed at Onslaught 2's beautiful graphics, the exhilarating crashing, and the flying character~
Then I looked at the developer~ok~I get it~the developer changed, no wonder the quality is so poor!

This game has the most racing types among the previous games~a full 10 crash modes~
There are no car modifications to purchase, only missions to unlock~emm~hum~(Ôø¢Ô∏øÃ´ÃøÔø¢‚òÜ)~

It also has achievements (the only one besides the 4th game that does~)~~8 achievements can be unlocked in 2 hours~
But the graphics are definitely the worst of the four games, and the sound effects are incredibly fake. It's completely shoddy!
At first, I almost thought there was a bug in the game‚Äîthe engine sound was gone, but it turns out it was just fake and low-pitched!

~Of course~ Since I got 8 achievements in 2 hours of play~ I'll give it a good review~ After all, it's an old game~
[h1]Although this game is really bad, it's still better than some of the garbage games on Steam! [/h1]

column9:
3 is evil!!!!!!!! I bought the bundle because I wanted to remember 2.
But since I bought 3 too, I'll download it.
This is pure evil. How can you ruin something so good?
They couldn't make another installment as good as 2 with better graphics.
Besides, speaking of graphics, they suck, worse than 2.

FUCK!

No, seriously...back when the game first came out, I was a fan of the series and started it up and turned it off after the first race. I was surprised, of course, but that was before my first review, and anyway, I wasn't really playing games back then, I was more of a student, so I didn't really pay attention. Now I've launched it and...

FUCKING F ... Of course, it's not hard to guess ‚Äì the publisher decided to cash in on the brand and signed Team6, a studio that's been releasing two or three racing games a year for 20 years now, and has released such masterpieces as Taxi Racer London 2, Big City Racer, and Road Rage! The latter game, by the way, was released in 2017, and... it's still just as bad, even on PS4 ‚Äì can you believe it? It's literally their studio policy to release absolute crap, and that's how it should be! I can already imagine the TEAM6 logo greeting you at the entrance to the studio's office ‚Äì WE'VE BEEN PRODUCING THIS SHIT FOR 20 YEARS.

Oh well. Of course, let's wish death on everyone involved, because they deserve it ‚Äì it takes a lot to ruin everyone's favorite racing game like that. Talent is needed ‚Äì after all, they made the most downvoted game on Steam, meaning Flat Out 3 has the highest percentage of negative reviews. That's the interesting facts section. Achievement unlocked! Why make better games when there are so many of them? It's easy and not cool. Make the worst! Now that's a challenge, I think!

As for the game itself, it came out in 2010, but it looks and plays like it was in 2002. Everything about it is terrible ‚Äì the graphics are terrible, there's no optimization (it still lags, you fucking bastard), the physics are like something out of ASSHOLES VS. GASI 2 ‚Äì it's devoid of any of the things we loved about the Flat Out series. It's simply unplayable, and any sane person would certainly turn it off after the first race.... But I've completed all the modes and all the races, gotten all the achievements...

FUCKING F ... And if the gameplay weren't at the level of MINUS 9999 THOUSAND OUT OF TEN, it would be playable. The ideas are there, and they're good, but the execution...

For example, the driver-tossing is cool ‚Äì there's a whole set of levels like Hell where you can throw the driver down a flight of stairs or send him straight to hell, it really looks cool. And the zombie mode is interesting. Or the racing characters ‚Äì there are many of them, they're hilarious and diverse, and would easily fit into a normal flatout. The same goes for the cars ‚Äì a wide variety of choices, all very different, there's even a fucking tank and a double-decker bus. The cars are cool and interesting, although with the local graphics, you can't look at them without tears, of course... but the fact is, I feel the spirit of that very Flatout in all of this. It's there! And if the game could be played without physical pain, risking losing a year of life for every hour of gameplay, it would be worth it. But...

FUCKING F ...

column9:
[h1]Rating 0/10 , Achievements Completed 1 of 46 , [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34526713/]Curator[/url] [/h1]

I grew up on flatouts. It was my favorite game and I could play it over and over again. I even have a receipt at home from 2006 for the then boxed version. So when I got a chance to get the next installment at a good price, I didn't hesitate and bought the game. Although I heard that it went to hell, but I said it was the Flatouts! Well, you should have seen my dismay after I excitedly launched the game for the first time‚Ä¶

Right after turning it on, I was struck by the game's menu itself. No career anywhere, so no racing, destruction in derbies and even biting your way through the game, let alone any car upgrades. Like what? What almost the whole game was based on is not here? Instead, the game offers different modes that you can play over and over again. Ok, so I tried the Race mode and the second horror came, namely the graphic side of the game, which corresponds to about 2003, so it's horrible. 

As for the actual racing, the physics of the cars suffered a lot. The driving model is terrible. Cars are clunky, reach impossible speeds or explode too easily. You spend most of your time off the road getting stuck on a bush while you playfully break through a concrete wall. The behavior of your opponents is absolutely unpredictable, aggressive and stupid. If you wanted to race normally, I don't think it's even possible. 

Although Flatout is also about destruction, isn't it? Well, the damages obtained would have to have at least some logic. After all, the damage to the car is somehow random. You land the Monstertruck on your opponent's roof and it doesn't take much away from them. On the contrary, if a small car lightly touches you, you are almost destroyed.

This whole disaster is underscored by the constantly repeating, nerve-wracking music. 

All in all, if you're a fan of the Flatout series, don't play the game. If you don't know anything about Flatouts, you can try it, but it's not for nothing that this game is the lowest rated game on all of Steam.

And what actually happened? Why is Flatout so bad all of a sudden? The answer is a change of study. The studio Bugbear Entertainment was behind the first very successful works. However, development was then taken over by Team 6 Studios. And here is the result...

column8:
I think I have to change this to a positive review now that I have over 50 hours played.

Don't pay more than an euro or two if you are planning on buying. Surely by this point if you are reading this you know what you are getting into.

Some parts of the game can be entertaining if you are able to think about the game not as a racing game but rather a puzzle game where you happen to be driving. You need a tolerance for random stuff suddenly destroying your vehicle. 

A lot of things to see. Many game modes, many maps. The maps have a good bit of detail.

Unveil the layers of "what were they thinking??" today!

Also they updated the game today??? On 6th of July, 2024.

column8: Nice game
column9: Nice game

Compared to the previous part, this one is complete crap. The maps are cardboard, the scenery is ugly, the cars are like Lego, but low-poly, the racing is boring, nitro can basically be used infinitely, which means it could have been cut from the game altogether. The soundtrack. Yes, it's here, but only in the main menu, and only one song, and even then, it's terribly performed. It's easier to play without sound altogether, because the sound effects are no better; when you hear them, you want to go deaf, shoot yourself, anything, just not hear them. I expected something more, since the second part turned out to be truly good, but I guess I expected too much. Bottom line: simply a terrible game, even for 2011. My grandfather played it and told me not to play such crap again, and I completely agree with him. I'd like to get my money back, but I can't, because... I bought the pack, which makes it even more offensive. I sincerely hope this is the first and last negative review on my account. Shameful!

column8:
So, so bad. That moment when the loading screen shows up in the first time, and you have bad feelings about it. Then the game loads and you saw the sad truth, you're right. The first two Flatout game is a must have title. I have so many hours in 1&2 (Not in Steam.). The Flatout 1&2 better in graphics, and in physics way much better. It's not a Flatout, it's much like an old and bad version of Carmageddon (which don't exist :) ). I absolutely don't recommend. If you are a Flatout fan like me, it's an absolute disappointment. 

Pros:
- It runs in ultra settings basically on anything
- Various selection of cars
- More challenges and races
- Funny characters (For why?) with pop cultural references

Cons:
- Absolutely bad car physics (like a flash game)
- Very aged graphics (It's predecessors looked much better)
- Tuning "system" is a joke (three modes per car, not configurable)
- Low res textures
- Leave out all the experiences that are in the first games

column9:
[h1]Review of FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction[/h1]

Hi guys,
I've decided to write a review of the third installment in the legendary FlatOut series. Even back then, I was a big fan of FlatOut 2, which originally featured a flawless damage model and good physics for the time. The Destruction Derbies, in particular, were a hit at every LAN.

Since I hadn't played Chaos & Destruction before
and noticed the rather negative reviews,
I decided to buy the game on sale for the symbolic price of
‚Ç¨0.99 to get my own impression of this gem.

In the main menu, you're greeted by "fabulous" music. When the race started, I immediately noticed the sloppy controls, although sloppy is an understatement. Unfortunately, the physics and AI aren't what they used to be either. The developers seem to have taken the driver sounds from bad amateur porn.

I have to say, though, that the game can be quite hilarious when the AI ‚Äã‚Äãjust blasts straight into the wall.

All in all: Compared to its predecessors, the game is complete crap, and the money would be much better spent on other cheap games.

Go for it!
[i]Corner[/i]
Zin Gasoline.

column9: Hello, I would like to share with you my experience with this game. I bought this game thinking it would be just as good or even better than the previous installment, but unfortunately I was wrong and in my opinion it's not worth the money even though I bought it on sale.

Damn! This Flatout installment is too ridiculous, from the control physics to the fun modes. Yes, it's worse, but surprisingly, my eyes didn't bleed from the lighting. Flatout 3 is the monstrosity of the Flatout family, a seemingly low-budget project. It's a shame, of course, that there never was a worthy successor to Flatout 2, because Flatout 4 isn't any better... Previously, the developers tried to convey maximum realism, juicy damage, enjoyable car physics, and more, but the 3rd series turned out terribly arcadey and lackluster. (It's more likely that the change in developers affected the result.)

[h1][i]Flatout 3 or "Why is my monitor covered in shit?"[/i][/h1]

When I bought the complete pack, I thought the 3D game had been trashed by hard-to-please old-timers. I've never been so wrong. It's hard to imagine how the publisher entrusted the production of the 3D game to developers who were more likely to make a cheap porn parody of Burnout, spiced up with hints of Carmageddon, than a continuation of a decent series.

But the race titles are amazing:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1811585841

The third part of Flatout was, to put it mildly, not very successful.

The emphasis here was mainly on multiplayer. They added several new modes that are only worth playing with friends, but judging by what's written below, they clearly won't be interested in playing.

Flatout 3 has killed the previous, appropriate car behavior. They've become like cardboard! Seriously... The slightest hit and the enemy simply flies off into space, along with you.

The graphics have been disfigured by countless doses of blur, bloom, and flying sparks. The second part looked much nicer than this one.

In short, see for yourself, but this game won't appeal to many. Because it kills almost everything we loved about the previous Flatout games.

Terrible game, the only reason I'm not refunding it is because I bought it as a complete edition.
Gravity terrible, destruction / demolition / destruction.. absolutely does not work, does not make sense. Almost endless nitro, which does not drop below half even if you finish all the rounds with almost non-stop nitro.

[h1][b]An underrated masterpiece?[/b][/h1]

Today I'd like to talk about a game in the well-known racing series, Flatout, which received very poor reviews from both players and the press. Deserved? I'll tell you now.

Spoiler: Absolutely deserved.

And I'll start by saying that I love Flatout, especially the first game. It had practically everything perfect: nice graphics, car physics, destructibility, and a stunning soundtrack. The same was true for the second game: they took everything good from the original and doubled it down. The end result is just as good as the original, and the FlatOut series itself has earned a cult following, which is well deserved. Then came Ultimate Carnage, which is an improved version of the second game, which was also quite good. But then came the third game... oh my God...

The graphics in the game are simply disgusting. After watching it for a short time, my eyes started hurting, and I even felt like I was going to puke, and this is no joke! It's so bad you can't believe it's 2011... and besides, remembering the previous Flatout games just makes me want to cry. And what detailed human models they had... 2011... 2011, Karl!

It's impossible to play this game properly. Not only are the physics (more on that later) terrible, but the gameplay itself is completely unimpressive. The demolition derbies are useless. Not only are the bots in this game terribly stupid, but they only ever attack you. Also, when you crash into opponents, you don't feel the adrenaline, the thrill, the sense of competition, etc., like you did in the previous games; what is Zombie mode anyway? This is a "very" exciting mode where you have to run over stationary zombies. Interesting, right? Formula 1 racing is lightning-fast crap where who knows what's going on. I don't see the point in talking about the other modes, since they're just as interesting.

Oh, this is fun! What are you saying? The physics in THE SGESH and the latest NFS are rubbish? Pfft... Some people just haven't played it or have forgotten what the car physics are like in Flatout 3! Seriously, after playing this game, you start to think that the physics in THE SGESH and NFS are just super-realistic, and I'm not kidding again. The cars don't respond at all. They sometimes slide along the road for no apparent reason, and most importantly, the cars handle incredibly poorly. You just don't feel like the car is turning, and there's no handbrake. Or rather, there is one, but it's not there. How can that be? Simple! You press the handbrake button, and instead of braking abruptly, the car engages drift mode, meaning it starts sliding even harder without losing speed. It's fucking genius!

Damage, as you remember‚Äîand you should remember‚Äîaffects the car's performance, and it (damage) was quite well detailed in both Flatout 1 and 2. Here, however, damage plays no role at all. It's there purely for visual effect. Yes, a car can be wrecked, but the lower the car's hit points, the less it changes. It'll stay that way, driving at 250 or more. And how about that, damn, the detail is so lousy... Flatout 1 and 2, we screwed everything up!

As you know, the soundtrack should play a major role in both a film and a game. After all, thanks to it, we can remember where a particular song was played, and the soundtrack also creates a certain atmosphere and mood for a particular project. In Flatout 3, the only music is in the menu, and only one, and it's terribly performed. I also want to add about the sounds: They're disgusting ‚Äì the destruction of objects, collisions with other racers, the nitro squirt, the roar of the car. All of this was recorded terribly, and after hearing it, your ears become...

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

Flatout 3 is a bad game, probably one of the worst in its genre, and, what's more, one of the worst games in the history of the gaming industry. Some might say I'm suffering from the duckling syndrome, but that's not true. Look at Flatout 2 and Flatout 1, and then look at Part 3, and everything will become clear. I don't recommend buying it, or even pirating it. This game is unworthy of attention, or even of its existence. It's better to play the first two parts than this one.

I don't know where I got this game from, but it's complete garbage. I remember how much fun it was racing around in the first and second games; it's a completely different game, aside from the menus and the concept.
[u]Gameplay[/u] is simply disgusting. There are no physics, and the handling is even more wooden, unrelated to anything‚Äîspeed, car, weight, or anything else. There's no car tuning; you can only choose a few preset parts (which don't affect performance) and paint jobs. It's cool that you can choose who you play as, but it's stupid that you have to do that for every race.
[u]Graphics[/u] are terrible even for 2011‚Äîeverything is blurry, even though I turned it off in the settings. Incidentally, when you set everything to ultra, they warn you that only top-end systems can handle this kind of graphics‚ÄîLOL!
[u]Sound[/u]... There are no decent tracks, and the FX aren't very impressive because they haven't been developed ‚Äì it's 2005, after all.
Overall rating: 1/10.

Well, what can I say:
Y ...

I honestly don't understand why everyone hates this game so much.
Many reviews of this game stop short of "ugh, this game sucks" without any specifics. Why exactly do they think that?
As soon as some top publications gave it a rating below 50, a bunch of schoolchildren with a herd instinct who haven't even played the game for an hour immediately rushed in and started pelting FlatOut 3 with rocks. They can't explain all the hate, or they're just old-timers who don't want to accept anything new in the series.
So what are the pros of this game, you ask? I'll answer:

+ Lots of modes (from Formula 1 racing to monster truck driving, so there's something for everyone)
+ Extensive car fleet (lots of cars, and each mode has its own unique style)
+ Juicy car destruction (come on, it's FlatOut)
+ Large tracks (some tracks are truly huge, but not all)

And what about the cons? The only cons I noticed while playing were:
- A couple of bugs (but what game doesn't have those?)
- Very strange damage percentage calculation (sometimes you crash into a car at full speed, and the damage percentage is only 3%)
Well, those are all the cons I noticed. Some might say the graphics are bad, but do we play just for the graphics or the gameplay?

Damn! This Flatout installment is too ridiculous, from the control physics to the fun modes. Yes, it's worse, but surprisingly, my eyes didn't bleed from the lighting. Flatout 3 is the monstrosity of the Flatout family, a seemingly low-budget project. It's a shame, of course, that there never was a worthy successor to Flatout 2, because Flatout 4 isn't any better... Previously, the developers tried to convey maximum realism, juicy damage, enjoyable car physics, and more, but the 3rd series turned out terribly arcadey and lackluster. (It's likely that the change in developers influenced the result.)

column9:
Let's start by saying that I'm a huge fan of the FLATOUT racing game series and own all the installments.
From the brilliant first one to the mediocre fourth. I didn't stumble upon this installment by accident, and as a fan of the series, I bought this "game."
What went wrong? You'll find out in a moment.

FlatOut 3: Chaos and Destruction - This is the third full-fledged installment in the brutal racing game series launched in 2004 by the Finnish studio Bugbear Entertainment. Now you're probably wondering why this installment wasn't developed by Bugbear, but by a retarded studio with nothing but crap under its belt, TEAM 6. In short, Empire Interactive, the studio that published FLATOUT 1, 2, and UC, went bankrupt after numerous layoffs and financial problems in May 2009. The rights to FlatOut were assigned to Strategy First, which made the stupidest mistake in history... They handed FlatOut over to TEAM 6, which contributed to the development of this cancer in 2011.
DRIVING MODEL: First up is the driving model, which is probably the most important thing in a racing game.
Which in FlatOut 3 is crap. Our cardboard car drives like it's on ice. The car has a lot of grip and makes quite sensitive turns. Now I ask: WHERE IS THE ARCAD DRIVING MODEL?!?!
I haven't seen grip like this since BIG RIGS. OH, IT'S SUFFICIENT TO TALK ABOUT IT.
GAME MODES: There are quite a few, but there's not much to say. We have modes like RACE, which is a normal race. Stuntman: A stunt competition where you have to launch our great guy into a specific spot using the left shift button.
Monster truck and Off-road: At first, I thought these modes would be interesting if we were driving huge machines, but unfortunately, I was wrong. They're like scrambled eggs in a frying pan.
I won't review the other modes because they don't make much sense anyway.
GRAPHICS: This represents a step backward compared to previous installments, where UC was brilliant in this regard.
Even though we have many graphical options, the game still looks like elephant dung.
ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE: The last thing I'll review is the AI. Remember how in the first FlatOut, enemies reacted to the situation on the track? It's much different here. When we block their path, our enemies stand there like cones. Omg. I'd love to describe other modes, like Arena, Big Battle, Splatout, and a few others, but this game is so underdeveloped it's not even worth mentioning. The same goes for the destruction model, which is also cheesy. After hitting a bush, your car falls apart. And hitting an enemy results in you taking more damage than the enemy ‚Äì that's a shame.

In summary: FlatOut 3: chaos and destruction is utter crap. Bugs and optimization issues are a dime a dozen. This game perfectly demonstrates for fans and non-fans alike how a great series can be destroyed. Team 6 should be thrown in the trash heap for ruining the series and insulting players for having pirated versions. I also don't understand how anyone can say that MW3 is a beta and updates add more bugs. After playing this crap, it's clear that it's the other way around. I don't recommend buying it, even on sale. Don't even get it for free. Despite this, FlatOut 4 by KYLOTOON is much better than this thing, but it still doesn't compare to what Bugbear has done. Just wait for FlatOut 5...
Okay, time for the rating:
Graphics: 2/10
Playability: 1/10
Audio: 0/10
Specific rating: 2/10
FlatOut by Bugbear RULES.

Oczywi≈õcie nikomu produkcji nie polecam. No, chyba ≈ºe chcecie do≈õwiadczyƒá masochistycznych dozna≈Ñ...

[quote=Szynka013]Je≈ºeli moja recenzja pomog≈Ça Ci przy podjƒôciu decyzji nad zakupem, bƒôdƒô wdziƒôczny, je≈õli zaobserwujesz mojƒÖ [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33046115-Fridge-Friends/]stronƒô kuratora Steam[/url], co na pewno zmotywuje mnie do dalszej pracy.[/quote]
column9:
Without a doubt, [b]FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction[/b] is the worst installment in the series. This time, the problem turned out to be the developers of the Wii port of the previous FlatOut games, and that fact alone was a sign that something could go wrong. All the good elements from the previous installments are gone, replaced by oddities. Cars are bricks with a flawed damage model, ugly audiovisuals, and poor optimization...

[h1] STORY[/h1]
[i]Rest easy, this summary is spoiler-free![/i]
There's no plot in [b]FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction[/b]. You simply take on the role of a man or a woman, assign them a nickname, and are thrown into a whirlwind of car races of several types. Despite being artificial intelligence, opponents "show" their own personalities during the races, or at least some hint of one. And that's it in this regard‚Äîjust like in previous installments.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1646649566
[h1] MECHANICS/GAMEPLAY[/h1]
Team 6 Studios has prepared a considerable number of game modes: classic races, stunt shows, derbies, off-road races, F1 races, and monster truck competitions. The problem is that they've forgotten the main mode‚Äîcareer‚Äîthat the series has accustomed us to and which was the driving force of the gameplay, allowing us to spend a good few hours playing and compete for the trophy. But oh well... Each mode features a different set of vehicles with different characteristics, such as speed, acceleration, durability, and mobility. There are a lot of cars, and each of them can be slightly tuned. It's really light ‚Äì there's no earning system, and the upgrade system itself is based on the flick of a single button ‚Äì other than that, it doesn't feel like it affects the driving mechanics in any way. The developers also created a variety of unique tracks and arenas, which are... boring.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1646650674
The same could be said about the gameplay itself ‚Äì it's incredibly boring. There might be a lot going on in regular races, but only at the very beginning, before the start, because once you get past the jargon of mindless drivers intent on destroying you (not reaching the finish line), absolutely nothing happens.

The worst thing Team 6 Studios has done, however, is destroy the intuitiveness of the vehicle controls and camera work. The car's handling is terrible, making you feel like you're racing cardboard without wheels, and the sense of speed (regardless of whether you're using nitro boost or not) is nonexistent. The speedometer is a sick animation added just for the sake of it, as the speed it displays doesn't actually represent anything. You can only dream of things like drifting, skidding, or even centripetal force physics. Just don't tell me that's what arcade racing games are all about! Sure, the handling isn't realistic in these types of games, but it exists, unlike what we have in [b]FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction[/b]. And yes, it can be done well‚Äîjust look at FlatOut 1 or FlatOut 2.

[h1] GRAPHICS [/h1]
Another element that Team 6 Studios neglected to address‚Äîthe graphics. [b]FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction[/b] looks terrible, and as if that weren't enough, the optimization is terrible. The textures lack detail, are blurry, and bland‚Äîaverage quality at best. We're also dealing with poor effects, which can cause the game to stutter and even stutter. Compared to what we get, the system requirements seem ridiculous. While they might not make much difference now, the game was demanding too much at launch.

Team 6 Studios has left nothing of the destruction model from previous installments, which set records for the series...
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1646649742
[h1] SOUNDTRACK/MUSIC[/h1]
Did you know that [b]FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction[/b] doesn't have a soundtrack? Exactly. Another element that perfectly built the atmosphere of arcade racing in previous installments is absent here. So, when we don't hear music, our senses will focus more on other sounds, such as the roar of engines, collisions, or explosions. While it's sometimes pleasant to listen to, listening to it over and over again is simply tiring.

[h1] SUMMARY [/h1]
[b]FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction[/b] is the series' black sheep. It's a game that, as soon as you start it, makes you wonder, "What have I done best?!"‚Äîremembering those few dozen zlotys spent. The FlatOut series is incredibly close to my heart, so I can't understand how the infamous Team 6 Studios acquired the rights to it. The developers blatantly spit in our faces, releasing a game that looks like an early alpha version and claiming that for the first time in history, they've created a product so open to consumer suggestions. Of course, I don't recommend this game to anyone. Well, unless you want to experience masochistic sensations...

[quote=Szynka013]If my review helped you decide to buy, I'd be grateful if you'd follow my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33046115-Fridge-Friends/]Steam Curator Page[/url], which will definitely motivate me to continue working.[/quote]

column8:
Pues Flatout 3, es malo, pero tampoco es Flatout, recibe el nombre por que "vende", pero realmente podria haber sido otro juego perfectamente, no se centra tanto en las carreras como los 2 primeros, en este, en cambio hay mas modos de juego, mucho mas divertidos que las anteriores entregas, el problema viene cuando...
- El coche no vuela o planea (como lo quieras llamar), por alg√∫n extra√±o motivo el coche se adhiere todo el rato al suelo, supongo que esto es un bug, pero vamos, es un bug que podrian haber aprovechado para hacer mapas chulos para correr por las paredes y techo, pero no.
-No se el efecto ese que le quieren dar como de "velocidad" emborronando el marco de la pantalla, es horrible y me crea ansiedad verlo.
-PUEDES EDITAR MUY HEAVY LAS CARRERAS, que basicamente puedes poner 1 vuelta, que sea de x manera y tal, es horrible.
-La banda sonora bueno... me he pasado el juego muteado asi que no podria decir.
-El juego aun que vaya a 120 fps se nota super laggado, como mal hecho como si el motor grafico estubiese desincronizado con lo que muestra no se como explicarlo, es muy raro.
- Crashes varios, una putada sinceramente.

Pero lo dicho no todo es malo, tiene muchos modos de juego que para la gente que busca variedad les puede gustar, en mi caso busco carreras asi que no.

Pues no lo recomiendo tristemente.

Nota : 4/10
column9:
Well, Flatout 3 is bad, but it's not Flatout either. It gets its name because it "sells," but it really could have been a perfectly different game. It doesn't focus as much on racing as the first two. This one, however, has more game modes, much more fun than the previous installments. The problem comes when...
- The car doesn't fly or glide (whatever you want to call it). For some strange reason, the car sticks to the ground all the time. I suppose this is a bug, but anyway, it's a bug they could have taken advantage of to make cool maps to run on walls and ceilings, but no.
- I don't know what that "speed" effect they're trying to give it by blurring the screen frame is horrible and makes me anxious watching it.
- YOU CAN EDIT THE RACES VERY HEAVY, basically you can put 1 lap, have it be x way and such, it's horrible.
- The soundtrack, well... I played the game muted so I couldn't say.
-Even when running at 120 fps, the game feels incredibly laggy, as if it's poorly made, as if the graphics engine were out of sync with what it's displaying. I don't know how to explain it, it's really weird.
- Various crashes, honestly a pain.

But that said, it's not all bad. It has many game modes that people looking for variety might like. In my case, I'm looking for races, so no.

Well, I don't recommend it, sadly.

Score: 4/10

column9:
Honestly, I have no words to describe this garbage!

I saw the negative reviews, but I never imagined the game would be so bad that I couldn't even finish a game.

This game doesn't deserve to be called "Flatout," as it doesn't sound anything like the games in the franchise, which, by the way, are very good.

One tip I can give to future buyers (I sincerely hope there won't be any more buyers) is to not buy this, spend your money on something worthwhile.

Reason for this extremely negative review:

Physics: Physics? What's that? I've never even seen it. What's the point?
Gameplay: "It feels like you're driving a tank at 200 km/h, it's so heavy."
Graphics: Extremely outdated for the time the game was released, and I found the game a bit blurry. Performance: Trash, I don't know how to describe the performance other than this.

Overall summary of my thoughts on the game: A waste of time.

column9:
As a huge FlatOut fan, I've played all the games since I was a kid, except for this one. I knew that the reviews were very negative, so I bought the game at a discount because I might change my mind while playing, but it didn't work out.

This review will be divided into 3 groups:
Group 1 : Not so much game-breaking problems
2nd group: Worse problems
3rd group : The biggest shits I found while playing




Elements of the 1st group: 
Ugly menu art (someone really did this in painting), Ugly icons (icon resolution stretched to 500x500 resolution), overall appearance of the game (which reminded me more of driving a car in Fallout 4 and not FlatOut), demented character selection (Eva Mentoz speaks for everything), multiplayer (nobody plays it anymore anyway)



Elements of the 2nd group:
Handling of cars (it's like driving on ketchup with concrete wheels, just scary), Vehicle durability (which is not specified anywhere and it kept happening to me that I suddenly had 3% of the car's durability and after I crashed it said I had 68%), Soundtrack (1 minute of guitar smashing on the ground done in a loop), Vehicle time in the air (I drive 300 km/h and when I jump the car is back on the ground within half a second), Resistance of the opponents' vehicles (at a speed of 240 km/h when crashing, I take away 2% of the opponent's life ??? mainly because if they hit you, you are automatically fucked).



Elements of the 3rd group:
Game physics (that word doesn't exist in this game), AI difficulty (I don't care if you don't do anything, I don't care what mode you play, everyone will always go for you), car speed (I highly doubt that a Pontiac from the 1950s can go from zero to 100 in 0.85 seconds), zombie mode (which has more bugs than the length of the track in decimeters), monster trucks (which can withstand exactly one crash into a wall at the speed 60 km/h), optimization of the game (the game runs fine and suddenly the button to restart the race turns into a button to freeze the game and the whole PC with it), (addition that I am playing on Windows 7, which was released 2 years before the game and on a computer that has better specifications than recommended for the game)




Pros: (there really are some)
Car design (some look like the real thing, such as the previously mentioned Pontiac)
Nitro (at least it does something, but it seems to me that there is too much of it unnecessarily)





Summary : 3.2/10
The game is really terrible and I couldn't change my mind.

DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS ATTEMPT AT FLAT OUT!!!!

There's nothing good about it. If I played it for 30 minutes, that's already a lot. It's the worst of the worst. The handling is terrible, it jerks excessively from one side to the other, causing a complete loss of control of the vehicle. If you can manage to go in a straight line for 1 minute, it's already a great achievement, since it's impossible to go straight.

I only bought it because it came in the bundle. I was really only interested in FO Ultimate Carnage, FO4, and FlatOut. That alone made it worth the purchase. But don't buy it individually; it's not worth it, even with a discount.

column9:
Flatout 3 doesn't quite resemble FlatOut, but it's still quite fun and everyone will find a mod that they like.

The big minus is that there is no career, but there are new mods that got me excited..... SplatOut, in which you drive within the time limit of zombies and Racing circuit, in which you drive in a formula racing circuit (Just like fairplay xD).. The lack of the game is the graphics, which is the least problem. It is worse, however, that there is no soundtrack during the race, so I recommend playing Spotify with some harder music, or whatever you like.


+Original new mods
+Still fun
+destruction

- different from the previous parts
-graphic arts
- soundtrack
-missing career


Verdict: 6/10

column8:
For ¬£0.79, I really wanted to like this game. But it's not Flatout in any shape or form, it's somehow worse in every way than all the previous Flatout's. What's more of a shame is it looks like it has bare bones potential, and then somebody made the call to ship it like it was. It's like playing Pre-alpha on a game that was worked on for six months, that was never worked on again. It has no real physics system, no in game soundtrack, no responsive AI, no tutorials, no excitement, no anything.

If you're doubting the other negative reviews, don't. While I may be biased as a huge Flatout fan, it is just a bad game, simple as.

column9:
[h1][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B9DXWXyoce8]What happened to the FlatOut series? (Youtube video - click)[/url][/h1]

[h1][b][u]FlatOut 3: Chaos and Destruction[/u][/b][/h1]
[i]Is it normal to play an episode I've been avoiding for a long time just so I can write a review? I guess so, you can't do anything more fun with this game anyway...[/i]
[table][tr][td]
[b][u]Pros:[/u][/b]
[i]It's unbelievable that I'm writing something about the pros, [b]BUT[/b] I think you'll soon understand...[/i]
[blade]
[*]‚Ä¢ Car destruction is here, [b]BUT[/b] it's as elaborate as a family lube pack (which I hope doesn't exist)
[*]‚Ä¢ Destruction of the environment is here, [b]BUT[/b] there are few things to destroy and the quality of processing is the same as when you cook according to Ladi Hruska's cookbook
[*]‚Ä¢ Lots of new modes and gameplay options (Zombies, monster trucks, formulas...), [b]BUT[/b] the creators completely killed this potential with everything (I'll write it down in the negatives)
[/list][/td][/tr]
[tr][td][b][u]Cons:[/u][/b]
[blade]
[*]‚Ä¢ Physics - this is as foreign a word to this game as if I say "infinitisimal" in front of you
[*]‚Ä¢ Soundtrack - But wait. Is there such a thing at all?
[*]‚Ä¢ Graphics - It's horrible, there's no other way to say it. (I think it's the same or even worse than FlatOut 1) In other words, if you're looking for a calculator game, go for it.
[*]‚Ä¢ Optimization - This is unbearable. The game sometimes freezes and sometimes has FPS drops even with powerful equipment
[*]‚Ä¢ What's the point of attributes like car power, speed or acceleration when all cars drive almost identically
[*]‚Ä¢ Tuning - Is this really a negative? (If you know me, you know that in the review for another FlatOut episode I wrote that tuning is always positive - yes, exactly - so it's not). It doesn't even cost anything, just choose one before the race.
[*]‚Ä¢ AI difficulty setting - It probably doesn't do anything at all, so what's the point?...
[*]‚Ä¢ AI count setting - I would understand this option if the game was good, but it isn't.
[*]‚Ä¢ The game looks cheap (I mean when I say it looks, it is)
[*]‚Ä¢ When you bump into an opponent, they simply slow you down/stop you, they look the same, you look the same and you keep going
[*]‚Ä¢ New mods could be nice, but what if you can still drive on grass and sand without slowing down with the formula. And what the hell is the Monstertruck mod? I didn't get it until now, and since all the opponents (AI) also had 0 points, neither did they.
[*]‚Ä¢ Demolition derby - I don't know what to say anymore - The derbies here last so long and are so boring. that I actually never finished them.
[*]‚Ä¢ Names of riders - Since I evaluated them in the 4th part as well, I can pretty much do anything here. Eva Mentos? Mr. Masked? Max Speed? Or even [b]Jan Benz√≠n[/b]??
[*]‚Ä¢ Destruction of cars - The rest is written in pros
[*]‚Ä¢ Destruction of the environment - The rest is again written in positives 
[*]‚Ä¢ Replayability - it is zero, there is no other way to say it
[*]‚Ä¢ Weather - Yes, the weather changes somewhere, but what the hell is the point when the car always behaves the same
[*]‚Ä¢ Turning - Yes, I include this kind of nonsense here, but there is no other way to do it. There is almost no need to brake, just turn sharply...
[/list][/td][/tr][/table]

[i]You hate this game. If you think FlatOut 4 is a bad game, don't even go near this one. I've only played 82 minutes of the game and mostly just trying out mods and gameplay. I couldn't take it any longer. I normally try to do funnier reviews, so if that review bored you too, you know how I feel playing this game. As I read on the internet: [quote=Absolute Games]This game is not boring to play. It's disgusting to play with.[/quote]
[/and]
[i]I will be happy for any "helpful review" and comments from you :)[/i]

The game is incredibly bad (gameplay). It's very sad what has become of such a good brand. Even the much older installment, Flatout 2, looks better graphically. I can recommend Flatout 2 without hesitation; I even finished it in one sitting shortly before.

This game has some nice ideas for new modes (running over zombies, off-road racing, "Formula 1 racing"), but unfortunately, the rest of it isn't quite up to scratch.
The best game in the series... is the second one. Everything after it: the third and fourth parts are garbage.

column9:
[h1]A bit like playing the lottery...[/h1]

The game is a bit like playing the lottery. The cars tumble across the playing field. And you never know exactly which one will finish. You have little influence over it.

This is simply a VERY DISGUSTING game.
I couldn't even play it for more than 15 minutes. (This mess weighs in at 5.8GB.)
I don't think this game is in the FlatOut series at all. The first and second games are simply amazing compared to this one. The menu interface is too complicated and confusing, they removed the previously cool physics, added super nitro boost (it even sounds gross), and almost all the textures are incredibly expensive.
I DO NOT RECOMMEND.

There are arrow keys for controls... and remember the cool character art in the second one? Well, here the 3D models are fucking awesome by any standards (especially for 2011)... even in Juiced 2 it looked much more familiar.
Highly recommend (NO).

column8:
This game is hot garbage. As a childhood fan of Flatout 2 on the original Xbox, and a fan of the overall Flatout series, this is by far one of the WORST driving games I have ever played in my entire life and I'm kinda insulted that this is called a Flatout game. Here's why...

-   I've played mobile games with better graphics, driving mechanics, and overall game designing than Flatout 3.
The art looks outdated, and the game development looks & feels rushed (ie: the main characters/drivers look like low poly background characters).
-   The UI & HUD is all over the place in terms of design, placement, and aesthetics.
-   The driving mechanics are just awful. Either vehicles will turn way too quickly, or will have less grip of the road than any vehicle in GTA4. Either way, you'll easily lose control and crash into something unintentionally & rage about it within 30 seconds of racing. It's like the devs have never driven a car or have ever played a racing game before when making this crap.
-   Apparently there's music but, it certainly didn't sound anything like what the other titles had in the series. If you were expecting metal & rock, you will be disappointed.
-   The overall audio, especially crashing sounds, is similar to the quality of what you'd expect out of the static you'd hear from a telephone.

It doesn't surprise me that this game was tagged under "Psychological Horror" & "Memes" because, it physically pains me to play Flatout 3. I can't believe this game exists, and I mean that in the most terrible way possible.

Total crap, I couldn't find a single positive. I'm not complaining about the money, but 20 rubles wasted... I'd rather have bought a Pie. The optimization is crap, and the graphics are better, even though I like soap operas. But this isn't good graphics, and it's not soap opera, it's worse than soap opera. What's worse than soap opera is that they tried to upscale it to HD, like soap operas. You get my point.

I'm giving it 0 points, rating 1.
Everyone's saying this is a failed installment of FlatOUT, and why was it even released?

I feel like I'm playing a game created using the Initi engine. I don't see the point in reviewing this game in depth, because for me, this would be a failed test of the game's failure. DON'T SPEND YOUR MONEY, and even though you've already spent it, I'd rather return it and buy a Pie. :-)
Bye!

I had high expectations for this game, but it was a disappointment. If you played both games 1 and 2 and plan to buy this one thinking it'll have the same level of improvements, you might as well give up, because everything is different, and it's not a good difference, but a bad one.

If I have one piece of advice for franchise owners, it's this: choose your game developer wisely, because many don't care about their franchise or its fans. As we saw with Postal 3, the same thing happens here.

Horrible, don't waste your time or money.

This poop is only suitable as a gift for your worst enemy, so that he gets anal pain and begs you for mercy, I don‚Äôt see any other purpose for this excrement of the gaming industry, it feels like the development team was assembled from Blues who were dumped by their girlfriends for guys who were ardent fans of Flatout 1 and 2, and they decided to get revenge on them like this!

column9:
Even though this is another installment in the Flatout series, it's not suitable for this.
- The graphics are so poor that the first installment in the series wins in this regard.
- The game mechanics are terrible; even though the vehicle handles well, everything around it feels like a free browser game: simple, childish, and thoughtless.
- We have 6GB of game to download, and I still don't know what I downloaded. The first installment was only 1GB and is more complex.
- A few new modes are a plus, but the way the developers used this idea and what they did doesn't quite match up. It seems to me that the ideas for the new actions were borrowed from online games for 3-year-olds.
- If you want to play a fun racing game with chaos and destruction, I recommend the second installment, which is a hundred times better graphically and mechanically than this one. It's the first part that looks better than this one, but it doesn't boast about it either. But it's the first part that was made years ago, not that piece of junk like Flatout 3. If I had to rate it, it would be this: -5 out of 10 It sucks.

I don't know what genius came up with the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãhanding over the continuation of such a great series to these clumsy idiots, but he will burn in hell sitting on a chiseled peak. -10/10, one race is enough to remove this hat.

column8:
Flatout 3 is just a bad game. It's ugly, lacks music and the various modes (racing, desctruction, zombies) are all poorly done and unentertaining. 

In destruction you might hit someone in the side at high speed and barely do any damage. Zombie mode is terrible. Racing mode encourages you to "find shortcuts" but respawns you on the track if you stray a bit.

The Dirt and Grid series are infinitely better racing/destruction games. If you really want to hit pedestrians, get Carmageddon 2 - it only looks a little bit worse despite being released way back in 1998.

column8: This game has been in my background for quite a while and after testing it I can now say with confidence that it is not up-to-date enough for a racing game; and I own Carmageddon. If you want a new car game then find one that is not this old or badly made.

column9:
Let's see:
2011 game, destruction derby around the world, the first FlatOut NOT from BugBear.
So... it doesn't sound bad, right? In 2011, the PS3 was already around, and it was already a good time for gaming.

The problem is that FlatOut 3 feels like a trip back in time:
Graphics that look like they're from 2000 to 2003
Very poorly put together arcade driving
Sounds that match the quality of the graphics (terrible)

Sorry, it's not a trip back in time. Destruction Derby Arenas is much better and older than this FlatOut

If you want to play a poorly made arcade game from 2000, this is your game

If you're looking for the essence of FlatOut in its original state, buy another one, or if you have the money, go straight to WRECKFEST
