[h1]SO[/h1]

Move aside! The Titan who knocked out all the achievements is about to tell you the whole truth about this thing.

WELL, IN FACT...
[spoiler] the game is truly complete crap [/spoiler]
[spoiler] but I liked it in places [/spoiler]

First, it's constantly trying to kill you. Yes, you, behind the monitor.
Second, it hasn't been tested by anyone, and sometimes you can facepalm from how stupidly the game is technically implemented.
Third, completing it completely is a real challenge.

[b]Enemies[/b] - a horde of demons placed on rails. Rubber banding to boot.
[b]Cars[/b] are terribly tuned, the physics are zero, but the gravity is like Jupiter. The models are sometimes not even completely terrible; I stole a few to shove into another game.
[b]The maps[/b] are, surprisingly, sometimes really cool. Until you start racing on them, considering the above.
[b]Graphene[/b] - the worst thing about 2007 games in a 2011 game.
[b]Gameplay[/b] - the modes are broken, 80% of them are always completed (if you're lucky) in first place. BUT...
[b]HOW I HATE NIGHT RACES WITH SOAPY RAIN, AND IN SUCH A NUMBER[/b], and in the fifty-challenge mode, there are two that are so poorly balanced that they're either impossible or very difficult to complete without the randomness. (More on that later). The [b]Splatout[/b] mode (aka sub-Carmageddon) is perhaps the best (or rather, the least annoying) in the game.
[b]The characters[/b] are amazing, I've never seen better.

[h2]If anyone wants to complete this miracle and get all the achievements:[/h2]

[b]Challenge #16[/b] can be completed either by editing the handling (SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Flatout 3\Vehicles\Common_Properties_[spoiler]Bus[/spoiler].XML) of the damned [spoiler]red double-decker English bus[/spoiler], or by driving the entire track in reverse to get a checkpoint that's impossible to reach by jumping (the enemy is completely stupefied, so you don't have to worry about losing).

Challenge #30 (a night race, by the way) pits you against three opponents who are obviously faster than the player, but you can beat them by randomizing cars with terrible handling (so the bots can't handle turns properly) and setting the game speed to "Classic" (which appears each time you enter Challenge mode).

By the way, stunt challenges should be completed with the game speed set to "Fast" because this directly affects the player's car speed. Save yourself some stress (though that's debatable).

For the [b]X150 Combo[/b] achievement in Splatout, I recommend one of the latest maps, the one with the circuit track. You need to shoot down the junkies on foot so that your combo splits into two laps (the zombies are arranged in rows of about three, and on your first run, you should shoot down one or two zombies per row).

[h3]Total...[/h3]
[spoiler]A wonderful game, marvelous.[/spoiler]

I recommend Flatout 3 only to those who've seen it all, are tired of normal games, and want to experience every possible hardship and deprivation.

Favorite maps: "Carpathian Lumberjacks," "German Swift Demons," Sewers, "Kazakhstan Massacre"
Favorite car: Nibarret
Favorite hero: Zin Benzin

[b]3/10[/b]

I bought the pack, wanting to reminisce about my youth... But I knew nothing about this particular installment until now... After playing (if you can call it that) for a couple of minutes, I decided the game was missing something... And then it hit me! Maybe it's the developers!? After looking at the developer's games, I realized that making such crappy "cool and action-packed" racing games is their specialty. It's a shame this game got such a bad name and ended up in this pack... The game has no positives, it's all negatives. I highly recommend it; it's not worth a penny...

[b]Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction[/b] is a disgraceful page in the FlatOut series. The game was created by a bunch of... um... not even developers, but unknown shit-makers calling themselves Team 6. This thing appeared after the original developers, Bugbear, went bankrupt and the FlatOut rights were sold to an unknown party, so it has absolutely no connection to the FlatOut series.

So, the pros (surprising, right?):
[list]
[*]- there are as many as 10 game modes, mostly ripped off from previous games, but there's one that, with a good engine, could have been a real Splatout. The idea is that the player crushes zombies. It's very reminiscent of Carmageddon. It would be cool if this mode were developed further in a proper game.
[*]- basically a decent car damage system
[*]- the first game in the series to have Steam achievements
[/list]
Otherwise, the game is complete crap, top to bottom.
Actually, the downsides:
[list]
[*]- Terrible, crappy controls. I could go on and on, but it was best described in a review on YouTube channel stopgame.ru: "...there are only two types of vehicles‚Äîcontrollable irons and uncontrollable irons..." The first Flatout, released 7(!) years earlier, had better controls.
[*]- disgusting graphics. Everything looks so awful, as if the game was made for some low-end Android phone and then poorly ported to PC.
[*]- also, for some reason, the developers added tons of blur (apparently to make the poor graphics less noticeable). But what happens if you smear shit? That's right‚Äînothing good.
[*]-sound. Oh, my god, it's so fucking awful. It feels like they ripped off the sounds from some decent game, then played them on a cheap speaker covered in rubber, and recorded them on a phone recorder.
[*]-music. Thank god it doesn't play during races, because you'd have to look hard to find that kind of crap.
[*]-the game weighs in at over 11 GB! Is there another game hidden in the game files?
[*]-the game costs 250 rubles. Seriously? It's a shame to pay even 10 rubles for this!
[/list]
This game is a disgrace. But basically, if it had come out on Android 10 years ago, and been free and lying around somewhere in the depths of the Google Play Store under the name "Car Driving Game," it might have been worth a 3. But this is Steam, this is 2011, and it costs 250 rubles now! So, nah... it's necessary!

[h1]2 liters of derma out of 10[/h1]

column9:
[h1]A piece of electronic garbage[/h1]
First, let's talk about optimization. I admit my graphics card is terrible, but even with the lowest settings, the frame rate still doesn't go up, maxing out at 20 FPS. And then there's the same amount of glitches as in Street Racing League [spoiler] (2005)[/spoiler]. It's just terrible.

Then there's the control feel. Ummmm, it's so stiff, I can't even drift. It's completely lacking the exhilarating feeling of the first and second generations. This IP is a complete waste.

Finally, if you ever see it for just 0.1CNY [spoiler], even though I know that's impossible[/spoiler], don't touch this piece of electronic garbage!

column9:
Avoid it; Flatout 2 has a much better gameplay.

Lots of bugs, poor usability; in short, it's not fun at all :(

[i]I don't think anyone in their right mind would buy this trash, unless it was just for a collection and at a discount of over 90%, but it's worth a warning just in case =)[/i]
I was sitting here one day, bored, smoking tea, and thinking: "Why don't we make a game like Flatout, and even call it the same? We won't bother with the engine, physics are completely irrelevant for games like this. We'll draw the textures at home over a beer in the evening‚Äîwell, not all of them, of course, but some. And to make it look pretty, we'll fill it all with soap and make the color scheme more acidic. It'll be awesome‚Äîcars, bushes, and all that. Beautiful, functional, and trendy." That's what they ended up doing...

Graphics - 1/10
Physics - 1/10
Gameplay - 3/10
___________________________________________

The other day I played this crazy Dutch creation again, and while I was at it, I inquired about the studio itself, and you know what I suddenly realized? That this was their highest-quality game to date! Seriously. Just look at all the trash they released before (and after, for that matter) Flatout 3, and you'll realize the scale of the disaster. Impressed by such a rich portfolio, I even changed my review from negative to positive. The guys obviously really tried, but as always, something went wrong, and instead of a masterpiece, they ended up with... well, what's done is done.
But overall, if you distance yourself from the name, series, and year of release, the game is pretty good overall. Yes, the physics are terrible, yes, soap and acid ooze from every pixel, yes, the interface is almost completely terrible, yes, there are tons of bugs, but as a silly gameplay experience, it's perfectly acceptable.
P.S.: By the way, the Russian localization very accurately translates the "leave the game" option as "STOP." Stop torturing your eyes, your nerves, your computer, and finally stop playing this. And in the case of the developers, stop releasing games. Completely. Change your career, move to the countryside, tend a garden, and milk chickens.

column9:
I literally learned about the third part during the 2018 summer sale. Until then, I thought there were only two (not counting Carnage). After that, the company was preparing Wreckfest (or am I mistaken?)

But no, here it is ‚Äì the third part of FlatOut. Let's take a closer look:

All that remains of the classic game series is the name.

* Everything in the game has been reworked (read: trashed). From the music, which kept the adrenaline pumping, to the physics of the cars themselves.

As I wrote above, the game's soundtrack has changed. Yes, music always changes, you say. But in this game, during a race, you won't hear a song that makes your heart beat faster. Here, it's just for background music.

* The game's graphics have also undergone changes. For some reason, they've been downgraded. The development budget is probably to blame. But I think the problem lies with the developers themselves. Because this is CLEARLY not BugBear. Let me check... Yes. Some Team6 Game Studios. About whom nothing much is known...
The graphics, the visual effects, the engine‚Äîeverything is clearly made in Unity. At least, that's what it seemed to me at first glance.

*Lots of bloatware.
*Terrible controls. The game was probably marketed as mobile content. Or at least as a console version. The sharp turns and jumps are just for show. The handbrake works incomprehensibly. It's easier to take turns by simply releasing the gas.

*They've added a variety of game modes. I was particularly surprised by Splatter‚Äîthe level where we're asked to run over zombies. Carmageddon‚Äîis that you? Or am I imagining it?

In conclusion:
This is a casual game. I don't recommend spending money on it. It'll just ruin your mood. Not worth it.

column9:
The game is very good.
The game's physics are simply fantastic.

What happened to the series after the rights were sold.

At first, I didn't want to criticize the game too much. It's not that bad.
There's destruction, minigames, a bunch of modes, and it's playable.
It's a bad FlatOut, but not the worst racing game.

I would forgive the new car behavior, the lack of upgrades, and the new gameplay strategy.
However, it's worse than it seemed.
The game has so much nitro that you can practically hold the button down.
When I hit a train, the game freezes on my still-powerful PC.
The car destructibility is so low that it often doesn't look interesting.
The minigames are ruined, and so are the derbies.
I really don't like the design of some of the tracks; I can't see the potholes because of all the debris and keep falling into them.
The music is bland, and the graphics look much worse than in FlatOut 2.

Well, it's playable; I even liked some of the tracks. However, everything is really at a low level.
4 out of 10

column9:
I bought Flatout as part of a bundle because "it seems fun."
I hadn't played the previous games, and first played it during Steam's 2018 Spring Cleaning event.

I started playing it by selecting the thumbnail.

I started playing it without realizing it was actually the third game, and was shocked when I saw the store page.

Is this a prototype?

Perhaps it's Flatout's physics, but there are some parts that are fun to move around in.
(But the car keeps getting stuck on the course.)

How can I put it, there are a lot of mode variations,
but the core gameplay feels sloppy or lacking.
(Are they relying on the Flatout name, the math, or imitating other games?)
It lacks a core, leaving a hollow, empty feeling. (Is it bad game design or poor development sense?)
It's not fun, so it's gradually becoming a chore.

I'm starting to wonder why I'm playing this game.

It's probably a playable crap game among all the crap games out there,
but it just feels so low quality.

After playing,
I was able to get a feel for Flatout's history on the store page, so I think it's worth it.

However, I wouldn't recommend it.

So why did Flatout go downhill? It's all because Bugbear Entertainment sold the franchise rights to Team 6 Studios, and that's where it all started. Part 3, a complete piece of crap that initially cost 1900 rubles and then 99 rubles, you can see where it was going... Team 6 Studios sold the rights to the Kylotonn franchise. They still made a fourth game, which was better than Part 3, but didn't quite measure up to the first three. Bugbear Entertainment never got the rights back. It's sad when a favorite game dies before your eyes, and you can't do anything about it.

column9:
The game isn't bad.
The graphics have something I like, but they're not the best in years.
I'm not a big racing game fan; I'd rather drive around with cars in Far Cry 2-5, which handle almost identically.
A good game for in-between times.
It's certainly not worth ‚Ç¨10, but if it's on sale for ‚Ç¨2 or ‚Ç¨1,
I can definitely buy it.

An addendum to that:

I'm playing a few more racing games now, Forza, Need of Speed, ... a few others, and I can now form a better opinion.
I haven't played Flatout 2, and I don't factor it into my opinion.

Back to the graphics: funny, strange, amusing graphics.
Controls: a bit sluggish or overreactive, but I can handle the cars well.
Racing: The races themselves in the game take a bit of getting used to.
Other modes, like driving against walls where the driver flies out of the car, aren't my thing, just like the mode where you have to crash the car.

Otherwise, as with the review above, it's a good buy for 1-2 euros and fun if you don't know what to play.

column8:
DON'T BUY if you expect Flatout!

I played Flatout: Ultimate Carnage and Flatout 2 a lot and some day I saw Flatout 3 on sale for around 5 $. Totally blinded by the awesomeness of the previous Flatout games by Bugbear I ran into this trap without checking what I was actually buying...

After playing maybe like 30 minutes I was really disappointed since I expected something like a worthy successor for Ultimate Carnage which Flatout 3 clearly is NOT. I uninstalled the game and considered this my worst game investment ever.

Some years later I installed the game again and played it for some hours to get some of the achievements and I came to this conclusion:

If you expect a Flatout as you used to know: DO NOT BUY!!!
Well if you expect a game that looks like a bad Flatout clone and is not perfect at all then you could maybe enjoy this one. It's actually fun to play to be honest but you need some time to get used to it and you always have to tell yourself that this is not Flatout...

At least there is game mode that puts you in a splatter car telling you to kill some zombies on the road .... every game is better with zombies and so is Flatout 3.

If the game wouldn't be called Flatout it would just be some "not that good" car game I wouldn't recommend either but as a part of the Flatout game series it feels like a malicious deception to make some money with the good name of Flatout.

Some years later I installed the game again and played it for some hours to get some of the achievements and I came to this conclusion:

If you expect a Flatout as you used to know: DO NOT BUY!!!
Well if you expect a game that looks like a bad Flatout clone and is not perfect at all then you could maybe enjoy this one. It's actually fun to play to be honest but you need some time to get used to it and you always have to tell yourself that this is not Flatout...

At least there is game mode that puts you in a splatter car telling you to kill some zombies on the road .... every game is better with zombies and so is Flatout 3.

If the game wouldn't be called Flatout it would just be some "not that good" car game I wouldn't recommend either but as a part of the Flatout game series it feels like a malicious deception to make some money with the good name of Flatout.

I don't have the right words to describe this total, soul-chilling mess. That's probably the only decent description for this pathetic piece of code. This isn't my favorite Flatout. It's just an aborted piece of shit that was shat out of nowhere.

column8:
This game is not developed by people, it is developed by the devil himself to torture us.

If i had to pick one game that made me rip off my eyes, this one game would be Flatout 3.

Also, you may be asking of why i have this obnoxious on my library, is because i bought Flatout Complete Pack which comes FO1, FO2, FO3 and FO: Ultimate Carnage, so 3 good games and one bad game.

Don't matter how hard you try to convince me that FO3 is a good game, it is simply not, compares it with FO2, where you feel the weight of the impact of the cars crashing, i could be sitting here listening the cars crashing while listening Demon Speeding by Rob Zombie, the AI drivers doesn't offer much of a challenge but hey at least they work, the graphics doesn't look good nowadays, but back in the day, they're really great, basically Bugbear took care of FO2 like it was the last thing on Earth.

Now, look at the FO3, the physics doesn't even exist, the graphics doesn't look good and Team-6 didn't cared about the quality of the game, full of bugs, AI that is way too OP, the sound of cars crashing doesn't make me eargasm like FO2 usually does and the modes are just not innovative, they tried something new here but it doesn't work.

In conclusion, stay way from this game, i really recommend FO2, if you're a fan of the PS2 era.

ce jeu est mauvais, point. il prend un place √©norme sur le disque. il n'est meme pas beau une fois lanc√©. il met une heure √† charger. et tu t'aper√ßois quand tu commences √† jouer qu'au moins, pendant le temps de chargement, tu avais encore une chance de croire que le jeu serait bien... du coup, c'√©tait moins d√©cevant qu'une fois dans le jeu en vrai. √† fuir.

column9:
This game is bad, period. It takes up a huge amount of space on the disk. It doesn't even look good once it's launched. It takes an hour to load. And you realize when you start playing that at least, during the loading time, you still had a chance to believe that the game would be good... so it was less disappointing than once you actually played the game. Run away.
I have the first games (1, 2, and the Ultimate Carnage), I thought I'd enjoy the new edition... it's like swallowing candy, and coming across an aspirin lozenge! (To be polite!)

[i]So many thoughts about this game are running through my head, and I can't even describe them all. But still.
I really loved playing the first and second games. So many videos we made with friends, with those poor drivers crashing, and it's so good that the third game passed me by at the time, how grateful I am. Thank you so much, [b]Team 6 Studios[/b] for protecting me from your brainchild back then.
I'm very grateful to you for creating this masterpiece. More and more negative emotions are filling my mind.
How would I classify this game!? My ardently unloved 2005 game, [b]Street Racing Syndicate[/b]. But even though it was challenging, and we controlled irons, the opponents were aces. And here... No matter what, you start last, catch up to the first, and think you'll break away, but nooo ... You got excited too soon, but the magnet on your bumper turns on, and all your rivals are immediately on your heels, pulled along by that mischievous magnet. As soon as you fall a little behind, they immediately slow down, and you're back in the lead...

So, to sum it up...
[b]- Son! I made you a game based on your favorite series.
- Yes, Dad, what did you call it???
- Very simple and straightforward. [b]Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction[/b]
- Can I play it?
- Yes! Of course!
.... 3 minutes passed
- my son shot himself[/b][/i]

column9:
SHORT VERSION OF THE REVIEW

Flatout 3 is terrible not only as a flatout, but as a game in general.

Gameplay 2/10
Most of the cars have the same stats, it's boring to play.
Graphics 0/10
The second game was better.
Optimization 0/10
Music dummy.
I turned it off because the main menu music got on my nerves after two minutes.

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES!!!
If you want to laugh at its ugliness with your friends, download a pirated copy.

LONG VERSION

Graphics and Design
They didn't give a damn about the graphics. One car has a model like the toy cars from Paradise City, another has a paint job on the right side that's simply mirrored on the left. The cars don't have wheels attached.

Gameplay
I don't give a shit about the gameplay either. Show me the person who invented nitro to heal you. I want to see a brainless person. Also, show me the translator. The translation is poor, and the cooling is crap, carbon fiber. But there are plenty of modes.

Racing
Classes, and sometimes cars within classes, have different characteristics. If the word "handling" is 3 out of 5 stars, then the car will absolutely not make the turn, but if it's 4, then everything is fine. The racing here is worse than in Cars the Game.

Derbies and Grand Derby
I don't know how they made it so that when you're pinned against a wall, you get points and most likely end up in the top three. I also want to know why the "Classic" class has a car that's more durable than the "Derbies" cars, and why the "Derbies" class has a car with ONE out of 5 durability?

Night Racing
One-on-one racing at night and in the rain. It's not any better.

Monster Truck Mode
This mode is crap. You complete some trivial tasks and that's it. Why isn't this a race or a derby?

Zombie Mode
You're driving a modified car, running over zombies. It's more boring than you think. You can replace zombies with planks and nothing will change.

Stunts
Where's the angle selection for the chosen monster truck's launch? Why the hell is this monster truck only controllable for a limited amount of time in flight? Where are the cars with jet engines?

High-Speed ‚Äã‚ÄãRacing
The icing on the crap cake. You're driving a Formula 1 car on a COMPLETELY EMPTY TRACK with bots, which zips along sand like it's asphalt. If you hit a wall, you fly out of the car. On the "Kazakhstan Massacre" track (I'm not joking), you can cut corners on the sand (in a Formula 1 car). Some turns can be missed by hitting a wall (they'll put you back after the turn).

Off-Road
I don't know who came up with the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãforcing people to drift 4x4 cars. The winner is the one who scores the most points for stunts. The closer you finish to first place, the higher the score multiplier. It seems like an interesting idea (if you forget about drifting in 4x4 cars), but the physics are a piece of fucking crap.

OPTIMIZATION
The game looks worse than the second game, and lags more. Stuttering occurs when changing cars, navigating the main menu, loading, starting a race, etc.

Verdict: 1/10. The pirated version is good for a laugh with some singing.

Is this "masterpiece" still on Steam? XD
The "best" racing game of all time, its competitors will never be able to keep up.
BUT! Such "terrible" games (if we consider racing alone) as Grid, DiRT 1-3, DiRT: Showdown, F1 2013, FUEL, Blur, the NASCAR series, and some others have been removed, but this "wonderful" creation lives and thrives. [spoiler]no[/spoiler]. Yeah...

I turned it on while hungover, thinking the "squirrel" had arrived, but no...
I wish the author a dick. Gulkin's dick in a clay box.

The game's only positive is the presence of achievements.
The first thing I noticed when I first launched the game was the presence of a fair number of modes. But not everything is so smooth. The differences between them are essentially negligible. It all comes down to the fact that you MUST be first in everything. And at the same time, not die on the map. Or be first in the score.
There's no music during races at all. Either it was there originally, but it's so crap that they cut it. Or, for this kind of crap, they didn't even bother.
Graphics. Apparently a port from a phone or PSP.
Controls - They seem to be there, but also sort of aren't. The car obeys you, there are no wild drifts. But it feels like a doll-like thing. Artificial.
Damage system. Pathetic. I drove into water, but came out, and they counted it as drowned. The car's durability was reduced. I bounced on a bump, landing on my wheels. They reduced the car's durability. Dents appear, and bits of metal fall off. But I didn't notice any more damage. It doesn't even seem like the driver is thrown out of the car.
- The tuning system. They probably forgot to add it to the game. Everything is already maxed out, you just have to choose cars with different characteristics and colors. And the whole tuning consists of choosing 'factory settings, drift, drag, KUEG,' etc. I didn't notice anything at all in the indicators, other than other letters. But when loading into one of the races, it said that the factory 'SETTINGS' hold the clutch better. Ahem.
They added a bunch of characters to the game with tiny backstories for each. As a result, we have a bunch of male characters (different models) and a bunch of female characters with the same body model. They're just repainted and have different costumes. The characters are horribly designed. *crap. They were beautifully drawn in the 2nd game. And what year is this? The characters themselves don't matter at all.
There's a zombie mode. I thought maybe it would at least be enjoyable. In the end, it's the same old story. Like, zombies. Like, you're driving around the map, like, crushing them. But it doesn't evoke any emotions.

In the end, we have something that's a cut above the first game with ported graphics from a phone or Nintendo. I'd call this part FLATOUT - 0 Pain and EXHAUSTION. And then there's that annoying frame at the top and bottom of the screen. A_A_A_A. Who came up with that idea?!

I need to master this creation somehow. Get the achievements.

column9:
This time, it was on sale as a bundle, so I bought it to reminisce. I thought maybe the third installment would be worth a try, but I was struck by how much time has passed and how much the memories still hold up. I played a race right after launching it, and was so shocked that I deleted it.

The graphics seem to have regressed even further compared to the previous installments, Carnage 2 and Fury. While they're certainly improved in real life, they don't quite match the game's atmosphere. They even feel more out of place than the original, low-poly game. The game's aesthetic demands a rusty, rough, and rugged metal look. The graphics in this third installment seem to have been inspired by the Fast & Furious series, with the cars all having a shiny, bling-bling feel. The car graphics are as good as they come, but the background remains rusty and rough, reminiscent of previous games, creating a stark contrast between the cars and the background.

Even if the graphics are okay, the most important thing in a racing game is control. As many reviewers have criticized, the cars lack weight, making them feel like they're floating and flying around. This series' trademark and strength is the heavy, crashing, flying, and shattering metal, yet this game boasts a lightweight, sloppy weight, control, and impact that completely squashes that feeling.

While the previous games and its sequel, Carnage IV, may have lost in the races, their distinctive, heavy impacts, made them fun and exhilarating in and of themselves. However, in Carnage III, when a collision hits, my car bounces like a cotton ball, causing me to become irritated and even more infuriated. Far from being exhilarating, the controls, weight, and impact feel of this game have completely disappeared, making it the most contradictory game in the series.

It's the worst in the series, and comparing it to the masterpieces Carnage II and Carnage is a no-brainer.
I assure you, don't even think it's better than the classic first game based on the graphics and release date alone. I assure you twice that the first game is. It's much more fun than the third installment.

I bought the bundle because it was cheaper than buying all the others separately.
Buying them separately is a waste of money, even if it's on sale. Playing this will make you realize once again how great the first, second, and third installments of Carnage were, and how even the divisive fourth installment is a decent work in its own right.

No matter how much I reminisce, I can't bring it back to life.

column8:
[h1]Why Does This Exist?[/h1]

This game may fool you by its name, But It's not a Flatout game. It's your average garbage that Team 6 makes. I don't know why they had the Flatout name at the time, but it sure hasn't regained its popularity ever since. If you so happen to enjoy this game, You just aren't human. There is nothing here that yells [b]"There was Effort!"[/b]. Seriously Nothing is good, I have tried to milk as much play time as I could out of this "game". It was a horrible experience. And somehow the game is bigger in file size than the [b]first 2 games combined[/b]. I don't know where all that space went, but it surely doesn't deserve to be on my hard drive. Alright, I'll stop rambling and get on with the "pros" and cons.

[h1]The [i]"Good"[/i][/h1]

[list]
    [*]  [b][i]It runs pretty well on modern hardware.[/i][/b]
    [*]  [b][i]It has a large variety of vehicles.[/i][/b] [i](Even though you'll never drive all of them.)[/i]
    [*]  [b][i]They kept all of the good game modes from previous entries.[/i][/b] [i](Though they all suck in comparison.)[/i]
[/list]

[h1]The Bad[/h1]

[list]
    [*]  [b][i]Graphics are nauseatingly bad.[/i][/b] [i]Flatout from 2005 looks miles ahead of this... and it's 6 years older.[/i]
    [*]  [b][i]The handling model is worse than most Unity made mobile games.[/i][/b]
    [*]  [b][i]Physics just Flatout don't even work properly.[/i][/b]
    [*]  [b][i]Controls are just outright horrible.[/i][/b] [i]Can you believe that they advertised Wheel support![/i]
    [*]  [b][i]The AI are ridiculously stupid.[/i][/b] [i]Don't even attempt derbies, the AI were only programmed to hit [b]You[/b].[/i]
    [*]  [b][i]The "Soundtrack" is so bland, it's depressing.[/i][/b] [i]Legit, Just mute the game and listen to your computers fans.[/i]
    [*]  [b][i]The Damage Model is just sad.[/i][/b] [i]They only had to do one thing to make it a Flatout game, and they failed at it... miserably.[/i]
    [*]  [b][i]The Graphics settings.[/i][/b] [i]There isn't even an option for Vsync, and it is one of the most needed options for this game. It has an extreme amount of screen tearing.[/i]
    [*]  [b][i]Literally everything else there is to the game.[/i][/b]
[/list]

So ya, that's about everything I can think of from the top of my head. I seriously tried to jump in and do as much as I possibly could to enjoy it, but I just couldn't. Even if you imagine the game as something that isn't Flatout, it still fails to be that. I can't even call the game incomplete or rushed. It's just bad. There is nothing they could have done to make this garbage better.

The title is the only reason this game has been played by more than 20 people. And the only reason why 99% of people who have this game in their library, is because they bought either the [b]Flatout Complete Pack[/b] or the [b]Flatout Anthology Pack[/b]. And I am sure that we can all agree that this game wouldn't have been missed if it wasn't in any of the packs.

I can't recommend this game to anyone. Even if you like racing games in general, there is nothing of value here. It doesn't deserve the Flatout name in any way, shape or form. I'll go as far as to say anything Team 6 makes just isn't worth it. They started making games in 2001, and they haven't made anything that shows that they are worth buying from. I know making games is hard. I'm not saying that they can't make anything good. But come on guys. There hasn't been any effort put into this game, and it shows.

[h1] It's a Solid 2/10[/h1]
[i]And that's only because I'm being generous[/i]

[i][b]I hope this review was helpful to someone. I hope you have a great day![/b][/i]

Initially, when you get to the menu, the game seems fine: lots of modes, cars, characters, but when you start the first race, you realize it's just crap. It would be better if they removed it from the pack and left the first, second, and Ultimate Carnage games there. I highly recommend it.

column8:
Crei que las criticas muy bajas estaban algo exageradas asi que lo jugu√©.
Empece una carrera, ningun tutorial sobre como conducir, supuse cuales serian los botones y sirvio.
Me enfrente a una curva, y como no sabia frenar choque, asi fui mejorando para conducir, a choque y choque.
Por la segunda vuelta hice un derrape para dar vuelta, choque con un arbol y mi coche exploto, termine la carrera en 7mo lugar solo por terminarla.
En si el juego esta mal, derrapes muy exagerados, caidas de Cuadros por Segundo, Musica completamente aburrida y repetitiva, tuve que ponerle mute para aguantar la carrera.
Todos los negativos tienen la razon, las 5 peores GB descargadas en mi vida.
3/10 Tiene un Menu bonito
Despues de un rato mas de jugar, no es taaaaaan malo, sigue siendo poco recomendado, pero si te gusta algo mucho mas arcade con explosiones mas exageradas y con fisicas menos realistas, puede que si te divierta
column9:
I thought the very low reviews were a bit exaggerated, so I played it.
I started a race, there was no tutorial on how to drive, I just figured out what the buttons were, and it worked.
I faced a curve, and since I didn't know how to brake, I crashed, so I improved my driving, crash after crash.
On the second lap, I skidded to make the turn, hit a tree, and my car exploded. I finished the race in 7th place just to finish it.
The game itself is bad: exaggerated drifts, frame rate drops, and completely boring and repetitive music. I had to mute it to make it through the race.
All the negatives are right; the worst 5 GB downloads of my life.
3/10 It has a nice menu
After playing for a while, it's not that bad, it's still not recommended, but if you like something much more arcade-like with more exaggerated explosions and less realistic physics, you might enjoy it.

The best part of Flatout.
I've been playing Flatout since I was a kid.
I don't care that it's a different company.
This game is TOP.
I don't understand why there are so many negative reviews.

column8:
The only redeeming part that I found from this abortion of a game is that it has Steam achievements where the previous games don't, then again, playing this game will make you question where or not you'd care in the slightest to try to get them. When the video settings options "target framerate" has an option for "15fps", you know you're in for a sh!t show. 

Racing:
The laughable driving mechanics feel clunkier than the 2nd Saints Row game. And you don't need to worry about avoiding obstcales, your car plows right through everything minus a building or a tree with minimal speed lose. The racing aspect is pitiful and cartoonish, if not downright insulting. Think boost is hard to come by, takes some slick maneuvering to gain, nope. You start the damn race with max boost already! Let alone the cpu has virtually unlimited boost as well, blast all the way down a straight away only to have the cpus a car length right behind you. "Stuntman" mode is trash. Instead of having multiple tries to get a specific score, you have one, which happens to a target that you need to hit perfectly and not a set distance or height; also, one of the male characters (Justin Case) has a female voice, which is sadly hilarious.

Controls:
The controls are vague in comparison to the previous games which will make you go to the control options screen. You'd think that you can't use a controller with the "device" settings on "keyboard", you're wrong. Actually switching the "device" setting from default to a controller option disables the controller and enables the keyboard, because it's Opposite Day when you play this game. That is if you'd even care to go in and MANUALLY set every single controller button in a game that has the option to use a controller but failed to auto set it for you.

The only enjoyable part I found was the "Splattout!" zombie mode, despite it being completely pointless for this type of game. You simply have achieve a specific score but it won't tell you that you have 2 minutes to achieve that. Not as though it would matter anyhow, it's embarrassingly easy that you can complete it with your eyes closed and using one hand. The game quickly turns into a personal test of how high of a combo you can get. Example: "score at least 50,000 points" in the 2 minutes, I ended up scoring over 8 million points by driving the course and keeping a combo.

The "Monster trucks" mode proly wouldn't be half bad if it wasn't for the damn team icon floating above your car and blocking most of your view, the fact that simply driving around the level and going off of jumps damages you just as much as ramming the enemy teammates. Your "teammates" are utter jackasses that actually ram you at the start if you don't purposefully avoid them, and the enemy trucks can easily overpower you and just grind on you until you explode. This of course will end at some point when you lose and the game crashes after the third/fourth retry with a "-pure virtual function call", as if the game itself is self-aware and pulls you out of the Matrix.

column8:
Der Ausreisser in einer sonst genialen Arcade-Rennreihe

Da ich irgendwann mal die gesamte Flatout-Reihe zusammen gekauft hatte, und sich somit dieses Spiel ohnehin seit langem in meiner Bibliothek befand, entschied ich mich, es trotz der vielen negativen Reviews mal zu testen. Ich wusste, dass dieser Teil im Gegensatz zu Flatout 1, 2 und Ultimate Carnage, einer HD-Version des genialen 2. Teils, von einem anderen Studio entwickelt wurde. Und obwohl Flatout 2 und Ultimate Carnage wohl immer meine Favoriten bleiben werden, habe ich auch mit dem sauschweren Flatout 4 meine Freude. 
Zur√ºck zu Flatout 3, welches, um es gleich vorweg zu nehmen, sehr entt√§uscht, und zwar aus folgenden Gr√ºnden:
Die Grafik sieht zun√§chst einmal extrem schwammig, verschwommen und weichgezeichnet aus. Sowas erwarte ich vielleicht von einem Indy Rennspiel, das von einem Ein-Mann-Team mit der Unity-Engine entwickelt wurde, aber nicht von einem Flatout. Sicher - Flatout war nie eine AAA-Produktion. Die anderen Teile waren auch keine Grafikkracher. Aber sie hatten immerhin eine f√ºr ihre Zeit solide Grafik. Zweckm√§√üig und stimmig, wie man so sch√∂n sagt. Das ist hier leider keineswegs der Fall. 
Die Steuerung wurde schon oft als sehr schwammig beschrieben, und das muss ich leider best√§tigen. Das Spiel wird dadurch zwar nicht unspielbar, leidet aber schon sehr.
Au√üerdem hinkt das Streckendesign, durchas eine St√§rke der anderen Teile, meilenweit hinterher. Ja, es gibt auch hier Abk√ºrzungen. Aber alles wirkt irgendwie ebenso wie Grafik und Steuerung billig zusammengeschustert.
Schlussendlich gibt es neben den normalen Rennen und den Destruction Arenen, die wir schon aus anderen Zeilen der Serie kennen, und die - soweit mit der schwammigen Steuerung m√∂glich - durchaus Spass machen, auch einige absolut langweilige sinnfreie Modi. Das Speedrennen mit den Pseudo Formel 1 Wagen geh√∂rt f√ºr mich ebenso in letztere Kategorie wie die Monstertruck-Events, in denen man merkw√ºrdife Aufgaben wie das Zerst√∂ren Explosiver F√§sser bew√§ltigen muss.
Der Modus, indem man auf einer offenen Karte mit gro√üen Trucks durch verschiedene T√§tigkeiten wie Zerst√∂rung, Spr√ºnge, Stunts und Geschwindigkeit Punkte erringen kann, ist zwar ganz lustig, reisst das Spiel aber auch nicht mehr raus. Ich muss mich meinen vielen Vorrednern anschlie√üen: Absolut nicht zu empfehlen. Wenn man es sowieso hat, kann man es nat√ºrlich durchaus mal antesten.
column9:
The outlier in an otherwise brilliant arcade racing series

Since I had bought the entire Flatout series at some point, and this game had been in my library for a long time anyway, I decided to give it a try despite the many negative reviews. I knew that this installment, unlike Flatout 1, 2, and Ultimate Carnage, an HD version of the brilliant second installment, was developed by a different studio. And although Flatout 2 and Ultimate Carnage will probably always be my favorites, I also enjoyed the incredibly difficult Flatout 4.

Back to Flatout 3, which, to be clear, is very disappointing for the following reasons:
The graphics look extremely blurry, fuzzy, and soft-focus. I might expect something like that from an Indy racing game developed by a one-man team using the Unity engine, but not from Flatout. Sure, Flatout was never a AAA production. The other installments weren't graphically stunning either. But they at least had solid graphics for their time. Functional and coherent, as they say. Unfortunately, that's by no means the case here.

The controls have often been described as very vague, and I have to agree. While it doesn't make the game unplayable, it does suffer considerably.
Furthermore, the track design, a strength of the other installments, is miles behind. Yes, there are shortcuts here too. But everything, just like the graphics and controls, seems cheaply cobbled together.
Finally, in addition to the normal races and the Destruction Arenas, which we already know from other installments in the series and which are quite fun‚Äîas far as the vague controls allow‚Äîthere are also some absolutely boring, pointless modes. The speed race with the pseudo-Formula 1 cars belongs in the latter category for me, as do the monster truck events, in which you have to complete strange tasks like destroying explosive barrels.
The mode, in which you can earn points on an open map with large trucks through various activities such as destruction, jumps, stunts, and speed, is quite fun, but doesn't really make the game stand out. I have to agree with many of the previous commenters: Absolutely not recommended. If you already have it, you can certainly give it a try.

Okay, the game is ugly. Okay, the game is buggy. Okay, the game has stupid AI. Okay, the game clearly lacks several months of development.
So anyone who waited with hope for this third installment, anyone who bought it day one, or simply at a hefty price, must be hating it.
BUT
For a game on sale for less than ‚Ç¨5, it gets the job done. It's fun, there are plenty of game modes (and even a few playable ones!!!), there are plenty of cars, and it's a pleasant way to pass up a few winter vacation afternoons.
So I'm doing a good deed and giving it a thumbs-up.

column9:
Well, for starters, luckily for me I got it with the bundle.

I installed it just to test it out. I thought, "Well, the game can't be as bad as it's made out to be."
WELL, DAMN, MY PIG, I've never messed up so much.

To start with, the game is ugly, compared to Flatout 2, and well, 2 is much better looking.
Then the handling, no, but seriously, how can you mess that up? Your car goes to hell even if you don't touch the joystick or the arrow keys.
Then...WHERE IS THE CAREER MODE? Well, there isn't one. So how do you win new tracks or new cars? Well, I don't know. Then the damage management, he really didn't want to bother because your car repairs itself like magic... guys, we're not at Disney.
And finally, WHY DID YOU BUGBEAR LEAVE THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE GAME TO THEM? No, but seriously, what?
It's a shame it's so bad.

column9: Don't waste your money on this game, FlatOut 1 and 2 are 100000000 times better, both in graphics, game modes, gameplay, etc.

[i] This isn't a game‚Äîit's a misunderstanding. [/i]

The car's handling, even considering the genre, is terrible. The car handles poorly on turns, when jumping off ramps, and when colliding with opponents.
Graphics? There's little point in talking about the graphics of a six-year-old game, but even by that time, they look terrible.

There's no music during races, leaving you to revel in the constant sounds of your opponents' nitrous oxide popping. This is surprising, considering that the soundtrack in this genre should set the right mood and make you feel driven.

The game doesn't really grab you; there are no strengths or advantages. It's better to stick with the previous games in the series.

Yes, tihs is a bad game.

I started the first race but couldn't even finish it. column9:
I got this with the previous Flatout games and after reading all the reviews I got curious and installed it. I was wondering if it was one of those cases where a game is fun but somehow the fans were offended because the game changed a lot from previous instances.

Yes, tihs is a bad game.

I started the first race but couldn't even finish it. The handling, the physics, all the crap in the screen that makes it hard to know where you have to go, the terrible player models and bad puns makes it feel like if it was one of those terrible Steam indie games made by 1 person following a game development tutorial.
Why are they releasing this, and I'm the one feeling ashamed? It took a lot of effort to turn the legendary Flatout 2 into this...

column8:
This game is a complete scam. Some dev team that doesn't even know how to make proper games bought the name to release this piece of crap and say 'hey buy it, it's flatout'.
But this game has none of the qualities the previous games had.
Graphics are unbelievably bad, which wouldn't matter much to me if the game would be at least a tiny little bit enjoyable.
The Soundtrack, which was a big plus for me in the other games, is complete garbage.
Just like the physics engine. Why make a game about wrecking shit when the physics engine takes out all the fun of wrecking shit?
The controls are reeeaaally clunky, you will drive into a lot of stuff if it doesn't move out of the way. Sadly, not a lot of stuff is moving out of the way.
AND! There is a zombie mode. A really bad zombie mode. Why the fuck did they think FlatOut needs a zombie mode?

Really. Don't buy this game.
Ever.
Not even on sale.
Not even for the 'hey I bought a crappy game to make fun of' 5 minutes of amusement.
It's not even good enough for that.

[h1]"The initial urge to wipe the monitor to get a clear picture quickly gives way to the desire to erase the game itself from the hard drive."[/h1] [i][url=https://www.igromania.ru/article/19978/FlatOut_3_Chaos_and_Destruction.html]link to original source[/url][/i]

The editors of Igromania magazine write eloquently and accurately. After [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/12360/FlatOut_Ultimate_Carnage/]FlatOut: Ultimate Carnage,[/url] the game passed into the hands of Team 6 Studios, who decided to kill the FlatOut series.

Okay. In reality, it's unlikely the developers had that goal in mind. But what should we think of Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction?

About the game itself. Let's start with the fact that there's no career in the game. As you complete races, you unlock new tracks and cars. There's multiplayer, but it doesn't seem to work. The cars are old and familiar, and there are also some new ones. It's worth noting that the developers decided to add a touch of humor to the game, something that wasn't there before. For example, we have a variety of characters to choose from (the Unknown Player resembles the Stig from "Top Gear," and Zin Benzin resembles Vin Diesel as Riddick). 
The graphics and physics in the game are a separate issue. The graphics are quite muddy and poor. The differences between "Ultra" and "Very Low" are noticeable, yes, but there are no obvious improvements. Physics, however, is a sore point here. The car easily accelerates to 150 mph, brakes just as sharply, and turns too sharply. Crashing into an opponent at that speed can send them flying into space. The car jumps terribly on ramps, diving down after 2-3 meters.

column9:
Oh yes, what times those were when you could sit comfortably on the sofa on Xbox and Playstation 2 and play a round of Flatout 1 and 2 with a few friends. A great rocking soundtrack, tough and challenging races, split-screen mode and fun mini-games still inspire me today, and then came... (I hardly want to say it out loud and yet I have to) Flatout 3 is truly the holy grail of gaming gems in the very back row.
Okay, there isn't a fancy intro with suitable music like in the first part, that's fine, but here you're thrown into a carelessly thrown-together menu with suitable stupid yawn music and you can choose from all sorts of modes like single player, multiplayer or mini-games. Not everything is playable straight away, which is fine, you do want to earn something, but it can really test your nerves.
There is no career mode, nor is there any way to tune your cars. You drive through boring areas and unlock other races or the challenge mode, for example. If it were fun, which it never will be, I could say something positive here, but almost every race starts with a mass crash thanks to the Rambo AI. On the other hand, the AI ‚Äã‚Äãis also incredibly stupid and tends to get stuck on objects, making it easy to lap them more than once in a race. What is also a feast for the eyes are the sub-par graphics, which even some PS2 titles would be ashamed of, and the exaggerated blurring effect that makes you fly off the track in a tango. Even the smallest bumps on the track, the messed up driving physics, or even a laughing fit can cause this. I couldn't test the online mode at this point because there are simply no other players, and even the two or three biggest hardcore fans out there are probably fed up with this masterpiece by now.

Pros

Haha, good joke

Cons

Pretty much everything

Flatout 3: Chaos and Destruction is one of those games where pretty much everything went wrong: lousy graphics, lousy driving physics, lousy AI, lousy sound‚Äîjust terrible from start to finish. It's simply no fun and would be too expensive even if it were free. Team 6 Studios is giving it a 6. The only positive thing to mention here is that the developer shows us how not to program games.

column8:
I read the reviews saying this is a terrible game, and the worst in the FlatOut series.  I loved FlatOut 1, 2, & U.C (The BugBear ones) and thought, "How bad can it be?", after I finally got the game to load (crashed on start-up because of an unnecessary DLL that installs with the game) and played a level/game-mode or two, I then started thinking "how much worse can this get?", then another couple of different levels/game-modes, I found out the answer was "A LOT WORSE!"

[b]PROS:[/b]
The "QUIT" button works (Although you still need to scroll to select YES to exit the game)

[b]CONS:[/b]
Graphics are crap, models extend in stunt mode.
Not only driving physics, but the physics in general are rubbish.
Sound Samples seem like they have been taken from a porno (a girl moans in stunt mode even if you are a guy)
Crash on start-up (as mentioned before, game installed a DLL file that is not required on all systems)

Unfortunately, I will keep playing the game, as I have made an agreement with my wife, that if I purchase a game, I must play it for a while, and try to complete the majority of it.

In my opinion, the game isn't that bad. Yes, it has its flaws. Many criticized it for its poor controls, although that was most likely the fault of the players and reviewers themselves, or they simply wanted to find fault with the game. I played it, and... lo and behold... I was pleased with it! Yes, yes! I drove a few races and realized that the controls in the game aren't all that bad. You have to brake before turning (if the turn is sharp enough). Physics. But there's one odd thing about it. While you can't harm your opponent with a hit in a race, in derby mode you can easily dispatch an enemy simply by accelerating and attaching your car to someone else's side. Winning a race is pretty easy even on the hardest difficulty (sounds weird, but it's true). The real problem here is the opponent's intelligence. In general, many most likely simply did not know what else to accuse this game of, but I can say one thing: in many cases, these accusations were unjustified.

column9: The game's optimization and performance are not as good as 2. I feel that this is the worst version so far. The AI ‚Äã‚Äãis as weak as a fool, the car can't drift, and the graphics are like games from the 1960s and 1970s. In short, buying this game is a waste.

I didn't think it was this bad!

1) The graphics are worse than even the second game, with lots of blur, low-resolution textures, and crappy lighting. The FPS counter shows well over 100, but it's noticeable at 30 frames.

2) The music isn't engaging, and sometimes it doesn't play at all.

3) The interface is terribly designed: low-quality textures, lots of toxic hues, yellow font on a yellow background, and so on. It's not pleasant to look at!

4) The physics are absolutely cardboard, with opponents moving like they're on rails at unrealistic speeds.

In the end, the game doesn't feel like a continuation of the series; it feels like it's from the early 2000s. I don't recommend buying it; you won't play it anyway.

A "game" that tarnishes the series' reputation and is certainly not worth your time. Flatout, Flatout 2, and Flatout ULTMATE CARNAGE are excellent in their gameplay, visuals, soundtrack, and artificial intelligence.
This game is awful, resembling browser-based Flash games... its "music" is that tired "electronic flatulence," and the gameplay is utterly incompetent.
Unless you're an achievement fanatic, I see NO other reason than to buy the franchise package on sale.
Do yourself a favor and stay away from it.

column8:
"Tell your friends why they should buy this game!"

Because I apparently hate them? I mean, if I'm going to tell a person to buy this, GENUINELY, I clearly have ill intent.

I loved FO1 and FO2. They will be forever staples of soft-body arcade racing games in my book, but this? I have no idea what I just played for three minutes, but in apparently five years (FO2 was 2006, FO3 was 2011) quality tanked, frame rate spiked, and texture models were literally expelled from a baby chimp, labeled as a racing game, and then sold on a gaming community called "Steam".

Just get FO2, crack open a cold beverage of your choice, and call it a day.

Post. Script.:
So I know I said "three minutes" and it turns out I had to play it for two more minutes before I could post a review. As each minute passed as I tried to complete a race or two, my virulent rage grew by every half minute.

F*CK YOU FOR MAKING ME PLAY THIS GAME ANY LONGER THAN I WANTED TO.

column8:
This game is tagged as psychological horror for a reason. When you realize you spent money to purchase this game, it will leave you with such an overwhelming sense of dread, you will need to be checked into the psych ward of the nearest hospital.

I wanted to enjoy this game, having enjoyed the first 2 games as much as I did. Instead I'm left with this scar on my Steam library, a constant reminder of how life serves to accomplish nothing more than total destruction of hopes and dreams. 

Thank you Team 6 Studios. Truly the best psychological horror game I've ever played.

column9: Both the graphics, controls, and gameplay are FAR inferior to the second installment. The first installment has fewer bugs and glitches than the third, even though the first one is almost five years older! In the five hours of gameplay, I fell out of the map about twelve times; in some places, you simply fall through the floor mid-run. I'll probably only play this game once more. For a YouTube video, after which it will probably be in my library as one of those "games I only play again when I've forgotten what the game was like." It's a shame, really; they could have gotten a lot out of it, especially after the successful second installment.

column8: Just awful.
column9: Just awful.
This is such crap, there's nothing to even say about it.

Flatout was one of my favorite games as a child. While my friends were trying to conquer Underground 2 in fancy chrome cars, I was wreaking havoc in rusty jalopies, and I found it far more enjoyable than tuning and other trendy features of racing games at the time. Of particular interest to me, of course, was the stunt mode, as it was the first game where you could launch a driver into free flight.

I can't say anything about the second game, as my computer was quite old when it came out, so Flatout 2 (like many other games) passed me by, or even drove past, losing parts.

When I first saw screenshots of the third game in the series, I had a strange premonition, as if I'd seen something like this before. And, unfortunately, my premonition was right. From here, let's begin the scolding.

First things first

First of all, I'd like to say a few kind words about the creators of this masterpiece. There's a company in Russia called "Media-Service 2000," which specializes in so-called "supermarket games"‚Äîlow-budget, high-quality creations. They primarily focus on releasing various half-baked shooters. Team6 is a sister company to our trash-making company, but with a different focus‚Äîarcade racing.

I'm sure many of you have seen at least one of this company's games: Taxi 3: eXtreme Rush, Shanghai Street Racer, German Street Racing, etc. These are very low-quality racing games, with terrible controls, no physics, and rather mediocre graphics. The latter is the only thing that has changed in this company's games. Overall, there have been no changes to either the engine or the gameplay.

Flatout 3 isn't one iota different from its predecessors. Let's look at each component separately.
I only lasted through two game modes ‚Äì the regular race and the stunt mode. I turned off the first one after barely making it through the first lap. All you do in this mode is explode, fly off the track, explode again, stare at a pile of sparks and smoke, and a pile of scrap metal that Team6 tried to pass off as cars... Oh yeah, did I mention you'll EXPLODE?

I spent a little longer on the second mode. The first stunt is to hit the target, safely navigating a huge windmill. It seems like there's nothing difficult about it. The difficulty is that you only have ONE try, and you have to hit the CENTER. I tried it about 20 times, and finally managed it, even though I'd given up. But after the second stunt, I gave up on the hopeless task. Maybe I did something wrong, but I just couldn't get over that hill.

Overall, the gameplay is atrocious, to say the least. Although if you enjoy watching 16 cars splattered on the track, peppered with smoke and sparks, then go for it. I'll keep going.

The only thing Team6 has improved is the game's graphics. Compared to everything else, it's not that bad. Sure, it's not Need For Speed: The Run, but it looks pretty decent. If it weren't for one or two "BUTs." The first is the Reflective Bump, which is present on everything, well, except the drivers. Everything in the game shines as if it's been pre-oiled or watered. Okay, when it's raining, for example, it's at least somewhat noticeable. But when the road is shiny and shimmering on a sunny day, it looks, at the very least, odd. And considering the low texture quality, it all looks doubly pathetic. And the second thing, as you've probably already guessed, is the bloom. Tons of bloom, which is an eyesore.

Of course, all this post-processing has an impact on performance. On my relatively new computer (especially for this game), the FPS counter barely breaks 20 frames. As you can see, Team6 has miscalculated here too. If they'd made it possible to disable post-processing altogether, perhaps everything happening on the screen wouldn't look so eye-popping.
There's not much to say here, because Flatout 3 doesn't have the concept of "physics." Cars don't have weight‚Äîyou can safely ram your opponents, but at the same time, they can just as easily knock you down. Some parts of the environment (like fences and poles) are destructible, but who's surprised by that these days? Also, I can't help but mention the pathetic ragdoll animation, reminiscent of Hitman 2.

Trying to control the iron entrusted to us is futile. If you manage to corner, it will be pure chance. You didn't like the controls in the NFS games? You thought this was a real iron simulator? Forget it. Compared to Flatout 3, NFS controls are closer to real life. Another miss. Bravo, Team6!

Flatout 3 is one of the worst games I've ever seen. Entrusting the game's development to Team6 was the most fatal mistake. Even if the publisher went bankrupt and didn't have the funds for proper developers, they shouldn't have gone to such extremes. The third game officially ruined the series and isn't worthy of the proud name Flatout. The final product isn't even worth downloading, much less buying. It's better to go through the first or second part again and remember all the good things you had associated with the name "Flatout" before this abomination appeared.

I didn't think this game was that bad. I was hoping everyone else was just nitpicking, but that's not the case. The physics are nonexistent, the gameplay is nonexistent, the graphics are nonexistent. 10 sticks in the ass to the creators for this creation. Don't waste your time or money on this. Even for fun. It's clearly not worth it.

column9: I had a LAN House and FlatOut 2 was a FEVER online, wow, it was crazy!! There were times when there were 20 pcs playing JUST FlatOut 2, I went CRAZY playing this game with the people online, there was SO much laughter that I couldn't even attend to the people properly aeheahuea... Then today I see a promotion for the bundle of all FlatOut and I thought "WOW if 2 was AWESOME imagine 3"?? LOL... I was testing them one by one, I started with Flat Out 1 (First time I played) and I found it VERY cool, then for my nostalgia I ran FlatOut2 and right away ''7 minutes in Heaven'' by Fall Out Boys played, wow, I sang along remembering the time when I earned money like water and playing that wonderful game, ok, then I went to FlatOut Carnage and ended up playing 3 championships without wanting to hrhueuaa... then I finally ARRIVED AT THIS ***** GAME that is Flatout3 AND OMG IT RUINED MY MORNING NOW, I even felt angry for having paid 5 dollars for this set just for this game, what a horrible game!! I had already read that the game was bad, but I SWEAR I imagined it was an exaggeration, there was no WAY they could ruin FlatOut2, THERE WAS NO!!! I drove about 3 laps and pressed ALT+F4!! The car didn't TURN the curve, not even chipping!! You can brake 1 kilometer before you won't turn over!! And what ridiculous graphics are these?? Even FlatOut1 is prettier! What ridiculous physics are these? It looks like a Playstation 1 game, or rather, a POLYSTATION game! Not to mention it was LAGGING on my PC!! And that's because I have an FX8350 + 8gb ram + GTX970!!! HOW could my PC not handle a TERRIBLE game like this??? I'm so angry, seriously, I'm even going to take a shower to cool off now

Eu tava muito bem aqui em casa, relaxando, esperando minha namorada chegar.
Eis que vejo Flatout na steam com promo√ß√£o. Comprei lembrando dos saudosos tempos de PS2, quando eu passava finais de semana inteiros com meu pai jogando Flatout, Crash, Pes e outros cl√°ssicos. Rindo, conversando, foi um dos tempos que mais criei recorda√ß√µes com meu pai, sempre mem√≥rias boas.
N√£o me recordava qual era o flatout que joguei no PS2, ent√£o decidi comprar o mais recente pois pensei que seria um jogo que me agradaria agora e me lembraria o passado.
PIOR ESCOLHA DA MINHA VIDA
Deturparam tudo de bom que esse jogo tinha que me fascinava quando crian√ßa.
Conseguiram fazer tamanha merda em formato de jogo, de modo que os gr√°ficos, f√≠sica e jogabilidade mais kagado do que se fizessem um jogo de corrida filmando pedras subindo uma cachoeira.
NADA NESSA PORRA DE JOGO √â BOM
Se for comprar um Flatout pra assim como eu, matar a saudades dos velhos tempos, n√£o se enganem, comprem o 1,2 ou ultimate carnage. Finja que esse daqui nunca existiu.
Al√©m de roubar meu dinheiro, esse jogo estragou minha tarde. Terminei comendo minha namorada com muita indigna√ß√£o. Eu tava putasso e ela acabou percebendo, eu n√£o queria falar que era por causa de um jogo lixo como esse. Ent√£o numa crise de genialidade falei que eu tava pu.to porque achei que meu pau tivesse diminuido. Ela simplesmente riu, falou pra gente deixar pra outro dia e foi embora.
Enfim
N√£o comprem esse jogo por favor
column9:
I was feeling great here at home, relaxing, waiting for my girlfriend to arrive.
Then I saw Flatout on Steam on sale. I bought it, remembering the fond memories of the PS2, when I'd spend entire weekends with my dad playing Flatout, Crash, PES, and other classics. Laughing and talking, it was one of the times I created the most memories with my dad‚Äîalways good ones.
I couldn't remember which Flatout I played on the PS2, so I decided to buy the latest one because I thought it would be a game I'd enjoy now and would remind me of the past.
WORST CHOICE OF MY LIFE
They distorted everything good about this game that fascinated me as a kid.
They managed to make such a mess of the game format, making the graphics, physics, and gameplay look worse than if they'd made a racing game filming rocks climbing a waterfall. NOTHING IN THIS FUCKING GAME IS GOOD
If you're going to buy Flatout to, like me, reminisce about the good old days, don't fool yourself, buy 1, 2, or Ultimate Carnage. Pretend this one never existed.
Besides stealing my money, this game ruined my afternoon. I ended up fucking my girlfriend in a fury. I was so pissed off, she noticed. I didn't want to tell her it was because of a trashy game like this. So, in a fit of genius, I told her I was pissed because I thought my dick had gotten smaller. She just laughed, told us to save it for another day, and left.
Anyway,
Please don't buy this game.
There was no third part of Flatout! It's a piece of trash and horror that's painful to watch. It doesn't even measure up to parts 1 and 2.

column9: The biggest pile of dog shite ever created by a human. I wouldn't even let my worst enemies play this horrible excuse of horse trash.

Yeah, I was "delighted" with this release. Unlike most conservatives who grew up on the first and second Flatouts, respectively (myself included), I tried to convince myself that the game had some kind of unique twist. But...

1. Absolutely terrible hissing sound and overall soundtrack.
2. Car and environment physics. A car, even a Bigfoot, gets thrown all over the track when hitting a small bump. Again, about the rocks. While large boulders are easily destructible, you can't move these "river pebbles" at all.
3. Horribly designed challenges. For example, I didn't know how to do challenge 19 until I googled it (you have to turn around and drive to the checkpoint, and that's half an hour behind the wheel of a bus).
4. Horribly designed stunts with driver ejections. Mastering them is practically impossible, and you have to rely on luck.
5. Derby... No comment. But believe me, it will set your orifice ablaze. And yet, that was the main (one of the main) feature that made the Flatout series so beloved.
6. Characters. Firstly, they're not particularly original, and their backstories are puzzling. Apparently, the developers aren't very good at humor. Secondly, all these low-polygon models are incredibly ugly, and when you fly out of the car, they jerk violently on the ground.

On the plus side (yes, don't be surprised, it even has its pluses), I'd point out the decent Formula 1 racing, the overall track concept (the tracks are indeed interesting, but combined with the gameplay, it's not noticeable), and, of course, Moscow. Yes, one of the derby tracks is Red Square. Oh, right, the zombie mod will help you unwind after all the mayhem.

I thought the entire game was a complete sham. There are still some positives here and there, though. But with so many negatives, I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Even if you're not familiar with the Flatout universe. Quote: "It's so trashy that you want to play it. But I don't recommend it to anyone."

column9:
So, I recommend the game as long as you buy it on sale, not at the regular price. Why?

- The game is cool. There are several game modes, from racing to running over zombies.

- Does it have several bugs? Yes, but nothing that won't stop you from having a few hours of fun.

- Some cars are really difficult to control; depending on your speed, you won't be able to make the turn, while the opponents take it as if it were a normal straightaway. xD

- Some cars have less than 50% health left if you blow on them. Is that annoying? Yes. But just be careful.

F3 has several bugs that could be easily fixed, including crashes during the game, but it's nothing that will stop you from playing. It's definitely worth buying the game, as long as you get a good deal. The game has several game modes, several cars, and cool skins. The game is very lightweight, any computer can run it, although it has some issues and seems to be poorly optimized. There were times when it was at 130 FPS but felt like it was under 30, I don't care. You'll play, you'll see the bugs, but you'll be so engrossed in the game that in the end you won't even notice. And there's also the issue of achievements, most of which are very simple to earn, so they're very easy to get on your Steam.

column9:
I searched for games in my library by sorting by negative reviews. This game has the worst reviews of any game in my library with over 100 reviews. It's fair to say it's the worst game in my library.

But after two rounds, I found it's actually quite good!

Compared to all that green-light garbage, it's a pretty fun game!

As for racing, there aren't any serious bugs, and the controls aren't awkward. The experience is great with instant recovery after crashing into things. You can crash into anything, and you can even use jets.

The UI is a bit crude and ugly, the maps are grimy and gray, and the collisions are a bit fake, but those aren't major issues.

Of course, I didn't spend much money; I got it as a gift or a charity gift (I forgot). Maybe my mindset is different from those who bought it at the original price of 88. I also started playing it relatively late. Maybe there were some serious bugs before?

All in all, this game is definitely not comparable to other AAA racing games, but I think it's passable as a mini-game.

Why are there so many negative reviews?

1) The game is terrible.
2) It crashes.
3) The challenges towards the end are absolutely mind-blowing.
But that wasn't enough: I made a mistake by not checking the stats to see that the achievement was bugged.
The developers have long since abandoned this, and no one will fix it, thanks to them for messing up the stats.
1 shitdemon out of 10.

UPD: Great news, people! The achievement for the cartoon has been removed, now the game can be perfected!
It took a lot of effort to ruin a racing series like that! Horrible graphics, controls, physics. Not worthy of the name Flatout!

column8: Jugue a toda saga de Flatout, menos el 4 que salio hace unos dias, y deje el 3 que segun muchos analisis es el peor de la saga y vengo a hacer otro analisis que estan en lo cierto. Solo con 7 minutos de juego te das cuenta que el juego, a medidas que entras y comienzas a indagar por el mismo, tiende a ser cada vez mas malo. Incluso el uno que es bastante viejo es mejor que este. Es una especie de super arcade que pierde totalmente la relacion que tiene con los otros. No debo analizarlo demasiado porque como veran, tengo 7 minutos no mas. Pero sinceramente no lo recomiendo pero al comprar el pack viene incluido, por lo tanto, bienvenido sea y tienen la posibilidad de jugarlo al menos.
column9: I've played the entire Flatout series except for the 4th, which came out a few days ago. I dropped the 3rd, which many reviewers say is the worst in the series. I'm here to do another review, and they're right. After just 7 minutes of play, you realize that the game, as you get into it and begin to dig deeper, tends to get worse and worse. Even the fairly old one is better than this one. It's a kind of super-arcade game that completely loses its connection to the others. I shouldn't analyze it too much because, as you can see, I only have 7 minutes. But honestly, I don't recommend it, but buying the pack includes it, so welcome, and you have the chance to play it at least.

column8:
Tags: Driving & Racing
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from content Library

TLDR: Cant get very far - Die or finish last...

So I am not very good at racing games, but I had a really hard time having fun with this title, it looked okay, and I guess the fact that it didnt require games for windows live and that the xbox 360 pad was detected right away are positives, because i had no luck getting the higher rated original flatout and flatout 2 to do either...

Anyways this game weights a solid 12GB installed on disk, I cant beat the first race, and a lot of people who seem very experienced in racing game say that the physics and the driving is off kilter for this title, so rather than worsen my appreciation for racing games even more by keeping this game and playing it I am going to get rid of it now in the hope that I own something better that I can review and be happy playing.

column8:
I believe by playing this game for five minutes, I have enough play time to give it a whole-hearted review.
The following are my thoughts as I was playing 'Speed Mode':
This game is awful.
Where are the soft body physics present in previous FlatOut games?
The HUD you're forced to work with is an embarrassment.
Who made this game?
Why did they make this game?
Who thought this would be fun?
Jesus Christ, is this a joke?
What the fuck is going on?
My life just got 16 times worse.
I feel suicidal now.
My emotions are getting the best of me.
I never thought racing games were meant to get you emotional.
I've never seen such an embarrassment to the soft body physics racing community.
Who is this prick in front of me?
Fuck you * [b] i say as i crash into him [/b] *
1% damage! * [b] the game tells me when i hit him full speed into a wall [/b] *
What the fuck is this?
I didn't get this game to lose brain cells.
I didn't ask for cancer.
I got it for $5, though.
At least it's almost over.
* [b] crashed like 20 times, because the steering is repulsive and impossible to control, among other things [/b] *
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ ending of my thoughts while playing speed mode
Get it if you want to die as well.
Anyways, I digress.
[b] IRREPARABLE [/b] damage to the FlatOut series, Bugbear did it right.
Whoever the fuck developed this game destroyed everything.
This game is essentially the product of an autistic kid's project in coding class.
I cannot imagine a single sane person recommending this game to anyone,
unless they're just trying to give someone a hybrid composition of aids and cancer.
I rest my case.

column8: Do no try playing this game unless you are ready to have the "flatout" image irreparably shattered. Bleh.
column9: Do no try playing this game unless you are ready to have the "flatout" image irreparably shattered. Bleh.

~I started the race and realized it was complete crap.~

So, after the first and second Flat Races, I decided to try the third one.

I launched the game, and out of habit, I set my sights on adjusting the resolution settings. There weren't any ‚Äì fine.

I continued, and was greeted by the Russian language. "Hooray! Now let's see what it's like to play Flat Races in Russian!" I said.

We move on. We choose a car. It's weird that we have such a wide selection of FREE cars. It's even kind of boring, or something...

And then we move on again. We're asked to choose a character. The choice is much wider now, and sometimes the descriptions are funny. I recommend the Italian mechanic to everyone!

Oh well, time to blow something up! I was expecting explosive derbies, mind-blowing races with incredibly brazen and clever opponents, and fun events. What I got was a batch of disgusting racing games, like they were released in three months by indie developers.
The racing became cartoonish, the brutality simply vanished. There's no divine background music, just a shitty instrumental (although I only heard the instrumental; there might be other songs, but I don't care, it doesn't matter).

I drove around two corners and decided this crap needed to be removed. And thank goodness for the Italian mechanic, I didn't buy it for less than 450 rubles (I bought the full game bundle for 149 rubles), otherwise I would have simply lost.

Basically, this Flat game didn't work out...

1 Italian mechanic out of 10

column8:
This game is a crappily put together cash-in to the FlatOut name, made by a wii shovelware team somewhere in the Netherlands. The funny thing is that this could've been its own game. It could've been called, "Chaos & Destruction Racers" or something. It would still suck by 2011 standards. But, hey! At least it won't forever have the Flatout name forever attached to it, permanently staining the series created by Bugbear and Empire Interactive with its inadequacy. The only saving grace about this game is that the multiple glitches can provide a chuckle for a moment and you can play your own music. Not that it will lessen the pain or anything. I bought this on a discount, beat it, and got nothing but hours of my life taken away from me. SAVE YOURSELF!! F**k you, Strategy First. And the biggest of f**k yous to Team 6. Who green lit this shit? It's like they didn't even check the resume of the developers but told them to make a game regardless! My god! Play Flatout 4 or the original 3 made by Bugbear and Empire Interactive. Hell, play Wreckfest too! Use this crap as a way to torture your worst enemy.

Fun Fact: There's a character in this game named, Silen Einnor. He was in flatout for the WII. That's the Director of Team 6 Studios, Ronnie Neils. So, he's basically a s*h*i*t*t*y self insert in this s*h*i*t*t*y fanfiction of a racing game. Merry Christmas.
