column8:
This game falls short on every aspect that made the first two game so addicting and fun.  At first glance this game may look like it focuses on the fun and crazy ragdoll party games established in previous games, and while I have no doubt that may have been what the aim was, it is quickly apparent that target was completely missed.

First noticable thing is the graphics are somehow worse than BOTH of the previous games.  With muddy flat textures that obviously repeat, excessive motion blur and bloom, and clunky frame rates, it makes me wonder where they were able to pull the screenshots that look almost like a completely different game.

Graphics could be forgiven if the game were at least as fun and addicting as FlatOut 2, but unfortunaly this is where the game is at its worst.  While there seemed to be some new party mode games and even new takes on old favorites, there was no way to know if they they would have been good additions as, at least in may playthrough, none of them were funtional in any way.  Every single one of them seemed to have broken physics as it was nearly impossible to through the drive anywhere remotly in the intended direction.  Many times they just seemed to fumble and glitch through the bottom of the cars, and even it that there was no spectical to it.  Every attempt to play this game was met with your driver flopping a few feet away from thier vehical in unceremonious disappointment.  

This game was a spit in the face to the franchise as a whole, and even the new ability to choose your driver only serves as a prelude to the dumpsterfire that is FlatOut3.  If you already own any of the previous games, don't waste your money on this terrible excuse for sequel.  If your new to Fallout and would like a solid racing game with a fantastic and addicting party mode focused on flinging your driver through the windshield of thier car, avoid this and go buy FlatOut 2: Ultimate Carnage instead.

column8: one of the worst games ever made right next to E.T. for the Atari.
column9: one of the worst games ever made right next to E.T. for the Atari.

A game with no physics, controls, or any playability whatsoever. If you don't get from 11th place to first place within the first 15 seconds, the first car automatically flies half a lap ahead. Is it a spectacle? Yeah, right, when five cars are circling around you, constantly trying to ram and smash each other and you. But the first car is already driving along with a 30-40 second lead. In short, in single-player, everything revolves around your car, and if you're not first, being second is very uncomfortable.
A map that only shows right angles on turns. Whereas before there were smooth lines on the map and a full understanding of the angle to expect when turning around a wall, now there's only "left/right."
An incomprehensible soundtrack. Simply incomprehensible.
Lack of the trash and frenzy from the first three games.
The game is pure chaos and destruction. The physics are on par with 3D games from the late 90s. Just a school programming project from a 7th-grade student at a rural school.
It's no wonder this game gets 1s and 20s out of 100. Out of 100!!!!

column8: Seriously, dont buy this..."Game"! Its a total waste of money and time. Dont let you fool by the name. This has nothing to do with Fallout 1 or 2.
column9: Seriously, dont buy this..."Game"! Its a total waste of money and time. Dont let you fool by the name. This has nothing to do with Fallout 1 or 2.

In anticipation of FlatOut 4's release, I finally decided to play the third game, which had already received a ton of bad press. For these reasons, I expected the game to be worse than 1-2-UC, but I didn't expect it to be such a complete disaster.

- Terrible physics, the car feels like it's stuck to the ground, and the controls are much more arcade-like. It's like playing Lada Racing Club after NFS Underground 1. If LRC's physics were a 1 out of 10, this one is a solid 1.5 out of 10.
- The graphics range from 2007 to 2003 (I'm not a graphics junkie), with some embarrassing textures that look like they're only 128x128, plus an incredible number of graphical bugs (and I only played for 20 minutes).
- Where's the fucking music? WHERE'S THAT 00s-Style MUSIC, CYYYKA?
- The opponents are stupid, they get stuck everywhere, both in races and derby.

Flatout is burning, Bugbear is crying :c

column8:
This game is a disgrace on proportions which are verbally unaccounted for. Don't even get this if you're a huge Flatout fan. Don't get it on sale. If someone gifts this game to you, delete it and just spare yourself the agony of defiling your memories of one of the most chaotically fun racing game series.

It's an originally licensed Flatout ripoff, developed by a different team, trying to cashgrab with the brand name and doing an abysmal job at it.

column8:
This game has issues-true, but it doesn't deserve to be at such low rating, so giving it a thumbs up. I take most negativity falls from the expectations people had, not for the game itself. So what is nice. I've enjoyed formula racing, offroad racing, destruction derby racing and zombie smashing. The visuals are not bad as well. I don't remember music but it was ok I guess but worse then Flatout 2. I haven't experienced any crashes or visible glitches. The stunt mode looks worse, and the worst thing is street racing, the driving model for this one is indeed ugly. Upgrades seems to be marginal, but at least there is some varsity in cars that can be chosen from.
I had some nice time with this title (playing mostly in offline mode), so I believe others can have such too, just don't expect from this title to have anything to do with real Flatout series. Of course 30 Euro for this game is way to much, but fortunately this games lands on really large discounts during sales and is visiting bundles.

column9: This game is simply a failure in all its glory.

A friend and I played Flatout 3 for the first time. Just for fun.

The wild screaming and laughter from the stupid mechanics, "wonderful" gameplay, and slag-like characters was guaranteed, but after an hour of playing, I wanted to puke. The maps are all pathetic and shockingly illogical compared to the second game. I'd throw a brick in the game designer's face, and not just him.

By the way, the localization in the game is simply divine; just think of the STOP button when I wanted to quit after another half-baked game...
@
"STOP MY SUFFERING, I CAN'T PLAY THIS ANYMORE"

I could go on and on about all the horrors going on here, but other reviews do a great job of that; just read them.
Personally, I can't bring myself to call this garbage a sequel to a truly masterpiece. It feels like this isn't Flatout, but a Carmageddon knockoff.

Don't even think about buying THIS, unless you have the Flatout Complete Pack. Seriously, you should pay extra to play this.

I'm looking forward to FlatOut 4: Total Insanity, scheduled for release this March! (Just watch the game trailer) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DcIvz2D64tM

column8:
Unlike most reviewers of this game, I don't actually like FlatOut all that much. I'm more lenient towards it now than in the past but it's still not my most cherished racing franchise by far. So when I looked upon all the vitriol of FlatOut 3, I figured I could at least give it a shot since people were complaining how bad it was and I being someone who isn't a big FlatOut fan could bring less skewed perspective to the table.

NOOOOOOPE. This game is as much the car crash as everyone else has already said. FlatOut has problems but none to the degree of this pile.

To start with, the controls are completely busted. In my opinion, you can't rag on a racing game's control right out of the box. You have to take time to understand the nuances of the way the game handles before you can write it off. One of my biggest problems with FlatOut is its handling, which has a very loose and bouncy feel to it that makes it hard to predict what will happen. While troublesome, at least you could make the car do what you wanted if you were patient and meticulous with the controls. That doesn't apply here. Any driving finesse you could hope for is blown out the window thanks to cars that drift like they're on glass. Using the handbrake is an even bigger crapshoot because it spins your car 90 degrees and redirects all the momentum in the direction of the turn, which is completely awkward. In addition, the crappy controls make racing a chore because you can never seem to get a good amount of distance, having to struggle with the terrible controls more than race.

The graphics are bland (like an early Xbox 360 game) and the camera has a weird fish-eye perspective, especially when you kick in the boost, that doesn't feel natural. I get what they were going for but it would have been better just to leave it out. One fresh innovation over previous FlatOut games is the "Ultimate Move", which occurs when you fill up a secondary bar. When maxed, you hit the button and time slows down as well as makes your car invincible, being able to plow other cars off the track with only the slightest bump. Neat, but hardly something that makes the awful racing worthwhile. Beyond that FlatOut's signature "plow into roadside junk and earn boost" mechanic is still present, which is something I never really cared for in the first place (since, combined with iffy physics, you end up doing yourself a mischief while trying to energize your boost meter by hitting objects the wrong way).

One thing FlatOut has gotten right for me in the past is having a pretty good licensed soundtrack. This game has none. The menu music is just generic and, baffingly, there's no music at all when you race. Why? Part of a good racing game is having fitting music pumping in the background as you speed along. Having NOTHING is dumb as rocks.

Anyway, I didn't get very far because this game is such a junk heap. This is definitely one of the worst racing games I've played, even as someone who thinks FlatOut leaves a fair bit to be desired. I only played this because of the upcoming FlatOut 4: Total Insanity and, frankly, I wish I skipped it.

Beyond that FlatOut's signature "plow into roadside junk and earn boost" mechanic is still present, which is something I never really cared for in the first place (since, combined with iffy physics, you end up doing yourself a mischief while trying to energize your boost meter by hitting objects the wrong way).

One thing FlatOut has gotten right for me in the past is having a pretty good licensed soundtrack. This game has none. The menu music is just generic and, baffingly, there's no music at all when you race. Why? Part of a good racing game is having fitting music pumping in the background as you speed along. Having NOTHING is dumb as rocks.

Anyway, I didn't get very far because this game is such a junk heap. This is definitely one of the worst racing games I've played, even as someone who thinks FlatOut leaves a fair bit to be desired. I only played this because of the upcoming FlatOut 4: Total Insanity and, frankly, I wish I skipped it.

column9: I haven't played a bigger shit :D :D :D

WHAT IS THIS? No, seriously! What the hell is this? The third Flatout? Pfft... Don't be ridiculous! What third Flatout is this? It's complete and utter garbage.

I won't even mention the graphics. Where did the physics of car behavior on the track go? Where did the damage physics go? Where are the dents after a collision with another car? Dents? What dents? Physics? What physics?

Now, in more detail:

1) I crashed into an enemy at full speed, and he was thrown a kilometer into the air!
2) The car recovers when accelerating. What? Since when does a car suddenly recover when using nitrous oxide? This has never happened in any Flatout.
3) I decided to play "zombie" mode, and I almost fell asleep! It's much more enjoyable to do this in Armageddon Riders.
4) I got slammed into a barrier, and my hood and trunk flew off. That's it?? And the dents? Remember Carmageddon, or at least the first one? Remember what happened to the car after dozens of collisions? And Destruction Derby? The car had a hard time after those collisions, too.

What a crap game. I got it as a bundle with the other three Flatout games at a discount. It's not worth the money at all; the top price is 1 ruble and 50 kopecks.

God, why did I even launch this? I bought the Flatout pack just to play it for fun. I played the first and second games a long time ago, and I enjoyed them again. God knows why I even launched the third one. I read reviews, but there's no word that can describe how flawed and wretched this game is.
Don't even install it for free, let alone for money.

column8:
I can not recommend this game.  The programming that runs the game is not up to par with what I would have considered required for a game to be published.  Or for a game to carry the name this one does, but more on that later.   The cars don't 'feel' right, the AI is programmed with swarm mentality, and the cars do not adhere to the same rules the player does.   

As such, I can only say I hope my few bucks spent on this game allows someone associated with it to buy something large to play with in their sinful little ways.   

Mentioning that, there are some positives of this game!   
1) I honestly enjoyed it better (before rage-quiting) than I did the PC-ported copies Flatout 1 or Flatout 2. 
2) It's derby mode is more enjoyable, but then again I enjoyed how the AI acted like bees guarding the center.  
3) In a few moments I'm going to remove it and get 11GB back on my T:\ drive!!!!  AH MAN THAT ROCKS!!!

Do I like this game? Yes

Do I think it deserves the name Flatout in its title? No

This game is great and all, but it seems like it was rushed in a few areas.  The game is good, but not Flatout good.  I'm pretty sure if this game was on Steam under a different name, it would be widely accepted throughout the community.  But when I'm playing this game, it doesn't feel like a "Flatout" game to me.  Flatout 2 and Flatout UC were the best successor's to Flatout.  This game in my eyes is not a Flatout game, but it's still a good game.  I got it in the Flatout Complete Pack when it was on sale.  This game is only worth it however if you buy the pack during a sale.  $30 for this?  No way.  But $6 is a steal.

column8: This game is so bad, it should be free. Unlike most of the FlatOut series, FlatOut 3 and 4 were done by totally different developers, while the original group who did FlatOut 1 & 2, Bugbear Interactive went on to work on their own project "WreckFest", which is a pretty good game. While FlatOut 4: Chaos & Destruction is a decent game, FlatOut 3 is just "flat out" horrible(doesn't help that Team 6 Interactive made this game, a company known for numerous shovelware Nintendo Wii games), with glitches, sluggish cars, and odd modes that don't really fit FlatOut well, such as a mode where you're running over zombies? Only get this game if you're a fan of FlatOut and can get this for $0.99 like I did, because this is up there with some of the worst Steam games of all time, and it's a shame that a great franchise like FlatOut has a terrible game like this. Thankfully, it's getting better, so that's good.

column9:
[b][h1]Problematic but fun
7/10[/h1][/b]
I understand people's anger at the negative reviews, but it's not completely trash. The game is quite fun with several racing modes, including one where you run over zombies. I recommend buying it at a good discount.

[h1]+ Pros[/h1]
‚Ä¢ Achievements
‚Ä¢ Various game modes.
‚Ä¢ Large number of cars.
‚Ä¢ Lightweight; even without a graphics card, it ran smoothly at 60 FPS (graphics very similar to Need for Speed: Most Wanted).

[h1]- Cons[/h1]
‚Ä¢ The game's biggest problem is its gameplay. The cars are very awkward to control, some are practically impossible to drive, and very few cars are salvageable.

column9: Ultimate Carnage was good, but 3 was boring.

After the FlatOut series rights were handed over to Team 6, the series received its worst installment yet ‚Äì FlatOut 3: Chaos & Destruction. I'll tell you just how bad this game is.

[h1]Story[/h1]
There's no story in the game, so I'll skip the rating.
Story Score: -/10

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The graphics in this game have noticeably worsened. Even the second game had better graphics. You can't customize the graphics, only choose one of five presets, which are pretty poorly chosen. The game menu also leaves much to be desired.
Graphics Score: 2.7/10

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The physics in the game follow their own rules, as if you were playing with cardboard boxes. The nitro system was destroyed. Super-acceleration was added for some reason. The scoring system in derby is idiotic. Yes, the second game had it too, but it was better done than the third. At least they added a race customization system.
Gameplay Score: 3/10

[h1]Content[/h1]
This game's only strong point. A wide variety of cars. Not just cars, there's even a TANK on wheels. Diverse maps and modes. Although they could have done without the zombie mode. A pretty fun monster truck mode. Various characters, though none of them have any special abilities.
Content Score: 9/10

[h1]Soundtrack[/h1]
No. No... No! They seriously added blues to a FlatOut game. Shouldn't music be rock? Not only is the genre poorly chosen, but it's also wordless. Not a single word. And you can't skip to the next soundtrack. Soundtrack Score: 2/10

[h1]Community[/h1]
The game was so bad that it failed to gather a decent community. While there may be a few players who liked it, what are the chances of finding them?
Community Score: 0.5/10

[h1]Average Score: 3.44[/h1]

[h1]Bonuses/Penalties[/h1]
Bonus +0.05 - This is the first game in the FlatOut series to feature achievements.
Penalty -0.1 - The very fact that Bugbear sold the rights to the game series is strange. The company itself is also little-known. The creation of FlatOut 3 left a bad mark on this company's history.

[h1]Summary[/h1]
Score: 3.44 - 0.05 = 3.39
Score: D
+1 negative review for this game

column8:
I got this on sale in a bundle, thinking "Can it really be that bad?" 

Yes, yes it can. After attempting to play it, I wish I'd saved the 20 cents and just bought the games I actually wanted seperately.

This game is simply unplayable. Even on the lowest settings the framerate refuses to go above 13 FPS on my i7-6700k/GTX 1070 rig. 

There are myriad of better games in this genre that actually work, Gas Guzzlers Extreme, Wreckfest, Flatout Ultimate Carnage, Carmageddon Max Damage, hell even Clutch is better than this game because Clutch ACTUALLY FUCKING WORKS. 

Don't get it, even if its on sale, even if its free, this game isn't worth the hard drive space.

UPDATE: After finally getting this game working, I've discovered even more problems with it. Such as changing the graphics to ultra removing all texture from the folliage.

Good day, guys and gals. I recently bought a Flatout set, having been a long-time fan of the series, and was surprised to see the third part. I rubbed my eyes, no, I wasn't imagining things. I think I played it all a long time ago and on a pirated copy, and then here comes FLATOUT 3, damn it. I stopped playing CS:GO and immediately started installing this "magnificent" game. The installation was successful. We log in. Oh, damn. Oh, no... it's just a menu. In my opinion, the first game was even better. Well, I guess you can't judge a game by its menu alone, so without a second thought, I decided to start a career, and to my surprise, it wasn't there. Well, no big deal, I guess, but it's a shame. Okay, let's start the race already! I want to smash everything in my path, like I'm a bulldozer at a construction site, or an old lady on a bus, or a taxi driver on the road, or me... But whatever. The loading process is complete, and here I am, seeing this creation. What is this? my brain asked. This isn't Flatout. It's something in the style of Need for Russia; those in the know will understand. After completing the race, I realized‚Äîmaybe it's just my opinion, but as I recall, it's complete garbage, and I wouldn't even bother downloading a pirated copy for it. After the race, I passed the controller to my friend Evgeny. After he drove the same track, he said the game was "good," except instead of that adjective, they used a short abbreviation for a penis (aka penis, in case anyone didn't get it).
+Pros+
-I haven't found it yet, I'll edit the description when I do.

-Cons-
-The game itself

column8:
I've played this for a little bit on Offline Mode (I think), so I had to have the misfortune of playing this thing for another 6 minutes, which is much more time than this game deserves.

This game is absolutely pathetic. To think that it carries the name FlatOut, a series that I've grown up with ever since I first played FlatOut 2, sickens me to my core. I genuinely feel bad for Bugbear, since their former IP was turned into...well, this.

But how much damage has Team6 caused? Let's go into detail:

The graphics are abysmal. Everything has this hideous red-orange lighting all over it, and it just feels horrible - it's not easy on the eyes at all. FlatOut 1's graphics are far more appealing than this, because, well, it actually knew how to light enviroments properly. My game was slightly laggy for the most part, but it froze for a full two seconds at one point - something that the first two (technically three) FlatOuts, nor Wreckfest have ever caused. So yeah. This game ain't pretty looking.

The gameplay, too, is horrible. I remember having an absolute blast with FlatOut 2's gameplay, playing Water Canal 2 and having the Flatmobile soar around and destroying practically everything - itself included. To put it simply, it was very exciting. This is not. I could only feel a tiny flicker of the fun I've felt with FlatOut 1, 2 and UC, at best. Overall, it just leaves me dead inside. I can just feel the blandness emitting from it and trying to infect me. The game often feels invasive in that sense. I played Stunt Man mode at one point, and I couldn't even get past the second "challenge", which I should call "impossible task". The word challenge implies that you can actually perform the task, but after much difficulty. The second challenge, with the giant hill, I can't get past whatsoever.
Oh, and it has a zombie mode, which just goes to show how absolutely little Team6 knows what made the original FlatOut games good.

The physics are also horrific. It feels much less like a FlatOut game, with realistic yet very fun physics (if that even sounds right), and more like a racing game on an arcade machine...at the *absolute* best. In the original games, cars actually felt like...well, cars. You could simply feel the smashing and crashing easily. They felt like they had weight - even the ragdoll drivers felt like they had more weight than this. This just feels like you're driving some weird balloon cars.

The sound design is terrible, too. The car engine sounds sound incredibly fake, not even on the standards of RC cars - which is a huge contrast to the original games' realistic sound design. I was playing as the Unknown Player (apparently Team6 couldn't think of any more rubbish character ideas), and the ragdoll voice does not at all fit - it sounds like a horny chick.

The AI, though, is one of the worst aspects. At least the AI in the previous games knew what they were actually doing - racing. Here, the CPU racers apparently didn't care much about racing and decided to just do whatever. And the AI characters - it truly speaks volumes when you can memorize all the AI characters in FO2, yet you can only remember two in this one - one is the Unknown Player, and that's literally only because of his name, and that he has a helmet, and the other one is that one Santa costume wearing chick. Seriously.

I believe I've covered everything, so allow me to conclude with this: Do not buy this game. Ever. And don't buy the FlatOut bundle either, because it has this garbage with it. Go play the first two FlatOuts, or Ultimate Carnage, or Wreckfest, all of which were made by Bugbear - y'know, devs that know what they're doing. I mean, I would even recommend Big Rigs: Over the Road Racing - despite that it isn't on Steam. That's because you can have some semblance of fun with how utterly broken it is. FlatOut 3 is just sad, hugely disrespectful towards the once-proud franchise.

And the worst part is that it's not only a mindblowing 11 gigabytes, but it's also 75% off as of this writing. Its full price is like 30 dollars, which is even more than the original games. I can only ask one thing: why?

I seriously wish I could refund this game, but since I bought the FlatOut bundle, that would mean erasing the good FO games as well. So I'm just gonna let this thing lie and rot, and wait for a Steam gift card for Christmas, or something.

Anyway, yeah. In quick summary, go wreck Jason Walker's car instead of flying around aimlessly as the girly-voiced, boneless, humanoid-shaped spaghetti creature known as the Unknown Player.

tl;dr: BAD GAME, BAD
column9:
I've played this for a little bit on Offline Mode (I think), so I had to have the misfortune of playing this thing for another 6 minutes, which is much more time than this game deserves.

This game is absolutely pathetic. To think that it carries the name FlatOut, a series that I've grown up with ever since I first played FlatOut 2, sickens me to my core. I genuinely feel bad for Bugbear, since their former IP was turned into...well, this.

But how much damage has Team6 caused? Let's go into detail:

The graphics are abysmal. Everything has this hideous red-orange lighting all over it, and it just feels horrible - it's not easy on the eyes at all. FlatOut 1's graphics are far more appealing than this, because, well, it actually knew how to light enviroments properly. My game was slightly laggy for the most part, but it froze for a full two seconds at one point - something that the first two (technically three) FlatOuts, nor Wreckfest have ever caused. So yeah. This game ain't pretty looking.

The gameplay, too, is horrible. I remember having an absolute blast with FlatOut 2's gameplay, playing Water Canal 2 and having the Flatmobile soar around and destroying practically everything - itself included. To put it simply, it was very exciting. This is not. I could only feel a tiny flicker of the fun I've felt with FlatOut 1, 2 and UC, at best. Overall, it just leaves me dead inside. I can just feel the blandness emitting from it and trying to infect me. The game often feels invasive in that sense. I played Stunt Man mode at one point, and I couldn't even get past the second "challenge", which I should call "impossible task". The word challenge implies that you can actually perform the task, but after much difficulty. The second challenge, with the giant hill, I can't get past whatsoever.
Oh, and it has a zombie mode, which just goes to show how absolutely little Team6 knows what made the original FlatOut games good.

The physics are also horrific. It feels much less like a FlatOut game, with realistic yet very fun physics (if that even sounds right), and more like a racing game on an arcade machine...at the *absolute* best. In the original games, cars actually felt like...well, cars. You could simply feel the smashing and crashing easily. They felt like they had weight - even the ragdoll drivers felt like they had more weight than this. This just feels like you're driving some weird balloon cars.

The sound design is terrible, too. The car engine sounds sound incredibly fake, not even on the standards of RC cars - which is a huge contrast to the original games' realistic sound design. I was playing as the Unknown Player (apparently Team6 couldn't think of any more rubbish character ideas), and the ragdoll voice does not at all fit - it sounds like a horny chick.

The AI, though, is one of the worst aspects. At least the AI in the previous games knew what they were actually doing - racing. Here, the CPU racers apparently didn't care much about racing and decided to just do whatever. And the AI characters - it truly speaks volumes when you can memorize all the AI characters in FO2, yet you can only remember two in this one - one is the Unknown Player, and that's literally only because of his name, and that he has a helmet, and the other one is that one Santa costume wearing chick. Seriously.

I believe I've covered everything, so allow me to conclude with this: Do not buy this game. Ever. And don't buy the FlatOut bundle either, because it has this garbage with it. Go play the first two FlatOuts, or Ultimate Carnage, or Wreckfest, all of which were made by Bugbear - y'know, devs that know what they're doing. I mean, I would even recommend Big Rigs: Over the Road Racing - despite that it isn't on Steam. That's because you can have some semblance of fun with how utterly broken it is. FlatOut 3 is just sad, hugely disrespectful towards the once-proud franchise.

And the worst part is that it's not only a mindblowing 11 gigabytes, but it's also 75% off as of this writing. Its full price is like 30 dollars, which is even more than the original games. I can only ask one thing: why?

I seriously wish I could refund this game, but since I bought the FlatOut bundle, that would mean erasing the good FO games as well. So I'm just gonna let this thing lie and rot, and wait for a Steam gift card for Christmas, or something.

Anyway, yeah. In quick summary, go wreck Jason Walker's car instead of flying around aimlessly as the girly-voiced, boneless, humanoid-shaped spaghetti creature known as the Unknown Player.

tl;dr: BAD GAME, BAD

[h1]Flatout 3 is one of the worst sequels to a once-great game series[/h1]

[quote=Ilya Maddison] Just don't tell my girlfriend what they did to Flatout, it was her favorite game[/quote]

[h1]Backstory[/h1]

There was Flatout once. The very first one. One of the most exciting racing games with massive car destruction. A round arena mode where complete anarchy reigned. Challenges in the form of bowling, darts, and many other games where the driver served as the projectile. And, of course, a career mode with an excellent tuning system and a fairly large car fleet.

There was Flatout 2. And it was much better than the first one, although it's a bit weaker now due to nostalgia. The same modes, the same destruction features, even the maps from the first game were brought back. The only differences were new, interestingly designed maps, car classes, and special trophies for each class. And drivers are no longer faceless men and women, but characters with first and last names and short biographies.

[h1]Review[/h1]

But, as the law of genetic inheritance goes, there's always a black sheep in every family. And what a shame that "black sheep" turned out to be the most anticipated Flatout installment (the third one), which we waited for five years (I emphasize "five years" because a year and a half passed between Flatout 1 and 2, depending on the release date in different regions). What we got, as you can imagine, was a real bummer. The most interesting career mode was removed. Tuning has disappeared, now everything has been replaced by builds with the briefest possible description. Under the guise of "exciting new modes," we're being sold the same old circular arenas where the goal is to destroy opponents, challenges in bowling and other sports, a ZOMBIE mode that seems unnecessary in a game of this type, and about five more modes that make it completely undesirable.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
BugBear made a colossal mistake by handing over development to completely unrelated hands; they've put an end to a viable sequel to a wonderful racing game.

[i]3 FPS drops out of 10[/i]
Old and not very interesting anymore! That's just my personal opinion!

You can play *)

Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction

The most depressing and terrible game in the FlatOut series. Do not, under any circumstances, play this game on your PC, do you hear me? It's just crap! There's nothing enjoyable about it.

The game does have its pros:
-start reading reviews and listening to others;
-everything written in reviews is a misunderstanding;
-the developers will suffer karmic punishment for this act of vandalism and violence against a beautiful childhood masterpiece;

The cons, of course, outweigh the others:
-this isn't a game; (it shouldn't be called FlatOut, that's just an insult to the franchise)
-sound; (there are no proper music tracks in the game, and the sounds onscreen are simply infuriating)
-graphics; (or rather, the lack thereof, as such. Wooden boxes with model cars drive around the map, everything explodes ugly, the main menu is dull and blurry, and turning all the settings to 100% doesn't change anything)
-gameplay; (terrible tracks and game modes ruined by the developers' negligence. They added a mode where you crush zombies, it's just trash)
-multiplayer; (as expected, no one plays this, and most likely since its release)
-name; (this product should not be distributed under the name FlatOut, so as not to use advertising for the franchise and to avoid tarnishing the entire series with such a piece of junk)
-developer; (the game's development was mocked by the little-known Team6 Game Studios, known for its unsuccessful and disastrous projects)
-price; (this is simply a juicy taunt aimed at the consumer, and I'm talking about a 97% discount)
-existence; (An inquisition must be created to eliminate and burn such surrogates.)
-weight; (For reasons unknown to me, this product weighs in at about 10GB, which I can't wrap my head around.)
-interest got the better of me; (I cursed the day I read those extremely negative reviews and finally decided to check it out. What's so bad about it? I should have done that.)

Bottom line: don't even try to play this product and don't even think about bringing money to this developer. All this game deserves is oblivion... There's no place in the universe it should go.

If you liked the review, join my group http://steamcommunity.com/groups/RrrUST and you'll always know when a new one comes out!

Good luck!

Unlike previous installments in the series, Flatout 3 wasn't developed by Bugbear, but by Team 6 Studios. And they seem to be spit on everything that was good about the series. They should have gotten some tips and suggestions from Bugbear during development.

Hands off!

I bought the FlatOut pack. All the races are amazing... Except for this one. I read the reviews and thought, "It can't be that bad"... I was wrong. It all started with the menu and its settings. As soon as I launched the game, just by looking at the text, I realized it was upscaled from 360p to FullHD. Even the very first game had way more graphics settings, and even there the picture was better. This one is pure soap with a Vaseline shine effect after the developer was raped for several years by Neanderthals with their killing sticks. There's no physics here at all. Damn, the physics in FlatOut 2 aren't even that good... It's like comparing Kubrick and Hitchcock films with the films (sorry for calling him crap - films) of Sarik Andreasyan. I accidentally hit a car, and it started dancing and calling out to the gods in the air, as if it had been shot in the gut with a sawed-off shotgun. And at the very first turn, my car caught a fever and started dancing, apparently in praise of the Fuhrer himself. And the music!? WHERE THE HELL IS THE MUSIC!!! I bought these games because nostalgia took hold of me when I heard Rise Against - Give it All. Okay, I have no complaints about the previous games, even the English language only enhances the feelings. But here there is nothing at all. I've only been in the game for 5 minutes, and my ass will be blown away for a looooong time. You shouldn't buy this game. In fact, NEVER BUY IT!!! Actually, no. You can buy it for your ex or your worst enemy. They don't deserve it, but they'll get the hint. Thanks for ruining the game. It's like the fourth Batman movie from Schumacher. A useless movie made for money. But even that is better because Schwartz, Uma Thurman, and Clooney save the film. And here a blow from Chuck Norris will help those who agreed to make this game, and those who approved it.

A piece of hellish shit on wheels! Feel all the torment the world endures as you play through and earn achievements. Afterward, you'll laugh at the interrogations Hollywood shows in its movies. It's a shame they haven't removed this abomination from Steam, or added the ability to delete games from an account. I had to play it for the stats. I hope Satan has already prepared a special cauldron for the developers.

column9:
A completely broken game, full of glitches.

I played countless hours of the first two games in the franchise, and I was excited to learn that there was a FlatOut 3.
As soon as I started playing, I noticed that the car damage wasn't as realistic as it used to be (in previous games, the dent in the bodywork corresponded to the collision location with the car. This one was different), and I felt extremely uncomfortable as the minutes passed. Here are some other oddities:

- In Derby mode, which is a single-player (free-for-all), it was clear that the game's AI is focused only on the player and not on others. As soon as you approached the map's limit, opponents would rush you against the wall almost instantly, making this mode ridiculous and boring to play.

- Some opponents would get stuck in specific spots on the map and couldn't get out.

- When lightly hitting certain walls, the car would glitch and be thrown away. When the collision was head-on (even a light one), the driver would be thrown through the windshield.

- The racing mode is extremely annoying due to the aforementioned bug. Imagine a dozen cars pushing you into a single pole or tree and your car exploding. This happened countless times.

I couldn't detect more problems because I couldn't continue. Despite playing the first FlatOut more than 10 years ago, I knew the third game had nothing to do with the essence the franchise established. Aside from the fact that it doesn't deserve its name, the game doesn't live up to the mechanics of a racing game.

Thank you, I was disappointed.
I could barely stand all the "beauty" of physics and gameplay in one race. I never played this masterpiece again.

I was lucky to get this game along with the other parts for a mere 89 rubles, so this installment was worth the price.

column8: This game is trash.
column9: This game is trash.
This is not a game...this is sh*t.

It was the racing year of 2004. The thermonuclear era of Carmageddon seemed to have vanished forever. Store shelves were filled with simple arcade games and "grown-up" simulators featuring famous racers on the covers, and those who enjoyed creating "hell on wheels" could only satisfy their thirst for destruction with GTA. And then, suddenly, a flashy racing car called FlatOut hurtled into our lives at breakneck speed, embracing the very best: if you race, you go all out, if you smash, you destroy everything!
The "Arena" mode sent you into a car hellscape, where "iron horses," showing no mercy to their riders, clashed in mortal combat. Circuit races turned into endurance races, where surviving was more difficult than reaching the finish line first. Minigames offered the thrill of "drive through the windshield." Hilarious physics, mangled cars, insane speed, and off-the-charts action: the proverbial "fun" flowed like water. FlatOut was a spicier dish, with more chili sauce than food.

The sequel, released in 2006, cemented the original's success, significantly improving the graphics and physics, though the gameplay remained largely unchanged. Alas, the developers ran out of fuel with FlatOut 2. Two years later, FlatOut: Ultimate Carnage, a remake of the second game for Xbox 360 and later ported back to PC, followed‚Äîa derivative effort that lost its former sparkle.

"Never mind," players thought. "The third game won't let us down."

FlatOut 3? No, I haven't heard.
In early December (just a week before the release), a thunderclap sounded: fans unexpectedly learned that FlatOut 3 was about to be released, and that it was being developed by the Dutch team Team6, the masters of trash. For ten years, they'd been diligently promoting the maxim "the worst is the friend of the bad," churning out one game after another, one better than the other, from the same dough. Fears that the studio would screw things up again were reinforced by a terrifying trailer...

The menu is replete with modes, the vehicle fleet entices with a wide range of classes, and the tracks are intriguingly diverse: you'll find the Kazakh steppes, icy lakes, and many other places promising indescribable beauty.

But as soon as you press the start button, it's not the adrenaline that hits your eyes, but the bumper of a KamAZ truck: the graphics are not only quirky, they're also several years late‚Äîeven FlatOut 2 had a prettier wrapper. To mask this oversight, the hard-working developers decided to compensate for the engine's shortcomings with massive doses of blur, bloom, and flying sparks. The result is a ridiculous, rainbow-colored mess that could even trigger an epileptic seizure in a healthy person. Sleep tight, Soviet "Rekord" TV from 1976 with a dead CRT! Your unforgettable colors have been celebrated by the game developers at Team6.

The crazy high-speed races‚Äîthe lifeblood of the series‚Äîhave turned into tedious, hastily assembled marathons. In rally races, it's easy to get lost among hundreds of crooked huts, unable to find the right path. In arena battles, the constant collisions fill the screen with thousands of sparks, making it almost impossible to see what's happening. And forget about calculating the trajectory in minigames that involve flying through the windshield.

Armageddon is postponed until better times
If the overall picture is painted by a digital impressionist, why shouldn't the cars "distinguish themselves"? In FlatOut 3, they seem made of plastic: the slightest collision and the enemy flies into the air like a balloon, or tumbles head over heels. Mighty SUVs bounce two meters over small bumps, while even a simple turn of the steering wheel threatens to completely spin out of control for a passenger car. Of course, the physics in the original duology weren't particularly realistic, but here the developers clearly overdid it, and even the simple task of "somehow reaching the finish line" became a serious challenge.
Destructible objects also behave strangely. Poles, trash cans, and other objects fly apart upon impact, as if the race were taking place in zero gravity. If Newton had lived in the world of FlatOut 3, he would hardly have discovered the law of gravity: the apple might have flown not downwards, but sideways, along a strange trajectory understood only by the creators of the game's physics model.

To top off this whole bizarre (insert the emphasis yourself) picture, there's an incredibly stupid damage calculation. If you crash into an enemy car, they'll take 3% damage, and yours will take a full 10%. Only a suicidal person could see the point of such maneuvers.

My rating: 3/10

I've long heard that Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction is, to put it mildly, a bad game, but now I've had the chance to personally evaluate this masterpiece. So, let me say this straight away: Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction isn't just a bad game, not just a parody of the previous games, not trash or rock bottom, it's simply the Mariana Trench, the depths of hell right under your feet. It's so bad and pathetic that after 15 minutes of play, there's a good chance you'll fall into depression, and after 30 minutes, into a coma. The graphics are straight out of the 90s, the controls evoke a sense of surprise and then laughter, the car performs incredible somersaults and completely disobeys the gamepad. The game is so wretched it could cause a shift in the space-time continuum. But this game still manages to do one thing: disgrace the proud name of Flatout. Even if the developers of the first two games had nothing to do with this hack job. This is one of those cases where the publisher should be ashamed of such garbage. 0 blown-up cars out of 10.
How did this end up on Steam?

column9: (Shit)

Story - 0/10 (There's none here).
Graphics - 1/10 (for 2011).
Gameplay - 1/10 (It's unplayable, the physics are terrible, the cars drive through textures).
Overall - 1/10 (We're passing by).

Words fail to describe this trash! This "game" tarnishes the honorable name of FlatOut and the developers of the first two games and the expansion. At first, I thought it was a bugbear, but I breathed a sigh of relief when I found out it was some thugs doing it.

FlatOut 3 is the brainchild of Team 6 Studios. A game that can cause parts of your body to spontaneously combust. 
So, until 2006, FlatOut was developed by Bugbear Entertainment, which gave us two excellent installments. But then something went wrong, and FlatOut 3 was released by a different company. A very incompetent company. There's no point in dividing my review into pros and cons because there are no pros. The game is completely riddled with flaws and shortcomings. The graphics are simply terrible due to the excessive blooming and incomprehensible image jerkiness, so people with epilepsy should avoid this "masterpiece." In general, everyone should avoid this game, if you can call it that. As for the gameplay, it's not far removed from the graphics. The map is full of objects, and when the car collides with them, it barely reacts or changes its trajectory. The cars handle terribly, the physics are wooden, and it's unclear how the car will react in the next second‚Äîwhether it'll drive 10 meters up a wall or simply disappear into the textures. I won't even mention the soundtrack... In short, the game has nothing in common with FlatOut except the name, which I assume the developers were trying to cash in on. I dread to even imagine the torment it must take to complete this game.

After the incredibly cool Flatout 2 and its wonderful clone, Ultimate Carnage, this game is simply a travesty. Everything is bad, from the graphics (which are worse than in the first Flatout) to the music and controls... I couldn't play it, so I deleted it. I'm glad I bought this game as part of the Flatout bundle; otherwise, I would have regretted the money spent. I highly recommend it!
Good

column8:
Hier sollte eigentlich stehen: "Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction" ist ein Fun-Racer. W√§re das nicht v√∂llig gelogen, denn mit Fun hat diese Gr√ºtze so viel zu tun wie der ZDF Fernsehgarten mit Niveau. 

Ich hab ja nicht geglaubt, da√ü dieser Titel so schlecht ist. 
Die Vorg√§nger waren klasse, hab ich mir gesagt. 
Die Vorg√§nger haben mir ein Grinsen aufs Gesicht gezaubert, hab ich mir gesagt.
Da kann man die Serie doch gar nicht so komplett gegen die Wand fahren, hab ich mir gesagt.
Pustekuchen!
Dieser Schrottplatz ist das mit Abstand grottigste Rennspiel, das mir je untergekommen ist (Pitstop auf dem C64 eingeschlossen).

Aber was bietet "Flatout 3" eigentlich? Viele Rennmodi, Destruction Derby, Monster Trucks, Speed Challenges, Stunt-Modi, nat√ºrlich normale Rennen, Offroad-Action und noch einiges mehr.  Zahlreiche (nicht lizensierte) Wagen aus den verschiedensten Klassen mit Repaints, dazu verschiedene (rein optisch unterschiedliche Fahrer. F√ºnfzig Herausforderungen aus den verschiedensten Bereichen und in einem Modus d√ºrfen wir Zombies m√∂glichst in Combos zermantschen.

Klingt lustig? 
Von wegen. 

"Chaos & Destruction": Der Titel ist Programm. Die ganze Spielmechanik ist destruktives Chaos. Die Fahrphysik ist unterirdisch, die Fahrzeuge sind durchweg kaum kontrollierbar, Wheelsupport existiert nat√ºrlich nicht. Dazu kommt eine nicht vorhandene KI und das Prinzip, da√ü sich die Autos gerne mal bei Kontakt ineinander verkeilen. Ich bin schonmal eine geschlagene halbe Runde mit nem Kollegen auf dem Dach rumgefahren. Die Gegner kommen auch ansonsten mit den Strecken nicht zurecht. Besonders witzig bei Speed-Runs zu sehen, wo das gesamte Feld nach einer langen Gerade die Kurve einfach nicht kriegt und kollektiv abfliegt. 

Die Formel-Rennen sind eh v√∂llig absurd. Nat√ºrlich mu√ü bei einem Crash-Titel nicht alles realistisch sein, da√ü man mit seinem Boliden im Gras allerdings auch fr√∂hlich 300 fahren kann, er daf√ºr aber nicht um die Kurve kommt, ist einfach nur iditotisch. Die Strecken sind strunzlangweilig gebaut, das Balancing schwebt irgendwo im All, die Aufgaben sind repetetiv, so etwas wie eine Karriere gibt es erst gar nicht und die Kameraf√ºhrung ist nat√ºrlich genau so, da√ü man etwa bei den Stunts √ºberhaupt nichts sieht, au√üer der eigenen Figur.

Auch technisch befinden wir uns im tiefsten Atomschutzkeller. Die Grafik ist das H√§√ülichste was mir in dem Genre je untergekommen ist, passend dazu der Brechreiz erzeugende Soundtrack der geschmacklosen Beliebigkeit. Daf√ºr kommen die Karren nicht an den realistischer klingenden Singer-Sound von 1914 ran (ja, ich spreche von der N√§hmaschine).

Alles, wirklich alles hat schon das sehr unterhaltsame "Flatout 1" Jahre vorher um mehrere Klassen besser gemacht. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
0/10 Atmosph√§re
0/10 Story
1/10 Grafik
1/10 Sound
0/10 Spielmechanik
0/10 Balancing
0/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Soviel Schrott ist nicht mal mehr recyclebar. 

[h1][b]0/10 Gesamtwertung
column9:
This should actually say: "Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction" is a fun racer. Wouldn't that be a complete lie, because this crap has as much to do with fun as the ZDF Fernsehgarten has with quality.

I didn't believe this title was that bad.

The predecessors were great, I told myself.

The predecessors put a smile on my face, I told myself.

You can't really drive the series into the ground like that, I told myself.


No way!
This junkyard is by far the worst racing game I've ever seen (including Pitstop on the C64).


But what does "Flatout 3" actually offer? Plenty of racing modes, Destruction Derby, Monster Trucks, Speed ‚Äã‚ÄãChallenges, Stunt modes, of course, regular races, off-road action, and much more. Numerous (unlicensed) cars from a variety of classes with repaints, plus various (purely visually different) drivers. Fifty challenges from a wide variety of disciplines, and in one mode, we can smash zombies into combos as best we can.

Sounds fun?
Not at all.

"Chaos & Destruction": The title says it all. The entire game mechanics are destructive chaos. The driving physics are abysmal, the vehicles are almost impossible to control, and wheel support is nonexistent, of course. Added to that is the nonexistent AI and the fact that the cars tend to jam into each other upon contact. I once rode around on the roof with a colleague for a full half lap. The opponents generally don't have the skills to handle the tracks. It's especially funny to see during speed runs, where the entire field just can't make the turn after a long straight and flies off the track.

The Formula races are completely absurd anyway. Of course, not everything in a crash title has to be realistic, so you can't control it with your car. The fact that a car can happily do 300 km/h on the grass, but can't turn a corner, is simply idiotic. The tracks are incredibly boring, the balancing is floating somewhere in space, the tasks are repetitive, there's no such thing as a career, and the camera work is, of course, such that you can't see anything at all during stunts except your own character.

Technically, we're also in the depths of a nuclear shelter. The graphics are the ugliest I've ever seen in this genre, and the tasteless, arbitrary soundtrack is just as fitting. On the other hand, the cars can't compare to the more realistic Singer soundtrack from 1914 (yes, I'm talking about the sewing machine).

Everything, absolutely everything, was already done several notches better by the very entertaining "Flatout 1" years earlier.

[h1]Rating:[/h1]
0/10 Atmosphere
0/10 Story
1/10 Graphics
1/10 Sound
0/10 Game Mechanics
0/10 Balancing
0/10 Fun

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
So much junk isn't even recyclable anymore.

[h1][b]0/10 Overall Rating
The game is complete crap, don't buy it!

When I saw the name Flatout 3, I bought it without a second thought. At the time, I had no idea a game could be so ruined. It completely ruined all the good impressions I had from the first two games. The physics in this game are worse than in the previous version of Flatout 2, there's no campaign at all, and the modes are all the same, just with the addition of half-baked zombies where they stand and wait to be run over. This is the most ridiculous racing game I've ever seen. I went into a derby, and there were no "bang," no "boom," no "bang," no "hooligan" (anyone who played the second game will understand)‚Äîjust 24 cars, all beating each other to score points. The point of surviving a derby is already lost. The car selection is very limited and meager: there are no divisions into classes like "derby," "racing," or "street racing." The division into classes is now just passenger cars and coupes. I highly recommend against this game, especially for those who played the previous games‚Äîit'll make your eyes bleed, though I only got blood from my nose. I could go on and on about the game's flaws and what they messed up, and that's just after 20 minutes of play (10 of which was spent reading character descriptions). Just think about how much negativity there is in that short time. I read the other reviews, and most of them have similar opinions, and they haven't even played an hour... With this game, the developers have simply buried their good name and ruined all the glory of Flatout. That's all.

- Graphics are roughly the same as in the first game: 1 out of 10
- Physics have only been degraded: 1 out of 10
- Car selection is limited: 1 out of 10
- The choice of characters to drive is large, but parodied: 3 out of 10
- No career options: 0 out of 10
- No ability to customize cars: 0 out of 10
- New zombie mode: 1 out of 10

- Average rating: 1 out of 10
Just 10 F-CK WHAT'S GOING ON HERE out of 10. And damn, everyone who writes a negative review - Why are you doing this?? This game is just for fun, it works like TimeKiller. Calm down.

column9:
[h1]I tried it... and that's all I've got[/h1]

I actually like the FlatOut series, but this game sucks.

The controls are terrible; you can't make a simple lap without using the handbrake. Besides, it's almost impossible to finish first (the only race I played, I barely managed to finish first), the AI ‚Äã‚Äãis very poorly programmed, there's no background music, the main menu is somewhat confusing, and so on.

The only thing I see as a standout is the damage system; it's a bit more realistic now. Still, one positive point will never outweigh the many negative points.

My recommendation is a definitive NO. This game may also be included in the Ultimate Pack, but I think it's better to get the other three without it. I got it this way; thank goodness it was on sale.

column9:
Touching or sad pictures often appear on the web... I think that showing people the FlatOut 3 poster makes everyone cry to this day. I think every fan of the FlatOut series felt the disappointment of buying a triple. I know I have quite a few Flat Out fans on my friendlist, so here are a few reasons not to buy Chaos and Destruction...

1) Absence of a career. Where are the days when cars were bought and tuned. In threes, cars are unlocked for results. You can't actually make any visible progress in the game...
2) Graphics... Rather than the 4th part of the popular game, it looks like an open alpha... The car can bounce incredibly high from the wire fence.
3) Maneuverability... Haha... Missing...
4) Sounds... It totally sounds like it was dubbed by some guy in a garage. Otherwise, I can't explain the undertones.
Basically, instead of the "Racing" category, I would assign it the "Uninstall simulator" category. But an uninstall simulator for ‚Ç¨30 is a little overpriced...

column8:
Racing games are easy to make.  You put some cars on a track, make them drive around in a circle, and award the "win" to the guy who completes the track.  That's how almost every racing game works it's a simple formula. 

You start at easy races, and then as your player gets "skills" you continue to make the races harder until he is racing almost perfect lines 

Flatout 3: Chaos and Destruction doesn't seem to agree with this.  It gives the player options of modes to play.  There's a lot of variety here, that would be a good thing.  The problem is the difficulty of this game is extreme.  There's no tutorial, and the game just is very hard.  If you turn the difficulty and number of cars down, the game is better, but still quite difficult.   

There are no tutorials, which means there's no explanation of the boost system (it seem it awards boost for style points when near other cars, maybe?) and the AI is INCREDIBLY difficult.  If you don't race near perfect on Easy, you'll lose.  Even when racing perfect, you better be boosting.  At medium, you don't have a shot, you probably need perfect boosts, and even then there's no rubber banding if someone gets ahead so expect to lose often. 

The game has the following modes. 
Race, (standard difficult race) 
Challenge mode (Seems like race, couldn't beat the first challenge) 
Splatout! (Kill zombies, race around the track for points) 
Offroad
NightShift (night driving?)
Speed (Faster cars, easier to crash)
MonsterTrucks
Battle Arena (fight) 
Big Battle (Bigger fight) 
Stuntman (a variety of annoyingly hard challenges) 

All of those would be amazing if done competently, but I would say none are properly executed on.  Sad because I love racing games, and high adrenaline games are fun, but this does everything except getting the blood pumping. 

A shame but this is a very firm "Do not recommend"  If you like Racing, Dirt 3 is good, if you like carnage, Burnout Paradise is bar none the best.  If you like killing "Zombies" go play Carmageddon.  But whatever you do, don't even boot up this game.   It's not worth it.

column9:
Super graphics, perfect AI, best soundtrack, awesome controls.

Those are some of the things I would have hoped for from the third installment.

But this absolute piece of shit they call Flatout should have been renamed Flatout Chaos and Shit.

This game gives you eye cancer after just a minute of playing.

If anyone's planning on going on sick leave, this game is definitely a recommendation; a two-minute dose of this piece of garbage will give you third-degree diarrhea.

No, let's be honest, presenting such a load of crap as the successor to a great game is just amazing. The fact that the developers even allowed other developers to ruin the game like that‚Äîseriously, money was once again more important than customers.

Many people only bought the game because Flatout 2 was so awesome, and they hoped this silly thing would blow the fat out of it too. The only thing it's blowing out is my graphics card.

But I feel the most sorry for my graphics card; it barely survived; it almost died while running the game.

Next time, I'd rather buy a ‚Ç¨30 Trojan virus that completely destroys my PC in a second than do that to my graphics card again.

The project was panned by the gaming press, which criticized its terrible graphics, poor controls, and poorly thought-out gameplay. FlatOut 3: Chaos and Destruction received extremely negative reviews from critics. On GameRankings and Metacritic, the game received average scores of 26.90% and 23/100, respectively.

If you're reading this, it means I survived playing this secret project called D.E.R.B.M.O. Personally, I spent 3 minutes in the game, I repeat, 3 minutes, and how those 3 minutes went...
"Hooray, this game installed (considering my weak PC, I waited 2 hours for it to load)... Oh!!!!! It launched... hmm, cool menu design, cool!!!! New modes... sooooo... racing...
WHAT???? Where's the very first class, what kind of cars are these... ok, I'll choose this one, WAA ... Well, here comes the race itself.
"1, 2... and... 3... WHA... WHAT THE FUCK??????????????????????????????????????? WHAT THE FUCK IS THIS??????"
Anyway, I sat there for a minute with my mouth open, and then I went out and wanted to commit hara-kiri. Well, to be precise, what didn't I like and why did I buy this "masterpiece?"
There were discounts on fleetouts, and I decided to take the ultimate carnage (or whatever it is) and part 3, I knew what I was getting into when I bought part 3, but I thought that... and who the hell knows what I was thinking, in short, when I started the race, I didn‚Äôt experience the best sensations of physics, that is, the car was... too light... when I drove it, I didn‚Äôt feel the same heaviness of entering a turn as in part 2, I didn‚Äôt understand at all why this car handled like that, I also want to draw attention to the opponents... THEY ARE NOT THERE!!!!! That is, there are cars, but no drivers... that is, there are cars and drivers, but there are no names of the drivers, in part 2 this was in some sense an integral part (for me personally) I knew everyone‚Äôs name and I knew who to yell at when they overtake me, but here no one has a name, and the cars all look the same, and this is the next drawback. When you start playing part 2, you are already offered 3 strong The cars are different, when you can choose any class, and the cars are also the same. And finally, namely the track design. I want to mention again that in the 2nd game, driving off-track was really tough. There were tons of bumps, trees, and rocks in the forest, and on-track it slowed you down. Forget about that here. I was lucky enough to get a hint that I needed to take a shortcut, but when I started playing, I saw that all the bots were taking shortcuts. I also want to point out the poor map design. Personally, in the time I drove, I only saw houses and right and left turns...
That's how I felt in 3 minutes, and the game gets...
-0000000000000000000000000000000000 whores out of 11111111111111111111% to 0000000000,000000000000000001% 1% other 1% up to 1 point out of 10

column8:
Wow, Just WOW.

Ok, I'm just going to tell you my experience with this game. My entire 8 minutes, That's all I played of this, and that's all I will EVER play of this. So, I've heard past reviews, I've seen videos of it, And I was convinced that this was a disgrace. So how did I end up with it? Because I bought the pack that came with it. I legit only wanted Flatout 1 & 2, and this thing tagged along with Ultimate Carnage (can't get that to work, but that's probably still way better than this). Because of that, I decided to try it. "Maybe it isn't so bad," I thought to myself. "Maybe it's just a letdown and that's why it's lower rated than Ride to Hell: Retribution."

Oh, I was wrong. So, SO wrong.

So, after this thing eats 11GB of my hard drive (yes, 11 Gigabytes of valuable space), I hit play and brace myself. The loading screen pops up, the game loads, and I configure my controller. I choose a race, select my car and character, there's another loading screen, and the race starts.

Now, here's my first of many problems with this game. The visuals.
Why do all the cars look like the toy cars from that Burnout Paradise DLC? Excuse me, even worse than those?
Not to mention the stage I was racing in was completely bland and uninteresting, with only right corners. Yes, only 90 degree turns in this stage. Even Flatout 1 had curved corners in it's first track. And yes, I know this was done by a different studio then Bugbear, the original creators, but still, have some variety in your stages to get the player interested (not like I was to begin with).
 
Second of all, and by far the biggest complaint from everyone who's played this, the controls and physics. DEAR GOD.
The car turned so stiff around the corners. It was literally the most unresponsive control in a racing game I've ever experienced. And the physics? Do you know how crazy and wacky the physics were in previous Flatout games? Well, there's little to no physics here. When the car hit the one ramp in the stage, it was like it was on a preset jump path. It only went up and down, it didn't even turn to the side. It was kinda like that jump in the original Ridge Racer. Except this isn't 1994 or on a Playstation 1, this game was released in 2011. Also, do you know what was one of Flatout's main selling points or what made it fun? The crashes and ragdoll physics. Here, you tap one wall going 30 miles per hour and explode. And there's no ragdoll cam. And it doesn't even look cool. Have any of the developers who made this even play or SEE a Flatout game before? Because it doesn't feel like it.

And now for my last point which kinda ties into the physics point, the stunts. That's right, I actually played a different mode after the race. I tried something that I don't think anyone did before. I went one step further and tried a stunt event.

So, after the stunt stage loads, I hit the accelerate button, press eject at the ramp and.... OH MY GOD WHAT?
If you don't know (which you probably don't), you can pick different characters/ragdolls at the menu. I picked the first guy, who has a trenchcoat on. When I launched him during the stunt, it cut to a ragdoll camera for once. And, well....
You know how sometimes games have that bug where a hair piece or piece of clothing stretch out in an odd way? Like into a wall or something? Well, my ragdoll's trenchcoat did that the first time. Then I retried the stunt, and it did it again. I actually think the developers gave up after the first stage of this game and never bug tested it. You hear that a lot with shitty, undeveloped games, but I truly thought that when I saw it. 

So.... in conclusion, don't buy this. Please don't buy this abysmal mess. Even if you got it with the pack, don't download it. Shitty graphics, controls, physics, this game has it all. Did I mention that this takes up 11GB of space? I did, but did I also mention this game costs $30 normally? THIRTY DOLLARS? You can actually get Flatout 1 and 2 on sale, which are way WAY better than this for less. Even when this thing is on sale right now (at the time of posting this), you can still get the original 2 for less.

I now know why everyone despises this game. Why it's the lowest rated game on Steam. And it's still up.

Don't waste your time with this game. It took me longer to type this than play it, and this was a better experience than that.
column9:

column8:
This is the first (and sadly the only) Flat Out game developer by Team6.

There are some game modes like demo derby, racing, stunts and doing tricks with specific car.

The first impression was very good for the game. Anyway I like Team6 Game Studio's racing games from early years. So it's the easiest Flat out in the series. Controls are easy, not like in Flat Out or Flat Out 2. You will easy pick the pace up. Also a good thing: whe you complete a game mode, it's cars available in other gamemodes (e.g.: you can use demolition cars in Speed mode, which is a fun, even with 16 car!).

The only negative thing is the stunts are really hard, sometimes I don't know what I have to do!

9/10
Legalzim

The Cons.

If you see the game don't get it, want a destruction derby style racing game? Get the first flatout.

Flatout don't buy.

column8:
The worst incarnation of this series; this game was not developed by the original dev team of Flatout 1, Flatout 2, and Flatout: Ultimate carnage.

While the previous titles sported a delicate balance of racing, wrecking, and arcade-like elements... this game throws it out the window and shares little in common with previous games aside from the genre of being a demolition-style racing game and it's title.

Visually the game looks worse than it's predecessor. The two are not even comparable; It looks more like a game I would have expected to play on the originally PlayStation or maybe an arcade.

Game-play-wise the cars have no real "life" to them, and again feel like something I would expect from an arcade game I pop $1 into. In previous iterations, cars felt like they had weight; you could slide beautifully around dirt corners, drift through tight turns, and could manipulate AI cars by using your force/speed/inertia. All that is gone in this game; even the most difficult looking turns are easily mastered by simply momentarily letting off the gas and simply hitting your left or right key; gone are the days of worrying about oversteer, understeer, or compensating for loss of traction. Even the ways cars bounce off each other seems more like you are in a pinball machine getting popped around by the bumpers --- you don't really have much control or force over other AI vehicles so you are at their mercy if their "line" gets in your way.

Also gone are the days of customizing your car tuning. Probably one of my favorite parts of any racing sim or, for lack of a better term, any "car game" in general is the ability to swap X for Y and make your car, YOUR car. All the white knuckle driving done to take 1st pays off for that next much wanted upgrade. Not here ---- you pick from the standard layout of cars, and then you can pick from 2 or 3 different pre-defined "tuning" settings which invariably just give you more speed for less durability or vice versa. But in reality, it doesn't matter because EVERY CAR FEELS EXACTLY THE SAME.

I'm not usually too harsh but I cannot recommend this game to anyone. If you are looking for an arcade-style racing game I am sure there are many alternatives that would be better. If you are looking at this game because you've player previous FlatOut games, then skip it entirely as it is not the same development team and therefore not the same game at all. I've just installed "DiRT Showdown" and while it seems a little different than flatout, it has many of the same feelings and elements and a bit more up-to-date graphics. I have also heard that the original developers of FlatOut have been developing/developed already a new demolition racing game which I will be eager to check out, so maybe do a quick google if you would be interested in that!

Qu'es-ce que n'a pas ? Il n'a pas de physique coh√©rente √† elle-m√™me, il n'a pas de moteur graphique performant (m√™me pour son √©poque), il n'a pas d'IA, il n'a pas de carte int√©ressante, il n'a pas de v√©hicule fun, il n'a pas d'impression de conduite, il n'a pas d'√©quipe de d√©veloppement (en fait si et c'est pire), il n'a pas de logique, il n'a pas d'optimisation, il n'a pas de raison √† √™tre achet√© √† moins que ce soit le cadeau empoisonn√© d'un bundle permettant d'aider des enfants en train de mourrir auquel vous tenez absolument √† participer.

column9:
How to describe this thing?

Flatout 3 perfectly demonstrates the indispensable work of a team of game designers by offering you an experience where the only game designer was D√©d√©, a weekend tuner, who wanted to see cars and flames.

What doesn't it have? It doesn't have consistent physics, it doesn't have a powerful graphics engine (even for its time), it doesn't have AI, it doesn't have an interesting map, it doesn't have a fun vehicle, it doesn't have a driving experience, it doesn't have a development team (actually, it does, and it's worse), it doesn't have logic, it doesn't have optimization, it has no reason to buy it unless it's the poisoned chalice of a bundle helping dying children that you absolutely want to participate in.

If you want to play Flatout, play the first one, play Flatout 2, play Ultimate Carnage, play the Burnout series, but most importantly, don't waste your time with this game.

Note that if you want to get into the world of video games professionally, in any field, I recommend playing this game. It clearly highlights the fundamentals of video games that shouldn't be overlooked in their design and will give you a good idea of ‚Äã‚Äãwhat a truly bad game is.
Cool game

column9:
The game's graphics are good, but because it was made in a different engine, the game looks completely different. If it weren't called "Flatout 3," you probably wouldn't even know it was a sequel to 2.

Some people will like the game, and others won't. I liked it, but there are still a lot of flaws.

-Terrible physics
-Demolishing enemy cars takes a long time, and most of the time you die before killing three.
-Your car gets damaged very easily
-Nothing like FO2
-Poor optimization

Positive
-More modes than FO2
-More tracks
-Cool skins
-Fun modes
-Speed ‚Äã‚Äãmode is great!

I recommend it, but some people won't like it, as the game is completely different.

column8:
When you have played the FlatOut series for years... YEARS on end, I remember playing it on the Playstation 2 when I didn't have the game on PC yet at my friends house, it was sooo fun. Then I had a new PC and I could play UC and I played it for DAAAAYS on end.

And then something like this, in your favorite franchise, comes along. Team 6, you should be ashamed of yourself. It looks like they took the previous titles in the franchise, threw it out the window, went outside and stepped a few times on the box cases, all smuddered in the dirt, spit on it and said 'let's squeeze the shit out of the FlatOut fans'.

That's exactly what happened. An absolute travesty. It should be eradicated, considered non-canon and remade and rereleased by a competent team that knows something about racing games, and especially about the FlatOut charm.

column8: this game is holy crap
column9: This game is holy crap.
Don't play this crap. I wonder if the creators themselves played it?

Let's start by saying this is a terrible game, and I don't recommend buying it!
The reasons for my opinion:
First: the graphics are terrible.
Second: the controls are terrible.
Third: there's no career, well, maybe there is, but at least I didn't find one, and that's a big minus, hiding a career from the player!
And the other minuses:
There are no soundtracks, which are typical for racing games, and there's no DERBY mode, although there are plenty of modes.
The game's pros:
Of course, it's the cars, and the cars in it aren't bad, I agree, but the previous game, FlatOut 2, also had cool cars.
So, my friends, I've decided: Don't buy this game, you'll be wasting your money. Buy the second game, it's much better and cheaper than this piece of crap!
Overall, I DO NOT RECOMMEND.

column9:
Completely crappy!!!
No music in the races, lousy controls, nothing like those in 1 and 2. The graphics require ultra settings and a big PC to get the same graphics as those in 2, with the basic graphics, which a simple PC can handle. They tried to make it arcade-style, but they completely messed it up. It's really ugly, with no feel whatsoever. The objectives are really, really hard to achieve (and I know what I'm talking about; I easily finished all the NFS, Burnout, and GT games on max difficulty). In certain modes, you take a lot of damage when you barely put in 1%.
Don't download this game, it's absolute crap. I've played games from 1998 on PS1 that were better than this.
