Complete lack of physics, graphics worse than Mario, the game isn't worth a dime. I DO NOT RECOMMEND it, don't waste your time.

Well... I should probably start by saying that I really love the FlatOut series. It's been one of my favorites since childhood, because my friends and I could spend hours every day smashing cars to pieces, and it never got boring.

So, it's 2016, and there's a Steam sale. I see a bundle ‚Äì four FlatOut games for the ridiculous price of 89 rubles. I buy all four. The only game I'm unfamiliar with is FlatOut 3, as I've played the previous ones, albeit on pirated versions.

I couldn't spend more than five minutes playing this game. It's terrible, from the menus to the gameplay. Plus, to configure the graphics, this game requires a Windows Performance Index (how on earth is that possible???), which, by the way, I have, but the game refuses to recognize it.

I maxed everything out, briefly decided to give the game a chance, forgot about all the reviews with their horribly low ratings and phrases like "this isn't Flatout at all," ignored the very poorly designed menu and far from the best graphics, and tried the first race.

I can't describe the nausea I felt after just one lap (of which there are three) in the very first race of Flatout 3. I immediately closed the game, and now, as I notice, I've been writing a review for this game longer than I could stand playing it.

My verdict: total disappointment. This isn't Flatout. It feels more like some kind of indie development. Moreover, I think if you gave this game development to even one skilled game maker who loves the Flatout series, they would have made a better game than this, frankly, triple-whammy of a game to all fans of the series. I only played it for the achievements... But after three minutes of playing, I turned off the crap... Then I started writing a review, but Steam said, "No! Go puke or play for 5 minutes to write a review!" So, I turned on this crap...
There's no music, no destruction sounds, etc., etc.!

If it's worth buying, it's only in the pack with three real flatouts‚Äîthe first, second, and the ultimate carrier.

Thank you for your attention.

column8:
[h1]Racing with a Broken Axle[/h1]

This is one of the games on steam where a [i]neutral[/i] option would prove useful.
In its current state, I simply can't recommend this game, certainly not at $30. Maybe if you pick it up in a bundle for $3 or less, or a price tag of $5~10, but no more than this.

I actually enjoyed the game, having played to completion the two Battle Arenas, but it fell short on Racing and Monster Trucks due to one fundamental problem - the [i]handling[/i] of the various vehicles was just horrible at speed. It's recommended in the first race tips to master the handbreak, though this seemingly does very little on its own. Used in conjuction with the boost (or being slammed from behind), I was able to take corners, and finished the first race on fifth or sixth position, but the problem with that was the even further loss of control, often resulting in slamming into someones living room, least for the first race.

Then there's the damage control system to contend with. I completely fail to understand how slamming into another vehicle at 160 kph head-on can deal only 1~3% of damage, while a slight "scratch" at half that speed can deal 5~15%+. I won, and lost, many a times for this during the Battle Arenas, even if did still technically win on points alone; which "feel" like for NPC's points are stopped been counted as soon as the player loses, instead of artifically continuing until the last one standing was revealed. 

Graphics wise, can't complain too much. There's a wide selection of vehicles, colours, and even characters behind the wheels, seldom "repeated" by the NPCs, if at all. So there's plenty of variance on the track. Though at no point did I actually see for example a wheel flying off, or a character being thrown out of the car when the car itself dies off, which can apparently be done in one of the other game modes where you land them in a target following a crash. A game from 1995, Destruction Derby 2, was based much the same as Flatout 3, and even for its time, if you took too much damage various parts of the vehicle would go flying; the wheels included, which then (was supposed too, but aided sometimes.) negatively affected your vehicle control, or you had the hood bouncing around obstructing your view until more damage knocked it flying off. These are relatively small things, but they matter to the overall experience.

[h1]Long Story Short[/h1]

[b]Pro's[/b]
[list]
[*] Wide Selection of Graphical Characters, Vehicles and Scenes
[*] Multiple game modes ranging from Racing to complete Destruction
[*] 'The Stig' reference with the unknown character
[*] Unlockable Characters & Vehicles
[*] Achievements
[/list]

[b]Con's[/b]
[list]
[*] Very poor vehicle handling, in certain instances a 1 star vehicle was easier to control than a 5 star.
[*] Poor damage control system. 'Scratching' doing considerbly more damage than head-on collisions.
[*] Damage control system based as a whole, rather than individual parts of the vehicle.
[*] Vehicle clipping. Occasionally at speed you'd drive straight through another vehicle, rather than hitting them
[*] (Maybe just me?) No, or little, ability to recharge your boost gauge. Tips say it recharges during jumps or causing damage, but it seems much more random than this.
[*] Damage having little to no affect on vehicle control. No losing of wheels until completely destroyed.
[*] Lack of varied sound effects; e.g horns, announcer discussions, crash sounds.
[*] Random unexplained "flatout3.exe has stopped working..." errors, or in some cases, inability to load the game at all according to some users.
[*] No Trading Cards ;)
[/list]

So once again, I cannot recommend this game in its current state, at the current price. 
If you can buy it in a bundle, then by all means. Otherwise, wait for a 80~95% sale, by which point it may be worth a couple of hours of entertainment, but overall, if the developers ever come back to this game, it does have its potential if cared for properly.

[*] Lack of varied sound effects; e.g horns, announcer discussions, crash sounds.
[*] Random unexplained "flatout3.exe has stopped working..." errors, or in some cases, inability to load the game at all according to some users.
[*] No Trading Cards ;)
[/list]

So once again, I cannot recommend this game in its current state, at the current price. 
If you can buy it in a bundle, then by all means. Otherwise, wait for a 80~95% sale, by which point it may be worth a couple of hours of entertainment, but overall, if the developers ever come back to this game, it does have its potential if cared for properly.

column9: The name describes the game. Chaos. Unfortunately, the game does not follow in the footsteps of the successful and entertaining previous installments and fits into the average Trackmania-type arcades. The career mode is missing, the musical subtext of the game and even the destruction mode is based on the version of armored vehicles. If you like Flatouts, stick with the previous episodes.

Give me back the 10 minutes of my life I wasted playing THIS.
This is not a continuation of the Flatout series. Any other Flatout game outperforms this piece of crap in every way. This game has absolutely no redeeming qualities! The Demolition Derby mode is a complete disaster. The sounds are simply insane! The graphics are ugly. The tracks are pathetic. The Demolition Derby mode... oh yeah, I told you, it's crap. There are even zombies. They look so pathetic that I had to quit it for fear of harming my health. Before quitting, I earned the "Combo X10" achievement in this mode, which I got for running over stationary zombies. The controls are absolutely terrible; any game from the 90s had much better vehicle controls. I've never seen physics so poorly implemented...
This worthless game costs 449 rubles; it's just insane! If you want to play FlatOut, get the second game or Ultimate Carnage (they updated the graphics and added a few new features). All the other games in the series are complete garbage and not worth buying.

0 out of 10 windshield crashes
0/10, that's terrible, FlatOut has gone downhill...

Can anyone tell me how to delete a game from my library?

Flatout is just a name!
Don't buy this game under any circumstances! Fans of the series especially!
The car physics are on par with Saints Row 2...

Flatout: 3? Are you serious?

Cons:
Graphics
Engine
Gameplay
Physics
Logic
Pros:
Moscow is there :D
Overall, I don't understand how the third part of the game can be worse than the first.
If you do buy this, it's best to return the money and use it to buy the first or second part.

column8:
this game is a shame to the original flatouts, if you think this is good, you're an idiot, and let me go into gtreat lengths about why:

1: has no damage model. a flatout game without a damage model is like nfs 2015 without customization

2: no career mode. this dissapointed me greatly because all other flatout games had one

3: horrid controls

4: blatent rip-offs of todays popular cars, like the mitsubishi evo x (scroll through the car list and you'll see what i mean)

5: the biggest one, THIS ABOMINATION ISN'T EVEN MADE BY BUGBEAR! this is what really gets me, because it's in a pack with games by bugbear, and those games were and still are awesome to this day.

column8:
Not as good as Flatout 2 but I still enjoyed this game.

I don't know what these peoples issues are. I've used this game on multiple PC's and it's never had any issues.
It was working fine on PC's without the best parts either. No lag on a GT 9800 with a AMD Athlon II 2.91 GHz dual core, 4GB DDR2.

The controls are no worse than other games. Burnout Paradise, Need for Speed.. There's not much difference. I mean, you can re-map them if you hate them, so.. what's the issue?

I tell you to take the fact this game is 12% overwhelmingly negative with a pile of salt. Buy the game, try it, if it works, enjoy it. Don't just take confirmation bias to your head and hate it just to hate it.

This is a good game made by a good company.

column9:
Unlike the previous parts, where despite all the possible destruction the position was the most important in the races, this part brings game modes where you can enjoy the destruction even during the race and finally thanks to it you can finish on the front lines. Even in a normal race, where order matters, I can enjoy the destruction much more - just set up simpler opponents, go crazy and attack the position at the end. But if someone wants a challenge, they can try the career mode, where the difficulty is set high. Others can ignore the campaign, all tracks can be unlocked outside of it.
The downside is the graphics, which are somewhat blurry at settings below "High". The claims don't quite match her. The musical accompaniment is also a rather weak side of the game, it is not very energetic. Well, in Stuntman it is sometimes harder to understand what is actually being asked and how I should do it.
Overall, though, the game is enough for me to enjoy the sight of crashes and explosions, even thanks to the destruction model, which is easier to deal damage with. As a nice bonus, some artwork is placed in the game.
This is just fucking crap, not a game.

Well... anyway, it went like this.
I was playing derby mode with a friend once. He took the bus, and I took the tank.
In the end, the bus won, with almost no damage.
So then we decided to try again, but I took the bus.
And we fought for about 20-30 minutes.
So, the bus is kind of overpowered, but it doesn't make sense.
I'd rather go play the first or second game and race around.
Buy it just for fun (No).

I decided to give this piece of crap a try, to my own misfortune, after taking a closer look at the first and second games. I wondered if this game was hated for no reason, or if it doesn't deserve a second chance. Aa ... The first game is a dud, a flop, and it actually had something interesting going for it, like the soundtrack was a complete disaster. But this... I won't fix this piece of crap even if I go completely crazy. The game is crap, and touching it is a waste of time.

column8:
If you're coming from Flatout 1 and 2, this game may dissapoint. The cars do not drift at all. The driving machanics is just understeer (going too fast or under breaks) and oversteer (on the power). It really does seem like a step backwards even from version 1.

The graphics seem to be a bland mix on a low color pallet.

The tracks are not too bad, but some are rediculous (they are more like off road tracks).

Does this game present any kind of challenge? I would have to say Yes it does, but not in the same way as 1 & 2. I think the fun factor has gone down with this version. Pick it up if its on sale.

There are a lot of negative reviews about this game, although I personally disagree. The thing is, they were mostly written by people who played (and absolutely loved) the first two games. They bought the third one, expecting it to be in their spirit, but... It turned out to be completely different. I also played through both of this one's predecessors, and what can I say? This game is no worse or better. It's just different. Yes, the controls have become indecently arcade-like, cars are repaired when using nitro (making it extremely difficult to crash or wreck someone in a race), the cars are disgustingly lacking in detail and uniform, the music is weak, as are the engine sounds (something partially redeemed by the stunning surround sound), the tracks have also noticeably become duller and more primitive (which is also partially compensated for by the myriad of game modes), objects have completely lost weight, and cars don't really feel it either, and so on, and so on... But for me, as a person with gasoline in my blood, the sight of rivals racing, swinging from side to side, and crashing inspires an irresistible desire to catch, overtake, and even better, wreck them. It's hard to put into words what happens during a race. Everything burns, explodes, everything blurs before your eyes, and sometimes it's hard to tell where the track is, with parts flying everywhere (the special effects are clearly overdone; there are so many of them that it's hard to tell what's happening), and the track quickly becomes covered in all sorts of debris. The car flies around the track, flips, crashes into everything it can, and the crashes are endless... Sometimes, with the next one, it's hard to tell where to go or what's going on, but after a series of flips, you're thrown straight into a tunnel and the pedal is to the metal again. While the racing in the first two games was tense, there was time to think about the next turn, or even relax a little at some point, that's not the case here. The game keeps you on edge every millisecond, with reactions and reflexes working at full speed. Even just driving along a long straight is difficult, or you'll get knocked around and a series of horrific accidents begin. Someone crashes into you, and together we fly first into a tree, then another, then a wall, smashing fences and other junk along the way. Basically, it's just what you need to unwind after a hard day at work and forget the grim reality. It's for this frantic drive and chaos, the crazy and colorful crashes, that I give this game a thumbs up. Although there's a hint of sadness‚Äîflatout isn't what it used to be...

I remember Flatout 1 and 2, they were two great games that I spent a lot of time in, but 3 has devolved into incredible crap - crooked destruction, poor graphics, a bunch of unnecessary crap (like the racer selection), etc.

column9: Trash!

How can you trash the Flatout series like that?

After playing for 10 minutes, I realized the game is such crap it's a shame to spend even a single ruble on it.
Let's start with physics and damage.
Physics... NO! What physics? What are you talking about? The developers don't even know what physics is (I'd like to rip the programmers' hands off).
The damage is just complete nonsense. You crash into some bot at high speed and... well, you'll get a little dented and that's it. The damage in the previous games was epic, but here it's just beyond words.
Moving on to the cars. Some of the cars here are ripped off from previous games, some are simply redesigned foreign cars.
The maps are a whole different story. You have no idea where you're going. You just drift, that's all. You try to make something out through dust or water (and the blurry graphics double the problem), but you end up flying off somewhere or just crashing into a dead end.
Music... Music... Music... NO COMMENTS! I don't even want to describe it, but I'll say it right away: after this music, your ears will hurt.

I won't describe everything, I'll just briefly describe what this game is... oh, sorry, it's crap.
And it's strange, for some reason, it's the third installments of famous game series that turn out to be crap (with the exception of Far Cry).
Take Carmageddon. The first two installments are simply amazing, but the third: Carmageddon TDR2000, trashed the entire series. Well, at least the third Karma is somewhat playable. And Flatout 3, damn. That's what happens if some mediocre campaign takes on a sequel. In general, don't buy this crap, unless you get a discount, and even then, it's better to buy all the parts.

All I can say about this game is that the developers just wanted to cash in.
Design-wise, it's worse than the second game, the gameplay has become more casual and boring, and I won't even mention the music.
In short, this is a game that should be made free to play, and even then, few people will play it.

column9: One of the worst games I've ever seen. After the excellent previous FlatOut games, this one is a complete disaster, made by a different developer.

Well... I should probably start by saying that I really love the FlatOut series. It's been one of my favorites since childhood, because my friends and I could spend hours every day smashing cars to pieces, and it never got boring.

So, it's 2015, and there's a New Year's sale on Steam. I see a bundle ‚Äì four FlatOut games for the ridiculous price of 89 rubles. I buy all four. And the only game I'm unfamiliar with is FlatOut 3, since I've played the previous ones, albeit on pirated versions.

I couldn't spend more than five minutes playing this game. It's terrible, from the menus to the gameplay. Plus, to configure the graphics, this game requires a Windows Performance Index (how on earth is that possible???), which, by the way, I have, but the game refuses to recognize it.

I maxed everything out, briefly decided to give the game a chance, forgot about all the reviews with their horribly low ratings and phrases like "this isn't Flatout at all," ignored the very poorly designed menu and far from the best graphics, and tried the first race.

I can't describe the nausea I felt after just one lap (of which there are three) in the very first race of Flatout 3. I immediately closed the game, and now, as I notice, I've been writing a review for this game longer than I could stand playing it.

My verdict: total disappointment. This isn't Flatout. It feels more like some kind of indie development. Moreover, I think if you gave this game development to even one skilled game maker who loves the Flatout series, they would have made a better game than this, frankly, triple-whammy of a game to all fans of the series.

If it's worth buying, it should only be in a pack with three true flatouts‚Äîthe first, second, and ultimate.

Thank you for your attention.
This is just crap... I expected so much more from Flatout 3. It can't even be compared to Part 2. It's terrible. 4/10

column9: It's stupid not to take it

If you were expecting a good racing game with realistic physics and stunning graphics, get ready... to wait. Enjoy a game you'll never forget, because it's impossible to forget being covered in feces for money. A game that was created as an iron-punching simulator, because not everyone can afford two irons. Spend seven minutes playing, and when you realize your chair is melting from righteous anger, throw your computer out the window.
Creators: Anuso-Razdiramuso, nyetzhnjE, Golden Rain, and, of course, Futility of Existence.
Starring: Cardboard cars, characters that would be better drawn by an epileptic paraplegic, and the same old song.
Shitout 3
P.S. I give it a thumbs up because this game solves environmental problems by collecting all the trash.

If you're reading this, it means I survived playing this secret project called D.E.R.L.M.O. Personally, I spent 2 hours in the game, I repeat, 2 hours, and how those 2 hours went...
"Hooray, this game installed (considering my weak PC, I waited 2 hours for it to load)... Oh!!!!! It launched... hmm, cool menu design, cool!!!! New modes... sooooo... racing...
WHAT???? Where's the very first class, what kind of cars are these... ok, I'll choose this one, WAA ... "Racing, WAA ... There were discounts on floatouts, and I decided to take the ultimate carnage (or whatever it is) and part 3, I knew what I was getting into when I bought part 3, but I thought that... and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• knows what I was thinking, in short, when I started the race, I didn‚Äôt experience the best sensations of physics, that is, the car was... too light... when I drove it, I didn‚Äôt feel the same heaviness of entering a turn as in part 2, I didn‚Äôt understand at all why this car handles like that, I also want to draw attention to the rivals... THEY ARE NOT THERE!!!!! That is, there are cars, but no drivers... that is, there are cars and drivers, but there are no names of drivers, in part 2 this was in some sense an integral part (for me personally) I knew whose name and I knew who to yell at when they overtake me, but here no one has a name, and the cars all look the same, and this is the next drawback. When When you start playing Part 2, you're already offered three very different cars, while here you can choose any class, and the cars are also identical. And finally, namely the track design. I want to mention again that in Part 2, driving off-track was very difficult; there were tons of bumps, trees, and rocks in the forest, and it slowed you down on the track. But forget about that here. Personally, I was so lucky that I got a hint that I needed to take a shortcut, but when I started playing, I saw that all the bots were taking shortcuts. And I also want to note the poor map design. Personally, in the time I drove, I only saw houses and right and left turns...
That's how I felt in 3 minutes, and the game gets...

What did they even give me?
The second game was simply the best racing game I've ever played. But, to my deepest regret, Team 6 Studios decided to take on the third game. And what happened? The graphics and soundtrack are worse than in FlatOut 2 and FlatOut: Ultimate Carnage; the interface is truly pathetic. Races begin with nitro, which refills automatically, completely ruining the game's crash potential‚Äîthe very thing that made the FlatOut series so beloved.
We could talk about the physics in the game forever, but everything I'd say leans toward the fact that it simply DOESN'T exist. The slightest hit against a wall can cause your car to explode. Trying to ram into an opponent's car will only result in their car flying up, bouncing, etc.; If it crashes into a pole, it will, at best, simply dissolve; at worst, it will fly into the sky or fall into the ground.
From all this, we can conclude that we were given a piece of crap instead of the second part, which was amazing for its time. Don't waste your time or money on this "game," especially if you've played the previous games in the series.

Wow, just... wow. I know people are saying this game is bad but you have no idea until you've played it. I honestly don't know what they're smoking to be charging ¬£24.99 for this. It's just awful. You know a game is bad when half the recommended reviews are negative reviews. 

The graphics, especially on the cars themselves are terrible, even for 2011 and on top of that it runs like shit on Ultra and I couldn't stomach what I saw when I turned the graphics down a few notches. I don't even think it has a licensed soundtrack which is like, 70% of what makes any racing game good (for me, I'm well aware the percentage is a lot lower for most). They should erase this game from existence and call Ultimate Carnage FlatOut 3. Unless you buy this in a bundle with the others don't ever let this one near your library. You will get a headache like Michael Flatley was dancing on your face.

column8:
Dieses "Flatout" m√ºsste eigentlich schon als Betrug deklariert werden. Wer wie ich die beiden Vorg√§nger kennt und diese mag, wird hier sowas von auf den Kopf gesto√üen, dass es schmerzt. Da habe ich mich wirklich vom Titel und den Trailern t√§uschen lassen - bei einem Rennspiel kann man eh nicht viel falsch machen, dachte ich mir. Weit gefehlt!
Nun zum Spiel in Stichworten:
- Masse statt Klasse: viele Strecken, Spielmodi und Fahrzeuge machen KEIN gutes Spiel, wenn sie derart lieblos zusammengest√ºckelt werden
- Realismus: nein, ein Fun-Racer muss nicht gerade realistisch sein, aber es sollte sich so anf√ºhlen. Gerade die Vorg√§nger zeigten, wie man realistische Umgebungen mit abgedrehten Stunts kombiniert
- Stichwort Stunts: eines der Highlights war immer der Stunt-Modus, in dem man in verschiedenen sport-√§hnlichen Disziplinen Punkte sammeln konnte. Sogar meine Frau hat hier die eine oder andere Partie mitgespielt. Hier wurde aus diesem Modus nur noch ein verbugtes Grundger√ºst belassen. Kein "Sport" mehr, sondern nur noch "Schrott"
- Steuerung: k a t a s t r o p h a l ! ! ! Ich kann mich grunds√§tzlich mit nicht-eing√§ngigen Steuerungen arrangieren und spielte auch Dark Souls ohne Gamepad, aber was hier abgeht, ist nicht mal mehr als Witz zu bezeichnen. Ungenau, hakelig, f√ºhlt sich unecht und hektisch an - Pr√§zsion unm√∂glich. Und das bei einem Rennspiel, wo es um Sekundenbruchteile gehen kann.
- Grafik: gar nicht mal so √ºbel, aber dennoch schlechter als die der beiden Vorg√§nger, wo man sich noch um Design und dezente Physikeffekte ben√ºht hat. hier eckt man einfach st√§ndig irgendwo an und sieht von der eigenen Karre eigentlich nur das Geflimmer des Respawns. 
- Sound: nicht besonderes, was man ja auch nicht unbedingt erwartet. Dass das aber besser geht, haben ebenfalls schon Teil 1 und 2 gezeigt.
- Preis: FRECHHEIT! Ich konnte das Spiel immerhin zu 80% verg√ºnstigt erwerben, aber selbst dieser Betrag ist mir zu schade. 
- Spieldesign: kein Karrieremodus (bzw. hier: gewinn jedes Rennen mit Platz 1 und es geht weiter; sonst eben nicht!), keine Motivation f√ºr Tuning, kein Spa√ü, es sei denn, man findet es witzig, st√§ndig zu versagen, weil nichts funktioniert, keine Eing√§ngigkeit - NICHTS! Nur ein hingeklatschtes Sammelsurium aus geklauten Ideen, die schlecht umgesetzt sind.
Fazit: ich WARNE hiermit ausdr√ºcklich vor diesem Spiel. Was hier f√ºr den Vollpreis geboten wird, ist frech und geh√∂rt boykottiert. Keine Ahnung, was die Entwickler gesoffen haben, als sie sich ans Gamedsign setzten, aber es hat ihnen definitiv nicht gut getan. FINGER WEG!
Empfehlung f√ºr gute Fun-Racer: Flatout 1 und 2, Burnout Paradise oder das meiner Meinung nach untersch√§tzte Crashday, das auch seine Macken hat, aber hundertfach besser spielbar ist, als dieses Machwerk
column9:
This "flatout" should really be declared a scam. Anyone like me who knows and likes the two predecessors will be so stunned by this that it hurts. I was really fooled by the title and the trailers ‚Äì I thought you can't go wrong with a racing game anyway. Far from it!
Now, the game in brief:
- Quantity over quality: Many tracks, game modes, and vehicles do NOT make a good game when they are so carelessly pieced together.
- Realism: No, a fun racer doesn't have to be realistic, but it should feel that way. The predecessors in particular showed how to combine realistic environments with crazy stunts.
- Speaking of stunts: one of the highlights was always the stunt mode, where you could score points in various sport-like disciplines. Even my wife played a game or two. This mode has been reduced to a buggy basic structure. No longer "sporty," but just "junk"
- Controls: catastrophic! ! ! I can generally deal with nonsensical controls and even played Dark Souls without a gamepad, but what's going on here isn't even a joke. Inaccurate, clunky, feels fake and hectic - precision is impossible. And that's in a racing game where fractions of a second can count.
- Graphics: Not bad at all, but still worse than those of the two predecessors, where they still made an effort with design and subtle physics effects. Here, you're constantly bumping into something and all you really see from your own car is the flickering of the respawn.
- Sound: nothing special, which isn't exactly what you'd expect. But parts 1 and 2 have already shown that it can be better.
- Price: RUDE! I was able to purchase the game at an 80% discount, but even that amount is too precious for me.
- Game design: no career mode (or rather, in this case: win every race with first place and you move on; otherwise, nothing!), no motivation for tuning, no fun unless you find it funny to constantly fail because nothing works, no catchiness - NOTHING! Just a slapped-together collection of stolen ideas that are poorly implemented.
Conclusion: I hereby expressly WARN against this game. What's being offered here for full price is outrageous and should be boycotted. I have no idea what the developers were drinking when they sat down to design this game, but it definitely didn't do them any good. STAY AWAY!
Recommendations for good fun racers: Flatout 1 and 2, Burnout Paradise, or the, in my opinion, underrated Crashday, which also has its flaws, but is a hundred times more playable than this piece of work.

column8: When I first started playing this, I expected something better than Flatout 2. Instead, I got something very different. In Flatout 3, the racing mechanics are close to none, theres no feel to how fast you go, to how you should turn, its all very different. You just have to be the fastest, not the most skilled. Yes, I do agree the graphics have been upped, but thats not everything a racing game needs to have. Flatout 3 seems to have a lot of good things about it, like the many many many different variety and types of races, but again, its missing the core element, which is the driving. Another thing I noticed was that I were to be given this game without rading the title, I would not realize that this is of the Flatout series. This felt more of an arcade game than a sit-down-and-get-serious-to-race game, its like a 1999 arcade game just with the graphics of 2011. I seriously feel that this game could be improved.

column8:
[h1]Un disastro in piena regola: I.A. assente, modalit√† assurde (zombie compresi), gestione della fisica involuta a titoli pre Commodore (ed √® un‚Äôoffesa per questa vecchia gloria). [/h1]

Anche se non perfetti i primi capitoli vantavano una buona gestione dei contatti, una fisica interessante in cui l‚Äôauto rispondeva diversamente a seconda dell‚Äôinclinazione del salto e della differente viscosit√† dei tracciati. Questo terzo capitolo puntava su elementi di contorno rispetto alla guida: modalit√† zombie, in salsa Carmageddon, Monster Truck a dirigere instabili barili esplosivi e la gi√† vista modalit√† Stunt Man‚Ä¶divertimento che in teoria poteva anche indirizzare il brand verso una maggiore specificit√† e originalit√†‚Ä¶peccato che la fisica dei mezzi e il comparto tecnico in generale cadano a picco rendendo frustrante l‚Äôesperienza di gioco.

[b]Gameplay:[/b] sembra di giocare ad un autoscontro. Agli avversari non sembrerebbe importare di puntare alla vittoria sul tracciato; vogliono solo la vostra pelle: vi vengono addosso buttandovi fuori strada senza criterio. 
E‚Äô un arcade puro, lo dimostra la Supermove: un‚Äôabilit√† che si rende disponibile allorquando avrete caricato in pieno la barra del turbo, effettuando azioni spettacolari come salti, sorpassi a fil di lamiera, ecc‚Ä¶quest‚Äôabilit√† dona l‚Äôimmunit√† a qualsivoglia danno, una barriera degna del pi√π potente dei maghi‚Ä¶il prezzo da pagare sar√† per√≤ un‚Äôauto ingovernabile, come se fosse una forza senza freni.
Il peso e le 4 caratteristiche delle auto (velocit√†, maneggevolezza, accelerazione e resistenza) non contano. Le diverse categorie si comportano allo stesso modo. In alcune modalit√† di gara le auto si scontrano fra di loro mimando piroette di fuochi d‚Äôartificio, regalandovi una facile prima posizione.

Modalit√†: classica Corsa; Stunt Man, ove fiondarsi di gran carriera su ostacoli di diverso genere ed espellere prima del contatto del mezzo il malcapitato pilota per farlo atterrare in una zona sicura (una modalit√† divertente sulla carta che si scontra con un‚Äôottimizzazione scadente rendendo i voli dello stunt assolutamente imprevedibili); Speed, una sorta di Formula 1 simile alla classica corsa se non fosse per l‚Äôincredibile velocit√† raggiunta che rende ingovernabile l‚Äôauto; Monster Truck, ove portare a spasso barili di benzina e avversari in cui il terreno si trasformer√† in una battaglia senza eguali in cui subirete attacchi a 360¬∞; Big Battle, in cui provocare ingenti quantitativi di danni; Nightshift dove vengono riproposte le modalit√† precedenti riviste in notturna e in condizioni atmosferiche ‚Äúproibitive‚Äù; Challenge, che si limiter√† solamente a concatenare i diversi eventi presenti nelle altre, e la gi√† citata modalit√† in cui investire zombie‚Ä¶
Manca la modalit√† Carriera, tipica dei giochi arcade, dove mettere in essere la competizione; quindi le piste e le auto andranno sbloccate con i punteggi realizzati sui tracciati gi√† disponibili‚Ä¶peccato che a volte non vengano registrate le nostre performance, costringendoci a ripetere la gara.

[b]I.A:[/b] non credo sia stata nemmeno presa in considerazione. Gli avversari, come su citato, non si preoccupano di vincere anzi commettono errori grossolani e si fanno superare agevolmente.

[b]Comparto grafico:[/b] animazioni scadenti, modelli poligonali dei mezzi di scarso impatto visivo, level design ambientale privo di fascino.

[b]Comparto tecnico:[/b] presenti bug di varia natura che costringono a ripetuti riavvii; il frame rate crolla in presenza di numerosi scontri tra auto; la fisica dei contatti non √® pervenuta, i Controlli mostrano lag e imprecisioni‚Ä¶a completare il quadro ci sono: compenetrazione poligonale, texture in bassa definizione, tearing e aliasing marcato.

[b]Comparto audio:[/b] pessimo nell‚Äôeffettistica; i rombi, o meglio i rumori delle 4 ruote non assomigliano a nessun suono udito su questa Terra.

[b]Commento finale:[/b] purtroppo ci troviamo di fronte ad un pessimo prodotto che forse diventer√† un cult del trash come ‚ÄúRambo the Video Game‚Äù...se volete farvi 2 risate allora‚Ä¶no, forse non conviene neanche in questo caso; desistete.

[url=http://www.lucullusgames.com/2017/04/flatout-4-total-insanity-kylotonn-recensione.html]Recensione di Flatout 4[/url]
[url=http://www.lucullusgames.com/2017/06/classifica-migliori-combat-racing-top-ten.html]Classifica dei migliori 10 Combat Racing[/url]
column9:
[h1]A complete disaster: no AI, absurd modes (including zombies), physics management reminiscent of pre-Commodore titles (and it's an insult to this old glory). [/h1]

Although not perfect, the first installments boasted good contact management, interesting physics in which the car responded differently depending on the angle of the jump and the varying viscosity of the tracks. This third installment focused on elements surrounding the driving: zombie mode, √† la Carmageddon, monster trucks steering unstable explosive barrels, and the already-seen Stunt Man mode...fun that in theory could also push the brand toward greater specificity and originality...too bad the vehicle physics and the technical aspects in general plummet, making the gaming experience frustrating.

[b]Gameplay:[/b] It feels like playing bumper cars. Opponents don't seem to care about aiming for victory on the track; They're after you: they'll charge you, throwing you off the road recklessly.
It's pure arcade, as demonstrated by the Supermove: an ability that becomes available once you've fully charged the boost bar, allowing you to perform spectacular feats like jumps, near-metallic overtaking, etc. This ability grants immunity to any damage, a barrier worthy of the most powerful wizard... the price you pay, however, is an uncontrollable car, as if it were a force without brakes.
The weight and four car characteristics (speed, handling, acceleration, and resistance) don't matter. The different categories behave in the same way. In some race modes, the cars crash into each other, mimicking fireworks pirouettes, giving you an easy first place.

Mode: Classic Race; Stunt Man, where you hurtle over various obstacles at full speed and eject the unfortunate driver before the vehicle hits the ground to land them in a safe area (a fun mode on paper, but with poor optimization, making the stunts completely unpredictable); Speed, a sort of Formula 1 similar to a classic race except for the incredible speeds reached, which make the car uncontrollable; Monster Truck, where you carry barrels of gasoline and opponents, where the terrain transforms into an unparalleled battle where you'll be subjected to 360¬∞ attacks; Big Battle, where you inflict massive amounts of damage; Nightshift, where the previous modes are revisited at night and in "prohibitive" weather conditions; Challenge, which simply links together the various events present in the other modes; and the aforementioned mode where you run over zombies...
The Career mode, typical of arcade games, where you can compete, is missing; So the tracks and cars will be unlocked with the scores achieved on the already available tracks... it's a shame that sometimes our performances aren't recorded, forcing us to repeat the race.

[b]AI:[/b] I don't think it was even considered. The opponents, as mentioned above, aren't concerned with winning; instead, they make gross errors and are easily overtaken.

[b]Graphics:[/b] Poor animations, visually poor polygonal vehicle models, and lackluster environmental level design.

[b]Technical:[/b] Various bugs force repeated restarts; the frame rate plummets when there are numerous car collisions; collision physics isn't there, the controls show lag and inaccuracies... to complete the picture, there are: polygonal interpenetration, low-definition textures, tearing, and pronounced aliasing.

[b]Sound:[/b] terrible sound effects; the rumbles, or rather the noises of the four wheels, are unlike any other sound ever heard on this Earth.

[b]Final comment:[/b] Unfortunately, we're faced with a terrible product that might become a trash cult classic like "Rambo the Video Game"...if you want a laugh, then...no, maybe it's not worth it either; give up.

column8: Good game
I don't understand why this piece of garbage is still being sold on steam.
column9: I don't understand why this piece of garbage is still being sold on steam.

It takes SO MUCH TRY to make everything THIS BAD.
A great indicator of the quality of work on this game is its very first race track. It's ALMOST entirely square with the occasional 90-degree turn, but these small sections are still perfectly straight. Just see it once and everything becomes immediately clear.
The damage system is completely inadequate. Regardless of speed and impact angle, damage is ridiculously low, making even survival arenas a real pain (in terms of time spent, not difficulty).
The driver-ejecting tricks suffer from poor level design and tight victory conditions. They simply ask you to HIT THE CENTER OF THE TARGET, and to do so with targets that are so awkwardly placed that you have to first try to find them, and then figure out how to get there, because something will always get in the way. Plus, there are parody drivers like the Postal Dude, Vin(t) Diesel, Agent 47, Mario, and the Joker's friend-zoned woman (Harley Quinn), along with cars clearly based on real-life prototypes with more descriptive names (a common practice in racing games, though).
You shouldn't buy it under any circumstances, even in the package with all the Flatouts (even with an 80% discount, I'm thinking "I'd rather have bought chips"), which didn't even work on Steam, unlike that disastrous 3rd installment from other developers.

Joguei o primeiro FlatOut e amei. Ent√£o, joguei o FlatOut 2, e amei mais ainda. Mas o 3 simplesmente me decepcionou, e arrisco dizer que decepcionou TODOS os f√£s do FlatOut.
A Engine, tanto f√≠sica quando gr√°fica √© uma droga. O FO2 consegue ser mais antigo e mais avan√ßado, mais bem elaborado que isso.

Sinceramente, n√£o vale nem um centavo. A Team6 pegou o jogo da BugBear e massacrou tudo que podia. Esse jogo √© tudo, exceto um "FlatOut". Ainda bem que a BugBear retornou e salvou tudo fazendo o FO: Ultimate Carnage (o quarto jogo), que √©, antes de mais nada, um remake maravilhoso do FO2.

Comprei ele no FlatOut Complete Pack, porque julguei ser t√£o bom quanto os demais, mas se soubesse, teria comprado tudo √† parte.

Se eu pudesse dar uma nota √† esse jogo, daria -50, que √© o pre√ßo que ele vale atualmente. Al√©m de ser o FlatOut mais caro entre os 4, √© o pior deles.
column9:
I played the first FlatOut and loved it. Then I played FlatOut 2, and loved it even more. But FlatOut 3 simply disappointed me, and I dare say it disappointed ALL FlatOut fans.
The engine, both physics and graphics, is rubbish. FO2 manages to be older and more advanced, more well-crafted than this.

Honestly, it's not worth a dime. Team6 took BugBear's game and butchered everything they could. This game is everything but a "FlatOut." Thankfully, BugBear came back and saved everything by making FO: Ultimate Carnage (the fourth game), which is, first and foremost, a wonderful remake of FO2.

I bought it in the FlatOut Complete Pack because I thought it was as good as the others, but if I had known, I would have bought everything separately.

If I could give this game a rating, I would give it a -50, which is its current price. Besides being the most expensive FlatOut among the 4, it is the worst of them.
Terrible......

column8: Probably the worse game ever made.
column9: Probably the worse game ever made.

column8:
I really loved Flatout 1, then Flatout 2 and Flatout Ultimate Carnage (although they were pretty much the same game, the latter graphically a bit tuned up and "more to do"). So, since I bought the FO1/FO2/FOUC/FO3 package, why not play Flatout 3 although I've heard some pretty nasty stuff about it. Note: one of my Steam friends told me to keep my memory of Flatout as it was: when I did install, he uttered "don't play FO3, uninstall and never look back" 

Naturally, I rejected his advice, because I wanted to form an opinion that I made myself. How I wished I had listened. The game has graphics worse than Flatout 1, driveability worse than Flatout 1, a damage model worse than Sony's F1 2005-2009 (and that was horrible) and looks like a game made in....1998 at best. No, even the Half Life 1 graphics were better. 1996, 1997? For the Dutch in my list, it looks like A2 Racer. The first one.

Just one race, but enough to scrape the pieces of my Flatout memory to what it was after Ultimate Carnage. Don't buy, and if you do, I hope you are buying the other 3 Flatouts with it, because this game should pay you to have you play it.

*updated without information for the 2017 autumn sale steam awards*

column9: Someone was either high, drunk or both when coding the driving physics for this game. Absolutely atrocious and not at all like its predecessors (and sequel). Do not buy.

What's left of good old Flatout?
Nothing! I don't know why the developers released this game, but the only thing it seems to have in common with the series is the name.
From the moment the car starts moving, you ask, "WHAT IS THIS?" And indeed, it's not what you expect. Those who played Flatout 2 or Ultimate Carnage were surely expecting something completely different, but this is a complete disappointment. No action-packed action, no coherent physics whatsoever. The system for conducting races in a group is unclear. It's a shame. ALT+F4, close, delete, and forget.
Amen.

I'm giving it a thumbs up only out of pity for the developers.
This game is comparable to a Chinese prostitute. Just as cheap and pathetic ;(

Coole Musik, realistische Schadensmodelle, eine gute KI, eine gute Engine, eine sehr gute Grafik, gute Sounds und viel Spielspa√ü.
Das sind alles Dinge, die ich mit der Flatout-reihe in Verbindung gebracht habe, bis ich diesen haufen M√ºll gespielt habe.

Hier ist eine Pro und Contra Liste zu diesen St√ºck Sche#√üe, dass sich in meinen Augen nicht Flatout nennen darf, da die Spielereihe sich wahrschein lieber selbst begraben h√§tte als so zu enden.

Contra:
- keine Musik w√§hrend der rennen
- schlechte, teilweise kaum erkennbare Schadensmodelle
- erb√§rmliche KI
- eine Engine die beschissener nicht sein k√∂nnte
- eine Grafik die selbst PS1 Spiele abschreckt
- grauenhafte Sounds
- kein einziges bischen Spielspa√ü

Pro:
+ das deinstalieren geht schnell!

Ich habe diesen haufen Schrott mit allen anderen Teilen der Reihe im Paket f√ºr 7,99 Euro gekauft und empfehle jedem die Spiele einzelnt zu kaufen und dieses auszulassen.
Ich habe Flatout 2 auf der PS2 gespielt, es war mein lieblings Spiel, jetzt habe ich diesen M√ºll hier gespielt und ber√§ue es, da es mir die Flatout-reihe kaputt gemacht hat.


R.I.P Flatout

Edit: 
Im Trailer kann man bei einigen Crashes die Ragdolls der Fahrer durch den Boden ihrer Wagen fallen sehen.
column9:
Cool music, realistic damage models, good AI, a good engine, very good graphics, good sounds, and a lot of fun.
These are all things I associated with the Flatout series until I played this pile of garbage.

Here's a pros and cons list for this piece of crap, which in my opinion shouldn't be called Flatout, as the series would probably have preferred to bury itself rather than end like this.

Cons:
- No music during races
- Poor, sometimes barely recognizable damage models
- Pathetic AI
- An engine that couldn't be any worse
- Graphics that even put PS1 games off
- Horrid sounds
- Not a single bit of fun

Pros:
+ Uninstalling is quick!

I bought this pile of junk with all the other parts of the series in a bundle for ‚Ç¨7.99 and recommend everyone buy the games individually and skip this one. I played Flatout 2 on the PS2, it was my favorite game, and now I've played this garbage and I regret it, as it ruined the Flatout series for me.

R.I.P Flatout

Edit:
In the trailer, you can see the drivers' ragdolls falling through the floor of their cars during some crashes.

I've always loved the Flatout series for its absurdity. And when the third installment came out, I loved it...it was unique.

I jumped on it three months ago, but the disc was already ruined. I logged into Steam yesterday...and all the installments are available for next to nothing...

I have no complaints about the graphics or physics, because they're trash. When the game came out, I was amazed by its optimization, because I was playing on Ultra with the following hardware: MB Foxconn P43A, CPU Celeron DC 3.7 GHz (without overclocking 3), RAM DDR2 2GB 800 (+ timings), VGA GF GT8600 256 MB. A month later, after upgrading to a C2D 3.2 GHz (default) and a GPU to a GF GTS250 512 MB, I was blown away by how smoothly the game ran.

But apparently, Steam and retail sold different games...
I didn't just broach the subject of hardware... I currently have a MB GB Z77-D3H, a Core i5 3.4GHz CPU (default 2.7), 8GB 1866 DDR3 RAM (+ timings), and a 2GB GTX750 GF VGA. I agree that the hardware is modest, but at medium settings, the fps is 5-7? Are you kidding me?

Perhaps it's the lack of Windows 7 x64 support, because I was running Windows 7 x86 at the time... but I played this game on Windows XP x64... or is it the lack of hardware support? Okay, let's skip that... I'm fed up with the message about the unavailable performance index!!! I can't access the advanced graphics settings.

I could believe the game was running so fast... so I downloaded the game from you know where. And it doesn't have these glitches... the game runs great. So it's a glitch in the Steam version.

Game score 8/10, Steam score 0/10.

column8:
I'm a huge fan of the Flatout series and have played Flatout 2 and Flatout Ultimate Carnage a lot with friends. This game has nothing in common with either of these two fantastic games. It's the biggest dissapointment I've ever had when it comes to games.

Flatout 3 is a so horribly bad it's not worth your money. The graphics are bad, but most of all it's the complete lack of physics - that which made the previous games so great. The cars you drive have no weight and terrible handling. I played this game for 10 minutes, uninstalled it and never looked at it again. It's simply that bad. Just keep playing the terrific other Flatout games and pretend this abomination does not exist.

column9:
It's a lightweight game that doesn't require much effort to complete. There's no career as such, just separate game modes with their own car classes. There's no realistic car physics to speak of, and licensed cars aren't expected, which gives the game's developers a free hand: there are tuned cars, racing cars, muscle cars, and a large number of SUVs divided into classes‚Äîwell, the whole motorsport thing in a nutshell. Everything is brightly colorful and seemingly has decent graphics, but realism is almost completely lacking, except for the cars crashing. Races are almost completely customizable: the number of opponents, laps, and opponent car classes, which makes the game at least a little interesting.
I recommend it to those who have nothing else to play or are tired of standard racing simulators.

column9:
Let's see...

Flatout was (and still is) a great game, Flatout 2 and UC are two great games, Flatout 3... it's garbage.

You can tell it's not from Bugbear; it bears no resemblance to its predecessors except for the name.

The graphics are poor, poorly detailed, ugly, and dull; they also require a massive computer to avoid stuttering, while FO1, which in my opinion has much better graphics, runs perfectly on computers from 10 years ago. The great soundtrack has been replaced by crappy music, the controls are clunky, extremely arcade-like, and fast, with no realism.

If I had known what I was getting into, I wouldn't have bought this game; fortunately, it was cheap. I don't recommend it at all.
How could they make such a fecal abomination?! HOW?! This is total crap! Schoolchildren make flash games much cooler than this... this... there are no words!

column9:
Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction
This is fucking crazy!

This game might have been interesting for the early 2000s. As a continuation of the series, it's not even worth $1.
I don't recommend it for the following reasons:
1. There's no career or story. Just pick it up and go.
2. The graphics and destructibility are poorly designed.
3. There are physics, of course, but the car rolls in any direction like it's in space or on ice.
4. And the race itself: there are two opponents. The others are superfluous.
5. The car design is terrible.
Compared to other games, the first Flatout is better in everything except the dynamics. This game has dynamics, but you don't participate in them.

column8:
I love the Flatout series..I really do love it! And I heard from alot of sources that Flatout 3 is like the unwanted child of the series. But I couldn't believe it..I looked at so many reviews and tbh I thought that the gameplay doesn't even look that bad. So I tried it just now..I never ever regretted playing a game that much.

This series was once known for it's incredible driving physics and its fun races including a partly destructable circuit..well forget about that in Flatout 3: Normally you would slow down when you aren't driving on the track but offroad..well here the speed is always the same and therefore nobody drives on the track. The car flips after every single shit and the environment is non destructable. If you ram a stone then you have to respawn. Also respawning makes you stand still for a few seconds which is a huge disadvantage. There is no career mode and you have all the cars from the very beginning which sucks. There are a lot of modes, but they are either other car models or the challenge mode, where you have to complete 50 random challenges. Also the 'Stuntman' Mode is back, but because of the poor physics it is no fun. 
The handling is so bad that it doesn't matter if you take a car with good handling and bad speed or bad handling and good speed, because the handling is exactly the same..utter bull****. 
The Graphics are slightly better than Flatout 2 but because of the overused motion blur it looks stupid. And the best feature: If you finish below 1st in any race you automatically lose and have to start over the same shit again..

DON'T BUY THIS JOKE OF A GAME FOR THE LOVE OF GOD!
column9:
I love the Flatout series..I really do love it! And I heard from alot of sources that Flatout 3 is like the unwanted child of the series. But I couldn't believe it..I looked at so many reviews and tbh I thought that the gameplay doesn't even look that bad. So I tried it just now..I never ever regretted playing a game that much.

This series was once known for it's incredible driving physics and its fun races including a partly destructable circuit..well forget about that in Flatout 3: Normally you would slow down when you aren't driving on the track but offroad..well here the speed is always the same and therefore nobody drives on the track. The car flips after every single shit and the environment is non destructable. If you ram a stone then you have to respawn. Also respawning makes you stand still for a few seconds which is a huge disadvantage. There is no career mode and you have all the cars from the very beginning which sucks. There are a lot of modes, but they are either other car models or the challenge mode, where you have to complete 50 random challenges. Also the 'Stuntman' Mode is back, but because of the poor physics it is no fun. 
The handling is so bad that it doesn't matter if you take a car with good handling and bad speed or bad handling and good speed, because the handling is exactly the same..utter bull****. 
The Graphics are slightly better than Flatout 2 but because of the overused motion blur it looks stupid. And the best feature: If you finish below 1st in any race you automatically lose and have to start over the same shit again..

DON'T BUY THIS JOKE OF A GAME FOR THE LOVE OF GOD!
This game is not worth the money.

column9:
That's why I played this crap for 0.2 hours, because it's a complete joke. So I bought the Flatout Game Collection, which is: FlatOut 1, 2, Ultimate Carnage, and I forgot about that :/. So, I start the game, the menu appears, I go to the options, and that's probably the only advantage of this game, which is the options. Before the races, we choose our character, which has a different model and name, and nothing changes at all. Then, tuning, any car is the same, only the model differs, and there are no options for upgrading the car's components. It's time for the game modes, this is an important part of Flatout, because from the first part of the game there have always been, for example, Normal Race, Stunt Man, and the most important one is Destruction Derby, which means you can completely destroy everything. Racing, which is a regular campaign, okay, this mode is fine. I start the first track, facepalms fly, I start driving and try to drive this thing, but it slips like a cardboard box on ice, and the grip The car's contact with the ground is very strong, meaning they turn sharply. The physics are laughable; cars bounce back like balloons a few meters. The graphics are crap, the cherry on the cake. The models are pretty bad, the environments look awful, and the graphical effects are a complete joke. And all of this is exacerbated by the blur, which is the worst blur in the history of racing games. The audio doesn't save this at all; the music is ear-bleeding. The AI ‚Äã‚Äãis a complete disaster; I don't know what else to say about this crap. And then there's the compatibility, which doesn't stand out from other aspects of this game.

Let me tell you one thing: don't buy this game for anything, even if someone gives it to you for free, don't buy it. Besides, at ‚Ç¨27.99, you people are kidding.

Pros +
-Extensive Options
-Quickly Uninstalls
-One mode had potential...
Cons -
-But it's still bad :/
-Graphics
-Audio
-This whole game is a minus, I honestly can't believe I'm writing that it has advantages.

A pesar de las malas criticas. lo he pasado bastante bien con este juegito. Pero predomina los defectos: En primer lugar, los graficos son muy inferiores al flatout 2. Los requisitos graficos son una bestialidad. Segundo: Los autos son de goma, asi es, ahora no hay diferencia si usas una lamborgini o un monster truck, apenas le golpeas la rueda y sale volando a 50 metros delante tuyo. tercero: el sistema de da√±os es asqueroso: si chocas con una monster truck a una ferrari, sufre el doble o mueres buggeado en una esquina, en una grieta, hasta inclusive: EN LA VEREDA. W T F ?. Si golpeas con un fiat a una chevy, la camioneta muere aplastada por el auto ¬øque se fumaron para darle tan buena inercia?.
 Lo bueno: Tantos bugs te hacen descojonar de lo patetico que es. Tiene muy buenos desafios como por ejemplo: tirar a nuestro conductor por unas escaleras para ganar puntos, usar su cuerpo para jugar al golf, un rally en donde puedes ganar causando da√±os, saltos y si es posible, matando a todos los competidores. PERO LO MAS IMPORTANTE: ZOMBIES PARA ATROPELLAR. Asi es, ahora esto no es flatout, es carmageddon pirata.
column9:
Despite the bad reviews, I had a pretty good time with this game. But the flaws predominate: First, the graphics are far inferior to Flatout 2. The graphics requirements are insane. Second, the cars are made of rubber. That's right. Now, it makes no difference whether you're using a Lamborghini or a monster truck. You barely hit the wheel and it flies 50 meters in front of you. Third, the damage system is disgusting: if you crash a monster truck into a Ferrari, it suffers twice as much or you get bugged out on a corner, in a crevice, or even on the sidewalk. WTF? If you crash a Fiat into a Chevy, the truck is crushed by the car. What did they think of to give it such good inertia?
The good: So many bugs make you laugh at how pathetic it is. It has some great challenges, such as throwing our driver down a flight of stairs to score points, using his body to play golf, and a rally where you can win by causing damage, jumping, and, if possible, killing all the competitors. BUT MOST IMPORTANTLY: ZOMBIES TO RUN OVER. That's right, this isn't Flatout now; it's Pirate Carmageddon.
The game isn't worth the money and is just crap.

column8:
This game isn`t really a Flatout game, I have to admit that. But it`s not as terrible as everyone claims it is. A few patches were released and its a decent arcade racer now. It has a lot of cars to drive and unlock and there are plenty of modes like Stuntman, Offroad, party modes like a monstertruck mode and Splatout.
  
Performance-wise it runs stable and smooth for me, although I have heard of people experiencing frequent crashes. The game doesn't look as good as Flatout Ultimate Carnage, but it's still about average (for its time).

The AI seems to be flawed, which hurts the most in Destruction Derbys, where basically all of the AI Competitors only chase the player. You can only avoid this by constantly fleeing and only targeting isolated AI drivers. In normal races AI drivers can go full retard when falling back too far, which can be dangerous when lapping them, but is rather amusing to watch after finishing the race.

To summarize, Flatout 3 is a playable arcade racer that doesn`t require experience with racing games, so it could be worth a try for casual gamers that don't play too often. I would however recommend to wait for one of the many 90% discounts, as this game isn't really worth 30 bucks.

column9: Flatout 3: Chaos and Destruction is, in my opinion, a rather underwhelming sequel to the Flatout series. It's recommended for those who enjoy a more chaotic and relaxed driving style. Flatout 3 may not be the best, but it offers a wide variety of vehicle models with which to spread chaos. Flatout 3 also offers a fairly diverse selection of characters to play as. There are fat, thin, crazy, short, tall, rich, and even some pretty girls :p. In my opinion, Flatout 3 isn't amazing, but if you're a fan of the series, it's definitely worth playing.

Graphics: I'll say nothing (I have no idea).
There are a ton of downsides to the game, and each mode has its own issues.

This game is awful.

It completely veers off from the classic "flatout" gameplay, and this particular game feels extremely arcade-like. column8:
[h1]bad FlatOut game. fun game when running properly[/h1]

Did you like FlatOut2 destruction derby, but wished the levels were bigger?
Did you like FlatOut2 destruction derby, but wished you could go against 23 other cars?
Did you like the crazy mini-games in FO2, but wanted more?

If you said YES to any of these, then you will probably enjoy FO3 enough to appreciate it for what it is: an arcadey racing/car combat game in the form of a bunch of mini-games.

PROS[list]
[*]many vehicles & driver models
  -makes me feel like I'm playing a poor-man's Twisted Metal
[*]unlockable vehicles, modes, & maps make it more addictive
  -I wish I could tell you my favorite vehicle, but that would SPOIL it
[*]Multiplayer (for up to 16 players).
[*]Single Player offers good # of game settings to change to your liking (# of AI cars, game speed, & difficulty)
[*]bigger, interesting levels
  -Moscow, bowl-shaped fields, big frozen lake, rolling hills in the desert, the list goes on!
[*]boosting for 3+ seconds repairs your vehicle to an extent & is an interesting mechanic
[*]many levels.
  -even looking at each individual mode, there are a lot of maps to play
[*]Explosions send you FLYING through the air
   -it's fun. it may be unrealistic, as if there's low gravity, but it's funny/fun to watch IMO
[/list]

CONS[list]
[*]no career mode ('Challenge' is the closest thing with its linear progress)
[*]handling feels off & other cars seem to STICK to you
[*]No AI in multiplayer (originally I thought there was, so I'm very sorry if I mislead anyone)
[*]unoptimized (ie: bad frame rate) 
   -depending on the map & your PC setup. Scroll to the bottom for my FIX for this.
[*]car deformation is worse than in other FlatOuts
[*]controls can only be changed/checked via settings, off the main menu
   -just like the other FlatOuts, but is still a bad design choice.
[*]Offroad mode only has 4 levels 
   -the most-fun mode IMO. technically 2, since 2 of them are the same map, just reversed.
[*]disconnects: I have experienced disconnect from the server about 20% of the time & it usually happens as I'm loading up -trying to transfer from- the Lobby to the map. TL;DR= You may have problems playing multiplayer, it just depends on your computer. (fyi, I've tested multiplayer both as host and not- both cause me to crash; I'm not sure why. I need to do further testing on my PC)
[/list]


[u]TL;DR=[/u]
Bigger derby levels versus MORE opponents,
more cars, less customization, less optimized, 
but still a fun game if you just want to have fun and can look past the flaws.


NOTE: I would recommend this ONLY if you spent about $2 or less for this game (as I paid $7.99 for the bundle); but the $30 base retail price is a rip-off.

----------------------------------------------------
[u]Technical issues[/u]
This game was inconsistent for me.
Sometimes the load times were long, running off a HDD.
Performance was terrible on SOME levels -if running off a Hard Disk Drive; I was getting as low as 6 fps on the 1st SplatOut map.

But...when I ran it off a SSD, somehow it magically worked much much better for me & I suddenly got an average frame-rate well over 100 on Ultra. (I had my resolution down at 1180x800, fyi.)

-----------
update: changed 'bad handling' to 'handling feels off, is worse than it should be on most vehicles'
update2: added 1 more con (disconnecting)
update3 (04/09/2017): changed description about disconnects (under Cons) & added Con of 'no AI in mp'
update4 (03/15/2020): after consideration, I realized the physics are RIDICULOUS in this game; As such, it's a selling point for me, so I added it as another PRO

It's made by a different developer, so it's a completely different game from Flatout 1 to UC.
I bought it but didn't play it due to the bad reviews, but when I actually played it, it was really crap.

The large variety of cars and drivers is commendable.

The representation of physical defects, which is unique to this series, lacks weight.

If you ram a rival car from behind, it will almost certainly lift the car and cause it to crash.

If you've already played the series, this crap will no doubt shock you.

column8: This game gets so much hate. Yea, it's not the best of the Flatout series, but so what? It's still a fun fast-paced arcade racer. The controls aren't perfect, the music isn't has good has 2, and the graphics are somewhat ugly, but that doesn't take away that it's fun to play once in a while. Using a keyboard for controls is an absolute nightmare, but then again (IMO) using a keyboard for any racer is a bad idea. Use an Xbox360 controller or you'll have zero chance. I only played a little bit of it, but the little bit I did was fun. At least to me. I don't play many racers and really only truly enjoyed Forza 3 on 360, but this was good to me. I find the entire series fun. It's like burnout or NCG. Stop your whining that it's different. Isn't that how developers learn what to do about games?

Warning: Bad game!

As a fan of the Flatout franchise, I can assure you that this game isn't like any other game. It's simply bad. There's no other way to say it. It's like taking Flatout 2, removing everything that's fun, cool, the good physics of the game, the scenery elements to destroy, etc., all the good reasons to love Flatout, mixing them all together, and we get Flatout 3. Flatout 3 is clearly not a Flatout... Bugbear? Empire Interactive? No, another disgusting developer who gave us this crap... don't buy it...
PS: Buy Flatout Ultimate Carnage instead: the best Flatout (just ahead of Flatout 2) ^^

column8:
This game is freakin HORRIBLE!

Its borderline unplayable! I mean you can play the game..... But I assure you, you will not enjoy your experience. Absolutly the worst controls I have ever had to try and use in a racing game.

I luckly got this in a bundle for the other Flatout games which I hear are all really good. So I thouht I would try out the latest one first since it had steam achievements and had modern graphics. 

Well at least I have the other games of the series that are actually FUN to play. So ya... If you get this game, It had better be beacuse you bought the Flatout bundle like I did. And when you do pick up the bundle (for cheap) make sure to hide this game in you're steam library. 

Step 1: Find Flatout 3 in your Library under the "Games" tab.
Step 2: Right click Flatout 3 and click "set Categories" from the list of options.
Step 3: Click little box near the bottom left corner that says "Hide this game in my library"
& finally
Step 4: Have the  peace of mind knowing you hid an embarassing game from your steam library. And people that may look on your Steam profile will never know you had this garbage amongst your collection of ACTUAL games. :-)

column8:
DO NOT BUY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I was under the impression that Steam retailed reputable games, to later find out that this is total garbage, I have owned this game for a long time and have only been able to play it for a few hours, I can understand the lack of support because there are no micro purchases in the game for steam to make extra money off, I personally believe that steam should show some integrity and dignity by refunding or compensating the people that bought this game and were dissatisfied with the end product, Steam Credit would be acceptible,

The Fact that steam would sell such an inferior product goes to show a lack of integrity and poor customer support to the people who, at the end of the day, support them.

Be wise with your purchases people, just as with many retail/sales people/companies, they will promise you and tell you everythin you want  to hear, but as soon as the transaction is done, any misleading information, inferior quality product will be left in your hands and you will be told that it was your fault for not researching the quality of the game or services.

If this was an automobile, It's a LEMON and just like car dealers, Steam does not care as soon as you drive off the car lot, they got their $$$$$ why should they care about you anymore?

column9: I bought it for 7 zlotys, and you can have fun for a penny, but 27 euros on Steam? The graphics look like they've been borrowed from some budget project, though they're not bad. Unfortunately, that's just an impression. The driving physics are cumbersome, but there are plenty of tracks and cars. There's no music... only in the menu. The stunts are still fun. The multiplayer is empty. Overall, it's average, like many others. 4/10 is the highest rating I can give it. You can pull off smashes and the like with impressive performance, but the overpowered AI won't let you win the race so easily, especially in a destruction derby where all the cars are rushing at you like idiots. The brand's potential is wasted. I don't recommend buying it on Steam; I encourage you to grab it from the Biedronka sale basket for a few zlotys. For this price you can go crazy, but unfortunately this game is a joke compared to parts 1 and 2 :(. You could say I got a ride on this product, even though I had a box of store coupon from CDA which gave me 7 gold... unfortunately I'm not talking about a car ride here.
Developers, you are idiots...
The most useless game I've ever played! I don't even understand what this game has to do with Flatout! It's supposed to be a phone game!

column9:
This isn't Flatout, simple as that.

Terrible gameplay (it feels like you're driving a tank at 200 km/h, it's so heavy), the car destruction is completely disfigured (not realistic at all), you're completely limited to having some bizarre cars (completely outside of Flatout's idea of ‚Äã‚Äã"imitating" real cars with different names), and worst of all, the graphics are extremely inferior, with a poorly digitized appearance (it looks like a Hotwheels cartoon) and yet it manages to be RIDICULOUSLY HEAVIER than Flatout Ultimate Carnage!!! WTF?!?!?!

Seriously, save your money. I bought this piece of crap even after reading the reviews because I thought people were being "too hard on the game," also because I'm a fan of the series and because I got all the Flatouts on sale, but let's face it, I can't recommend this piece of crap to anyone.

Such a shame.

column8:
Unfortunately Flatout 3 is a big disapointment for me and many fans of previous parts. 
What went wrong? 
Gameplay has lost this "catchy" spirit making this game addicting. Controls has changed and physics as well. You don't have any feeling of the vehicle You driving. The game seems to be at faster pace. Too fast form me :) Too many explosions and destructions out of a good taste. Soundtrack is flat and colorless. It isn't bad but... There is no tracks of some famous rockbands as previously. Graphisc has not made any progress. It has made a step backwards as it stay in place.
 Flatout3 has a lot of game modes some of which are not playable at all. 

I like SPEED Mode it has something good :)

The rest is kind of fun ... for about 5 minutes. There is no career mode :(

To be honest : Flatout 1 & 2 have their own style and leave in gamers' minds an unique impresion and lots of good, warm memories. FO3 does not...

column8:
Don't be stupid like me and don't buy this game, it's total garbage. If you want nice destruction derby game, get FlatOut2: Ultimate Carnage, soo much better than this crap. Or get Bugbear's new game called Next Car Game, thats a great destruction derby game (but still in making).

The real problem with this game is, that it isn't made by Bugbear but by some shitty company.
Graphics seems (at least to me) like downgrade from FlatOut2.
It have horrible original "music" and not licensed music from rock bands like the other flatouts.
From what else i saw in that half hour i wasted on it was horrible maps like simple square with some houses around and thats it, thats your city race track. No destructible props at all.
The "throw your driver out of car" minigames are worthless, so much better in FlatOut2.

My verdict? It's 1/10. One point for cool name that can charm fans like me who played and loved previous FlatOut games.
Seriously, don't buy this crap, hell, don't even pirate it, it's just waste of time.

P.S. On the other hand, if you want to torture some clueless friend, get this game for him/her. He/She will get this monster big mindf*ck and will do anything for you, just not make him/her see this game again.

column9:
I played it, and like everyone else, I'll say this game is truly poor. I'd rather throw my monitor out the window than watch this pathetic driving model. I'd also throw out my speakers to avoid the sound issues. The only good thing about this game is its graphics; it even looks nice. Everything else is irritating rather than enticing. Controlling these cars is like steering a boulder; they turn incredibly hard. The audio is so bad that I can't hear my car's engine, but I can hear others'. The optimization is okay. You can even see where the game stands. There are AI-controlled opponents on the battlefield, and even during the first challenge, they're so idiotic. How could such a weak sequel to such a great series be ruined? At least I know other idiot developers have done the same. Good pros and cons:
+The graphics are quite nice
+The game runs well
-The AI ‚Äã‚Äãis crap
-The controls are awful
-The audio is crap
-The bugs are clearly visible
-I don't know what else to mention, but definitely no party mode
-11 GB of crap game, what did they put in there?
My rating is 3/10. This game shouldn't exist, and whoever thought of making it should be crucified. I can't believe they would taint such a beautiful Flatout game series with this garbage. I don't recommend buying it, touching it, or even looking at the game menu.
Bottom.

column9:
FlatOut 3 is a disgrace to the series. The first game was okay, the second became a cult favorite for FlatOut fans, but the third game ruined everything. I didn't think they'd turn a good game into such a pittance. In my opinion, Ultimate Carnage is a worthy continuation of the FlatOut series (it's still the same good FlatOut 2, but with better graphics and new and returning characters).
Overall, Chaos & Destruction is a pittance. Team 6 Studios shouldn't have even taken on the development; they should have left it to Bugbear Entertainment. The only game Team 6 did well was GSR (German Street Racing), and it's a shame it's not on Steam; you could have played that.

column8:
Don't ever think of getting this, no matter how cheap. I'm a fan of FlatOut and FlatOut 2 and didn't even finish the first race in this.

It's bizarrely bad, the kind of bad that makes you pause in awe of its epic, sweeping suckitude and instills you with the immediate urge to warn other people lest their lives too will be tainted. There is no point in getting into details about the different aspects of this game. Just assume it's worse than any racing game you have ever played in every aspect.

I'm not exaggerating. Don't be like me. It's not too late for you. You can still save yourself.

Don't get FlatOut. It doesn't run on modern machines. Don't get FlatOut: Ultimate Carnage. It's Windows Live. Get FlatOut 2 and wait for Next Car Game.

column9:
Well, what can I say about a game like this? This horrible game destroyed what, in my opinion, would have been the best racing game series. But the only thing this "FlatOut 3" game managed to do was end the best racing game series in the world. FlatOut 2 is wonderful. I highly recommend it; in my opinion, it's the best racing game in the world, but this one is crap compared to the others.

For those who enjoyed FlatOut 2, I don't recommend playing this one because it ruined my enjoyment of what FlatOut 2 would have been, but the sequel ended up with this crap. This game killed the FlatOut series.

In my opinion, whoever changed this game from what it was in FlatOut 2 should have been beaten up badly; the game ended up like just another racing game. I don't recommend this game to anyone.

Total crap! No pros, only cons! But I still decided to play it for my collection, and unfortunately, I couldn't. Not because it's crap, but because there's one challenge, challenge #19, that's IMPOSSIBLE!!! It's a bus race, and even with nitro, they only go uphill at 10 km/h. There's a river across the track; to cross it, you have to get a good run and use the ramp to jump over it. Unfortunately, the bus only gets to the end of the ramp and rolls back, or falls into the water, and that's it! And you have to somehow complete three laps!!! Something like that. In short, it's crap! 
Overall: 0.5 out of 10!
Shit, bitch, fucking shit

5 minutes. 5 minutes was enough for me to understand how shitty this game is. I can't even call it a racing game because... There are no physics, the controls are like you're playing TF, everything is so blurry that visibility is no more than 2 meters. Well, the developers are great, they gave us HEADLIGHTS to combat the blur. But unfortunately they forgot that there aren't that many buttons on the joysticks. Well, I found a solution, I put the headlight controls instead of the gas button. So what? At least you can see everything well... In short, I bought the pack for 120 rubles, and that third part was about 50 rubles. GIVE ME MY MONEY BITCHES BACK!!! I'D BETTER EAT THESE 50 RUBLES IN A CASTERBALL!!! THIS IS NOT CHAOS AND DESTRUCTION, BUT SOAP AND DISAPPOINTMENT!!! I TURNED THE STEERING WHEEL 1 DEGREE TO THE RIGHT AND IT THROWS THE CAR TO HELL WITH TRACKS AND SHE STILL MANAGES TO DO A FIVE SOMETHING! FUCKING PARASHA!!!1
