column8:
Edited october 1st 2014
I have come to a conclusion that it is even worst than when i first looked at it.  The game feels just  like a cheap arcade game.  The vehicle physics is crap and wanky.  The destruction is okay at times but it pretty craply done compared to the other games.  Some items like cones and wood float and never move.  I can no longer recommend this game to anyone, not even your worst enemy.  Its like the just stuck the name FLATOUT 3 on a piece of crap and tried to sell it.  You have a better chance at winning the lottery TWICE than enjoying this game for more than 30 mins!
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ALL FLATOUT FANS BEWARE!!!  This game is a horrible addition to the Flatout series.  That is why I gave it a negative reveiw. It feels nothing like the originals.

Now on another note as a racing game it isnt the worst (still isnt that great).  It is okay for people who have never touched Flatout if they can get it cheap.  I highly recomend getting the complete pack mainly for the other games.

Overall I do not recomend this game.
Once again FLATOUT FANS BEWARE!!!!

column8:
Not the worst driving game ever, but if you loved the hell out of FlatOut 2 and/or FlatOut: Ultimate Carnage, then this release by a different developer will be a big disappointment. Still, it's not all that terrible, really, if you're not familiar with the older games (but they did make good effort to address issues).

I would still recommend FlatOut: Ultimate Carnage instead (or FlatOut 2 for older computers); and other great similar titles are Burnout Paradise, DiRT Showdown, Gas Guzzlers Extreme, and especially Wreckfest. Even Grand Theft Auto 5 to a degree for the car races. :>  [Oh... Avoid Flatout 4 at all costs!!!]

No graphics, no physics, no cars or tracks, no controls. This isn't a game, it's the work of a failing schoolboy... I categorically don't recommend wasting a single minute of your life playing this game...
Complete nonsense, compared to the first and second parts.

I absolutely love the first three games; they're fantastic. The gameplay, the soundtrack, the graphics, and tons of meat and metal. BUT THIS!!!
THIS PIECE OF BULLSHIT IS NOT WORTH EVEN THE LITTLE FINGER OF PART 2!

Let's start with the graphics.
The blurry images smeared across the screen, the vomit-inducing blurriness, the fog, and the increased field of view with nitro look absolutely stunning. Even the graphics in Part 1 are better.
The cars look like they're made of cardboard: they crash easily, and the crash effect is worse than even GTA San Andreas.

Music.
IT'S NOT HERE, FUCKING! REALLY! ONLY ONE SOUNDTRACK IN THE MENU! THAT'S IT!

Gameplay.
Oh, that's a whole other story. I started the first race and CRASHED A FEW SECONDS AFTER I STARTED! EVERYTHING HAPPENED SO FAST THAT I DIDN'T EVEN REALIZE WHAT HAPPENS! AND IT HAPPENED THE ENTIRE RACE! I JUST CRASHED AND CRASHED!

Modes.

Race:
Very monotonous. You drive, you crash, "PRESS 'R' TO RESTART," you drive, you crash... And so on until the end of the track.

Stuntman:
I still haven't figured out how to play this crap. Everything is so poorly designed that I can't do without a cap, but I'd rather play UC.

Big Battle:
Deadly Derby. Multiplayer only. Oh yeah... NO ONE WILL PLAY THIS SHIT!

Battle Arena:
Yeah, yeah, it's a classic demolition derby, but they screwed it up too!
WHERE'S THE NITRO?! WHY DO THE CARS HARDLY CRUSH?! WHY THE HELL DO YOU HAVE TO RAM CARS TO GET POINTS INSTEAD OF CRUSHING THEM?!

Monster Trucks:
I was hoping for something decent, but nope. Boring.

Speed:
Formula 1 racing. Now that's more or less it, but I don't understand WHY THE HELL IS THIS IN FLATOUT?!

Night Shift:
Same race, same tracks, only at night!!! OH FUCKING NIGHT! OH MY GOD! SIMPLY FUCKING AWESOME.

Off-road:
Booooooooood.

SplatOut:
YESSS! ZOMBIES!!! MEAT!!! Fuck you!
It's all a piece of cake.
The zombies are standing still, huge as who knows what. The maps are buggy and small. There are very few zombies, and running over them is boring because they don't move.
I completed the first map without even realizing what happened, just driving forward and occasionally turning.
But the fun started on the second. The first time I played, I got stuck in the textures after a few seconds. Well, I decided to drive around a bit more, restarted. While smashing the zombies for a bit, I ran into some small mountain of 3-4 minibuses, and... I FLEW INTO THE SKY, FUCKING!!!
After that, I turned off the game and deleted it from my computer.

Don't play this crap, even if you pirate it. It's a mockery of a great series. 2/10.

column8: Jodida basura, el 2 le da mil vueltas, las fisicas de de este juego parecen hechas por monos, es un jodido juego de coches que se bas en las ostias no mola estamparte contra otro coche y que parezca que te has estampado contra un muro y los minijuegos dan puta pena. Con lo bien que ivan en el 2(juego que si recomiendo)
column9: Fucking garbage! 2 is way better than it. The physics in this game look like they were made by monkeys. It's a fucking car game based on fighting. Crashing into another car and feeling like you've crashed into a wall isn't cool, and the minigames are fucking lame. They were so good in 2 (a game I do recommend).

The game developers are lousy. Honestly, when I first downloaded the game from a torrent, I thought someone had uploaded a fake game or mod for the first FlatOut and renamed it. When I bought it on sale on Steam along with others, I realized how screwed I was. From the very first seconds of play, you'll understand the poverty of this "franchise successor." The game's shortcut makes it clear that no effort was put into it. The menu is also very COOL (you get the idea). The racing games suck, there's little variety, and there's no campaign like in the previous game. The modes are just some zombies, night shifts, and other such nonsense. I'd overlook all this if all of this had beautiful graphics, but the current ones are unbearable. Remember the stunts from FlatOut 2? They weren't just killed, they were shot. They remind me of a golf minigame from Madagascar. The game is simply terrible. 
P.S. And why is only the third FLatOut listed as "FLatout" in the Steam Library? "There's a black sheep in every family," wrote LAl7ATKA¬Æ.

Well, all the previous parts were and are the best and unforgettable trash. But as always happens these days, the good old games are better than the new ones in everything, and I want to say the same about Flatout 3! I expected something better and more interesting, but it turned out to be complete "CRAP"! I've been wanting to try it for a long time, and now I have the time, and it turned out to be a waste of time! The sounds, the effects, the graphics - which do not change no matter the video settings, I'm not even talking about the characters, they turned out to be complete and utter crap. And there's nothing to say about the cars either, they're like straight out of Sony 1, boxy, pathetic! The competitions are neither interesting nor engaging, the tracks are completely out of place. Where our favorite Rock derby and massacre should be, we hear dull party music or pop! In short, it's better to play the older parts of Flatout; they have everything you need for an awesome mood and hardcore racing!

Keine Kaufempfehlung!!!! f√ºr diejenigen die einen Flatout-Teil erwarten!!!!

Fakten
Pro:
+ coole und viele karren
+ viele modi

Contra:
- kaum karriere
- seltsame kreuzungen/umbauten von echten autos
- sinnlose instrumente
- keine anleitung
- kein nachvollger der flatout serie
-schlechtes Gameplay

Ausf√ºhrlich:
Habe Flatout3 im bundle mit den anderen Teilen gekauft und die ersten zwei auch gespielt. hab nun den dritten Teil installiert und gro√üe Hoffnungen gehabt: bessere grafik, mehr autos,...

Das kam dan beim ersten anspielen heraus:
erstmal √ºber ein sch√∂nes men√º gefreut und auch relativ coole karren(auch wenn sie teils seltsame kreuzungen oder umbauten sind) gefreut
aber das erste manko gleich vorab keine karriere bzw erstmal nicht ersichtlich 
stuntmission gestartet und erstmal keinen plan was ich machen soll / wohin ich muss, erst nach zigfachen ausprobieren irgendwie geschafft eine mission zu beenden
dann die anderen modi auf LEICHT ausprobiert, dank einer seltsamen steuerung, keiner lebensanzeige und schlechter karte die h√∂lle
dann hab ich auch noch bemerkt das da ein sinnloser drehzalmesser ist, der sich zwar bewegt ,aber dir nichts bringt ,da man nicht selbst schalten kann und auch die geschwindigkeitsanzeige an einer ganz anderen stelle sitz.
letzten endes war ich froh mir das spiel im bundle gekauft zu haben und nicht einzeln.

Fazit:
im angebot kann man dieses spiel kaufen aber kein muss, flatoutliebhaber werden ent√§uscht sein , schlussendlich hat Team6 wohl versucht eine eierllegende Wollmilchsau hervorzuzaubern aber eher einen zombieschwein geboren
column9:
Not a recommendation!!!! for those expecting a Flatout installment!!!!

Facts
Pros:
+ Cool and numerous cars
+ Many modes

Cons:
- Hardly any career options
- Strange crossovers/conversions of real cars
- Pointless instruments
- No instructions
- Not a sequel to the Flatout series
- Poor gameplay

In detail:
I bought Flatout 3 in a bundle with the other installments and played the first two. I've now installed the third installment and had high hopes: better graphics, more cars,...

This is what I discovered when I first played it:
First, I was happy about the nice menu and also the relatively cool cars (even if some of them are strange intersections or conversions).
But the first drawback right from the start: no career, or rather, not immediately apparent.
Started a stunt mission and initially had no idea what to do/where to go. Only after countless attempts did I somehow manage to complete a mission.
Then I tried the other modes on EASY, but thanks to strange controls, no health indicator, and a terrible map, it was hell.
Then I also noticed that there's a pointless rev counter that moves, but doesn't do anything for you, since you can't shift gears yourself, and the speedometer is in a completely different place.
In the end, I was glad I bought the game as a bundle and not separately.

Conclusion:
You can buy this game on sale, but it's not a must. Flatout fans will be disappointed. Ultimately, Team6 may have tried to conjure up a jack-of-all-trades, but they've actually produced a zombie pig.

column8:
WTF, the biggest crap every played... there is no physical explanation for anything which happens. Everything is just "chaotic", no rules, not the smallest possibility to predict any behavior.
The KI is driving like connected via rubber-band... it doesnt matter if youre driving extremly fast or slow, the distance to every other enemy remains identical.
There is that much bullshit going on in this game, I cannot find any appropriate words to describe it.

I rate this game 8.5/10

Eu particulamente gostei mais do Flat Out 2 do que do 3, eles inventaram muita coisa, com a inten√ß√£o de melhorar o jogo e isso "assassinou" um pouco o jogo, fugindo do que era o jogo "Flat Out", a divers√£o √© o foco do jogo n√£o se trata de requesitos altos para rodar em um computador comum, n√£o considero um jogo ruim, por√©m o 2 ainda √© superior ao 3, tem menos op√ß√µes de jogo, mas as op√ß√µes s√£o melhores, o multiplayer desse jogo √© sempre vazio, a grande maioria n√£o gostou das novidades, mas n√£o √© um jogo chato e ruim, se voc√™ tem com quem jogar esse jogo √© divers√£o garantida.

column9:
This game brings a new dimension to racing. With nine entirely different game modes and classy cars, Burnout fans won't find this game bad.

I personally liked Flat Out 2 more than 3. They invented a lot of things to improve the game, and this "killed" it a bit, straying from what Flat Out was. Fun is the focus of the game, not the high requirements to run on a regular computer. I don't consider it a bad game, but 2 is still superior to 3. It has fewer game options, but the options are better. The multiplayer in this game is always empty, and the vast majority didn't like the new features, but it's not a boring or bad game. If you have someone to play this game with, it's guaranteed fun.

PS: I recommend it if you have someone to play with; it's tedious alone. =)

I really disliked the game. When I bought it, I was hoping for the same atmosphere as in parts 1 and 2. Parts 1 and 2 had destruction and more realistic graphics, but here... kids' cars with Minecraft-like graphics.

column9: Honestly, Flatout 3 really disappointed me. I expected more, in my opinion. I mean, 2 is more developed. Nothing more to say.

A game that should never have been created. A game that brings shame on the entire FlatOut series. Although it's hard to classify it as part of that series, as the only thing that's FlatOut-esque about this [strike]heap of crap[/strike] game is the name. It's unclear why, or by what coincidence, the development of the third game (and the rights to the entire series) was handed over to another publisher and developer. It feels like Team6 didn't even try to make something decent and playable. They apparently just decided to go straight to making trash, a parody, or something else inspired by FlatOut.

In [strike]burning and tearing[/strike], Chaos and Destruction, literally EVERYTHING is done terribly. You could start with any aspect of the game, as nothing is of any value.

The graphics are pathetic; Team6 clearly didn't skimp on the ubiquitous blurring. The car models, the environments, even the interface ‚Äì they're straight out of the 2000s.

The car physics are nothing compared to those in FlatOut 2 (in my opinion, the best game in the series). The cars here behave like bars of soap, hard to catch in a bathtub.

The gameplay, while varied, offers so many modes, but they're so poorly organized and outdated that they're worthless.

The opponent AI is completely nonexistent.

Judging by the soundtrack, I can tell it wouldn't be out of place in some parody arcade game from the 2000s.

The characters are also a rather controversial issue. They're simply the pinnacle of the insanity that the developers seem to suffer from.

The end result is one of the worst games in the entertainment industry, one I'd be ashamed to release on Steam, especially at a price of $30.

Rating 10 out of 10 bars of laundry soap.

column8: sakƒ±n almayƒ±n

Let me give you the TL;DR right now. Worst game ever.

I played a single race (yes I made it that far, so I earned the right to judge the game). I immediately remembered a really funny parody of the FPS games of that era. Duty Calls. Now for those who aren't familiar with this name, let me describe it briefly. Duty Calls is a parody of many FPS games, based on Call of Duty franchise. It was made as an advertisement for Bulletstorm, whose trailer played at the end of this mocking game, with the message being "nowadays FPS are like the one you just played, here is what it is supposed to be like (Bulletstorm trailer begins)". Flatout 3 felt exactly like that. "Here is a crappy racing game to depict everything wrong with racing games today, and now, real Flatout 3 begins where you get to have super fun just like you had in the previous games, even ultimate carnage, which was basically flatout 2 re-sold to you suckers, but turned out to be pretty good anyway". Disappointment begins... It was no joke, no "real" Flatout 3 started. Flatout 3 really is the horrible.... ummm..... I can't really say that it's a game.... It's...... a software...... where you control...... no not control........ more like........ watch a car that was based on the drawings of a drunk newborn...... cruise in a city designed by a band of autistic apes...... and think that you contribute to its behaviour by pressing certain buttons on the controller.

Ok jokes aside. Graphics are extremely unfinished. Simple and undetailed, but not intentionally, just due to lack of skill and/or effort. Just look at the screenshots. At the first glance they look pretty decent. Now look closer. Inspect details. Don't tell me it's a 2011 game. Compare it to DiRT or just Flatout UC. You will see it has horrible graphics.

Controls just don't matter. You don't feel in control of the vehicle, not even a little bit. The car just goes vroom vroom. No realism, no control, no fun. For those who will bash me for looking for realism, just go play the previous games. You will see what I mean. Junker cars used to slide, drift, bump, etc. Now they just perfectly hover over the asphalt. When you try to turn, it either doesn't turn enough (if you're too fast), or turns successfully (if you're slow enough). It doesn't drift, slide unless you pull the handbrake. But if you use nitro when your car is aligned with the road, it just immediately and magically stops sliding and continues it's hovering over the road. Here is a short list of games that offer a better and more realistic driving experience: Asphalt 8 (iOS and Android), The Need for Speed (1994), FIFA '96. Also, I'm using a Logitech F710. When I set the controls to the gamepad, it stops working. If I set them to keyboard I can use my gamepad with xinput mode. Fuck logic!

Sounds. There are 4 sounds in total. One of them is the menu sound "click". Three in game sounds are "vroom", "bfffttt", and "dufff". Now "vroom" is the engine sound made by the cars engines. The sound was produced by a pair of bored game devs, that just made the sound with their mouth. I can almost hear one of them saying "screw the consumers, they will buy our games anyway", in the middle of the sound recording session, faintly hidden behind the sound of the engine. "bfffttt" is the sound nitrous makes, and the artistic creation of this amazing sound was most likely based on an air refresher spray. "dufff" is the collision sound used in every single collision to every single combination of objects. Again, it was probably made by devs dropping a heavy pillow from a distance. 

Music. Literally non-existent.

Car tuning. Do you remember the simple, yet fun car modification system Flatout used to offer? It's gone. Here is the new system. "Would you like to tune the car?" [Yes/No]. If you choose yes, then the car is "tuned" by standards seen fit by the devs. I swear to god, I am laughing at the stupidity of this, as I'm writing, while crying on the inside because it isn't even slightly exaggerated. Ladies and gentlemen, a new era of modification begins where cars are either "tuned" or "aren't".

Please just watch a single gameplay footage from any source. Even the official game trailers give you an idea of how ridiculous this game is. Don't take any of my word for it. Just look it up on youtube yourself. Watch some videos and see for yourself that every single sentence you read here, is describing that video.

I bought the Complete pack for 10$. I am not sorry because I love Flatout games. I played them on PS2 for long hours. I am glad to have 1, 2 and UC in my steam library for just 10$. But if you want a Flatout game, just buy UC. 2 was better than 1, even though 1 was a pretty solid game itself. And UC is just a graphically and realistically superior game, that is essentially Flatout 2 with additional content.

column9: Very bad game

I bought it hoping it would be newer and better than parts 1 and 2, but how wrong I was (there was no Steam rating back then)...
And indeed, the graphics are so blurry and overly bright that you can't tell what's on the screen, like you're staring at the sun without glasses...or a nuclear blast!
The physics are bad, the camera is mounted oddly, the menu is bad, the only thing I liked was the zombie mode, but that's also bad...
Basically, I heard that the publishers are either bankrupt or have outsourced development...The results are clear.

column8:
I'm a fan of the FlatOut series, and I bought this on release thinking it would be the latest and greatest. But this game is tough to get into, if not for the fact that the controls operate like your gamepad is begging for an immediate and swift death. The adrenaline of Ultimate Carnage is ill-supported here and the game lacks a lot of the punch that made past titles great.

Worth noting - this game was made by a third party studio, not the one responsible for the earlier games.

column8:
Three things you need to know about this game:

-This is NOT developed by Bugbear, as they are infinitely better than this.
-If you're lucky enough to race, you'll find that the handling was unbearable at best.  The fact that the technical graphics quality isn't on par with the Bugbear series doesn't help one bit.
-This game constantly crashes, especially if you want to use a custom soundtrack.

The only reason why this game was made so that Steam can sell the Flatout complete pack.  Don't even get that, even if it's on sale.  Just buy Flatouts 1 and 2 and you're good to go.

Ansonsten bietet Flatout 3 alles was ein Rennspiel braucht: Viele Strecken, viele Autoklassen, viele Fahrer, viel Spa√ü und gute Musik, dabei macht Flatout 3 nichts perfekt, aber alles gut

column9:
As usual, there's plenty of junk, quirky party games, and‚Äîbecause it's fashionable‚Äîa zombie mode, although for once without Nazi zombies, instead featuring regular, albeit somewhat sluggish, brain-eating zombies. Otherwise, Flatout 3 offers everything a racing game needs: plenty of tracks, plenty of car classes, plenty of drivers, lots of fun, and good music. Flatout 3 doesn't do anything perfectly, but it does everything well.

Algors Game Rating: 7/10

I bought this game as part of a bundle. However, if you are just thinking about buying this game because you liked other flatout  games in this seris, DO NOT SPEND MONEY ON THIS GAME.

Got this in the FlatOut bundle.  Definitely and by far the worst of the four.  Doesn't play anything like the rest of the franchise and the team that made this did it a disservice.  It's like Blur played with Micro Machines driven on ice and everything is boxy and glitters.  Several of the characters are obvious jabs at annoying celebrities, but they bring nothing interesting to the table.  After playing and enjoying all of the previous games in the series back to back, I played half of one track of F3 and couldn't stand to finish the race.  Every negative review of it is spot on.

This series peaked at FlatOut: Ultimate Carnage in terms of graphics and full controller support (finally), but was handicapped by requiring Games for Windows Live.  Hopefully if/when Bugbear finishes Next Car Game, it'll be the FlatOut we've always dreamt of.

column9:
It was released suddenly, without any notice.
I bought it immediately because it's one of my favorite series.
The developer changed, the UI is cluttered, the screen is filled with particles at the start of a race,
cars get stuck in obstacles and explode, cars get buried in the ground...
How did it end up like this...?

Updates have improved the addictive bugs, particle-filled screens, and control,
but if you're familiar with the previous trilogy, it's not fun at all...

Only buy it if you want to experience the game that killed the series.

As an aside, Bugbear Entertainment, the developer of the previous trilogy, has announced [url=www.nextcargame.com]NextCarGame[/url]
Don't buy this under any circumstances.

column9:
Very bad, really bad. There's no way I can recommend a game like this to anyone. I'll give my usual standard review.

This game has no story. But that's not something that's missing for a racing game.

The gameplay is horrible. The controls in this game are very strange. The tracks are uninviting. And the difficulty of this game is ridiculously easy. It doesn't take much effort to unlock the best car in the game. And once you do, this game is in your hands, because the most stolen car in the game is easily unlocked. There's a good variety of cars, but they're all boring. There's no upgrade system anymore. This game has become so ridiculous that you can play as a tank in derby mode (destruction). The opponent AI is horrible. It feels like zombies behind the wheel. No, I think zombies could drive better. The game's physics are horrible.

The soundtrack is okay. Good, heavy rock. If you don't like the game's OST, you can configure it in the game menus to play your PC's music.

The scenarios are quite varied, and there are a good number of tracks. But they were, I don't know, poorly designed. There's nothing unique about the races.

The graphics aren't bad, but they literally got worse, man. No joke, the previous game's graphics were prettier.

There are a small number of bugs and glitches in the game too.

This game is all bad. Everything ranges from so-so to bad. It's horrible. I've played it since the first title in the series. Flatout has always been an exceptional game. Very good gameplay, excellent AI, lots of fun mini-games, very good cars with upgrades, excellent graphics, impeccable physics, and a unique destruction system. This game has nothing like FlatOut. This title is a disgrace to the series. There are generic racing games out there that are much better than this one. This game should never have existed. And I'm not saying this because I'm a fan of the series. Even though I rate this game as a generic racing game, it's still crap. I really don't recommend it! If you're a fan of the series, you'll be VERY disappointed. And if you're unfamiliar with FlatOut, you'd better play something else, because this one is crap. I suggest FlatOut 2 or FlatOut: Ultimate Carnage. Stay away from this game.
Good game, you can have fun with friends!

Everything is absolutely terrible. The first game was significantly better than this one.

The game received extremely negative reviews from both gaming publications and players. Among other things, the game's terrible physics, awkward controls, and weak artificial intelligence are noted.

The game has a Metacritic rating of 2.3 stars among critics and a user rating of 3.9 stars.

At the very beginning of the game, the player is given the opportunity to complete a short tutorial, where they are introduced to the basic principles and control system. After this stage, the player can choose from various modes, including typical tournaments, races, and competitions. The game's developers didn't adhere to realistic physics, but instead focused on spectacle and a large amount of destruction. During a race in any mode, you'll perform crazy stunts and constantly battle opponents. The interactive world allows you to destroy parts of the track and create new obstacles.

For added variety, there are several additional mini-games, implemented in a humorous manner. You'll be able to dive, bowl, and play darts, using your car and driver as your tools. The game was originally developed for consoles and later adapted for PC, so it will take some time to get used to the mouse and keyboard controls.

Unfortunately, it's far behind its predecessor.

I really thought Flatout 2 was great! It was fun from the very first minute and had addictive potential, both in the "story mode" and the stunts.
The sequel, on the other hand, unfortunately falls far short in terms of content (if you can call it that), presentation, handling, clarity, and fun factor, and thus also falls short of expectations. You're simply not encouraged to even race or choose a different game mode, because controlling the cars just doesn't feel right, both with the keyboard and the gamepad. I only played it for a good half hour and tried out most of the game modes, but I didn't even begin to feel interested in continuing. What a shame!

It doesn't resemble the good old Flatout series (of course, they just bought the name), it doesn't resemble any indie games, or anything at all, it's pure garbage. STOP!!!

You better DO NOT BUY the game.

At first it may look pretty cool, and you don't have a problem with the little "easy" made graphics. 
For player's that knew the old version, Flat Out 2, it is even more depressing. As far as I can remember you could gear your car's up in Flat Out 2 and the Cars still looked made up, BUT not like toy cars. Even if I mix something up here, the physics are even worse than the car's look like. It so brutally Acarde that it should run under "fun games for babys" . 

Finally: I can't belive that this should be the next version of Flat Out 2. I totally don't get it. Even if you took the same graphic and physic enginge from the old game, and mix it up with a few new Racetracks and Cars and what ever, you would wind up with a better game than this. 

I wish I had take on of the thumbs down more seriously before I bougth the game. 

Good for Kids, but everyone who knew the old Flat Out 2 will be badly disappointed!
And even Kids I would recommend to buy Flat Out 2. Is't simply the...no it is complete different game and defenatly more fun! Cheers, Shoot1stAskNxt

column9:
This game is not Flatout!
[h1]Pros[/h1]
-Lots of cars
-Variety of game modes
[h1]Cons[/h1]
-Difficult to choose cars, the way to compare and trade them isn't user-friendly. You have to choose a class, then choose a car and choose a design, but not all classes are always available. You unlock cars, but they don't appear as new.
-You don't have a goal in the game; just jump in and play the different game modes.
-Excessive lighting in a colorless game, it's eye-sore.
-Idiotic physics, it looks like all the objects are made of cardboard/Styrofoam.
-Extremely stupid AI, no skill required to win.

column9: The game has little in common with the first installments. It's very weak. The physics are pathetic. Overall, it's a complete mess.

God, why didn't I read the reviews before buying this? Don't let the name fool you‚Äîit's nothing like Flatout, the graphics are worse than the second game, the physics are worse, and worst of all, there's no career mode at all. You just pick a single race and that's all there is to the gameplay. I'd pay twice what this game costs just to punch everyone who had any part in its creation in the face.

This is simply pathetic; to disgrace the FlatOut series like that is truly mind-boggling!
The controls are borderline Mega Arcade; it feels like you're driving a toy.
The physics, on top of the controls, are simply mind-blowing.
The cars look like toys you'd find on store shelves, pathetic imitation cars like the Nissan Skyline GT-R, Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution X, and other well-known foreign cars with incomprehensible names in the game.
The car shapes are crooked,
The tracks look a dull "0," the trees, fences, and houses are simply awful.
Basically, it took me two minutes to get my eye twitching!!!
My rating is 0 out of 10...
I do not recommend this product to ANYONE!

column8:
Team 6 really put an effort into this game, unfortunately that effort was to make the game as unenjoyable, mundane, unsatisfactory, monotonous, tedious and lastly rage inducing (at having to pay a price for such disk clutter).

If you tried Flatout and compared it to Flatout 3, you would be hard pressed to notice any game play difference apart from the garish new graphics in the case of the latter (yes Team 6 developed both games, and it tells).

Yes you may say there is a lot of variety to the game, but its kind of like saying which style of shirt you would like to wear when you go and get a lobotomy.

In my opinion the title is a typo, a more apt title would be FAIL-A-LOT 3 : Clumsy & Irritating

column8:
After 5 minutes, I stopped playing.
A big step down from flatout 2, I know its not the same developer, so the title is really a shadow on the series.

The gameplay is outdated and stiff, the graphics are horrible, and the game contains a decent amount of bugs.
If this game came out in 2000, it would be decent, but for a Q4 2011 release, its simply horrible.

Bugbear (creator of flatout 2) is currently working on The Next Car Game, if you want to get a taste of how a sequel to flatout 2 should be, take a look there, and stay away from this one

2/10

column8:
This game is basically a piece of unrespect towards bugbear, this game has been made by another studio Team 6 and they not only didn't maintain the original Flatout idea, they smashed it and not even in the good way, the physics are pure rubbish, the cars look like matchbox toy cars (forget nice flatout 1 or 2 bangers.), The car tuning is just a text saying what changes to the car (seriously? are we back at text rpg's?), Oh I forgot, the graphics even if I do not need nice graphics to love something, here they are disastrous, there is the bloom and motion blur effect on everything and you can't turn them off. 


I bought this in the complete flatout bundle, just because I wanted all flatouts since i had owned 1 and 2 on disc but played them so much they got scratched and didn't play anymore. But this Is just a huge piece of unplayable material, I mean even 3 years later on a SuperPC compared to it's requirements I got screentear and graphics buffing. 

This ain't worth a dime, maybe a nice try for a indie studio trying to make a name with forgiving fans and a pricetag of a handfull of dollars but not a game called: Flatout 3:Chaos and destruction, the only chaos and destruction you get here is the game itself. 


Installed, started it up, found it funny looking... tried it out... uninstalled, piece of utter rubbish.

Compared to many other games in the genre, it deserves at least some recognition.

column9:
I've never played shit like this in my life. The physics of the game is somewhere below the level of the DOS game Stunts from 1990... the recommended requirements are as funny as Chuck Norris jokes... the graphics correspond to the game from 2000 and for that they recommend you own a GTX590... it's a shitload of tons of lighting > even a blind person would blind the second one... and with the absence of anti-aliasing and texture filtering, it makes you feel like the game will kill you after one round out of three it stops being fun completely. Even though I had the game set to ultra and 1920x1080, I had the feeling that the game and the menu were at a resolution below 1280x720> I have to admit that they made the impossible possible...
If anyone has decided to buy this game or just thought about it for a second, don't even do it... > even for free, this game is expensive
I definitely recommend the older, funnier 1 & 2.

The game is really bad.

All that's left from the previous games is the name :) The graphics are on par with the first game, the physics are even worse, and the nitro from the huge blue flame is very reminiscent of the mobile game Asphalt. The fun and excitement are gone, leaving only disappointment.
A waste of money.
3/10.

column8:
Ok, I was honestly expecting that the latest release of Flatout will be the best so far. I have never been so wrong in my entire life and yet they got the name right: "chaos&destructrion" which fits perfectly to my hopes and dreams about this game. But here it goes, allow me to start with the good parts of this "masterpiece":

+it has steamworks
+it has achievements
+it has multiplayer and works well with the steam incorporation
+it gives you a good reason to appreciate the classics and your life in general
+it has wacky looking characters and vehicles, always good for a good laugh (since this entire game is a laughing matter)

And now...for the long and tedious negative list...I could probably just sum it up to: "It sucks!", but I will mention just a few of the downgrades (in comparison to it's predecessor it seems lesser of a game) and downfalls of the game:

-it crashes, sudden unavoidable and uncontrollable exit of the game (I have everything up to date, but not only for me, but also for others...it just gives an error and crashes)
-bad handling (not sure if this game was supposed to have handling that you would only see in those old car games, really rudimentary and quite disappointing)
-bad graphics (I know I played it on low, but I wasn't expecting to look worse than the first title)
-no community (hmm, I wonder why? *sarcasm* )
-the crashing effects suck (apparently every time you crash, you lose all of your wheels and other unaesthetic looks for the crashing events)
-from what I noticed, it lacks the story part or something related
-the physics are broken most of the time
-limited maps, barely new features compared with the previous titles etc.
-it was not worth the price I paid at the time

And the list can easily continue for a lot...this is my experience from only an hour or so of gameplay...but, I will still recommend this game, because it really helps you to learn to appreciate what you have and, heck, how knows, you just might enjoy this game while you are drunk or feel like doing something really dumb, so why not keep it close for just those special occasions when you "dare to be stupid". This game really deserves it's metacritic score 2/10 .

column8: Maybe I was expecting too much. What I wanted from this game was something like Flatout 2, with that fun, cartoony art style and derby/racing game. First off, this game has aggonizingly slow load times and I run this game on a fairly modern computer! The soundtrack is so dark and mysterious which doesn't help with that fun part either. I also dislike how if you looked at Flatout 2 and Flatout 3, you would not see anything that represents each other. Set aside the bad stuff, I do like how this game looks, it looks absolutely goregous and I have to say I wasn't expecting Flatout 3 to be looking this good. I also like how you can finally choose your character which was something that was highly requested throughout the Flatout franchise. I also like how there is a whole new selection of cars to choose from. I don't like how there is no car from any of the previous Flatout games in Flatout 3. The number one thing that really bugs me the most, is the physics of this game, they are NOTHING like any other Flatout games, same with the camera angles. I won't get too much into detail with that because I have so much to rant on about with the camera angles and physics. I will probably play this game again being me who doesn't want to accept the fact that one of his most beloved franchises is now ruined by one simple game. I'd give it a 5/10.

column9:
This isn't FlatOut anymore.
Simply a terrible misuse of the name, and then they misspelled the name, Flat"O"ut, with a capital O instead of a lowercase... Horrible...
Below is a pro/con list, and even further down I'll go into detail about each point.

As a FlatOut fan since the first game, I almost fell off my chair when I started this game... Okay, it wasn't so bad in the menu, but when the race started... I was horrified...
You could play a version of Hot Wheels on any handheld (Nintendo DSLite has a game like that)...

Pro/Con List:
You should always start with [u] Constructive Criticism [/u]:

- The graphics options directly show what changes.

Unfortunately, I don't have any more...

[u] Destructive Criticism: [/u]

- Graphics are beyond cheesy.
- Graphics are beyond bad.
- No soundtrack in races.
- Sounds aren't very high quality.
- Bad. Controls

Details on the individual points:
Pro:
- The graphics options immediately show what changes.
Well, I like it.
I also have a computer that can afford it. On older PCs, you can sometimes sweat in the menu, but otherwise, I like it.

Con:
- Graphics are cheesy.
If you compare FlatOut 2 with FlatOut 3, you can see that the graphics in FlatOut 2 are more natural, and in FlatOut 3, they're at the level of a child's game... simply pathetic.

- Graphics are bad.
Well, I started playing right away on the highest settings and I have to say... Half-Life 2 is from 2004 and has better graphics... I don't know, I couldn't see much because of the bright colors, but the "dummies" that can crash out of the cars are extremely angular and have poor edges.

- No soundtrack in races.
Maybe there is one, but I didn't notice it... In the first two games, the soundtrack stood out because it was It was very good rock music, and in this installment of the series... well, I didn't notice anything.

- No high-quality sounds
When I started my first event, I immediately noticed this annoying, strange humming noise. After careful consideration and back and forth, I came to the conclusion that it was supposed to imitate an engine noise... I'll cite Half-Life 2 from 2004 again and say it again: This game is worse than a game that came out seven years earlier.

- Bad controls
Well... whether it's bad or not is up to each individual... Since I like to compare, I'll cite FlatOut 2, where the cars would even skid out at the rear when the steering was too harsh, and I have to say: If there were a car with this level of grip, it would be a dream for every racer. You steer left and you drive left... quite simply, without any objections, your car does exactly what you tell it to do; it sticks to the left...

Since this review is very much in line with my own opinion, and I've packaged it a bit nicely, here it is again, without mincing words and in full:

[spoiler] Worst racing game I've ever "played," if you can even call it playing, given the 5-minute driving time...
I almost fell over backward when I saw those childish graphics and was immediately reminded of a Hot Wheels game from the Nintendo DS Lite I used to play... Then the controls... It was just too easy. The game lost all its appeal because of those vehicles that stick to the ground. Yes, the sound... also DS Lite quality. And I can't believe this game is from 2011 because it's simply poor quality... [/spoiler]

Best regards and have a nice day/evening/night,
Lex

Flatout 3 is not only a terrible spin-off of the series, but also a truly terrible game. I wouldn't even spend a single euro on it!

Be careful! Irons on wheels, cartoonish animation, soapy special effects, dry 8-bit sound.
Too much of a name for a game. The founder probably simply lost the right to "continue" the franchise to the company responsible for this misunderstanding.
This game should have been called simply "Chaos & Destruction," without the catchy word "FlatOut." Then it would have been forgiven, as it would have been perfectly acceptable as a poorly executed parody of Carmageddon.

What can I say about Flatout 3? It's a disgrace to the series, a bummer, a bummer, a disappointment. And all because it was made by completely different people.

Some developers decided to make a buck off a well-known series, but one only has to look at the games they've created, let alone the reviews, and everything falls into place. With people like that, Flatout 3 simply couldn't have been any good. It's a complete travesty: terrible graphics, disgusting physics, and so much more. When I first launched it, I felt like soap was in my eyes! God, the graphics were so disgusting.

I bought the entire Flatout pack a long time ago, and all the games in the series cost as much as this piece of crap. So I recommend doing the same during the sale. This game should definitely not be called Flatout 3.

Overall, I don't recommend buying it. Maybe as a pack on sale or for a collection, or if you're a masochist...)

We're looking forward to the release of Next Car Game from Bugbears, who really know how to make games like this.

0.1 / 10

column8:
This is a FlatOut game in name only. It shares none of the good qualities the previous games had. The first sign I knew that this wouldn't be a quality title was the developer: Team6. If you know anything about the FlatOut series of games, you'd know that all of them were developed by BugBear Interactive. Still, I was stupid and went ahead with the purchase (only $7.49, but still, I could have bought a better game). Expecting something at least halfway decent, I got a buggy, crashing, and barely playable pile of mess dumped upon me. The physics are arguably the absolute worst thing about this game. Cars don't handle like cars, they handle like ice cubes lubed up in a messy bowl of KY His and Her jelly and butter. The graphics are just awful and look worse than the first FlatOut game, which, for reference, was released in 2004, a wopping 7 years before this pile of fail. I guess the only nice things I can say about it are the car designs themselves, the amount of them, and the amount of  game modes included in the game. Other than that, avoid this like the plague. If I could get my money back, I would. 
Rating: 1/10.
Buy the other FlatOut games and BugBear's Next Car Game instead.

column8:
I picked this up in a multi-pack with several other games as I had played previous games in the series before.  Honestly, I think I might have been better off paying more to buy the rest of the pack separately without this one. 

Avoid this game and here is why:
The graphics are at best mediocre.  However, despite this expect to find the game stuttering and struggling to keep up (especially when turning corners).  This quickly becomes more than a minor annoyance when you find yourself losing control because the game has stuttered on a corner.  Textures applied to the walls around the track (such as graffiti on the concrete) will flicker.  (Keep in mind this is on a PC with an i7 CPU, 8GB of RAM, and a GeForce GTX 670).

The car handling is distinctly fishy.  Half the cars will stick to the road like glue.  The other half will be sliding all over the place.  There is nothing in between. 

The AI is even fishier.  When they go around corners expect to see carnage as they drive straight in to walls.  To make up for this the AI will quickly catch you on the straights ‚Äì passing your car with no problems even when you‚Äôre burning nitro.  

The damage modelling on the cars is all or nothing.  Where Flatout Ultimate Carnage slowly added damage to the cars depending on the impacts in this game your car is either brand new or has been completely crumpled.  There is no damage in between these two options.  As soon as your car scrapes against anything expect to see the whole car appear as if it has been squashed by an 18 Wheeler.

column8:
Ci sono sequel di giochi in grado di portare avanti con fierezza lo spirito dei loro predecessori, in grado di portare aria fresca in gameplay che oramai hanno fatto il loro tempo... 

Ecco Flatout3 non √® nulla di questo. L'antico splendore della fisica, la giocabilit√† ed il realismo della sua prima incarnazione sono finiti a concimare il terreno dove sono stati sepolti.

Nel primo Flatout il succo risiedeva nell'accurata simulazione delle movenze dell'auto, dell'allora giovane motore grafico Havok: La compressione delle sospensioni, lo sbandare del posteriore sotto i cavalli del motore e l'aderenza che variava costantemente a seconda del fondo della pista e di come l'auto poggiasse a terra.
Per poi non parlare di come l'auto subisse danni accartocciandosi in modo tanto realistico da sembrare vera o di come gli oggetti in pista una volta urtati volassero comportandosi come le loro controparti reali.

Dopo un sequel, si bello, ma con gia alcune mancanze in fatto di realismo fisico, ecco che arriva Flatout3.

Sono state aggiunte una fiumana di modalit√† di gioco, tra cui ora la modalit√† Splatout dove si corre per la pista massacrando zombie a colpi di paraurti. Si puo correre su un monstertruck o su una monoposto da competizione. Peccato che mettendo in pista tutte queste nuove idee per spremere la fisica del motore grafico, ci si √® dimenticati proprio di implementare quest'ultima nel gioco: l'auto si comporta praticamente come un go-kart: rigida, per farla curvare bisogna dare una dose spropositata di freno a mano per poi vederla riprendere subito l'assetto iniziale come se qualcuno spingesse il fianco per rimetterla dritta. 
Le ruote sono solo per abbellimento in quanto si vede lontano un miglio che non sono loro a dare trazione (o almeno cos√¨ pare) pare pi√π che un'invisiile forza spinga sul retro dell'auto per farla correre. Il sistema danni non rende giustizia, dopo aver urtato violentemente contro un avversario ne il vostro muso ne la sua fiancata presenteranno danni di sorta; come far schiantare due macchinine giocattolo tra di loro.

Le auto di per se hanno un design interessante, talvolta molto surreali ma discretamente disegnate. Sono davvero tante e sono distribuite in varie classi: si va da auto classiche, ad auto di tipo tuning con spoilers immensi, a delle vetture studiate per il derby, dunque supercorazzate ed imponenti, a delle monoposto simil F1 ma con le fattezze di caccia-bombardieri.

La pecca √® che se prima si acquistava un'auto e la si potenziava man mano vedendola evolversi e voi con lei, imparando a controllarla e a pennellarci le curve, ora ,prima di ogni gara si sceglie una vettura tra l'elenco di quelle disponibili e sbloccabili via via vincendo gare, l'unico tipo di potenziamento che si puo attuare √® la pseudo-selezione dell' assetto (di solito sono disponibile 2 o tre modalit√†) attravesto un click, dove il gioco stesso descrive in poche righe con frasi accattivanti le migliorie che si sono istallate;

Nella realt√† dei fatti non si avverte nessun cambiamento, l'auto resta rigida, non curva e sembra un blocco di acciaio inox con delle rotelle.

Tutte e dico tutte le auto si comportano allo stesso modo (fatta eccezione forse per i monstertruck) l'unica differenza tra le varie classi √® la velocit√† che raggiungono (forse).

Non esiste un campionato, tutto si √® condensato in una modalit√† arcade dove le vittorie sbloccano auto e tracciati in modo casuale, non c'√® quel clima di competizione che si aveva prima, la IA cede il passo al giocatore che si avvicina tentando il sorpasso, senza contare che spesso vedrete i vostri avversari lanciarsi deliberatamente fuori pista e speronarsi in continuazione dimenticandosi totalmente della gara. 
Esplosioni e fiamme ovunque, spettacolari ma molto di distrazione ed eccessive.
Inoltre √® stato implementato una specie di superpotere che consiste in una barra rossa che si carica usando il nitro. Una volta attivato garantisce una manciata di secondi di invincibilit√† e la capacit√† di distruggere chiunque venga a contatto con la vostra auto (lo avevo gia visto fare in super mario land), il tutto in slow motion rendendo la guida ancora piu complicata.

Il motore grafico √® pesantissimo ed il dettaglio che offre non rende giustizia alla tecnologia che implementa. inoltre la configurabilit√† della grafica √® scarna, il gioco rileva le caratteristiche hardware in base al voto dell'indice prestazioni di windows
, universalmente noto per essere un'enorme bufala (un portatile samsung con 6gb di ram un core i5 da 2.4Ghz ed un'Nvidia GeForce GT540 e quasi un Tb di disco rigito si √® beccato un pietoso 4.9) ma il gioco non mente: le impostazioni sopportabili sono medio-basse, anche se con questo pc gioco a titoli abbastanza recenti con un ottimo dettaglio grafico.

In fin della fiera se avete giocato il primo Flatout, reinstallatelo, rigiocatelo e spendete 30 euro in qualcos'altro. 
Se non lo avete giocato, acquistatelo e fate cio che ho consigliato prima.

Questo titolo deluder√† a mio parere tutti i seguaci della serie che si aspettavano molto di piu da questo sequel.
column9:
There are sequels to games that proudly carry on the spirit of their predecessors, breathing fresh air into gameplay that has long since passed...

Flatout 3 is none of that. The former glory of the physics, gameplay, and realism of its first incarnation have ended up fertilizing the soil where they were buried.

The essence of the first Flatout lay in the accurate simulation of the car's movements, powered by the then-young Havok graphics engine: the compression of the suspension, the rear end skidding under the horsepower of the engine, and the grip that constantly varied depending on the track surface and how the car rested on the ground.
Not to mention how the car took damage, crumpling so realistically that it seemed real, or how objects on the track, once hit, flew, behaving like their real counterparts.

After a sequel that was good, but already lacking in physical realism, here comes Flatout 3.

A slew of game modes have been added, including Splatout mode, where you race around the track, slaughtering zombies with bumpers. You can race in a monster truck or a single-seater racing car. It's a shame that, while introducing all these new ideas to push the graphics engine's physics to the track, they completely forgot to implement the latter into the game: the car behaves practically like a go-kart: rigid, and to make it turn you have to apply an inordinate amount of handbrake, only to see it immediately return to its initial position, as if someone were pushing on its side to straighten it out.
The wheels are just for show, as it's obvious from a mile away that they're not providing traction (or so it seems); it's more like an invisible force pushing on the rear of the car to make it race. The damage system doesn't do it justice; after violently crashing into an opponent, neither your nose nor its side will show any damage; How to crash two toy cars into each other.

The cars themselves have interesting designs, sometimes very surreal but well-crafted. There are so many of them, and they're distributed across various classes: from classic cars to tuned cars with huge spoilers, to heavily armored and imposing derby-style cars, to F1-style single-seaters with the look of fighter-bombers.

The downside is that while you used to buy a car and gradually upgrade it, watching it evolve and you along with it, learning to control it and carve the curves, now, before each race, you choose a car from the list of available ones and unlock them gradually by winning races. The only type of upgrade you can perform is the pseudo-setup selection (usually two or three modes are available) via a single click, where the game itself describes the installed upgrades in a few lines with catchy phrases;

In reality, you don't notice any change; the car remains rigid, doesn't curve, and feels like a block of stainless steel on wheels.

All, and I mean all, the cars behave the same (except perhaps the monster trucks); the only difference between the various classes is their speed (perhaps).

There's no championship; everything has been condensed into an arcade mode where victories unlock cars and tracks randomly. There's no competitive atmosphere like before; the AI ‚Äã‚Äãgives way to the player who approaches you and attempts to overtake. Not to mention that you'll often see your opponents deliberately diving off the track and continually ramming each other, completely forgetting about the race.
Explosions and flames everywhere, spectacular but very distracting and excessive.
Additionally, a kind of superpower has been implemented consisting of a red bar that charges using nitro. Once activated, it grants a handful of seconds of invincibility and the ability to destroy anyone who comes into contact with your car (I'd already seen it done in Super Mario Land), all in slow motion, making driving even more difficult.

The graphics engine is incredibly demanding, and the detail it offers doesn't do justice to the technology it implements. Furthermore, the graphics configurability is poor; the game detects hardware specifications based on the Windows Performance Index score,
which is universally known to be a huge hoax (a Samsung laptop with 6GB of RAM, a 2.4GHz Core i5, an NVIDIA GeForce GT540, and almost a TB of hard drive got a pitiful 4.9). But the game doesn't lie: the tolerable settings are medium-low, even though I play fairly recent titles with excellent graphics settings on this PC.

At the end of the day, if you played the first Flatout, reinstall it, replay it, and spend 30 euros on something else.
If you haven't played it, buy it and do what I recommended above.

This title will, in my opinion, disappoint all fans of the series who expected much more from this sequel.

column9:
The previous Flatout installments were practically a dream come true for me as a player. The fantastic destruction system, totally awesome tracks, and party mode meant I had each installment on my hard drive from release to release. I eagerly returned to each of the previous installments. The latest installment is a complete rip-off of the series; I honestly don't know what could have been worse...

As a loyal fan of the previous installments, I'm saddened to report that a legend has died. Out of respect for the previous installments, let's bury this junk and not play it... besides, it's unplayable...

1/10

EDIT 09.05.2021:
The game is often on sale and can be purchased for the proverbial dollar. Luckily, there's now a refund system on Steam, so you can easily return the game. When I played this piece of crap, that wasn't an option. If you buy this crap on sale, fire it up as soon as possible so you have a chance to return it. Remember, you have two weeks to get your money back. The game isn't worth a penny.

The true creators of the original flatout games are Bugbear Entertainment, and their latest game, which has a flatout-like feel, is Wreckfest. If you enjoy this type of racing, you should definitely check it out. Here's a direct link to the Wreckfest store: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/228380/Wreckfest/]WRECKFEST[/url]

Jogo pessimo, apesar de levar o nome Flatout n√£o foi produzido pela bug bear e sim poir uma empresa obscura chamada team 6, o jogo √© um retocesso em rela√ß√£o aos seus antecessores rem varios aspectos, a fisica √© ruim, os carros apenas amassam e voce fica com a impress√£o de que eles s√£o feitos de plasticos, ja que os amassados somem misteriosamente, a trilha sonora regrediu e agora √© compostas de musicas eletronicas repetitivas que parecem terem sido feitas em midi. os controles ent√£o, eu uso um controle de xbox 360, e os carros desse jogo pareciam estar sem pneus devido a dificuldade de mante-los na pista, mesmo abilitanto o suporte a anlogicos no menu do game o jogo ainda respondia como se eu estivesse usando as direcionais.

Se voce curtiu a serie flatout, pule esse jogo pois ele √© a "ovelha negra" da serie
column9:
A terrible game. Despite being called Flatout, it wasn't produced by Bug Bear, but by an obscure company called Team 6. The game is a step backward from its predecessors in several aspects. The physics are poor; the cars just get dented, and you get the impression they're made of plastic, as the dents mysteriously disappear. The soundtrack has regressed and is now composed of repetitive electronic music that seems to have been made in MIDI. As for the controls, I use an Xbox 360 controller, and the cars in this game felt like they had no tires due to the difficulty of keeping them on the track. Even after enabling analog support in the game menu, the game still responded as if I were using the directional pad.

If you enjoyed the Flatout series, skip this game because it's the "black sheep" of the series.

A disappointing installment in a well-known series. Too bad...

2/10

I knew from the start that Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction was complete crap because it had the wrong developers, the wrong publisher, and it was a completely different game altogether. They just took a well-known name and sold it. Personally, I wasn't planning on buying it. I just bought a pack of all the parts for 149 rubles and decided to see for myself what it was like, and OH YES, I wish I hadn't downloaded it and launched it. I've never seen such crap. The graphics are crap, they were better in the second part. The car controls are crappy, there are no physics at all, the tracks are crappy, meaning they're just a fucking square instead of a track. There are no complex turns or any originality in the track design. The funniest thing is that I decided to play online for at least 30 minutes, but there isn't a single server there. So, no one even plays this crap now, only someone played it when it came out. If they give you a discount, don't buy this piece of crap, because this inferior game should be given away for free, not sold for money. And for the record, people are still playing Flatout 2, so it's better to play that than THIS.

If you are searching for a good desctruction derby "recreation" or for "destructible mindless racing fun" do not buy this game! I have made this mistake! The Racing mode part is terrible and hopeless to win. There is allways just this 1 car you can't beat. The "stunt mode"......i have spend 20 min to solve the mysteries bejind it, what you have to do in this part.....without result .:(
And the Destruction Derby mode.....lol the 1st level is fun......it's a deathmatch. But the other levels....its a 1 vs 23 other fight, where every car has the mission to destroy you, and they are ignoring each other....This was the most worst 2 hrs of my life i spent in it!

column9: FlatOut started very promisingly, super controllability, amazing possibility of destruction and a lot of fun during races, but then something happened (probably the name was sold to other developers) and things went downhill with the second part. Now we have the peak of dementia and short-sightedness of the development studio (which, however, is not behind the creation of number one) in the form of the third part. The cars behave even more senselessly, the destruction is the same or perhaps even worse than in the predecessor, and the whole thing is still covered with strong bloom effects so that it is not so much visible that the developers have slopped this part in every way.

column8: Flatout 3 is flatout bad. Cars crashing into other cars should not look and feel like cardboard boxes hitting each other. Cars should not pinball off of a building after it crashes into one. column9: shit. so shit. there's nothing worse.

A few years ago, Flatout 2 was released‚Äîa game that has long been etched in my memory as an alternative take on the Burnout series, with gameplay that's much more dynamic but less realistic. So, when I started using Steam, I finally decided to buy the next installment, with high hopes. And here's what happened:
When I opened the menu, the first thing I noticed was the graphics, which were out of date for their time, and the poorly designed menu itself. It was passable, but I expected something more. The real fun begins when I started the first race. Specifically, the city track is poorly implemented, the controls are poor, and the physics are unplayable. It's incredibly difficult to know when and where to turn. The car doesn't respond to the controls at all, refusing to slow down or take turns. The physics of objects and cars remained the same. But while this was fine in previous games and I quickly got used to it, here...
In the end, I didn't even bother playing. I simply turned off this "creation," called the developers names for unfulfilled expectations and wasted money, and went to play something else.
I don't recommend buying it under any circumstances. I think fans of the previous games will understand.

column8:
The only thing that is chaotic and destructive about this game are the ugly glitchy graphics, the balloon physics and the underwhelming damage model. For one, the game, as it is painfully obvious, is not even made by bugbear interactive, but by a studio named Team 6 who seem to be way off with their games quality.
  It is unfortunate that this game has so much content to offer, but does it in such a disastrous and wasteful way. There are plenty of modes, with both old and new added to the mix with a variety of vehicles types, but nope! This just wont save this game from the shovelware/bargain bin 

For what is worth its kind of hilarious to play the game and then read its description.

column9:
It's obvious just by looking at the developer.
It's not developed by Bugbear Entertainment, the same company behind the series.

Whether you've played the previous game or not, the game displays strange and incomprehensible behavior.
It's definitely not FlatOut,
to the point where you start to wonder if the thing you're controlling is even a car.
Sure, FlatOut is a "game about broken cars." But that's not what players wanted!

Also, while not really related to the main game,
the soundtrack probably only supports .mp3 files.
If you have .flac files in My Music, it will definitely crash during play!
...So, that's not what players wanted!

I've never seen a worse racing game, it's not even worth watching. I'm warning potential buyers. This game wasn't made by the same developers who brought us the first games; the publisher simply decided to cash in on the name. It should be noted that the publisher isn't the same as the first ones either; that one no longer exists. So, it's a nice name, but the game is complete crap!!!
Objectively speaking, the graphics are worse than the second one, and the physics are not only worse than the second one, but worse than anywhere else. There are so many game modes, it's as if they thought the more the better. They're all boring. The AI ‚Äã‚Äãis ridiculously funny, like a Kashchenko patient driving, and when you turn on the nitrous, the car stretches like a limo. Maybe this game was made by mental hospital patients :)

column8: Heyyo, DON'T BUY THIS GAME! It's an insult to what Bugbear, the original developers of Flatout created. This was made by some shit-budget-Russian "game" "studio" and it's every bit as bad as its Metacritic score of 23 / 100. The text is poor, it feels like a free game a college student made in a week, and it's nowhere near the price they're asking for. This game deserves to die. Buy any other Flatout game or Bugbear's upcoming "Next Car Game"

Flatout 3 is a joke to the great Flatout Franchise, You are better off checking out Ultimate Carnage or Flatout 2 for your destruction derby needs.

The game is something else, car handling and menus are some of the worst i've seen and you can really feel that this game has been thrown together to just grab your money. Stay the frack away from this title.

The main reason why this game is so diffrent (and therefor worse then Flatout 1/2 and Ultimate Carnage) is because its diffrent developer for this game (Not Bugbear). So i can't even call it a "Flatout" Game... this is... something else.

column8:
The game name says Flatout. But do not think of it as Flatout. It is not even made by same developers as the original Flatout, Flatout 2 and Ultimate Carnage. This is made by Team 6. Team 6 has not made a single good game ever. And this is not exception.

This game is absolutely horrible, I do not recommend it for anyone.
The physics are one of the worst I have ever seen in racing game.
Crashing does not feel good when it should in this type of game.
The graphics look just ugly. Even the first Flatout from 2004 looks better than this in my opinion.
There is not even a proper career mode, just a boring challenge mode that has random single races you can complete.
This game is overpriced, it should cost 5‚Ç¨/5$ at max, and even then I would not recommend the game to anyone.

Play the good old Flatout instead, or check out Wreckfest by the developers of original Flatout games (Bugbear Entertainment). That is the true successor to Flatout.

DO NOT BUY FLATOUT 3

column8:
This game is rubbish, if you loved flatout 2 or UC then don't buy. 
Flatout 3 features cars that have some of the worse systems of damage e.g. you trade paint and explode, you hit someone face on no damage. Maps that have the track missing in places e.g. a map where you have to jump across a black hole and never make it (including the AI). Zombies that should be road cones (they don't move). Graphics that are worse then flatout 1. Maps that have nothing in them called off road maps. 
This game was not made by bugbear it was made by Team 6. Think Pizza Dude and Taxi Raser. It is the same quality

column8:
Flatout 3, or The One Where The Flatout Franchise Shat Down It's Legg
The first two Flatout games were good fun, but it's third installment felt like a step backwards so big that I would have believed you if you  told me that it was released before the first game. The biggest issue with the game is one that writes the whole experience off: the physics are horrible. Cars don't FEEL right. Their acceleration, turning and collision feel simply horrible. You can really tell a different developer made this title.

Can't Drive Stick out of Ten

Ce jeu n'est pas un FlatOut, c'est une merde.
Les graphismes sont pire que le premier du nom, la maniabilit√© est horriblement arcade, la bande son est inexistante, les bruitages sont plat... c'est vraiment du foutage de gueule (m√™me les options graphiques se foutent de vous en r√™glant les param√®tres sur la base de l'indice Windows...)
Le SEUL point positif, c'est le support int√©gral de la manette (jeux + menu) alors qu'il n'est pas pr√©sent dans FlatOut 1 & 2.

Prenez plut√¥t FlatOut : Ultimate Carnage (alias FlatOut 2.5) qui, lui, est vraiment bien foutu.
column9:
This game isn't FlatOut, it's crap.
The graphics are worse than the first one, the handling is horribly arcade-like, the soundtrack is nonexistent, the sound effects are flat... it's really a joke (even the graphics options make fun of you by adjusting the settings based on the Windows index...).
The ONLY positive point is the full controller support (games + menu), which isn't present in FlatOut 1 & 2.

Take FlatOut: Ultimate Carnage (aka FlatOut 2.5) instead, which is really well done.

This is a disappointment after FlatOut 2. The graphics are atrocious. You can run over zombies for a while, but that's pointless! I didn't bother with the multiplayer because after just playing the game, everything was clear! A waste of money!
Rating: 1/10

This is a disaster! How could they ruin such a great game like this? It's simply not fun to play now... Graphics... there's no point in even talking about them; the first level was definitely prettier. Physics!? Are there any? The music is far from the wild racing gameplay and is actually depressing. Carmageddon, with its graphics from those days, doesn't even compare to this knockoff. It's more like some company bought the rights and quickly slapped together this piece of crap for a quick buck. It's a sad and sad story, my friends...

A true rating for FlatOut 3 is 20%, or maybe even 21%. Still, compared to those Polish knockoffs, it does have a semblance of something sensible. But there's no escaping Team6's retribution. At the very least, for not being dead yet and for daring to venture into polite society.

column8: How did they fuck this game up so bad? F:UC felt good to play, but this game is a frustrating chore. Ramming other cars has no weight and pisses you of for the next 30 seconds when the other car is glued to your hood. The "Power" is merely slow motion where you can tap other racers to blow them up, but good luck finding any racers to ram, and good luck getting your power up more than twice per race. Not to mention it only lasts 5 seconds, so the most you can manage to do is kill only one racer out of a conglomerate total of 16 racers. 16 racers, yet most of the track is always empty, staying in between the shitty racers that can barely finish the race whithin a week, and the asshole first placer who finishes sooner than you can even expect. Buy this game if you're a cretin, otherwise ignore it to death. This is a really bad game.

Ramming other cars has no weight and pisses you of for the next 30 seconds when the other car is glued to your hood. The "Power" is merely slow motion where you can tap other racers to blow them up, but good luck finding any racers to ram, and good luck getting your power up more than twice per race. Not to mention it only lasts 5 seconds, so the most you can manage to do is kill only one racer out of a conglomerate total of 16 racers. 16 racers, yet most of the track is always empty, staying in between the shitty racers that can barely finish the race whithin a week, and the asshole first placer who finishes sooner than you can even expect. Buy this game if you're a cretin, otherwise ignore it to death. This is a really bad game.

column8: Bulshit game!
column9: Bulshit game!

NEVER, hear me, NEVER buy this game! Flatout is the only thing it's known for; it's a piece of crap slathered in an INCREDIBLE amount of blur, with terrible physics, primitive tuning, insane soundtracks, autistic AI, tracks designed by a one-armed kid with Down syndrome, and TONS of blur. After playing this game for just over an hour, I permanently damaged my vision. Forget about this game like it's a bad dream.

column8:
A time honored classic that redefined the way we look on racing simulators; This serie is one, if not THE first that effectively used detailed damage to cars and their components.

Don't expect a lot from the 3rd installment though, as far as I can tell its FlatOut 2 with better graphics only; The track are the same, the vehicles are the same...even the other drivers are the same...

Also don't expect guns or other forms of weapons though; Its not Death Rally or any of the Interstate series.

NEIN! Ich kann nur empfehlen dieses Spiel in die Tonne zu treten. Das einzige was es mit seinen Vorg√§ngern gemein hat ist das man ein Auto f√§hrt, das war es dann aber auch schon.

Die KI ist total verdummt, Objekte die gerammt werden fliegen wie Gummib√§lle in die Umlaufbahn, unangebrachte Blur Effekte, ich selbst hab zwar nur ein paar Autos ausprobiert, aber das Handling was Untergrundbeschaffung etc angeht... no way.

Von Teil 1 und 2 war ich sehr angetan von der Einfachheit des Aufbaus, der dritte Teile ist meiner Meinung nach ein totales Chaos, auch was Tuning angeht, viele Einstellungen sind toll, hier sind es aber einfach zuviele. Nichts f√ºr jemanden der das Spiel wie die Vorg√§nger einfach nur "spielen" will. Grafisch fand ich selbst die Vorg√§nger besser/rustikaler, die Soundkulisse... ich weiss n icht was es darstellen soll, aber es poltert und knallt nur es scheint als ob es nur unterschiede in den h√∂hen und tiefen des Kollision gibt. 

Ich rate vom kauf ab.
column9:
NO! I can only recommend throwing this game in the trash. The only thing it has in common with its predecessors is that you drive a car, but that's about it.

The AI ‚Äã‚Äãis completely dumbed down, objects that are hit fly into orbit like rubber balls, inappropriate blur effects. I've only tried out a few cars myself, but the handling, especially when it comes to ground clearance, etc.... no way.

I was very impressed with the simplicity of the setup in parts 1 and 2. The third part is, in my opinion, a total mess, including in terms of tuning. Many settings are great, but there are simply too many here. Not for someone who just wants to "play" the game like its predecessors. Graphically, I even found the predecessors better/more rustic, the soundscape... I don't know what it's supposed to represent, but it just rumbles and bangs, it seems as if there are only differences in the highs and lows of the collision.

I advise against buying it.
Compared to the previous parts, I'm sorry, but this one is SHIT... I don't even feel like writing anything. It's a crude piece of code; it can't even be called a game!!!

column8:
Flatout 3 Chaos and Destruction ist kein perfektes Spiel. Doch hat es all die Kritik und einen Wertung unter 40 nicht verdient. Obwohl das Spiel abgesehen vom Namen kaum noch was mit den Ausgezeichneten Vorg√§ngertiteln zu tun hat ist es dennoch ein passables Rennspiel. Einige Bugs wurden seid Ver√∂ffentlichung ausgebessert und die Spielphysik wurde erheblich gepessert. 
Flatout 3 ist kein Spiel, das l√§ngere Zeit motiviert, sondern ein Spiel f√ºr Zwischendurch, ob es im Zug, Auto, Urlaub, Flugzeug oder Autobus ist. 
Trotzdem w√ºrde ich das Spiel nur im Angebot um ca 5-7‚Ç¨ kaufen, mehr ist es nicht wert. :))
column9:
Flatout 3 Chaos and Destruction isn't a perfect game. However, it doesn't deserve all the criticism and a rating below 40. Although the game, aside from its name, bears little resemblance to its excellent predecessors, it's still a decent racing game. Some bugs have been fixed since release, and the physics have been significantly improved.

Flatout 3 isn't a game that will keep you motivated for long periods of time, but rather a game for playing in between, whether on the train, in the car, on vacation, on the plane, or by bus.

Nevertheless, I would only buy the game on sale for around ‚Ç¨5-7; it's not worth more than that. :))

column8: This game is fucking garbage.  Seriously, I can't say I've experienced a worse racing game in my life.  What happened to this franchise? There's just no focus to this title, they just kind of throw all the modes and everything at you without any sort of explanation or objective to unlocking new tracks.  Everything seems so random, oh and the rubber band AI is unbelievable.  What happened to the physics engine too? This is a huge step back for the franchise and I hope future titles don't go this route.  If this didn't come with the FlatOut franchise pack, I wouldn't have it.  Don't waste your money on this, it's fucking terrible.  Fuck you developers, give me 30 minutes of my life back.

column9:
Metascore 23 is no joke; its content is so unrewarding that it's almost painful, even trying to finish every race in the top three or complete it becomes a hassle.

It doesn't have the "Flatout-ness" I imagined it would have. When you play it, it's just your typical cheap retro game with compact arcade-like behavior. This is not Flatout.

To begin with, it's missing some of the elements that make a retro game fun. The developers probably thought they'd beefed it up with the number of cars and modes, but it's nothing more than a sham. The cars also don't have the Flatout feel.

And what about the graphics? Unfortunately, there's not much to praise. The recommended environment is VGA, which is the flagship of the previous generation, but I wonder if such high resources are really necessary for graphics like this.

The AI ‚Äã‚Äãis also sloppy. Mysterious boosts like NFS and FUEL are commonplace. I wish the game would at least complete the course instead of masturbating against the wall.

Overall, it's flat and shallow. What was Team6 Studios trying to create?
